review.title: Good location but average hotel for what you pay
review.reviewText: Very centrally located no frills hotel. Almost feels like a Budget airline style hotel . Good for price conscious Travellers who want to stay in central location.

Our stay was from Sept 11-16, 2016. This hotel has construction all around it. Constant noise from construction and very difficult to get a good nights sleep. Rooms are dated and the bathrooms are very small, shower kept leaking all over the floor. The restaurant is terrible. Only option for breakfast is $28 / person buffet and there is no room service. Next time we're in town we will stay somewhere else.

Staff was great and very helpful/friendly.
The front desk service was great. Very friendly,  helpful and accomadating.

review.title: Great location large rooms
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great market & 3rd. Only problem was no reataurant. But did have a bar.

review.title: Doesn't offer the services of a major urban hotel.
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel many times in the past when it was a part of different chains, including Westin. Although conveniently located, it does not offer the services of a major urban hotel. I was shocked in the morning when I couldn't find a room service menu in the room, and was told they don't offer room service. When I went down to the restaurant (more of a rinky-dink cafe behind the larger lounge), I was told they only offered a buffet -- even on a weekday -- and had no menu one could order from. I am not a big breakfast eater, and buffets are not a good deal for me, so I had to wander down the street to find someplace to have breakfast before an important business meeting -- not what I expect at a major downtown hotel in a big city. Also, when I came back to my room that evening about 7 pm, they had a musical group in the lounge, which is right off of and open to the lobby, playing extremely loudly. They were so loud it was hard to speak to the concierge or front desk staff without shouting. This was not a problem in my room, which was on the 11th floor, but just an annoyance to have that much noise in the lobby. Some parents with children rushed their kids out of the lobby into the elevators with the kids holding their ears. Also, in the business center, access to the internet is pay-per-minute, at $7 per 15 mins, and copies were $1 per copy. On the whole, pretty chintzy and money-grubbing for a hotel with room rates $200-300+. I will not go back.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: Very nice,transportation was excellent next to everything wish had more time to see more San Francisco

review.title: Nice Hotel Best Location
review.reviewText:
If you are going first time to San Francisco, and you are ready to pay 300 USD per night, I am sure you cannot find a better place to live. All shopping malls are just walk away. Market street is just next to this hotel. All major bank ATM are nearby. Union Square the best shopping area is also just at a walking distance. Overall location is the best. 

Now if you talk about this hotel, you get coffee machine in the room, iron is there, TV is there. So far as food is concerned, there is a restaurant /bar on the ground floor, go and enjoy your food. 

Hotel staff is very cooperative and nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Being Indian we need Jet Spray in toilet.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: We found the park central was in a good location to explore San Fran. Whilst the rooms were comfortable they felt dated & we're in need of a refresh. Beware of the resort fee! We used no faculties stated as part of the resort fee & we're still charged the fee. Disappointing, seeing that other hotels we stayed didn't charge this fee.

review.title: Great location. Very comfortable room
review.reviewText:
Our family of 4 had a wonderful time at the Park Central. Great location, modern, clean, roomy and a great view!

Being a family of 4 with 4 iPhones and one iPad, it would have been nice if the power source on the front of the desk worked.  The plugs were very loose and only worked some of the time.

We were surprised by the a daily charge ($35ish dollars) on top of the room rate for Wifi, etc...  I've never stayed at a hotel where this was charged separately.  They said that it also includes "bike rentals" included in this fee... but there are only 4 bikes and you are not able to reserve them in advance. We were told we had to be at the desk at 6 or 7 AM if we hoped to get the bikes for the day... but no guarantee. This extra charge felt a bit like a money-grab and should be included in the actual room rate so that there are no surprises at check-in. If I'd known about this extra charge, I may have booked somewhere else.
review.negativeRemarks: Small refrigerators should be standard in every room!  One was brought to our room after we asked but fridges should be standard in all rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, transportation, AT&T Stadium - great location. Would definitely stay here again.  Location Location Location.

review.title: Clean and well-situated, but not luxurious
review.reviewText: We spent 6 nights in this hotel during our family vacation -- they were one of the few hotels to promise (and deliver) adjoining rooms so our teenage kids' room could connect with ours, which we very much appreciated.  The hotel is supremely well situated in the city, close to just about everything, and the staff is friendly.  The rooms are spacious and clean, but be prepared that this is not a luxury hotel along the likes of a Ritz, St. Regis or Four Seasons.   This is much more of a standard, business-type hotel. The rooms are appointed with very basic, minimal furnishings and decor (really, there is no decor).  No mini-bar, no room service -- but we did ask for and receive a refrigerator for no charge.  The bathrooms are small, somewhat dated and do not have double sinks (also only a tub with a shower curtain as opposed to stall shower), though they were clean.  The daily fee for internet service is annoying, as is the fact that every 24 hours we had to re-enter our request to access it.  At these rates, the internet should just be included.  Overall, the hotel was more than adequate for our purposes.  We enjoyed our stay and had no complaints.

review.title: Very Disappointed
review.reviewText: I made reservations for myself and husband and three more rooms for family members.  I was there to participate in the Avon39 Walk to Crush Breast Cancer. The advertisement for the hotel said it had outside dining, a restaurant etc.  During our check in I paid for the other rooms and gave the attendant strict instructions to not ask my children for their credit cards as we were paying for their rooms.   My kids drove all night from Oregon to see me complete this walk.  I requested a noon check in and explained they were driving all night and would be exhausted. The first child cam with twins and was asked for her credit card and charged $85.00 to park overnite.  She called me frantically and it was take care of. Again I went downstairs and discussed this issue for the next two kids that would be arriving with their family. Luckily the next two check ins went ok. However, the rooms were absent a refrigerator and a microwave which were listed as amenities.  Our room had neither, the bathtub plug did not work.and our phone was perpetually telling us we had messages which we did not.  The staff would not provide us with a microwave for any of the 4 rooms but did provide  a refrigerator. My daughter with the twins was forced to heat coffee water t heat the babies milk.  The restaurant was basically a very dimly lit bar which would not be suitable for children.  They no longer had a patio dining area.

review.title: Hidden facilities fees make this a terrible deal!
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is fine, but our experience was ruined when we checked out after three days to find that we had a significant fee on our bill for "facilities fees." Without the fees, this hotel seemed like an amazing bargain, which must be why they hide these fees until the end of the stay. A hugely disappointing end to an otherwise great trip.

review.title: High resort fee doesn't cover much, extras cost
review.reviewText:
Despite having a $30/night plus tax resort fee (or "facilities fee" as they call it), this hotel charges individually for having a bar fridge ($25/day), or handling mail ($6 per package).  The resort fee itself makes a mockery of Expedia's transparent pricing, as the Expedia price doesn't show added taxes and service fees, which ended up being approx. $60.  Note, yes this fee is compulsory even if you don't use the Internet etc.  Business travellers especially beware, the amount Expedia invoices may differ significantly from the hotel cost due to these added fees and taxes.

This hotel is effectively charging for things that other hotels include for free - so if you are looking at staying here, and are comparing with another option, pick the other option - the extra costs here are likely to make up for it even if this hotel appears cheaper.
review.positiveRemarks: The location - easy walking distance to Union Square, Moscone Center, and other CBD attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: More transparent pricing by incorporating the cost of compulsory fees into the room rate for easier understanding.

review.title: Accessible, convenient
review.reviewText:
I probably wouldn't pay the amount for another stay at this location. Prices are too expensive with only the bare minimum necessities. No bed-room slippers, no refrigerator, no hot water kettle. The latter 2 can be requested for. Though, you might get to speak with an operator who replies you saying "I'll check with housekeeping on the kettle. If there is one, we will send it to your room". Certainly was not expecting such a response.. it seems like the kettle is available only on a first come first serve basis. And, I would have to spend my time, waiting for someone to check then deliver. 
On top of the booking fees and taxes, there is also a mandatory resort fee that is charged for every night stayed. This figure is also taxable. What does this mandatory fee cover? Only one or maybe two items that I will require - Internet access and the gym. I can probably do without the gym. So effectively, I am paying US$34.20 each night for a few hours of internet. This is insane. You might be better off staying somewhere in the heart of union square instead and even pay less or equivalent rates. Nothing wow about the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked that the hotel was quiet. Little disturbances from the adjacent rooms or the streets below. Accessibility to trains.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText:
Having never been to San Francisco before, we thought staying in the Union Square area would be most central to the other districts (Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, Embarcadero....) and we were right.  It was a short walk to the Powell Street cable car and there was a bus/street trolley station less than a block away.  Getting around town is very easy. We purchased a 3 day Metro pass which can be used on cable cars, buses and the electric trolley cars.

We took the BART train from SFO airport to the hotel and that was a breeze. (I recommend buying your R/T voucher online ahead of time so you can skip the ticket line at the airport.) The station was just a block from the hotel. I can't imagine the need for renting a car unless you plan to head far out of the city. While checking in we asked if we could upgrade to a room on a higher floor. They happily obliged and upgraded us without any additional charge.  We had a corner room on the 14th floor which made looking out of the floor to ceiling windows even more spectacular. The only negative comment I would have is the street noise.  San Franciscan drivers clearly love using their car horns.  Even 14 floors up, we were woken in the middle of the night a couple times, but not a big deal.

The staff was very friendly and we would definitely stay there again!
review.locationRemarks: Great location.  Very close to bus, electric trolleys and cable cars.  An easy walk to the Financial District and Chinatown.

review.title: Excellent Hotel But Terrible Hidden Costs
review.reviewText:
This is a superb hotel with floor to ceiling windows in our room and great views over the bay. Smart, clean, friendly an the fastest check-in ever - plus a nice (but expensive) shop by the elevators with everything you might have forgotten or want - Based on that alone I would rate as 5 stars. I never tried the restaurant  because a California Pizza Kitchen was opposite and the rest of the city was open for exploration but it looked smart (and I suspect pricey)

But

The rule that "the nicer and more expensive the hotel the less freebies are included in the price" really applies here.

I am seriously irked by the additional charges. When you look on expedia the hotel looks like a great price for a city center hotel. However at check-in you have to pay an extra 30 dollars a day "resort fee". This is an outrageous bait and switch on headline pricing. This fee (according to expedia) covers internet, however my experience was wifi in the room was still 24.95 extra a night (per device connected!!!) - I refused to pay this and used the hotspot feature on my phone quite happily.

In addition parking was 66.95 per day! That is also outrageous (although I did use it). I noticed on my second day that directly opposite the hotel is a parking structure which is likely a lot cheaper (turn right down a small street immediately after driving past the hotel lobby)

The shop is nice but 3.49 for a bottle of coke is too high. The liquor store next door isn't cheap but sells for 1.99
review.negativeRemarks: stop fleecing us on everything

review.title: Not terrible, but I expected more
review.reviewText:
When booking this hotel it looked great. Great location, photos seemed nice and the price seemed about right for what I was getting (despite the hidden "resort" fee).

When I got there the staff seemed friendly enough, no complaints there. The room was a little tighter than I expected but that was fine considering the location. 

The biggest issue I had was the thin walls, every sound, creak, voice and bump could be heard as if it was in the same room. I don't know where they were but I could hear someone constantly vomiting or something very loudly at about 2am and it sounded like it was in my bathroom. When that subsided all I could here was creaking framework and I had to put some music on to get some sleep, which I'm not used to doing.

I could have looked past this but when I checked out they told me I needed to pay an extra $30 per night for some reason, I though I had already paid this as a "resort fee" but apparently it was something different. I was too jet lagged and tired to care so I just went with it. I asked how long it would take for my bond to be returned to my card and they said 4 days! As I was travelling, this was part of my spending money. I wasn't warned at all of the amount of time it would take when I checked in, and the attitude of the staff seemed a lot different like I should have known all this.

I wouldn't consider this a quality hotel at all. It's okay, but not worth the price.
review.negativeRemarks: disclosure of all fees before you book, attitude of staff when there's a misunderstanding, option to pay bond in cash (for quick easy return)

Though it needs to take few minutes to get to union square, it's not that crowded outside the gate of the hotel. Outside Some other hotels'gate is amazingly crowded!!! Lots of tourists!!!!!. It won't happen at this hotel.
The customer service is superb. The front desk staff is so nice and smiled all the time. 
And I like the room's bed so much. I can't describe how comfortable it is! Everything is pretty clean!!!!!!!!!! 
I have a good time with my boyfriend.

review.title: Eh
review.reviewText: It was a nice hotel, but I found it lacking in a few areas. The staff were friendly, but were not excellent (they didn't let me know of any hotel amenities at my disposal when I arrived, didn't really want to answer any questions, just wanted to get me through check in and out of their hair).  The housekeepers were so loud. Around 7a this man on several mornings yelled "housekeeping" and banged on doors - I would hate to get woken up like that by a stranger so early. The hotel looks nice, but when you look closer there are signs of disrepair. The rooms appear clean, but I don't think they get vacuumed regularly and I saw quite a bit of dust around filters and water sprinklers in the room. The bed was comfortable and sheets cleaned. It wasn't bad, just for a place that not only charges a resort fee but has a high rating - I was disappointed.

Expedia says that Internet is free, but it's not.
In the room, no beverages or the customary items a so-called four star hotel provides.
If you drive, be prepared to pay $66.50 to park your car.

review.title: Wouldn't stay again
review.reviewText:
Room small and oddly shaped for hotels of its price range and location I've stayed in. Windows afforded very little privacy, looking directly into offices across the narrow street. Bathroom itself uncomfortably small. 

Bathroom ceiling leaked huge puddle all over floor and toilet. Maintenance guy coming to repair it dumped disgusting wave of water all over bathroom and left it for housekeeping to eventually (not) clean later that day. 

Ethernet cable at desk didn't workhotel staff when contacted told me (an Internet professional) that it was my computer's network settings that was probably the problem!? Desk chair broken and slowly kept changing height while sitting on it. 

Bathroom sink cold water tap had almost no water pressure, water only trickled out in tiny stream. Shower had great rain shower head with detachable head. But often had to wait for several minutes leaving the water running before any hot water would come out. 

No fridge in room, TV was pretty old, and had scratched up the dresser top pretty badly. 

Fitness center mediocre. My room was directly above it, and laying in bed at night could hear the rhythmic thumping of people running on treadmill on the floor beneath me. 

Front desk staff not particularly friendly or helpful when contacted a few times from roll phone. No apparent sign of available room service or menu. Had to manually check out on morning of last day, no bill waiting for me under door that morning, as is customary most places.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your feedback!

review.title: Overpriced Hotel, with hidden fees.
review.reviewText:
Terrible experience at this hotel. Please believe me people!  Don't book this hotel because 
once you book it, you can't cancel anymore and then when you show up there, they don't even tell you that they only have valet parking and that they charge $66 per day! I am not kidding! This is what happened to me, and if I am writing this it's because I wish that someone had warned me, so I don't want this to happen to anyone else. So if you don't want to go thru what I went, then here it goes.  When I went to check out, they charged me $252 dollars just for parking, for the three days I stayed there! They didn't tell me until I checked out that I was getting charged extra for having an oversize Car! Can you believe this?! So it ended up being $84 per day for parking!!!  Plus they also charged me  $25 daily mandatory fee, who knows for what!  Wow! 
So for a three night stay I end up paying $750 dollars!  This hotel is not worth this much. 
The sad part is that they don't even care if you agree to the charges or not. THEY HIDE ALL THESE VALET FEES and they didn't even explain all this when I arrived. Enjoy your stay and be annoyed when you leave!
review.negativeRemarks: They can start by being honest and post all the hidden fees that they have.

review.title: Nice hotel location, terrible check-in experience
review.reviewText:
Clean and nice hotel located in the heart of San Fran. Very close to public transportation. Hotel staff leave much to be desired. 

Extremely disappointed in check-in staff and their attitude. Reserved and paid specifically a king-bed for four nights. Upon a late night arrival, I was placed in a small room at the end of the hall with a bed that appeared much smaller a king bed (in-fact it was a Queen). I called the front desk who told me it was a king bed and then immediately hung up on me. After this point, the the front desk did not pick up my subsequent calls. Once they finally did, I told them the room only had a Queen bed and I had paid for a King. They said someone will be up with keys to another room and hung on me again. While we did get the King bed in the end, the whole process was extremely infuriating and hospitality was non-existent. 
- Only free wi-fi in the lobby
- Parking at the hotel is limited to expensive valet parking. Would recommend parking at the Paramount across the street instead
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel staff could use a lesson in hospitality

review.title: Great location, bad everything else.
review.reviewText:
I was staying in San Francisco for a number of days and needed a room to round out the last 2 days of the trip which is how I came to book the Park Central Hotel.  During check in I was told that I was "upgraded" to a better room, and sent on my way.

When entering the room we noticed that we were placed in a room that was in an angle of the hotel's architecture, so the entire room was small, cramped, and triangular.  This is where the real fun started.  Below is a list of the problems we then found with the room:
1. The drain plug of the shower was ripped out and hanging on the bottom of the shower, which did not have a light and was quite dark while inside
2.  Due to the triangular shape of the room, when closing the bathroom door from fully open to closed, it would get stuck on the bathroom counter (made contact with the counter about halfway through and required some force to continue swinging shut)
3. The toilet was inches away from the shower and blocked about half of it making it tough to get in and out
4. There were no outlets on the left bedside table or below.  The outlet on the right was very close to the ground and hard to access as it was under the table.  The only other outlets were across the room
5. Large paint chips on the ceiling  and holes in the wall where a painting should have been
6. Either the coffee machine or the outlets did not work properly because it would not stay on

Informed the desk about the shower and was moved to a new room the next day.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was the only good aspect of this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Almost everything.  The room I was given was clearly a last resort room when they have no space left.  The second room was better but still not good.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great. AT&T Park is a mile walk down 3rd St, and the heart of the Union Square and China Town are a short walk the opposite direction.

review.title: NO free Wifi
review.reviewText:
Location was just OK ... area is still quite seedy after dark.
Only one bathrobe provided for two of us.
We booked and paid for an upgraded room 2 months earlier and when we checked in they tried to put us into a lesser room saying that they don't honor 3rd party room requests (i.e. Expedia). We refused and they miraculously found the room we had paid for.
And my biggest complaint is no free wifi... I have traveled a lot and have always had free wifi.... even a Motel 6 gives free wifi. This hotel wanted $14.95 a day... anywhere in the hotel - even the lobby! San Francisco city provides free wifi so could walk out the door of the hotel and connect.... but it was blocked in the hotel. 
I do NOT recommend this hotel.... there are lots of others which are better.

review.title: Affordable and comfortable
review.reviewText: This place is nothing fancy - just a basic motel. But it has been remodeled, with nice linens and furniture. Our room was very spacious, with plenty of room for our huge suitcases. There were lots of horizontal surfaces - a table for a suitcase, a desk, and then a table with two chairs. A nice touch was a lap desk so you could work in bed. Beds were comfortable and everything seemed very clean. Microwave and fridge in our room but we didn't use them. The only down side for us was the classic "motel room" layout where the sink and vanity area is open to the rest of the room, with very bright lights which make it impossible to sleep while someone is waking up or getting ready for bed. Breakfast was the best I've ever had in this type of hotel. Pre-made omelettes and sausage but they were really quite good. Plenty of everything, nothing ran out. Staff was friendly and helpful - they were happy to store our bags for us after we checked out, while we toured Stanford. I would definitely stay here again. Justr be award there are not many dining options nearby.

Thank you for the nice review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay at The Park Central Hotel San Francisco again very soon! WiFi connectivity comes at an additional cost for most hotels in San Francisco. Until next time!

MSingleton

review.title: Within Easy Distance of Union Square
review.reviewText: This is a fairly pleasant Westin Hotel, with the usual excellent shower, comfortable bed, and good service.  I give it only 4 stars because it charges $14.95 per day for WIFI.  In this day and age, it ought to be a no charge service.

Thank you for patronizing our hotel. We really appreciate the feedback, and I will certainly route your feedback over to our management team to ensure that we make it right for upcoming guest visits. We would like to welcome you back again in order to make things right. Best regards!

review.title: Tis didn't cut it for me..
review.reviewText:
Based on what I would expect of Westin's standards, this leaves very much to be desired.

Hotel is rather old and though the it was rather roomy, conditions of hotel bathroom (like bathtubs, sinks, walls) and carpets are in need of upgrading. 

Basic amenities like bedroom slippers and toothbrush should be made available without having to request for it.

Reception staff not friendly, hardly approachable; at least for those I have encountered. I didn't feel valued to be a hotel guest, let alone a Starwood member.

review.title: Nice Hotel in the Center of Town
review.reviewText:
It's exactly what we have come to expect out of a Westin. Great service & Great rooms with ideal location.  Westins tend to cater more towards the business guest - and this particular location was in Union Square -which is close to their financial district. No pool, whirlpool or sauna - so kinda a bummer for the vacationer, but just fine for the business traveler. Location is close to all sorts of public transport - BART (which takes you to the airport), the historic trollies. The Market Street Cable cars which will take you to Fisherman's Warf/Pier 39 and the buses. 

We asked the concierge for a  bar/pub near by and we ended up at a fish house...so that wasn't ideal. But the morning concierge  was great and gave us awesome food and activity recommendations.

review.title: Perfect weekend stay
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel! Comfy rooms, great views, close to everything. Love the restaurant downstairs! Incredible food & cozy atmosphere. Would recommend to anyone!
great staff, room was great. would definitely stay here again! 1 block from the Montgomery BART station. couldn't have booked a better location.

review.title: A grave disappointment
review.reviewText:
5 star properties require 5 star staff that wish to make your stay enjoyable and provide customer service; not just roll up to work receive there next pay packet. Leadership starts with management, but management please note this this is the worst Westin I have ever stayed in!!!!

5 star in facilities only.
review.negativeRemarks: Its called the hospitality industry?

review.locationRemarks: Public transit was very easy to find, use, and navigate.

review.title: Excellent service and spacious rooms
review.reviewText: I reserved the room the morning of new year's eve and was pleasantly surprised to find a room with two queen size beds and affordable. We drove up and told the concierge we were parking across the street (less than what we would pay if we valet parked at hotel - thanks to prior reviewers) and they still treated us well. The check in was a breeze and the gentleman (think his name was Brian?) was professional and courteous.  Our room was spacious  and we didn't feel cramped even though there were four of us. The beds and pillows were very comfortable and room clean and quiet.  My only issue was the fact that on the reservation I did mention four but the bathroom had sets of towels for three.  Had to call room service for extra towels and blankets and they were delivered right away. Thanks, W, add me to your list of new customers!

managementResponses.response:

review.reviewText: It took 10 minutes to get into an elevator. Granted it is a busy season, but I don't know if I've ever been to a hotel with slower elevators. When we got into the room we opened the window to reveal a lovely view of a white brick wall and someone's office. Practically at eye level with their desk. Super disappointing. Then when we went to put our left overs from dinner in the mini fridge, we found a huge rotten papaya and the fridge was just dirty and it smelled so bad. We called down to the front desk to ask if someone could please come clean it out and although they said yes,no one did. We called a 2nd time and told them we would just be leaving the rotten fruit outside. They said they were sorry no one showed up and comped us breakfast.

review.title: Not All Westin's are Same- AVOID
review.reviewText:
Good hotel, great proximity. Stayed for a comfortable recovery after a surgical procedure, but had a bad experience with the Hotel Lobby staff who did not call a cab even after requesting multiple times at check in and requesting at am. Unfortunately, SFO was hit with a storm and we understand the rush for the cabs, but we had to wait for more than an hour, soaking in rain to get a cab while the lobby staff was trying to push Limo services instead!  Our car was parked by valet but even they stated- it will take them at least 20mins to get the car out.... remember parking is underground and entry exit are from the Lobby itself! Really!!  
We barely made it to my hospital appointment due to this attitude, later the cab guys also confirmed the "extra $ from Limo" made by the lobby staff.
Well, overall rooms were comfortable and clean. Check out was ez by "key drop". Little did we know that somebody will clean out the Mini Bar and slap the charges to us as confirmed by the emailed folio. On contacting hotel they took the guest info and said the billing department will contact you! It has been 4 days and I haven't heard anything yet. NEVER staying with them, WESTIN is good name but this place is  a DISGRACE.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff needs training for self-less service and needs better management
review.locationRemarks: Close to freeways, Union square, Wharf, shopping mall

review.title: Great location, nice experence
review.reviewText: Great hotel in all aspects, however, the $20/day internet & $60/day parking isn't included which puts it in a different price point with other hotels.  Thought I was getting a great rate.... Not really, just comparable.

review.title: Excellent location. Very accessible to SF sites an
review.reviewText: Comfortable stay. I didnt spend much time in the hotel.  So I really don't know what all the facilities are like.
It was a very pleasant stay at this hotel. The staff were all helpful & the parking attendants at check-in & check- out were accommodating considering the volume of traffic on 3rd Street.

review.title: Great hotel in the heart of the city.
review.reviewText: Walking distance to shopping, restaurants, and Yerba Buena Gardens.  Signature Westin/spa feel.  Great menu for room service - food was delicious.
review.locationRemarks: Heart of the city - a stone's throw from Yerba Buena Gardens.

review.title: Great Experience - My Staple Hotel
review.reviewText:
I was at a loss for words as it was my first time visiting San Francisco. The area we stayed in was amazing and had everything you could possibility imagine. The hotel could not have been in a better location. You walk out the door and in every direction there are tons of things to do - eat, shop, and/or museums. The entire staff was very knowledge and exceptional helpful all the way down to the concierges - Olivia and Aiyaz-, valet, front desk that gave us a late checkout for 4pm for free, restaurant staff -exceptional service and the hotel driver - a gent from Russia. 

Side note: My friend dropped his phone in the cab. He did not realize it until the cab had left and of course he was freaking out. The hotel driver call the cab and helped him locate his phone all within an hour or so.  My friend was so thankful and amazed at how helpful everyone was. 

Lastly, the nightly rate was very reasonable. This will be my staple hotel when I visit San Francisco for now on. We could not have asked for a better stay.
review.positiveRemarks: My experience spells out everything one could want in a stay in San Francisco starting with this amazing hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The maid left an article of clothing in the bathroom for the previous guest.
review.locationRemarks: Oh my god, there is too much to mention: mid to high end clothing stores, great restaurants, museums, wine tours, Fisherman Wharf, tour bus, cable car

review.title: Thanksgiving weekend 4days.
review.reviewText:
Very pleasant stay.Staff and cleanliness excellent. Restaurant good.
Wifi expensive. 
Pi llows too fat for comfort and no thinner ones available.
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows.  free wifi.
review.locationRemarks: Yerba Buena park, MOMa, shopping, walking distance to Union Sq., China town.

review.title: Luxury all around
review.reviewText: I had often walked about near this hotel, so I decided to try staying there while winding up my long-term stay in San Francisco.  Everything was pristine and luxurious.  In fact, the shower was so modern that I couldn't figure out how to use it--it had various modes I had never encountered before, and an engineer came up at my request to show me how to use them.  The restaurant's breakfast bar is downright decadent--you won't need to eat the rest of the day at all.  A great place to wind down in absolute comfort and security.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location--near Yerba Buena Center for the Arts, BART stations, SOMA and the Financial District, Westfield Center and Bloomingdale's.
review.negativeRemarks: They should have user guides to all the technology.
review.locationRemarks: Yerba Buena Center for the Arts and MOMA (when it reopens) are right next door.  Union Square and shops are within a few blocks.

review.title: Really great time in SF due to our hotel stay
review.reviewText: Loved the ease of walking anywhere to shop and dine. Great room. Quiet and what I consider first rate. Took care of our parking needs by letting us valet early and keep our luggage safe til our room was ready. We could leave and do what we wanted to and the hotel staff called us to say the room was ready.

review.title: Had a great experience staying at The Westin
review.reviewText:
My wife and I decided to stay at the hotel to celebrate our anniversary. The check-in staff (Justin) surprised us with a complementary upgrade and champagne and that just made our trip. Very thankful to him for being so thoughtful.

Would definitely stay there again. Convenience and proximity to Union Square is a great benefit. On a downside, would have liked free wifi. Aah well!! You don't get everything you want :)
review.positiveRemarks: friendly staff, convenience, proximity to union square
review.negativeRemarks: bathrooms smelled lightly of staleness / dampness.

Overall our experience was great, would stay here again.

review.title: Great hotel close to Bart, SOMA, Union Square!
review.reviewText: A great hotel very central to everything SF has to offer. Partner and I stayed here for an extended weekend trip to see friends and family and couldn't have had a better time! The views are amazing, the hotel staff is warm and friendly. House keeping does a very thorough job with such a short amount of time I was surprised how quickly they cleaned everything! Would absolutely stay here again - ask to stay in the higher up floors, we were on the 23rd floor and I would have loved to been a little higher but still had an excellent view from our room!

review.reviewText: The hotel was great. Great location, great staff.

review.title: San Francisco Escape
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located to many popular sites and has good access to transportation. The hotel concierge was great in arranging wine tours, tickets for events, transportation and dinner reservations. The only criticism would be that you can hear noise from the halls and doors closing from inside the rooms.

review.title: Must stay in SOMA/Martket St
review.reviewText: Great 1 night stay with top floor room (1 queen) with amazing city views. Requested this and was granted. Clean room with modern amenities. bed was comfy and perfect room really. Staff at check in was competent and helpful. Requested list of places to eat w/in walking distance. Found a great steakhouse steps away. Ideal central location for shopping. Opted to save $ and park overnight in garage next door. Paid $35 rather than $60+ at hotel. Overall 5 star hotel, would stay again any day of the week.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, features of room (modern), views from 36th floor room, competent staff
review.negativeRemarks: nothing

review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel located in the heart of downtown San Francisco. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a convenient location and absolute comfort. The bed was heavenly to sleep in and the rooms were immaculate

review.title: Nice place in the middle of the city
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located in a bustling part of the city. People, food and places are right out the front door. We walked to eating places and to our business meeting. The staff is pleasant and friendly, rooms are well appointed and fresh, and bar is great for relaxing. If you are driving, valet parking is your only option. It's a little pricey like all other places these days, but then again city parking is hard to come so the convenience is great.
review.positiveRemarks: Pretty much well done all around.
review.negativeRemarks: If you are staying downtown take a taxi from the airport. You don't need a car in the city.

managementResponses.response: First of all thank you for choosing to stay with us and for the feedback regarding the inconsistency in service. It is good for us to hear your first hand account in order to ensure the services we have are operating as we have designed. Thank you for the kind comments on our service professionals that met and exceeded your expectations. Safe Travels and we do hope to welcome you back again.

review.title: inconsistent stay
review.reviewText: Arrived shortly after the Giants won the world series.  Traffic made it hard to get to the hotel.  Check in went fine.  I was not offered help with the luggage though it was only 9:30 PM.  The room was easy to find, however.  Ordered room service.  The food was overcooked.  I had to ask for a receipt for the food since it was a business trip.  I did not get one the first night and the server to my room ignored my request.  I tried room service again and again had to ask for a receipt.  This time the food delivered was not what I ordered.  The quality of the food did not improve.  Housekeeping was awesome.  The lady was incredibly nice, as was the ladies in the gift shop.  Check-out went well at 4 AM and the concierge had arranged a limo.  A copy of my bill is to come to my email.  It has now been three days and I am still awaiting the copy of the bill.  I would not stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: food service
review.locationRemarks: I was at a conference and did not interact much with the attractions around.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for choosing to stay at The Westin San Francisco Market Street during your travels to this great city. You had great comments to share and we appreciate the review on Expedia!

review.title: Nice Hotel with Good Location
review.reviewText:
Room was very nice. Very comfortable bed, air conditioning, cable TV, nice shower. 
Location was great.  Couple block off of Market street with excellent access to transportation around the city and, if you wanted to, a reasonable walk to many of the spots of interest (Chinatown, Fisherman's Warf, Union Square, Market Street).
Be careful of the hotel bar as the drinks are very expensive but the WiFi is free in the bar/lobby area. 
Also a great little breakfast place a block away that should not be missed

Great hotel. This was my second time there. Great workout room, large rooms... Bummer that you have to pay for wifi. Really? Walk across to the starbucks across the street, get a coffee and snag their internet.
Great Experience! Very clean & Staff very Friendly & Helpful. Would definitely recommend & would stay again.

Excellent location, good food in restaurant/bar area.  Great deal for the price.

review.title: Could Not Have Been Better
review.reviewText: Easy check-in, prime location, great staff, terrific, quiet room (floor to ceiling glass windows are wonderful!), quick service, great bed.  Everything was, actually, perfect.  And I am particular about all of these things.  Would stay there again in a heartbeat - in fact, I will!
review.positiveRemarks: My corner room with a wonderful view and great light; everything that I needed was provided; quick response to questions; best location; cleanliness.
review.negativeRemarks: Plusher towels.
review.locationRemarks: I was visiting my son and the hotel is located close to him.

review.title: Excellent stay
review.reviewText: Two colleagues and I stayed at the Westin for 3 nights in total. Our deluxe room was clean and comfortable. The gym was clean and supplied cold and dry towels. The hotel restaurant was also quite enjoyable for our lunch. It's a great location for our walk to a conference at the Moscone center.

review.title: Great hotel in centre city
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel in heart of shopping and dining area. Friendly staff, clean and VERY comfortable beds
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet, handy to shopping and dining. Courteous staff

review.reviewText:
Great location, room was nice but clearly the previous guest smoked although is a non smoking property. Everything including the sheets smelled like smoke.
Valet Parking is crazy expensinve $60 per 24 hours. 
Staff was really nice.

review.title: Good Hotel in SOMA..
review.reviewText: Very clean and well situated as its close to Union square and market and mission. I stayed for 5 nights for work and hence didnt really use any hotel facilities besides the gym which had everything i needed.
review.negativeRemarks: Free internet. in california especially to pay $15/night for wireless is simply wrong..
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, 15min walk to Giants stadium

review.title: Central Location
review.reviewText:
Stayed for three nights in September 2014. Room, service, bar restaurant all excellent. Had a nice view of Yerba Buena Gardens. If you've got a car, stick it in the Moscone car park down the road and walk up to save on the Valet parking charges. Or ditch your rental for the time you're in the city & hire a new car when it's time to move on.

More a problem of the city than the hotel, but being centrally located meant navigating around hordes of panhandlers looking to tap the tourists. Top tips: stay above 5th Street if walking, don't look/act like a tourist, know where you're going before you set off so you're not checking maps and looking lost.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, friendly, good bar & restaurant. Good location for shopping, restaurants, China Town and to walk to Ferry Building/Piers.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Bloomingdales, Westfield, Macy's, Union Square all within walking distance. 30min walk to Colt Tower/Ferry Building/Piers.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText:
This Westin was a very nice hotel to stay at during my home hunting trip in San Francisco. The staff was very friendly, although they never held doors for me like they did other guests when I would walk in or leave and I believe this is due to the fact that I look very young and like a college student. 

The valet service was very fast and I liked how convenient the system is. All you do is text a number when you're ready for the car and it's there in 10 minutes. Very efficient. 

I was very disappointed that they don't offer Free Wifi in hotel rooms. For as much as you pay for the rooms and parking, this should absolutely be complimentary. 

I think the mini-fridge system is a neat idea (charges when you take something out), but it kept me from providing my own drinks in there and that was a little annoying. 

Overall, my stay was very comfortable and the staff was very friendly. I recommend it to anyone who wants a good location and doesn't mind paying extra for other items.
review.negativeRemarks: Free WIFI! Space in mini-fridge for personal items.

review.reviewText: Good overall experience! Walking distance to union square.

review.title: Good hotel with central location
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It has a great location close to excellent shopping, restaurants, and public transit. The room was very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wireless internet should be offered.

review.title: Great location. Hotel staff and rooms were great
review.reviewText: Nice to receive a complimentary upgrade which included a free breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Drinks at bar very expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Waterfront was excellent, lots to do and see.  Would recommend big bus tour of the city.  Was excellent.  Saulsalito is a nice little town as well.

review.title: Decent place to stay during ones holiday.

Not the Hotels fault I know but I would suggest Expedia review the rooms they are allocated, It's nice getting a discount rate for this hotel but never expected a Room on the 4th floor next to the Gym, a tad disappointed !

review.negativeRemarks: Finding a new purpose for that one room

review.title: Great downtown hotel, but...
review.reviewText: They say the mark of a great sports stadium is that there's not a bad seat in the house.  I'm sure nearly all of the rooms at the Westin on Market Street have a spectacular view of the city.  That is, except for a row of about 5 rooms and the first 16 floors or so that have an intimate view of the building to the northwest of the hotel.  In my case, on the 14th floor, we got to see not only the roof, but some upper extension of the building that almost completely obstructed our view.  My wife and I get to travel without our kids about every other year.  It sure would have been nice if they gave that room to some business traveler who never even looks outside.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to great shopping and restaurants, which is exactly what we wanted.

review.title: Great Place to stay
review.reviewText: The only thing I was disturbed  about was the $60 parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Let people know before hand about parking fee

review.title: Hotel
review.reviewText: For such a price , hotel should include breakfast and free wi fi!!

review.title: Great hotel near Union Square.
review.reviewText: Came here with wife for her first time in San Francisco.  We checked in Friday afternoon and walked about a mile to AT&T Park for the Giants game (nice, safe walk, near quite a few neighborhood nightspots). Next day, we were directed to a great place for brunch (the Grove) by the concierge, who later gave us a great recommendation for North Beach dining (Fior di Italia).  Saturday, we went to Fisherman's Wharf and local tourist attractions, which were accessible by cable car, metro or taxi---a bit of an adventurous walk if one doesn't mind hills.  Church on Sunday (Catholic Church--St. Patrick's, another San Francisco landmark with a 160 year old history dating back to the Gold Rush days.) was literally right around the block.  Great location, great staff---the doorman even gave us a discount coupon to the restaurant as he was getting us a cab----who does that?  What I can't comment on is the quality of hotel restaurants or other services---we just never used them.  Rooms were clean, quiet and the bed was extremely comfortable after a long day of walking.  We're coming back again.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't change anything.
review.locationRemarks: See above.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Super friendly staff, ready to help with anything. Very clean rooms with good view. Centrally located convinient for the both business and trourists. If will be again in SF will stay in the same hotel
We picked this hotel, because  of its quality and location to AT&T Park.  We would definitely come back to this hotel.  Comfortable, clean and highly recommended.

review.reviewText: I loved the hotel. They had originally put my friend and I on the 4th floor, but with the street noise, I wouldn't be able to sleep. So, they upgraded us to the 34th floor. The view was perfect from our window. I would definitely stay there again. The hotel staff was excellent.

Wi-fi was not complementary in the rooms and the business centre charges were high. Many hotels are now offering these services complementary and at better rates.

Room was good, and comfortable, with notable exception of check-out, an excellent stay. Slightly dodgy neighbourhood
I enjoyed staying at this hotel mainly because of the location.

review.title: Comfortable hotel in excellent downtown location
review.reviewText: The Westin's signature White Tea aroma is the first thing you notice when you walk into the hotel lobby. A very calming welcome in hectic downtown San Francisco. All staff are professional and hospitable, smiling, courteous, and helpful. The room was comfortable, spacious, clean, and the mattresses are the best. Rooms were mostly quiet and we slept like roses during our stay. The only dissonant was that the guests in a neighboring room were loud lovers one morning. Tacky behavior that is outside the control of the hotel. If only they had soundproofed the walls a little better. Overall, the place was quiet though.
review.positiveRemarks: All things Westin White Tea; what a beautiful fragrance for the home that is! We loved our room, Housekeeping did an excellent job.

The hotels concierge staff were excellent!
Hotel was very nice, clean and comfortable.  Close to everything and staff was great.

review.title: Good location, horrible water pressure.
review.reviewText: Hotel was convenient to Union Square. Upgraded to higher floor only to be put in a room behind elevators. Could hear a lot of rumbling from elevators through the night. The water pressure in the bathroom is the worse I've ever encountered in a hotel. Showers took at least three times as long to rinse out the soap.

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Great hotel if you're new to San Fran. I liked it a lot. I'm a bit of an inexperienced traveler, 23 years old, but I thought it was a beautiful hotel, conveniently located, and fairly priced (I booked a few weeks in advance).

review.title: Centrally located hotel
review.reviewText: On entering we were transported to another world, the spacious lobby, the very fast and friendly check in staff.  We were given a quiet corner room, which was great as we had bad jet lag. The room was spacious, the furnishings of a higher standard.  We enjoyed having a coffee machine.  Fast, free internet on multiple devices, was welcome.  I had no complaints over the bathroom, the products provided or with no place to hang towels, because there were plenty of them and they got replaced every day.  Hotel close to union square, and lots of great shopping, convenient to transport to the pier, but within walking distance! Transport easy to mission and Castro. The concierge managed to get us tickets to Alcatraz - which are scarce as hen teeth if you haven't booked them well in advance.  Hop on and off buses stop outside the front door.  Close to china town, and good places to eat and drink.  I would definitely stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, value for money, friendly helpful staff, clean modern rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: I think that they have everything pretty right.
review.locationRemarks: Union square, piers, places to eat and drink, shopping

review.title: Great Service!
review.reviewText:
Tried to get an early check-in and they were very accommodating. Hotel staff are all very friendly. 

Only downside was that there was a long line at check in and check out - they need to have more people at the front desk during peak hours.

review.title: Convenient Hotel in Downtown
review.reviewText:
Convenient location to Moscone Conference Center.  Traffic in this area can be a little inconvenient.  When I arrived at my room, a car horn was going off within clear hearing distance for 1 hour straight.  I vowed that if it proceeded after 5 PM, I would ask to change rooms.  Luckily it stopped, so I didn't have to worry about it.

Overall my room was pleasant.  Employees from Bell Hop to Front Desk were very pleasant.  Aside from the car honking, my room was across from the ice machine, so I probably would request to be higher and away from an ice machine in a future stay.

review.title: Great hotel, such a convenient location, felt safe
review.reviewText: Loved the room, clean , large, comfortable bed.  I felt the price was very reasonable as San Francisco is a very expensive city.  The location was perfect close to everything. Locate transportation right at the corner .  Easy to walk to everything.  Staff were very professional.
review.positiveRemarks: Felt safe, room and hotel was  luxurious and clean

review.reviewText: Overall it was positive, however, like with other Expedia bookings this hotel gave me a low floor and noisy room, they did move me, but charged an upgrade fee. This is similar for all Expedia bookings, and it is troublesome.
review.negativeRemarks: Better room selection without having to pay upgrade fees

review.reviewText: Staff was super friendly from arrival to departure. We also had a nice dining experience at the on-site restaurant Maso (though a little pricey, their portions were generous). I would have enjoyed a better view, but that would have required a larger cost on my part :)

review.title: Beds are comfortable,  Bathroom dirty!
review.reviewText:
The room was not as large as in the pictures online. It did not come with a chair and ottoman that the pictures show, so no sitting room. The bed however was delightfully comfortable.  The location is great.  Walking distance to ATT park, Union Square, and embarcadero. They allowed us a late check out, which was quite nice with a little one.

The reason for the lack of stars in my review is that the bathrooms were not cleaned upon our arrival!  The toilet was disgusting,  and hair in the bathtub.  Every hotel folds the corners of the toilet paper to show they at least looked at the bathroom and this was not done here, so I know it was untouched. 

I thought the man who checked us in could have been more friendly.  He certainly was to the well dressed couple in front of me. I was traveling with my family and tending to my infant son, so I'm sure I did not look my best, still no reason to treat people differently.  You never know a person's background.

I couldn't tell you about the hotels facilities.  I felt uninspired to go to the gym after the person checking me in said "the gym is on such and such floor, but I'm sure you won't be going." Again, quick to pre-judge. I went for a jog outside instead. I would suggest to this gentleman and most men in SF for that matter to take a trip to NYC and take down a few tips in manners.

review.title: Nice hotel, well located in the downtown
review.reviewText: Beds are very comfortable, well located close to cable trams, busses, normal trams and trains. The only complaint I have is our room was close to the elevator so there was a little noise as they went past. Overall experience was good. P.s parking is really expensive, avoid having a car if you can.

And when I asked for a list of recommended restaurants/bars from the consierge I was told I would have to pay a dollar a page for the list...are you kidding me?!? A $300 /night hotel should get me some "free" recommendations...but overall the stay was pleasant.

review.title: Careful
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel in a nice location however the hotel doesn't offer complimentary breakfast and wifi which for hotel in this price range should be included. Also they try to charge extra wherever they can. We got charged a $12 package handling fee for 2 packages that were delivered to the hotel. Additionally they put a hold for the full amount for our hotel stay on our credit card even though the hotel was prepaid fully and when moving out they tried to bill as all taxes again. Definitely wouldn't stay there again.

review.title: Trip to SFO

review.title: Fantastic location!
review.reviewText: I picked the Westin on Market to be near the Muni/Bart. Great location! I could walk to the Ferry Building and hop on the Muni to go to Dolores Park or the Castro. At the end of my stay I walked to the Bart and was at SFO within 30 minutes. I did need to move my room after the first night. It was up against the elevators and you could hear them whizzing by all night. They must get some complaints because there was a white noise machine in the room... but even that didn't help. I've never asked to be moved to another room but the lady at the front desk was very nice about it and even kept me on the same floor. It was the morning when I asked to be moved so she asked me to pack my bag and they would move it to my new room once it was ready. Very easy. The bed was VERY comfortable. My second bathroom was a tad small. I was rooming alone and still needed to close the bathroom door so I could, err, sit down and use the toilot. But the bathroom was very clean and had GREAT shower heads!
review.positiveRemarks: Very nice hotel and friendly staff. Great bar off of the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: If I was to stay there again, which I hope to do, I would ask to not but near the elevators due to noise.
review.locationRemarks: GREAT location. Two Muni/Bart stations close by, 7 minute walk to the Ferry building. The Muni took me directly to all of the places I wanted to go.

managementResponses.response:

First of all, thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We apologize that we did not meet your expectations and were not able to recover from that. We do appreciate you staying with us while you were in San Francisco.

Be Well

review.title: Westin on Market - Tired, Lacking & Over Priced
review.reviewText:
I expected so much more from this SPG Westin Hotel after staying in so many over the last year.
The Room was a high floor supposedly large room which ended up being very small and had a tiny cramped bathroom. for like $50 more could have stayed at the W San Francisco or the Palace Hotel, a Luxury Collection Hotel, San Francisco which were as it happens really close as well.
The check in facilities were tiny and staff not that knowledgeable and this hotel seemed like more suited to the quick business traveler for a conference who didn't care about the room size for a night.
The Westin on Union which is like a 5 minute walk is better featured and the same price with much more staff so easily is a better stay.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
Great location for a hotel, as it is within easy walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, Little Italy. Public transport is all around the hotel too.

Restaurant is lack luster... had breakfast there twice, and since yesterday was Easter they raised the price on the buffet by about $5 and only added a couple extra items to the buffet which were not really very good. I would not recommend having breakfast here... it is better to go to one of the nearby cafes.

Rooms were nice and large, but lack luster. No real wow factor. And we were placed right beside the elevator bank, so you could hear them running all day and night. No pool in this hotel...which is a let down. A steam or sauna would be great too after a day out on the town.

The hotel was okay in general, great location, but there are others to choose from..

review.locationRemarks: great location...easy to get anywhere from the hotel

review.title: Excellent location, good facility, great beds
review.reviewText:
I stayed on the 30th floor with a fairly good view of the city, keeping in mind you're not right next to the water. This hotel is a fair walk from the ferry building and very close to Union square, but it's a pleasant area and there is plenty of stuff to do especially if you're in the mood for shopping. It's very close to the Moscone center so it suits different types of travelers well. The staff gave me a choice of rooms and I appreciated that flexibility.

The rooms are very comfortable and clean, and I very much appreciated the complimentary water bottles. I really could not find any major faults with this property; they're doing things right. Of course, as is typical for an upscale property, amenities such as wireless Internet access are not free. When it came to what's important, it's great -- I slept very well.

Also of note: the bar and restaurant seem to be pretty popular.

review.title: Nice hotel with one amazing staff member
review.reviewText: The Westin Market Street is just like any other 4 star hotel in San Francisco. It's nice, clean, close to business and tourist sites, and reasonably priced. Without Zeke at the front desk, the trip would have been great. With Zeke, the trip became spectacular. He kindly upgraded us to the 32nd floor without charge, sent my partner and me free champagne and chocolate covered strawberries, made spot-on bar and restaurant recommendations in each area of the city we inquired about, and even came over and asked about our stay when we ran into him on the street when he was off duty. The Westin Market Street is nice, and I would definitely recommend it for business traveling, couples getting away to the city for a weekend, and perhaps small familities. But Zeke is the true treasure of the hotel and the asset we will remember most about our stay.

review.title: Letting the Westin Brand down
review.reviewText:
We just spent the last weekend at the Westin on 3rd. We paid extra for an upgrade which we thought was worth it when we got to our room as we were on the 28th floor with great views.
Unfortunately we discovered that our 'upgrade' meant we were right next to the elevator shaft so we heard it loud and clear all night. The walls were so thin that we could hear people going to the bathroom and showering.

The breakfast was probably the worst buffet I've had in years- I can't understand why a 4 star hotel would make scrambled 'eggs' from dehydrated powder. With credit to the check out staff, they took it off our bill when we said something.

The entertainment system is old and outdated. Most 4 and 5 star hotels these days allow you to purchase a 24 hour pass so you can watch as many movies as you like as opposed to paying for individual fils. The new movies at the Westin cost $18 which is more than most people pay at the cinema. Also, you're only able to pause and fast forward for a small period of time.

All in all, it felt like The Westin has a way to go before really competing with other 4 star hotels in the area. It's ok but it's just not getting the finer details right that take your stay from ok to fantastic.

I wouldn't recommend it to anyone as I know that your money can go a lot further in so many other well known hotel brands in the area.

Julie,

Thank you for sharing your feedback about your stay with us. I followed up with our management about these situations and they were able to isolate them but as you said, after it was brought to our attention by our guests. The fire alarm was being taken care of by the MOD and was isolated to the one floor below you and two floors above you and were in communication with the Fire Department per protocol. Proper communication during an event such as this is very important and that is what resonates with your message to me.
We do appreciate your comments on the rooms amenities and wished other travelers did not impact your stay so negatively. Great lengths have been taken by our General Manager with this serious of events you have mentioned. We want to establish our hotel as a place of rest for our travelers. Safe Travels and Be Well.

review.title: Nice Hotel, but Over-Run With Trouble-makers
review.reviewText:
My first night at the Westin, at 3:30am, several extremely intoxicated young people, who had littered the entire hallway with smashed food, pulled the fire alarm, and the floor had no choice but to walk two long only to be told flights of stairs per floor down to the street. When we walked around to the front entrance, the night desk person did not even know an alarm had been tripped! Where were the guards at the entrance to the hotel? Who allowed this to happen?
The second night, in the room next to mine, it sounded like there were at least ten people in there and they proceeded to play a game that began at 11pm and lasted till 5am, which consisted of running in and out of their room over and over, running up and down the halls yelling and screaming and running up and down the fire escapes. I called to complain once, but it changed nothing.
The third night, I asked to be moved to a different floor since my neighbors were staying a second night. The staff was very sympathetic and made the move right away.
The Westin is an enormous hotel and I don't feel like it is under very good control. The kinds of behaviors I have described would never be tolerated by a smaller hotel, paying essentially the same price.
One very nice thing is that the rooms were extremely comfortable with comfy beds and pillows. I just wish I had gotten the chance to actually sleep at night a little more!
review.positiveRemarks: Day time staff very helpful and friendly. Nice work-out facility.
review.negativeRemarks: Staying more on top of large groups of young people renting rooms just to party there. Knowing when there is a smoke alarm set off!!!!
review.locationRemarks: Market Street has all the shopping you would want to do. At Union Square. Fairly close to Fisherman's Wharf.

Hotel was expensive for what you get (or rather don't get). Additional fees for hi-speed internet. I am looking at hotels in NYC right now, and most of them come with free internet. The front desk lady told us that the internet fee would be waved, but it showed up in the bill, so that we had to remind them to do so. After we reminded the front desk about the internet fee, the front desk lady told us that she would take it off immediately and send me a confirmation mail, but I didn't get the confirmation mail until I asked other front desk lady about the status.
Coffee and water in the room was not refilled so that we had to go ask for it.

The hall way was trashed by other guest, and it was not cleaned for a very long time.

A false alarm went off in the middle of night. And I don't think the announce was appropriate.
They should have remind that people should not use elevators, but I heard other guests were using elevator. Whether it was false alarm or not, the hotel stuff should give more clear instruction to hotel guests.

review.locationRemarks: Not much besides Alcatraz, Fisherman's Wharf & Muir Wood.

review.title: Great hotel bad service
review.reviewText: Great hotel, very convenient location! Great service from bell boys ( we had Michael ) and valet parking. However, only one room was ready when we arrived (we had 2) . At 6pm it was still not ready. Next morning I got an email with the hotel folio and noticed that they double charged our parking fee. Also we requested the check out time 4pm but when we returned to our rooms the keys didn't work because they forgot to rekey it for us! All in all, we've been helped but it was too many going down to the lobby back and forth to fix it considering it was our wedding day.

review.title: Great hotel in the financial district
review.reviewText: From the minute we checked in to our departure they were all absolutely wonderful. Very attentive, helpful and willing to do whatever we needed! A worse experience was had dining at the other westin in San Fran

review.positiveRemarks: Nice hotel. Great location and city / bay view.

review.title: Perfect hotel
review.reviewText:
Perfect hotel to stay in SF, the location is really convenience, I never save transportation mi ey on any vacation, easy acces to bus, bart, trolley and amazing to walk to many interesting places.
The staff awesome, room pretty comfortable and neat.

review.title: Perfect hotel
review.reviewText:
Perfect hotel to stay in SF, the location is really convenience, I never save transportation mi ey on any vacation, easy acces to bus, bart, trolley and amazing to walk to many interesting places.
The staff awesome, room pretty comfortable and neat.

review.title: Perfect location and outstanding staff
review.reviewText: We were visiting family and stayed during the holiday rush time. The staff was so courteous and helpful with a smile. Our private in-room safe was out of order and staff fixed it with new batteries within ten minutes so that we could get out and on with our day of holiday fun! Although there is not free wifi we figured out that you can use your Cellular Data plan to avoid the $15 charge for their wifi. It is too bad that they cannot supply wifi but not a deal breaker. Great beds. Clean and new facilities. Amazing location. Only complaint is thin walls and connecting doors to other rooms so much so that every word is heard and had to place a sticky note on neighbor's door to please be quiet after 11 pm. Thank goodness they understood and were courteous, too. All in all a very good deal when bundled with the flight in a package of only $350 for 4 nights and airfare from LAX!
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proof the doors connecting rooms. Add wifi.
review.locationRemarks: F train to Embarcadero and Fisherman's Wharf. Walk to shopping and skating at Union Square. Holiday concerts at the Palace Hotel are amazing.

review.title: Good hotel but not value for money
review.reviewText:
Hotel was clean, central and very well located but lack of parking facilities and high price means that I wouldn't say it provided 'enough value for money'. I think the price would justify including breakfast, free Wi-Fi or free parking.

It's located near Union and Mission which means you can get about the city very easily and it's also near the main shopping mall which means there are plenty of bars, restaurants and facilities (ATM's etc...) about.
review.negativeRemarks: Free Wi-Fi, complementary breakfast or some extra value to justify the high prices.

review.title: I end up purchased their heavenly mattress pad
review.reviewText: Nice and clean luxury hotel in a excellent location. It's just 2 blocks from the Union Square. There is another Westin hotel at the Union Square but the price would be much higher. Breakfast Buffet is about $30 per person and the continental Breakfast is about $20 but we had our breakfast at Subway and Starbucks just next to the hotel. I highly recommended booking through Expedia because the rate is higher if you book with the hotel. If you need connecting rooms like us, just call the hotel 2 days before the arrival day. Their bed is comfortable and yet firm. I had this lower back pain every morning sleeping at home and usually got better in the afternoon. I always suspect it was the mattress and this trip confirms it. I woke up pain free in three nights stay and end up purchased their heavenly mattress after we were back.

review.title: Great hotel, location , location, location
review.reviewText: This is a very good hotel with a great , great location. Walking distance from Union square, Chinatown, and even a movie theater! Staff was very helpful ans provided excellent advice when organizing city tours and restaurant options. I would definitively recommend it to anyone visiting San Francisco on a family or business trip.
review.negativeRemarks: Availability of taxis , sometimes it took over 15 min to get one...
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, movie theater, Union Square, great restaurants

review.title: Nice but NO WI-FI, Really???
review.reviewText: Loved the place, loved it...hated the fact that w/the cost of the room, no complimentary wi-fi existed, what the heck is that all about? The Westin, really?
review.positiveRemarks: Location to retail shopping, grocery, fine restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: FREE WI-FI for goodness sakes!
review.locationRemarks: All of it.

review.title: Quick trip to the city
review.reviewText: Perfect location. Very nice hotel. Helpful staff. Room was very tiny though.

review.positiveRemarks: Nice rooms, good location, pleasant facilities
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to Yerba Buena and Market street.

review.title: Gym nut
review.reviewText:
The hotel put me in a room on the 4th floor, which has a 24 hour health club.
People were working out at 2:00 AM and I heard and felt the pounding sound.
The hotel told me that it is open for 24 hours.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is conveniently located to the Bart, Union Square, and Market Street.

review.title: Great hotel perfectly located!
review.reviewText: We wanted to do a quick Black Friday getaway and the Westin did not disappoint. We picked it mostly because it was pet friendly (we have a 25 lb dog) and it's conveniently located. Clean room (with amazing view), great location (walkable to Union Square shopping and tree lighting), friendly staff. Only gripe was that the failed to deliver a bed / bowl for our dog (no biggie since we bring our own bowls). Definitely will stay there again!
review.negativeRemarks: Staff follow up
review.locationRemarks: Walkable to Union Square - we also cabbed it to the new Exploratorium (on Pier 15) which is amazing.

review.title: Great location for walking and transport
review.reviewText: no further comment
review.positiveRemarks: central location and away from the madness of Powell St
review.negativeRemarks: no further comment
review.locationRemarks: no further comment

review.title: It was great
review.reviewText: I loved this place better then any hotel!!!

The young lady is about med. high wearing eye glasses was very friendly and helpful. I think her name was Karina???
I will stay@ your hotel again .
review.positiveRemarks: I like the hotel is clean, great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking price
review.locationRemarks: shopping

review.title: Book this hotel if all you want to do is shopping!
review.reviewText:
Check in went very smooth. This hotel is a walking distance to Union Square shopping centers, from westfield, barneys, macys and saks. Great place to be on Black Friday, as you can shop and ran back to the hotel to put all your shopping away and going back shopping.
Staffs were really nice and willing to give help to you without you having dollar sign for them to help and assist you.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed as it was advertised is heavenly.
review.negativeRemarks: the bath is just small. I have an asian body type short 5'5" and I had to bend my leg to be able to have a bath.
review.locationRemarks: across the hotel there is Dave's bar and California Pizza Kitchen. Best staffs and great food.

review.title: disturbing subway noise, even at 27th floor
Excellent location on Market St
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was excellent. We arrived early and expected to have them hold our bags until check-in but they got us a room right away. Staff was friendly and helpful. Will stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Right by Yerba Buena and close to the Orpheum and Union Square.

review.title: Fun and nice place to stay
review.reviewText: You are in the heart of downtown walking distance to union square and cable cars. I had a great experience here. The hotel facilities were great, the beds were comfortable and clean, the gym was nice and the front desk people were helpful and smiling. I would definitely stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: the water pressure to shower was low but i think its a downtown san fran problem.
review.locationRemarks: You can travel the whole town with cable cars, bus and bart. the city is well connected.

review.reviewText: I stayed here for several days recently, while helping my son move into a new apartment and start a new job. The hotel was very convenient to everything. We especially loved the Mexican and Indian restaurants around the corner, and walked everywhere to shop. When I was leaving, I took a black car to the airport, arranged by the hotel, for only $50. A very comfortable and easy way to end my trip, especially since I was traveling with more than one suitcase, and one especially large one.

review.title: Not worth the price
review.reviewText: Just old and not that nice. Plus you can park your car yourself for half the price (it's on-site).

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Great location at an affordable price. And I got a free upgrade. Staff was really nice and the cleaning lady as well

review.title: Easy access to most of SF
review.reviewText: We found the hotel centrally located with easy access to public transportation, restaurants and shopping. The staff were sincere and helpful. The room was small, the bathroom especially, but the amenities were very comfortable. The view was astounding! We will return.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfort, view, location, and mostly staff

review.title: big hotel all sealed up with stale air
review.reviewText:
A pre-programmed alarm clock went off both mornings at 6. It kept going off even un plugged. I threw it into the hallway second day
Air was stuffy. The AC was freezing anf no air was HOT.
This is a pretty nice hotel but it is very very uncomfortable
The beds are HORRIBLE! I think..I got very very little sleep in 2 nights
review.positiveRemarks: Good cheap expedia price! A hotel at the level I would stay in
review.negativeRemarks: get rid of the alarm clocks
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Over rated Westin
review.reviewText: Decent location and okay staff but for a full service hotel of this caliber to have a limited service restaurant (one only) and room service which is not available as backup during the restaurant's daytime closed hours is ridiculous. Further adding to aggro was attitude of staff who seemed not only to care less about a 2 minute "late" arrival past a 1:30 pm lunch closing but then couldn't suggest nearest neighborhood option.
