Also wasn't informed that my room had only an ADA compliant tub/shower with only a chest-high, non adjustable shower and no other room offered. Not the best Westin experience of many which have been good. Won't be going back there.

review.title: stay at the westin
review.reviewText: We were so impressed how nice everyone was. They went out there way to answer questions and make suggestions to enhance our stay. The weather was beautiful.
review.locationRemarks: Union square has so much shopping. IT IS SO EASY TO GET TO THE WHARF, BART .I loved the museums as well.

review.title: Good, clean hotel in the Financial District
review.reviewText: This was a good hotel in terms of housekeeping and cleanliness. The staff are all smiles from check-in to the bellhops to the maids. The only thing I would complain about is the lack of hotel umbrellas for guest use during rainy days. Being in the city for business, I didn't want to go out of my way to purchase an umbrella just so I can walk two blocks to a meeting. I saw that there were other clearly marked hotel umbrellas but none for Westin on the streets!
review.negativeRemarks: They need umbrellas!

review.title: Reliable, Comfortable
review.reviewText: With an influx of 140,000+, the city of San Francisco was well prepared and The Westin Market Street was as well. The accommodations were superb, the service was fantastic and everything you expect from a Starwood Hotel was up to par.

review.title: Nice location and comfortable
review.reviewText: The room was very comfortable and the food was great. I got free internet since I only stayed one night.

review.title: Okay hotel, no free inroom internet
review.reviewText: Hotel has the basics I expect from this chain of hotels. Not as nice a lobby as typical for this chain of hotels. The biggest annoyance is that you have to pay for internet access in the room. Nowadays it should be included. The bed was super comfortable. I also enjoyed our view. Guest services was good too, they had a curling iron I was able to borrow. The bathroom was clean and nice. Water pressure was a bit low.

review.title: extended weekend get-away.
review.reviewText:
We arrived very late and were given a room with two beds when we clearly stated a reservation for a king bed. The night staff was not able to accommodate our request, however, the day shift managed to secure the proper room for us and transferred out bags while we were out for the day on a wine tour. A comp dinner would have been a good gesture - but the management offered nothing in return for their mistake. Oh well I given up on good customer service anyway.

The room(s) were clean, comfortable and had good views. The bar is energetic and fun ! There is a never ending flow near the entrance and this place is close to every conceivable convenience you should expect in SF.
Overall a very good hotel

review.title: Nice place to stay in downtown SF
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff completely satisfied all we needed from them.

review.title: Great hotel.. Close to the Moscone..shopping great
Excellent!! Will definitely return.
review.reviewText: Very pleasant. Comfortable.

review.title: Nice hotel close to convention center
review.reviewText: Hotel was conviently located next the convention center. Staff was very friendly and very accomadating. I would stay there again. The internet should be no charge since you pay so much for your room. Gym was nice to have.

review.title: Great location for shopping
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel in a great location. Good for shopping, really a sensory overload with the numbers of stores. Close by to transport - cable car, trams, buses and BART. Walking distance to Westfield Mall and the cable care turnaround. Also close to the Embarcadero down Market St. Busy location with lots of people and homeless about also. The Restaurant is also good, fantastic food and with great bar. Hotel rooms were nice and all amenities provided (with exception of swimming pool). Wonderful hotel and would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: A Sanctuary from the busy environment. Overall a great hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: All good.
review.locationRemarks: As above

review.title: Excellent Stay
review.reviewText: 34th floor overlooking ocean, bridge, park. Amazing central location. Easy access to BART, cable cars, and buses.
review.negativeRemarks: 24 hour concierge
review.locationRemarks: Near everything you want to be close to.

review.title: One great night!
review.reviewText: Just spent one night, but it was great. Staff was especially warm and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Right down town

review.title: Good hotel but expensive extras!
review.reviewText: Great location, great staff, great rooms. Just about everything is great about this hotel. Only complaint is the expensive extras, WiFi for example was $18 a night!
review.negativeRemarks: Offer free WiFi.
review.locationRemarks: Great location on market street, easy to get anywhere in the city.

review.title: Clean and Comfortable Room.
review.reviewText: As an Expedia customer, I already have an expectation that I am not a hotel's primary client, but rather a way for them to fill rooms when they can not otherwise reach capacity. I also expect, however, that the level of service will be the same since I am still forking over a healthy chunk of cash in order to facilitate my quick and whimsical weekend getaway. Unfortunately I did not receive the level of service and friendliness I would expect from a 4 star facility. I found the staff to at times be either indifferent or somewhat rude. Given that this was my first time to San-Francisco, it painted a negative first impression of the people and the culture which should never be the case with an institution centered on high quality service. Other than that one speed-bump, the hotel was very nice and clean, as was my room. The bed was especially comfortable, I slept like a baby. At the end of the day it's just a room for me to return to after a day out on the town, but an insufficient service experience can encourage one to move on and not return.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff attitudes at the front desk.
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect, right in the heart of San-Fran, easy walking access to South of Market and Chinatown, and of course Market Street.

review.title: Awesome view of the city!
review.reviewText: Only downside was that parking was pretty steep. $54 a day plus a tip for vallet

managementResponses.response:
Dear Terrie,
Thank you for your visit and taking the time to write a review. I'm sorry to hear that you had some issues with your room but very relieved that we took care of it quickly and to your satisfaction. Hopefully we get to welcome you back soon. Be Well, Simone

review.title: Close to everything.
review.reviewText: There were some cleaning issues with the bathroom, but when mentioned to staff it was addressed immediately.
review.negativeRemarks: cleaning.
review.locationRemarks: shopping on Market street.

review.title: Negative
review.reviewText: Very basic room. Very poor lighting & minimal barest of comfort in bathroom. No extra mirror or any kind in toiletries. Charging for basic internet connection is pitiful..
review.positiveRemarks: Size of room, comfortable bed, great linens.
review.negativeRemarks: See above
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco Market & Third

managementResponses.response:
Dear Robert,
Thank you so much for choosing the Westin San Francisco Market Street and for your super nice ratings. We loved having you as our guest and hope to welcome you back soon. Be Well, Simone

review.title: Brief Stay in Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Our arrival could not have gone better. Coming back from a tour of the wine country, my wife and I were fortunate enough to find a wonderful parking garage across the street from the Westin. We deposited our rental car, and crossed over to check-in. The desk clerk was very welcoming, and took the time to find that I was a Starwood Preferred Guest. With that she upgraded us to a higher floor and a corner room. The room was modern, quite clean and very quiet. We only stayed one evening, but we could not have asked for more.
review.negativeRemarks: The price was pretty steep.
review.locationRemarks: Near the Westfield Mall, the Trolley stop, downtown shopping, and not too far from the Embarcadero.

review.title: Convenient location to Shops, Arts, and BART
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the central location. Walkable to Union Square, to Conference facilities, and Transportation. Check-in and checkout was quick and easy.
review.negativeRemarks: Option for an emailed receipt failed. I had to call and request they email it to me.
review.locationRemarks: Starbucks across the street towards Market (as is the stairs down to the BART station).

review.title: It was just a little tight in the room
review.reviewText: I liked the location & service of the hotel but the hotel itself was soooo small. For the price I paid I was expecting more room. If I were closterphobic I would have had an attack.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are too small not sure if you could fix that. Also I had conceierge help me order a pizza & got cold pizza 3hrs later
review.locationRemarks: San francisco Bay tours, Alcatraz, Pier 39, Golden gate.. everything is close

review.title: Nice hotel, close to union square
review.reviewText: Excellent, no problems!Excellent, no problems!Excellent, no problems!Excellent, no problems!Excellent, no problems!Excellent, no problems!

review.title: Hotel close to several down town sites,
review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel was very convenient and close to several important downtown sites. It was also very conveniently located close to the Mascone Centre . Could easily walk to any down town location.
The staff was friendly and helpful.
The rooms were clean, quiet and quaint.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was friendly and extremely helpful.The rooms were clean and quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Presently, the hotel is undergoing some construction which will result in updating and improvements.
review.locationRemarks: A lot of shopping near by; Mascone centre within walking distance; transit system close by.

review.title: basic stuff, but all you need
review.reviewText: Pretty typical Westin, conveniently located near the Bart station. Yummy squishy pillows. Soaps smell good.
review.positiveRemarks: Great liquor/wine store right next door.
review.negativeRemarks: Wish it had a pool and hot tub.
review.locationRemarks: Near Bart.

review.title: Very good
review.reviewText: Usual very good quality expected of a Westin, bar & restaurant prices a bit on the high side (especially breakfast, we ate out every day after the first day) so watch what you spend.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Bathrooms are very small, good deals on Friday nights, but the area is dead, you better off staying in Union Sq. Although it is not a long walk. Rooms clean and comfy.
Staff is always friendly and accommodating.

review.title: Okay but have been to better Westin properties.
review.negativeRemarks: Service. The bellmen were not attentive. Concierge and front office can try to be a little friendloer. Bathroom is dated.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown and Union Square is walking distance. Also possible to walk to Embarcadero

managementResponses.response:
Hello Karen,
Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback on your recent visit, and for commenting on the friendliness of our staff. I am sorry for the miscommunications that occurred, and hope that we have a chance to welcome you back in the future and make an even better impression. Be Well, Simone.

review.reviewText:
We checked in and had a note about the "green" initiative, which means if you don't want your room serviced, they will give you $5 to spend at the hotel.
We called and told them to please clean our room.
Next day we came back to the room, which had not been cleaned. Not good. Bad communication between departments.
Other than that, the hotel was adequate. The staff was friendly, but when I inquired about transport to the airport I got many different price quotes. We ended up taking a towncar for $50, which the concierge quoted at $89!

review.title: Fabulous view of the city!
review.reviewText: Checked in very early (around 10:00 AM). Sara was extremely amenable to allowing early check in and even got us a room on the top floor. Staff was all very friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Great views of the city, very centrally located.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost for parking was another $50 per day. The hotel was not inexpensive to begin with, charging that much for parking seems exorbitant.

review.title: Great location, excellent staff. Room ver nice wit
review.reviewText: Perfect in every way from check in to valet parking to location close to shopping

review.title: Nike Women's Marathon event
review.reviewText: The rooms and service was great but the hotel is lacking in amenities. The restaurant did not suit our needs for mid days meals at all and there was only one restaurant.

review.title: Great location and professional staff.
review.reviewText: Comfortable bed and pleasant room. I do feel the parking service fee should be a little more more reasonably priced for their guests.

review.title: SF downtown/block from Union SQ
review.reviewText: Far less than I expected for the money and from the brand.

review.title: Poor attention to detail
review.reviewText:
I'm a Starwood Preferred member and chose the Westin Market for my recent trip to San Francisco. While the overall hotel experience turned out OK, there were several niggling issues with the room that put a crimp in my comfort. The lights next to the bed didnt seem to work, and the phone next to the bed also wasn't working. It was late when I noticed the problem and I called down to the desk and they sent someone up quickly. They fixed the lights but after they left the phone started beeping and I couldnt get it to stop without unplugging it.

I will say that when I checked out, they asked me how my stay was and when I gave a half-hearted "OK"
as my response, the desk clerk asked why and after I explained my issues, she offered to remove the charges I had for a movie and internet, which I happily accepted (though I was not seeking anything).

review.title: good location, ok overall
review.reviewText: Overall ok, a little $$$ but its SF, room smallish. Will not be first option on next visit, prefer to try the other location at Union Square

review.title: Great Staff and Service
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with our stay at the Westin. The location was in the middle of everything you want to see and we didnt need to rent a car. What really made us like the hotel was the staff. Zeke at the front desk was amazing. He found out it was my wife's 30th birthday celebration and he upgraded our room the second night. He also made sure to tell us about all of the great places to eat and experience the city. Joshua and the rest of the concierge staff were very helpful and knowlegable. The resturaunt staff was incredible as well. Needless to say we will be staying at the Westin next time we are in San Francisco. You can tell that the Westin knows that the people make the experience and they have a great staff. From the cleaning staff on up they were great.
review.locationRemarks: We chose this hotel because on the proximity to everything in the city. You will spend more money on the room but make it up easily in transportation

review.title: Great location, staff and access - easy BART/Muni
review.reviewText: Great staff, location and access to everything SF! Warning, don't move anything in the hotel mini-bars or open the door if you don't want to deal with correcting a billing error; there are electronic sensors that don't function as intended and mischarged my room, luckily I caught before leaving.
review.positiveRemarks: Bar, access to/from SFO and Transit, easy tourist and business location
review.negativeRemarks: They are in the midst of finishing the renovation - it's looking great!
review.locationRemarks: Union Square; Ferry Building; Cable Car; Mission; Market Street

review.title: Beautiful hotel close to all shops and restaurants
review.reviewText: The room is clean and the bed is very comfortable. The hotel cleaning lady is extremely nice. The hotel checking staffs wasn't that friendly, or informative, but it doesnt really bother me. I'm not going to let one or two staffs ruined the image of this hotel. Overall, I love this hotel. I would definitely stay here again in the near future. I will also recommend this hotel to all my friends and family.
review.negativeRemarks: Train the front desk staffs to be more friendly and informative.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is in the middle of everything. It's close to the union square, bus station, china town, and surrounds with shops and restaurants.

review.title: was in the centre of town and offered good access
review.reviewText: the food and bar within the hotel were hugely overpriced. the rooms nice clean comfortable. I would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: food and drink prices were very high.
review.locationRemarks: central,easy to get around.

review.title: Good proximity to Moscone.
review.reviewText:
Lower floor rooms are very noisy, street noise. Internet is very expensive, $19/5 devices, speed is not so good.
No decent place close by to eat. Better to stay at hotels near Union Square.

review.title: excellent
review.reviewText: we enjoyed everything about this hotel, large comfortable room, excellent downtown location, good outdoor restaurant. courteous staff!

review.title: Nice hotel in a central location.
review.reviewText: We stayed for 5 nights recently and were very happy. Its a big hotel but very comfortable, we had a room with a lovely view (the windows are huge) the bed was really comfortable and the bedlinen and towels were high quality. They also supplied decent toiletries.
review.positiveRemarks: The girl on Reception that booked us in, I think her name was Maisie, was really welcoming, friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Supplying shower caps would make sense, especially as the showerhead isn't adjustable.
review.locationRemarks: It was handy for Union Square and the bus stops etc but not too noisy.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Overall a good experience. Staff was friendly. Room was nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient location. everything was pretty much walkable.

review.title: Wedding night
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent our wedding night at the Westin and loved every moment of it. They had a bottle of sparkling wine ready for us when we arrived and a beautiful view! This wasn't the first time at this Westin and will not be the last!

review.title: Very central
review.reviewText: Nice stay , valet parking little expensive , but overall excellent stay

review.title: Perfect location for our San Francisco visit
review.reviewText: We had not stayed at a Westin for years, but after this visit - will definitely check look at Westins as a first choice for future trips. Even joined the Starwood Preferred group based on this experience. The staff member who checked us in was very gracious and pleasant to talk with. She didn't act like she was in a hurry to move us along. Our room was totally quiet, clean w/luxurious sheets & towels, and very comfortable. All the personnel we came into contact with - concierge desk, doormen, cleaning staff - all were genuinely nice.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Close to all downtown & waterfront activities. Easy access to roads out of town and to airport.

review.title: Location was perfect, close to everything.
review.reviewText: The hotel is in central financial district. Within walking distance to public transit and harbour. Hop on hop off bus tours also stops in front of hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The concierge was very busy most of the time.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great - Starbucks was right across the street, so got some free wi-fi when needed.

review.title: Great vacation at great place
review.reviewText: Room and services were incredible. Friendly and helpful staff. Great hotel. Incredible experience at a great hotel.

review.title: perfect for what we needed
review.reviewText: We didn't spend alot of time at the hotel but the time we did spend there was great. The happy hour at MOSA is tasty and the staff is very helpful and kind. Beds are amazing!! Wifi is good also.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, friendliness, price of room, waiters, concierge, beds, wifi!
review.negativeRemarks: Price of valet is way too much! Shower curtain was moldy.
review.locationRemarks: Many great restaurants close by. Good malls, bars, fishermans wharf.

review.title: Nice, but reservation was significantly changed
review.reviewText:
I reserved a king bed and instead ended up with a queen sized in a handicap-assist room. A small room with no bathtub. Price of parking was consistent with just about every thing else -- at $54 far more than most cities in the US.
My GPS batteries were dead, so I called for directions to the hotel from AT&T Park, a distance of probably 3/4 of a mile. The person who answered had an extremely thick foreign accent such that I had difficulty understanding anything she said. With that, she didn't know where AT&T Park was, so she transferred me to a Guest Services extension that, according to the recording I heard once there, had been closed for over two hours.
review.positiveRemarks: Grand entrance, good restaurant, good neighborhood for restaurant or necessities shopping.
review.negativeRemarks: You must replace people who do not speak English well who you've assigned to answer the phone. You barely consider the needs of phone callers.
review.locationRemarks: Good neighborhood for restaurant or necessities shopping.

review.title: Beware of the rooms next to the elevators
review.reviewText: Even though the hotel had plenty of available rooms (as I checked on Expedia), the front desk manager put me in a room across the hall from the elevator. It felt like somebody was constantly moving the furniture in the rooms next and above me! It took a while to find the decision maker and they relocated me to a "Starwood Preferred Guest" room, which is the same room but with a great view and two free small bottles of water instead of one.
review.negativeRemarks: The shower stream is so powerful, it could be used by the riot police. Worse yet, it can not be regulated. The water in the shower is not hot enough
review.locationRemarks: Great place for breakfast about 10 minute walk away on Montgomery Street (Jackson Square) called Bocadillos. They are open from 7am on weekdays.

review.title: AWESOME HOTEL!!
review.reviewText: It was pricey but well worth it very nice. Easy check-in & check-out. Matt Cain was staying there also we saw him. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Birthday weekend
review.reviewText: This was a last minute trip, excellent prices on Expedia
review.locationRemarks: Great shopping and family activities

review.title: Would def stay again!
review.reviewText: Great hotel... fantastic location for food and shopping! And easy access to transport! Comfy bed! Loved our stay!

review.title: Very comfortable, great location
review.reviewText:
Great in room coffee.....only no tea as one of us doesn't drink coffee. Wifi in lobby. Housekeeping is a little lacking. Only 1 bathrobe when we checked in for 2. Someone left a almost empty can of diet coke in the mini fridge and it hadn't been checked. Reception was ok when we told them and said we hadn't used minibar- they checked on their computer and said we hadn't removed anything to be used....think I read on another review they have a sensor on the minibar.
Otherwise very comfortable beds and facilities

review.title: The westin marketplace san francisco
review.reviewText:
Great loction in downtown, staff was great, rooms were
Clean and nice . No mini fridge in the room, unless you ask for one, but only upon availability.
Wifi only in the lobby, otherewise you have to pay for it in your room. Overal i would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi and mini fridges in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Location was in downtown 5 minute walk to union square, located near the mall amd shoppong district.

review.title: First time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: A pleasant hotel in a good location. The lobby is under renovation, but the staff did a great job of making sure guests were not inconvenienced.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location......... Close to shopping, dining and public transportation
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom lighting is a little dim.....

review.title: Good location for shopping
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very close to Nordstrom, Bloomingdale's, trolley, and a stop for the BART transit
to/from the San Francisco airport was 1 block away. The hotel was very clean and comfortable.
The hotel restaurant and bar were too expensive (martini was $15) but California Pizza Kitchen across
the street has a full bar and there martini's ($8.50) and food were outstanding! Chinatown was approx 5
blocks away as well as trolley to Fisherman's Warf.
I will say I was disappointed with the number homeless people throughout the city. It is such a beautiful
place but no matter what area, homeless were abundant. The Westin is next to the Four Season's so
location didn't have much to do with it. Wish the city had better resources for this population.

review.title: All good!
review.reviewText: Have stayed at multiple hotels in downtown S.F. and Fisherman's Wharf and Westin Market St. is now my favorite. Staff is great. I used the mini-fridge for storing some items and then realized I may be charged for it, but no worries, not a problem. The staff makes your stay trouble free. Beds are super comfortable and room very clean and pleasant. Restaurant in hotel has very good food, bar is relaxing and nice. BART (subway) is a block away so if you fly in, take it and the hotel is super close. All good at The Westin Market Street.

review.title: August in San Fran
review.reviewText: Stayed 3- nights. Hotel centrally located for walking around downtown in San Fran. First night we had a domestic going on next door that security did their best to address promptly. One night after being out all day and returning at 10pm our room was not made up! We called housekeeping who claimed we were on some sort of green program which we certainly were not at $300 per night! Staff did come right away at this late hour and made up our room. Valet parking very expensive ($54 per day). We parked across the street for $25 per day.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, central location, great beds.
review.negativeRemarks: Cheaper parking at hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Very central to walk anywhere downtown.

review.title: Wonderful hotel and close to everything!
review.reviewText: The staff at the front desk were really nice. We reserved a standard room and got an upgrade to the 17th floor with a nice city view without asking. We always had 2 free bottles of water every day which was great and the bed was sooooo comfortable along with the pillows. The concierge was nice and helpful and made us a restaurant reservation right at his computer. There is 36 floor levels and we never had to wait for the elevator, it was real fast. I can't comment about the hotel restaurant because we never ate there. The only negative thing I can saw it the valet parking. It cost $55 for a night and when I received my hotel statement by email, the charged me 2 parking's for the same day. Contacted the hotel and they said they had to contact the parking attendants because it is operated by a separate company from the hotel before they can do anything about removing the amount. On the second day, we discovered across the street a indoor parking lot for $25 for a period of 24 hours. The only downside is that they open at 10am and close at midnight. They few days we were there, we had to leave before 10am. We had a wonderful in San Francisco, it is such a beautiful city. Also visited the Napa Valley which has a lot of nice scenery and great wineries.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, good staff, very clean and the bed and pillows were very comfortable
review.locationRemarks: Cables cars are withing walking distance, close to Bay Bridge, Fisherman's wharf and Golden Gate bridge by car.

review.title: Weekend Trip
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel overall! Only recommendation is to park in the lot behind the hotel, valet is rather expensive.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to the Moscone.
review.reviewText: The Room was very clean and confort. Like the way you called the taxis. It is different than in other countries.
review.locationRemarks: The Moscone, Pier 39 by taxi, bicycles

review.title: Excellent hotel with a central location
review.reviewText: Easy access by subway. Hotel is beautiful and clean. Had a high floor with a great view of the city and coast.
review.positiveRemarks: Near good restaurants, efficient staff, rooms Very quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: They shouldn't charge for wifi access at these prices for rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to access all modes of public transportation.

review.title: one night stay
review.reviewText: clean room, very comfortable bed. our room was next to the service elevator room (which on check in they told us and gave us another option) and was not a bother, I heard a few bumps and noise in the early evening but nothing after that.

review.title: decent size rooms, friendly staff
review.reviewText: front desk checked me in early without even asking (another hotel down the block wasn't so accommodating). room was good size and queen beds (not the twin beds we had at down at the Warf). good location, right off market. Close to BART and Muni too.
review.negativeRemarks: tv reception on a couple of channels was fuzzy..

review.title: Best hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Front desk was excellent. Offered to upgrade us since we were celebrating our anniversary. Terry is the best!! Everything about our stay was excellent including the anniversary surprise when we returned from dinner. Thank you Terry!!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very professional from front desk to housekeeping. Room was clean and comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Everything there is to do in SF is only steps away to catch trolleys cable car or public transportation.

review.title: Surprised
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised about the fantastic service this hotel gave. I had read other reviews and was a sceptic. Overall it is very nice, close to union square without being right in the middle.

review.title: Over Priced, low quality hotel.
review.reviewText: This hotel was a huge disappointment to me. I normally stay at the Marriott but this time, I stayed at the Westin because of the location and the price through Expedia. My experience was not good. I have some food allergies, so I normally need a small refrigerator in my room. I asked 4 times for a refrigerator, each time, the people were friendly and said they would accommodate but the refrigerator was never delivered. Finally, at 8:30 pm, when I really wanted to get ready for bed, I called again and expressed my frustration, which finally resulted in a delivery of the fridge. From that point forward, there were many issues, the bathroom sink leaked, the maid did not deliver new cups for water, etc. The only thing that was reliable was the valet. However, for $45 a day, I would hope they could deliver your car with a smile and some kinds words.
review.negativeRemarks: The service, inconsistent and unreliable.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, down town San Francisco, walking distance from many things we did.

review.title: Not all its cracked up to be
review.reviewText: Disappointed with the room which overlooked the exhaust fans (6 year old son wondered why we had a view overlooking the junkyard). Gym was minimally equiped, No pool.Staff were helpful. Hotel was also being renovated.
review.locationRemarks: bus tours, Groves cafe round the corner is a great place for breakfast.

review.title: Westin SF
review.reviewText:
Bathroom very small and out of date. No standup shower stall just simple tub not even soaker tub with shower.
Bar size fridge stocked with hotels overpriced items no room to place any of your own stuff.
review.locationRemarks: Location ideal pied a terre to convention center and financial district.

review.title: Great location and quiet room
review.reviewText: We loved the location of this Westin because it is very close to bus lines that took us to North Beach, Chinatown, Haight, and other tourist type locations. It is a 10-15 minute walk to the Ferry Building, and an even shorter walk to Union Square. There are numerous coffee and sandwich shops within a couple of blocks. The room was clean and comfortable, but most impressive was how quiet the room was. We rarely heard any sounds from other guests, even though there seemed to be a lot of guests, based on the elevators and lobby area. The staff at the desk and at the concierge station were knowledgeable, courteous and quite helpful. Their private "black car" service to SFO was far more comfortable than the taxi ride we took on the way in, for about the same price. We have no complaints, and will stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the location and how quiet the room was.
review.negativeRemarks: They should provide a few more coffee/tea cups without being asked.
review.locationRemarks: The location was good because of easy access to public transit, and a short walk to the Ferry Building and Union Square.

review.title: Great hotel! Great staff!
review.reviewText: Great hotel! Booked last minute and got a great deal. The concierge and front desk staff were a pleasure and extremely helpful giving us maps and pointing out where to go and how to get there. This is a great hotel for tourists. I know the Westin to be a more upscale hotel and this one didn't disappoint. Great, safe location.
review.negativeRemarks: We prefer an empty fridge over a minibar. But nicer hotels usually have minibars.
review.locationRemarks: Very central and safe.

review.title: Lovely hotel in a nice neighborhood!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. The rooms very spotless and everything was in great condition. About a mile and a half walk from fisherman's wharf, pier 39, pier 33 (Alcatraz), Boudin's and Ghirardelli's. The valet service was great - our car got broken into at dinner and they were very helpful. FYI. If you check in at 7pm, you get to use the garage until 7pm the day you leave, even though checkout's at 11am.

review.title: An AMAZING view of downtown San Francisco.
review.reviewText: The room we had was a perfect view of downtown San Fran. It is also located right next to MUNI/Trolly stations. In my opinion it is the perfect hotel and location for a San Francisco getaway.

review.title: A few changes and it would be pleasing
review.reviewText: Coffee in the lobby (every day but especially after a false alarm at 2:30 AM) and not charging for internet access would make my rating closer to pleasing.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was good, staff was very friendly and helpful, workout room was well equipped.
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to Pier One and Farmer's Market. Market Street has many shopping and eating options- fun to walk down. Close to union square.

review.title: Exceeded Expectations
review.reviewText:
We needed to book a last minute stay near the financial district of San Francisco, so we were expecting to pay through the nose. We were very happy to find the Westin looked comfortable and was reasonably priced. We saw that parking was $60/night, so we parked at a nearby lot and walked over. We could have also walked from the CalTrain Station.
Upon arrival, the staff was very pleasant and upgraded our room. We had a beautiful city view, all the way to Alcatraz Island and the Bay Bridge in the distance. The room was spacious by SF standards and the bed linens were 100% cotton and very fresh. Although we could hear the elevator, the hotel provides a white noise machine that masked the sound just fine. We probably could have switched rooms if the sound bothered us, but we didn't want to give up our view!
From the hotel, we were able to walk to Yerba Buena Gardens, which has a children's museum as well as other attractions. Many restaurants and museums are within walking distance.
The 12:00 check out time was really convenient for us as we needed to take care of a business matter in the city prior to our departure.

review.title: Front desk was great. Upgraded us to higher floor
review.reviewText: Spent 3 nights there with my daughters and it was a great location for all that we wanted to see.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to a lot of things.

review.title: Very nice hotel close to the center of SF
review.reviewText:
We were there for 9 days, everyone in the hotel were very helpful and pleasant. The minus is that the parking is very expensive.
Our stay there was a very nice experience.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, and the very nice staff.

review.title: Our stay
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay. Our room was nice and there was room to move around
review.negativeRemarks: Sometimes we had to wait a while for the elevator. We ended up going up in order to come down since they all seemed to be full coming to our floor.
review.locationRemarks: Location of the hotel was great.

review.title: Average
review.reviewText: There was nothing special about this Hotel. Very average
review.negativeRemarks: no swimming pool. No free internet

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, great room. Only reason its not a 5/5 is they were reno'ing their gym and have no pool. If you do research im sure you would know about the pool thing, just assumed with this hotel chain they would have one!
review.negativeRemarks: No pool
review.locationRemarks: Good, minutes from shopping

review.title: nice place to stay
review.reviewText:
All the staffs were polite. Clean up the room very detail.

But 2 coffee cups for 3 people.
review.negativeRemarks: Our room no view
review.locationRemarks: Market street San Francisco

review.title: Check your final bill
review.reviewText: Location and cleanliness of the room was great; however I paid for an upgraded room to king bed on a floor higher than 15, when I checked in I was told there were none available and was given two queen beds on the 7th floor. I was shattered at the time because I had just come off a long flight and couldn't be bothered arguing, but they offered to 'let me keep that room if I wanted', however they didn't offer me a refund or anything else in return. Of course I asked to be moved the next day and was given a room on the 16th floor. It was okay, but it still would have been nice to have been offered something for the inconvenience. I had to keep all of my stuff packed up so that the bell boys could move it. Then they charged me for two days of valet parking, even though I didn't have a car. I had to ask on two seperate occasions for this to be removed from the bill before checking out. My advice to you would be - check your bill before you check out. I was simply asked "should I charge the rest to your card" and because I knew that I had valet parking which I had already asked to be removed, I asked to check the bill. It was still there, and if I hadn't have checked, I would have been charged.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was excellent, room was also nice and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Being downgraded without being offered any compensation and being charged for valet parking even though I had no car.
review.locationRemarks: Great! Close to Union Sq, shopping and very easy to get to Fishermans wharf.

review.title: Best experience.
review.reviewText: Excellent service, the most modern amenities and room available in Union Square area. The online and mobile check-in I particularily loved, no waiting in line when I arrived and I received a text when my room was ready. Loved it, this is now my hotel of choice when visiting Unions Square, SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Extremely clean and modern, and very convenient location.

review.title: 12 night stay - very comfortable
review.reviewText: This is a very comfortable hotel in a good central location. Market Street at night can be a bit confronting, but the hotel is close to almost everything, and there is every form of transport you can imagine so you can go wherever you want very easily. The lifts are often unbelievably SLOW. When we were checking out 2 lifts were out of order and it took 20 minutes to get downstairs (Im not exaggerating  stood around for 20 minutes waiting for a lift!). Other days were also slow (5 minutes for a lift to arrive). Seems the lift maintenance is not up to standard. Most staff were helpful and friendly, but not the bellhop. He seemed to resent storing our luggage for us and was quite rude. Housekeeping on the other hand were really friendly and helpful and did a great job.
review.negativeRemarks: Bellhop is rude
review.locationRemarks: Very central

review.title: Spacious hotel, central location
review.reviewText: Comfortable, clean and centrally located hotel. Great views and good room space. Coffee maker was appreciated but weren't able to use the fridge. Cable Car stop very close at the end if the street.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Nice hotel smell on entry.
review.negativeRemarks: Could have better size fridge for customer use
review.locationRemarks: Great and close to Cable Cars

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: The location was not good, very inconvenient & we were not told ahead of time that we had no other choice but to pay $50+ per day for valet parking. The staff was very nice & the room was very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: Fantastic staff. Made traveling around the city great

review.title: The most pleasurable hotel experience in years!
review.reviewText:
Our check-in was the beginning of a wonderful customer oriented experience; the greeting, the smile of confidence and the assurance of true satisfaction. The room was exceptional; facing the harbor with floor to ceiling windows and viewing the tanker ships as they awaited their turn at port.

The mattress is truly "heavenly." My wife and I had a sound and relaxing sleep 6 nights. Most hotels are not offering this level of comfort. My hat is off to Westin for the quality of mattress and linen....and the toilettries that rival all of the better four and five star hotels.

If you are considering comfort and value, Westin leads the competition.
review.positiveRemarks: The view from the room at night was simply romantic--the city scape and harbor.
review.negativeRemarks: Would you consider free parking; afterall, the vehicles will stay parked for most of any visit to San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: We were centrally located to fine shopping; Nob Hill; Market Street line; eateries; and everything is within walking distance.

review.title: Great location for shopping
review.reviewText: .....but not many restaurants close by except in hotels.

review.title: Needs a renovation
review.reviewText: The hotel is very well located, I believe it is undergoing renovation works. However, the rooms are tiny (we stayed in a superior double), bathrooms antiquated and unbelievably small, no free wi-fi in the rooms etc. It's really old style, dusty feeling. Other than that, the staff has been very nice and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade, invest in renovation of bathroom & fixtures etc.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, shopping area.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Room was clean and cozy. Staff was kind and great to talk with and helped alot!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, staff was knowledgable and worked well with you on what to do as tourist things. Help us alot!!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing stay great and awesome!
review.locationRemarks: Few blocks from union square the shopping area which is great, movie theater in the other corner, and near the Cable Cars.

review.title: Westin SF
review.reviewText: The restaurant was very expensive - we chose to eat elsewhere after our first experience. Our room was next to the elevator which made a constant noise. There were problems with our account which were pleasantly resolved but should not have happened in the first place. We felt like we were seen as customers, not as guests.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy room
review.locationRemarks: Central

review.title: Nice hotel in a good central location
review.reviewText:
Overall a great hotel that we loved. It was perfect for all the things we wanted to do, although there were a few negatives, there was nothing that would stop a recommendation.

Pros:
The room was great - beds were fantastic, lovely bathroom, very spacious.
Perfect location - taxis out the front, 5 min walk to the shopping area, and 5-10 minute tram to fisherman's wharf.
Friendly staff

Cons:
The gym is being renovated so you have to walk a block to use another gym.
The room was prepaid, yet the hotel double charged - this was rectified immediately however if we didn't check, it wouldn't have been fixed up.
Expensive parking - $59 a day. However if you take the location into consideration it isn't unexpected.
The lifts were a bit unreliable, despite being about 6 there was sometimes a 5 minute wait for it to come.
Late check-out was difficult to get, we had to go back three times. Must depend on who is on reception, but we eventually got it extended to 2pm which was helpful as our flight did not leave until 11:30pm.

review.title: nice hotel close to all the center city shops
review.reviewText: overall the hotel was clean and the staff was pleasant but the room was very small and it felt like we were always in each others way. would stay there again but would request a larger room.
review.positiveRemarks: location very good, and the staff was helpful
review.negativeRemarks: room size was small
review.locationRemarks: close to Little Italy and fisherman's wharf

review.title: Nicely done
review.reviewText: Very nice remodel, great staff, excellent restaurant expensive parking.

review.title: Great Location but lack of services for the cost.
review.reviewText: Comfortable stay in a nice hotel. The location was the best part of this stay. Cost of hotel is merely the location - do not expect anything special. Wi Fi, which is a given in most hotel stays now, the Westin will charge you not only for the connection but for each computer or tablet you use. Parking is also a costly issue - understandable given the location, but the cost is a bit extreme. However the staff will inform you, if you ask that there is a more reasonable parking garage one block over.
review.negativeRemarks: Could offer more services for the cost of the hotel stay - Wi Fi should be included in price and parking garage should be more reasonably priced.
review.locationRemarks: Great location; close to plenty of shops and variety of food choices in the area. Cable car stop is close and most attractions within walking distance

review.title: Not the best Westin
review.reviewText: There was no pool, the restaurant was overpriced and had inconvenient hours also had to go elsewhere to use a workout area, the area around the front door was far too congested and busy with vehicular and pedestrian traffic.
review.negativeRemarks: The crazed front entrance
review.locationRemarks: convenient

review.title: Not what I expected
review.reviewText:
We had booked a room above the 15th floor for the views, paid extra and got a room on the 14th floor which we were told was the upgrade. One bottle of water on the first day and then nothing for the next 2. Room smelled skunky when we returned the first evening, it dissapated but was gross. The bed smelled like stale beer. Walls very thin and very noisy. No one ever asked how our stay was, even when I took the time to wait in line to check out.

Location is great for shopping and the Bart and street cars.

Not the Westin experience I would expect at that price point.
review.negativeRemarks: Room odour and very noisy
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to Bart, shopping, street cars

review.title: Room Horrible
review.reviewText: The shower leaked all over the floor, carpet was wet for both days. Couldn't open door in bathroom and use toilet. The gym was closed due to construction. For as much money as they charge the internet should be free. They charged me $22 to use the internet and print 5 pages of paper. I would not recommend this hotel.

review.title: Hotel sits n city bus tour route, and is stop.
review.reviewText: Lobby lounge was under construction during my stay. Sitting area in my room was awfully lacking with just one desk chair.
review.locationRemarks: Close to public transportation.

review.title: Recent Stay
review.reviewText: Amazing beds and great Location in SF. Can only recommend it!

review.title: This was very nice hotel and good location.
review.reviewText: The experience in the hotel was pleasant and comfortable. We loved the area were is located and very good access to other locations of interest.
review.positiveRemarks: the location of it and the access to transportation and areas of interest
review.negativeRemarks: The area I would say that needs some improvement is were the vehicles are located nothing else.
review.locationRemarks: very great location and great access to other good areas

review.title: Not pleased
review.reviewText: I rated the room of 2 star due to the bathroom. Although I didn't spend most of my time in the room cause I was out all day... I think that the bathroom disgust me the most. It smell like feces. I started to investigate where the aroma was coming from and realized the rim of the base of the toilet had a streak of feces. I immediately called housekeeping and reported the smell and what I noticed. They send housekeeping to the room to clean it but knowing this completely upset me and made me disgusted with the hotel. For this reason, I do not recommend this hotel. If u don't care for cleanliness and only concern urself with location then this is a good hotel cause of location. Market street is the best location for hotel stay cause all the stores, restaurants and etc are located there plus transportion. You will find the cable car, bus, trolley and other transportation stop on the market st strip leading u all over San Francisco. If you decide to go to Westin wish u a better experience stay there. As for me, no more stays at the westin not at San Francisco or anywhere. This is not my first time staying at a Westin hotel... Didn't like it in Ny and the one in San Francisco. In both hotel found it to be filthy. Courtyard Marriott is cleaner and nicer furniture for less. Don't believe me check them out yourselve and you will see. It's truly ashame... Pay less in one and its all around better than a so call high end hotel. I feel like Westin is truly overrated.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Lots of shops, restaurants, and transportation to get around San Francisco

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: We stayed as a personal visit to SF and loved the location. Close to restaurants, public transportation and activities. Clean and well appointed rooms with cheerful staff.

review.title: Weekend in SF
review.reviewText: Hotel is location is good. Rooms clean and staff very good. Overall experience was very good and it's the second time we've stayed here.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be a big plus if wireless internet was not charged as an extra........

review.title: Weekend with the kids
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel - we stayed on the 22 floor with a great view to the city. We had a king bed, I asked for two queen and unfortunately they we're completely booked. Carmen at the front desk was amazing she called for a rollout bed and it was waiting as we arrived in our room. She was great with making sure our stay was comfortable. This was a weekend trip with my three kids 16, 14, and 9 - they love the city, love to walk around catch a movie and take out time with no real agenda. Very safe and clean area around the hotel.We parked at Jessie's garage overnight next to hotel highly recommend it. Target is nearby great to buy snacks and drinks to bring back to hotel. On our way out we drove to Alamo Square to look at the painted ladies - good pictures. SF is a great City, lots to see and do!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything, beds very comfortable, great view, very clean, rooms have enough space. Up to date decor. Front desk - Carmen was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance to everything - Union Square, movies/Metreon, Shopping, park. We parked next to the hotel at Jessie's parking recommend!

review.title: Hotel review
review.reviewText: We visited San Francisco and also Napa Valley. We stayed at the Westin in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The concierge was very helpful. The rooms were in good condition. The hotel is in a good area of the city as far as picking up buses to get around.
review.negativeRemarks: They should provide free Internet in the rooms.

review.title: Good Location But...
review.reviewText: Location was excellent to get anywhere in the city. We had a tub drain back up that after 2 attempts staff did not respond to our requests to fix it. Upon leaving it still was not fixed. Food prices in the hotel are not family friendly at all, in fact they appear high even for business travelers. Room was great and the beds are as advertised. As with anywhere you go in San Francisco, unfortunately the homeless are everywhere
review.negativeRemarks: Response to traveler needs and the food prices
review.locationRemarks: Easy to get to all public transportation. Close to cable cars, Muni and Bart systems

review.title: Good Location & Excellent Restaurant
review.reviewText: Well located and excellent hotel with excellent restaurant. Unfortunately rnevations occuring while we were there. Negative was public wiFi not working and in room needed to pay unlike all other hotels on our trip.
review.negativeRemarks: Paying for WiFi
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: Westin Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was good but there was substantial renovations occurring during our stay. In particular the gym was out of action and the lounge areas were impacted. Overall however I'd be happy to stay at the hotel again. Great location.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is great for shopping and is only a 15 munute walk to AT&T Park, which was ideal as we were here in part to see the Giants play.
review.negativeRemarks: The renovations that were occurring
review.locationRemarks: Ideal

review.title: renovation and room behind elevators...
review.reviewText: Lobby and bar was under renovation. My room was right behind the elevator so we were listening to the elevator for 24hrs. I asked for the room change but they did not offer anything else.

review.title: San Francisco downtown
review.reviewText: Hotel-Staff overall arrogant. Lots of renovation in process. Gym closed. Avaialable in different hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: friendlyness
review.locationRemarks: MoMa Lots of restaurants and shops

review.title: Very corporate, not what I had in mind
review.reviewText: I have been in San Francisco several times and every time stayed at boutique style hotels like the Prescott and loved it. Thought I would give Westin a try for a change as usually never a disappointment. Of course the rooms were lovely, the bed extremely comfortable, but I found it to be a little too corporate for my couples getaway. The restaurant was great if you sat outside, but inside was like a warehouse. The bar was similarly styled (it is attached to the restaurant) we went once for a drink but didn't return as it just didn't feel warm and cozy at all. Restaurants seemed to be a hike to get to, and in the San Francisco evening weather just too cool to walk far so we had to cab it to the places we wanted to go. Was a better stay in Union Square. Staff very helpful but almost too professional and flat.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, good service, very comfortable bed, high floors and good views
review.negativeRemarks: They seemed to be undergoing a major restaurant renovation when we were there so maybe that might add to the ambiance it seems to be lacking.
review.locationRemarks: I didn't love this location. Prefer to walk, but the Wharf was a half hour so a little far. Good shopping nearby though.

review.title: Nice landing pad.
review.reviewText: We were only there 2 nights and it was action packed, so spent very little time at the hotel. The staff we dealt with were excellent. Rooms were clean and fairly spacious, but ours by the elevators not the best for sound, unless you can pretend the elevators are waves crashing outside your room all night.
review.positiveRemarks: Paul - Not sure of his title. Bell Captain? He's the man outside taking care of us as we came and went. A lovely person and a pro.
review.locationRemarks: Great breakfast spot across the street, on the corner next to Pete's Coffee - the Grove Yerba Buena, 690 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94105.

review.title: Worked well for our visit.
review.reviewText: Not close to everything, but was good for all we did.

review.title: Wifi
review.reviewText:
I thought the hotel was great. You have to pay for in room wifi. Lobby wifi is free.
We got free wifi at every hotel we stayed at on our trip except this one.

review.title: Clean hotel, reasonable pricing
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, staff were friendly, and it was in a safe, convenient location. It's just a short cab ride from Chinatown and other areas of interest. A must-do, wonderful hop-on, hop-off tour bus stops for pickup right in front of the hotel.

review.title: Very close to the Exhibition - Moscone Center
review.reviewText: starting July 8t 2013, I was at room 2817 at the Westin Market Street to attend the Semico Exhibition at Moscone Center. First they didn't have the type of bedroom available of what I ordered until two day after my checkin date. They gave me a room on the twenty eight floor right next to the elevator which was unbelievable noisy!!! Every time the elevator went by it sounded like a freight train goes by!!! As soon the elevator traffic started up in the morning, sleeping was history. The noisy elevator traffic of course went on until late into the night. If one wants a quiet room, don't take one near an elevator. Other then that, it was good. Staff was friendly. Remodeling on the first floor/reception area was noisy and in times inconvenient. I left a day earlier. It wasn't worth the money nor the time there!
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly Hotel staff, very close to the Exhibition - Moscone Center
review.negativeRemarks: Quiet down the elevator!!!
review.locationRemarks: close to the Exhibition - Moscone Center

review.title: Great view!
review.reviewText: Check in was smooth... Parking a bit expensive but I managed.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Minuted from China Town and the Warf.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower the price of valet parking.
review.locationRemarks: Not big on travel advice. San Fran is a place in which you can do whatever you want at anytime...

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Nice clean hotel with accommodating staff. If there was a negative I would say their gym/pool was out of service. Since it was my summer vacation I was hoping to go swimming.

review.title: Nice but uncertainties about booking via expedia
review.reviewText: Great hotel, etc., but we were told that the room type we reserved through expedia was not guaranteed when we arrived. Not a good way to start a trip.
review.negativeRemarks: Communication between expedia, the hotel, and the customer.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco is great.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was good apart from the day the lifts stopped working. Free wifi in the lobby is good. Wifi in rooms is a bit expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Great - just near Union Square and a 35 minute walk to Fishermans Wharf

review.title: Nice - but we didn't feel pampered
review.reviewText: The hotel is fine, good location, very comfortable beds, etc, but I never felt pampered or like it was really a $250 per night stay. Food in the restaurant was adequate, not great.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff could be more accomodating
review.locationRemarks: Location is nice if you don't want to be down with the crowds on Fisherman's wharf, etc

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel is at a great location. The room was nice with a good view, beds were comfortable. I would recommend this and would stay there again !

review.title: Good Stay, but pay for internet?
review.reviewText:
This hotel was very comfortable and updated. The room was very clean and the location was great. We were right near a lot of shops and restaurants.
The only thing I really do not like is that they charge you for daily internet usage and valet (ridiculous fee). The hotel is too expensive in my opinion for them to charge $14/day for internet.

Just use the internet on your smart phone if you have one and park in the garage across the street if you're driving. Also, don't touch anything in the refrigerator unless you want to pay an arm and a leg.

review.title: Great hotel, clean, good area
review.reviewText: Very impressed w/ the Westin. Excellent accommodations for the price. Was put on a high floor w/ great views of Yerba Buena. Close to Union Square and Market Street, but quiet/safe enough to not be concerning. Hotel bar was pretty lively at night, which is a plus, for a nightcap/late drink. Would definitely stay here again/recommend to friends.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Market Street, BART, Bus Stations, Restaurants/Bars/etc.

review.title: Good solid hotel
review.reviewText: The front desk staff was helpful and the Concierge provided a good recommendation for Chineese. The bellhop helped in finding the city lot. The room, not grandiose, was nicely appointed and comfortable. Watch out for the snacks which will be put on your bill if you take them off the tray for more than 10 sec. There is reasonable not hi-scale food in close proximity. The cable car stop is 4 blocks, but you'll have much better luck catching them back from the other end where the lines are not as long. Market St trams within a short walk can take you out to Golden Gate park or the Embarcadero and the piers, and Chinatown is also easily accessible on foot. This is a very nice and comfortable place to stay to enjoy SF. There is some remodeling being done to what seems to be their conference facilities and the in-house restaurant (still operational but upscale). I would consider this seriously as a conference venue that wouldn't make participants feel gouged, but treated with respect.

review.title: Excellent right in the hub of things
review.reviewText: Had a great stay. Great view, great staff, great food, great room.
review.locationRemarks: wonderful location !

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
The beds were rather soft for my liking. Also, the bar fridge was all stocked with sensored items and we were not able to cool our own drinks and fruits.
However, the location of the hotel is great and an easy 20 mins walk to the Ferry building.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, easy access to Market St trams, Chinatown and Ferry Building.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom is cramped and bath tub is slippery.
review.locationRemarks: Great central location close to Macy's

review.title: Great San Francisco Hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel was very convenient on the corner of 3rd and Market! Right in the middle of shopping, restaurants, museums and everything Union Square has to offer.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was very nice and comfortable!

review.title: San Fran visit
review.reviewText: My stay at the Westin was wonderful. Our plane landed early and the hotel had no problem accommodating us without any additional charge. The staff was really friendly and kept our room nice and clean. The room was very spacious and I love how close the hotel is to everything. Great visit!
review.positiveRemarks: Size and proximity to public transportation and things to do

review.title: Two Days in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and well located. Nice place to stay for a couple of days.

review.title: Gym Closed!
review.reviewText:
The availability of a gym with at least some good equipment is my first priority in choosing a hotel for me and my family. They like early morning workouts. I do some racing. This hotel has a great gym with all good equipment, including treadmills, stationary bikes, elliptical trainers, weights, etc...
Just make sure it's open when you get there!!

No advance notice (booked 2 mths in advance), no e-mail updates. This gym was just starting to go through renovations when we arrived, until the day we left (4 days). The Hotel did their best to accommodate the guests by allowing us the use of the gym in another hotel-Palace Hotel (free of charge, of course).

But it was annoying to have to walk a block and a half to that hotel, carrying a change of clothes, get a security card daily at their reservation desk (don't go there during checkout. waiting in line), when the reason I first booked this Westin hotel was to avoid this type of scenario.

The moral of this story, constantly check with your hotel (even up to the last day where you could cancel) for any renovations or closures in the hotel that could affect your stay This should be grounds for cancellation. At least next time for me it will be!
review.negativeRemarks: Gym closed.
review.locationRemarks: Good location. close to everything that is downtown

review.title: Fantastic Holiday Experience
review.reviewText: I have never been to San Francisco and the hotel staff were helpful in giving me directions. the cleaning staff were friendly and the front desk staff were efficient and fast. I would highly recommend staying at the Westin New Market. Thank you Expedia for making my holiday a pleasant experience.
review.locationRemarks: Location Location Location need I say more...close to everything

review.title: Middle of everything. Comfortable bed.....
review.reviewText:
We stayed 2 nights at the beginning of July 4th week. Because of the parade, it took us 2 hours and looping around 4-5 times to finally get into the area (have to talk my way through a barricade).

The 2nd challenge is the parking fee. But fortunately some nice staff "hinted" at the Ellis Garage between this hotel and Four Season next door. The parking fee is only $26 per day and the elevator took you right into the courtyard; from there it is a 2 min walk into the hotel. Hooray....

Once inside, we really enjoyed the comfortable bed, the view, and the proximity to everything including the Yerba Buena area, Chinatown, Metron, and the endless shops around. We walked to the trolley station; took the trolley to Fisherman's wharf, had a huge Sundae at the Ghirardelli store, walk to Chinatown for dim sum.

Overall, a very pleasant visit.
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby under construction
review.locationRemarks: Park at Ellis Garage

review.title: Perfect! Will definitely come back!
review.reviewText: Hotel was great. Staff was helpful. Great location. Pillows weren't comfortable though. We even have free bottles of water :).
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows
review.locationRemarks: Near stores and great restaurants. A walking distance to a pier 39 and more.

review.title: Nice hotel, helpful staff, great location.
review.reviewText: Fantastic location! I was traveling with my husband & 2 children. This hotel is walking distance to Union Square, the Ferry Building, many restaurants & public transportation. We'd love to stay here again.

review.title: Great stay, perfect location
review.reviewText:
This was my first time in San Francisco, and I travelled alone. I stayed for 4 nights. I looked at many hotels in the area, and eventually chose the Westin, and I'm glad I did! I travelled alone, and got a corner room which felt just perfect.
I did feel the view could have been better from an higher floor (I was on the 16th), but since everything felt so "right",
I decided to keep the room. The room itself was lovely, quiet and calm. Everyone, from the concierge and reception, to other guests I met on the elevator, to the maid which I ran into on one occasion, were incredibly nice and friendly. Granted, I came to see the town, so I didn't stay much inside the hotel itself. But waking up to the wonderful view, drinking coffee brewed from the coffee-maker inside the room, while relaxing on the very comfortable couch, gave my mornings just that extra punch. The hotel itself is near a large intersection of streets which can take you anywhere: To Market st. itself, which feels like a Manhattan street only better, to chinatown, union square, the embarcadero, and more. I walked or took the bus to less central locations, and a cab on later hours. It felt like the center of town, where you can just get anywhere and everything's nearby.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the room itself, and the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: I understand why most people complain about the lack of free wi-fi. The snack drawer that triggers a charge when you take something felt a bit sneaky
review.locationRemarks: It's close to everything the center of town has to offer, and everywhere else is easily reachable

review.title: Good hotel, location
review.reviewText: I spend 4 days and nights at the Westin and we chose the hotel for our team because of price and location.
review.positiveRemarks: Fabulous staff at the desk and in the restaurant. We ate there 2x, once in the restaurant and once in the bar. Good food and drinks
review.negativeRemarks: I have no complaints other than I wish hotels would provide free internet as a service. I do choose hotels based on that - because it hassle free and
review.locationRemarks: The location was good, especially if you stayed on Market street. Fun place to eat, the Ghiardelli store, and it was close to all the Museums.

review.title: Comfortable stay with wonderful view!
review.reviewText: Comfortable stay. Clean hotel. Friendly staff with impeccable service, particularly Zeke. Very friendly. Food was extraordinary.

review.title: Great Hotel and Staff very well managed.
review.reviewText: Great hotel friendly staff and exceeded my expectations.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel.........would recommend and would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to lots of restaurants and shops...........easy access to public transportation
review.negativeRemarks: Shower head water pressure............not enough
review.locationRemarks: Close to lots of restaurants, shops and public transportation...........near to most major attractions.

review.title: Comfortable stay
review.reviewText: Front desk professional, Concierge very helpful. Good location.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed, nice layout but small.
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms, dated bathroom, vent fan and safe did not work. Parking 58$ per day, breakfast buffet for two 68$
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Yerba Buena Gardens, China Town all within walking distance. Close to Trolley station and F-line street cars.

review.title: great neighborhood to hang around
review.reviewText: the hotel had 2 strange needs. there was no towel rack in the bathroom......bizarre. and there was no overhead light or light of any sort where the full length mirror was......also bizarre
review.negativeRemarks: towel racks and better lighting
review.locationRemarks: shopping, yerba buena gardens, restaurants

review.title: Okay stay
review.reviewText:
Nothing special about this hotel, wouldn't want to stay here again. Staff was friendly, rooms were clean but small. I liked the option to go eco-friendly and refuse unnecessary room servicing. Location is good.
Hotel itself is dark and kind of stuffy - would probably be good for business travelers but not so much for fun friendly people or families.
One bad experience: We returned to a fruit and cheese bowl in our room on the first day with no note attached. When we asked at the front desk about it they told us it was sent to us by one of their staff members, that they sometimes do this for random guests. We thought that was so nice until we found out that a family friend had actually ordered it to be sent to us with a lovely note that we never received. That was very disappointing.
review.positiveRemarks: Fast elevators, good location, clean rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Should offer free wireless and do not have expensive foods just sitting on counter where they can easily be moved and thus charged for.
review.locationRemarks: Right next to Market Street and Union Square, next to two cable car lines. Tons of shopping and dining very close by.

review.title: stayed for conference
review.reviewText: Close to everything downtown. Great for moscone centre conferences. Friendly staff. Clean rooms though puzzling lack of hanging room in the bathroom. They were kind enough to give me free internet for joining the club, but it was a little slow but fine of you want to check some emails. Safe enough walking after hours.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to shopping, ferry building, business district and convention centre (moscone)
review.negativeRemarks: No towel racks in bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Excellent unless you are after golden gate and Alcatraz. Even then, old cable car could be the go.

review.title: Excellent facilities and hotel accommodation.
review.reviewText: Nice service up front the beginning of the stay an up to checking out....
review.positiveRemarks: Room cleanness and hotel staff services and attention
review.negativeRemarks: no comments
review.locationRemarks: stores and restaurants are fabulous

review.title: Beautiful Place to Stay!
review.reviewText: The hotel was amazing, clean, and the hotel staff was super helpful. I would definitely go back!!
review.positiveRemarks: The room was spacious, clean and bright!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, everything was fabulous!!
review.locationRemarks: There are shopping centers close by, food and Walgreens as well.

review.title: It was ok!!
review.reviewText: Hah, was was ok. Nice location. Pleanty of shopping in near by area. Close to the BART system. In regards to my experience in San Francisco, it was really NEAT!!! I had a great time. I ate some of the bext seafood ever..
review.negativeRemarks: If your going to charge $370.00 a night, AT LEAST, provide free internet service. I will definitely stay in a different hotel next time, because of th
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, food, sight seeing - all of this in the near by districts.

review.title: Located in downtown SF
review.reviewText:
Very convenient for accessing to Starbucks, Walgreens, shopping etc.
It would be better if there's free wifi.

review.title: Home from home
review.reviewText: Was there for a week - really a home away from home
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant was being updated at the time of my stay

review.title: Do Not Stay Here
review.reviewText:
Location: Downtown, lots of homeless people on the street, feels unsafe. Close to Metro and buses, but noisy

Staff: no visible services

Facilities: unreasonable expensive parking charge!

Room: Small
review.positiveRemarks: I do not like this hotel
review.negativeRemarks: everything need to be improved
review.locationRemarks: Location: Downtown, close to Metro and buses, close to Starbucks and 7-11

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Being just south of Market still close to everything without the craziness. Tram stops the same block as the hotel and short walk to Bart station. Refreshing beverage station in the afternoon after a day of sightseeing. It would be nice if they can leave the beverage station open till 9pm.
review.negativeRemarks: Toilet flushes really loudly!
review.locationRemarks: Great!

review.title: Great location/hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel room was overall a good experience. The 29th floor had a great view. While the bathroom was on the smaller side, the room itself was clean and I would definitely recommend people to The Westin.
review.negativeRemarks: There was a dark splotch on the floor by the TV that made it kind of iffy.
review.locationRemarks: Off Third and Market conveniently in downtown. It was a quick run to the Ferry Building and a brisk walk to the heart of Union Square.

review.title: Excellent stay for date night.
review.reviewText: Excellent service and location for the price. The ability to drop the car off out front for valet and leave it for the night allowed for a smooth and seamless date night experience, as if I had put significant planning into the affair.

review.title: Rooms = good, extra fee for internet
review.reviewText: While the room and the service were good, it was disappointing that even as a Starwood Club member we had to pay $14.95 for internet access (for one device only). The restaurant was under construction as well.

review.title: One of the best totally non-smoking hotels in SF
review.reviewText: The most comfortable hotel we have ever stayed in SF. Most noteworthy: professional and friendly staff, comfortable rooms, beds; excellent air quality throughout; quiet with no outside noise one usually hears in a major city, sirens, etc. We really enjoyed our stay and will certainly book this hotel again and recommend to family and friends. Finally, location is excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: Quality of air, comfort & cleanliness, professional, friendly staff, & no outside noise from traffic, sirens, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: We honestly don't have anything we would suggest should be improved. Looking forward to trying the restaurant on our next visit.
review.locationRemarks: Ideally located with easy access to shopping, Chinatown, Financial district.

review.title: The best housekeeping staff
review.reviewText: The amazing thing about my stay was that my room was attended to and cleaned promptly each morning of my 4 night stay while I went out between 8 to noon for breakfast and sightseeing. When I returned to my room to freshen up for my afternoon touring, my room was cleaned. So different from other hotels that I've stayed at where the room could be unattended to until late afternoon. The housekeeping staff also thanked me each day with a note acknowledging the daily tip I had left. Of course the Heavenly beds are great for a restful vacation. This is my second stay at the Westin on Market and both stays were excellent experiences.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, clean rooms, and excellent housekeeping.
review.negativeRemarks: Excellent housekeeping
review.locationRemarks: Great location. In the heart of downtown SF

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: We stayed for one Saturday night here on the 28th floor. The view is very nice and we love it. The hotel is very nice with best location and room is clean with comfortable bed.
