We didn't got a chance to eat in the hotel. We went to Bubba Gump restaurant on Pier 39 instead. The view there is amazing too. The only complaint I have is the expense parking fee, which is $50/night.

review.title: Fantastic view
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay. We originally were scheduled to stay on one of the lower floors. The desk clerk offered to upgrade us for a small fee. To our surprise the upgrade put us on the 33rd floor. Wow! What a treat.
review.positiveRemarks: All was nice. The room was so comfortable and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The bellboys (men) were so great - very attentive.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't really think of anything. You folks have everythign covered.
review.locationRemarks: We were in San Francisco. We walked over to the Fairy Building and had dinner at "Region Restaurant." We had never heard of this place, but loved it.

review.title: Worked well for work
review.reviewText: I was in SF for 2 business meetings, one in the hotel and one at another nearby hotel. It was comfortable and convenient. I liked the Green program...a guest could choose not to have room cleaned every day...there was a small incentive, but not everyone needs everything cleaned and replaced every day...a small way to cut down on carbon footprint. I also took BART to/from SFO...2 stations only a couple of blocks from hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Some construction going on in the lobby...wasn't really an impediment, but nicer not to have workmen running around.
review.locationRemarks: SFMOMA (though now closed for 3 years); trolley on Market Street; enjoyed Thirsty Bear and Fang restaurants nearby.

review.title: Nice hotel near everything
review.reviewText: Accommodating hotel staff, excellent location - within walking distance of piers, BART and cable cars. Highly recommend.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I stayed there for three days. Great experience staying there.

review.title: Enjoyable Western
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and very well situated. The rooms are well presented, the beds are very comfortable and the shower and bathroom are very user friendly. The two things to watch out for are the mini bar, if you move anything in it for whatever reason, you get a charge to your room as its on a pressure switch, and the Green Option they provide. With the Green Option, you elect to re-use the towels, but what they dont tell you is that they do not empty your bins or clean the room in any way either. The staff on the whole are helpful and we enjoyed our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Great views, excellent presentation and fantastic location.
review.negativeRemarks: The Green Option - Keep your towels, but they dont clean your room.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for transport, shops, and Union Square.

review.title: Nice hotel with a few exceptions.
review.reviewText:
It was a great hotel overall, the only exception was that the bathroom was far too small, the toilet was next to the shower and door and the lightning outside near the
sink & vanity was dimly lit. I was in the shower at about 9 am when housekeeping came to pick up the room. I've never stayed at a hotel where housekeeping would arrive so early in the morning.

review.title: Great hotel and location!
review.reviewText: Wonderful room, views, experience. Great location.

review.title: Pricey but good except last visit wasn't great
review.reviewText:
Booked a king room because my husband and I were celebrating our 1 year wedding anniversary but upon arrival (which was a late arrival), were told only queen beds were left because a lot of the people that checked in before us kept asking for rooms with king beds (even though they didnt necessarily book it). I hope they were charged for the difference in the rooms so the hotel made money because I can't understand otherwise why the hotel would not give me a room that I booked. I don't work in the hotel industry so I don't know what the reasons or procedures are, I'm just annoyed I didn't get the room I paid for. They supposedly made up for it by giving is a 'deluxe' queen room but there wasn't anything deluxe about it but the fact that it was on a higher floor with a bad view. We couldn't really unpack because I wanted my king bed that I paid for so we moved rooms the next day. They have us a higher floor again to make up for the previous night but the bathroom mirror hasn't been cleaned properly because the previous guest got toothpaste residue all over the bottom of the mirror and I could still see it everywhere. I told the front desk staff and I guess because our room was prepaid, he couldn't do anything with the rate we paid so he offered us a voucher for their breakfast buffet. At least they tried.

I've been to San Francisco 3 times and stayed here all three times. The rooms are typically clean (must've been an overlook this time), beds are comfy and location is great!
review.negativeRemarks: Didn't get the room I paid for upon arrival and when we switched rooms the next day, the Mirror had toothpaste residue all over the bottom
review.locationRemarks: Great location, just a 5 minute walk to the cable car turnaround at market and powell

review.title: Excellent Accommodation
review.reviewText: Great motel to stay. Would stay there again. Friendly, clean and well worth the money.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were very comfortable. Best view
review.negativeRemarks: Had to pay for wifi in room
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco Market street

review.title: Real comfort stay in westin
review.reviewText:
My family and I had a wonderful experience staying in Westin for 4 nights. Apart from its proximity to union square, powell, and the subway, the hotel staff were indeed very nice and their service was very prompt.
I requested for a roll away bed upon check in (which was already late at night) and in less than 10minutes, the bed arrived. The hotel was spic and span, and our family was delighted about it. Checking out was also very quick and it took us less than 5 minutes and the concierge ( who was also a Filipino) smoothly eased our way out on to the hotel limo going to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: hotel rates a bit pricey
review.locationRemarks:
very near powell, geary and kearny st. to get you into the bus, cable car, and subway line.
near walgreens, 7-11, and cvs for grocery needs.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The only thing we found disappointing was the extra fee for parking, coffee in the lobby or using the business center.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was amazing and the hotel rooms were nice and updated.
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing we found disappointing was the extra fee for parking, coffee in the lobby or using the business center.
review.locationRemarks: Nice location with plenty to do around you.

review.title: Upgrade was a great surprise!
review.reviewText: We were offered an upgrade room on the 21st floor, which had a wonderful view. That was a delightful surprise, as we expected to be close to street level. Parking was the usual for San Francisco- exorbitant. However, what is one to do? A business traveler who did not have to deal with a car would benefit.
review.negativeRemarks: price of parking
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square, Moscone, theater and lots of great restaurants.

review.title: Great hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: The people on staff were helpful and very friendly. The view from our room was beautiful, and the location was MUCH better than expected. The bed was ultra comfortable, and the service was prompt and courteous. Overall, a great hotel experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Having to use the revolving door.
review.locationRemarks: Really great location, even better than being right on Union Square. Many terrific restaurants within walking distance, especially Tropisueno.

review.title: Expensive Wifi
review.reviewText: The only thing that I disliked about the hotel was the price of wireless internet. It was nearly $20 per day for internet. I was not prepared to pay this much.

review.title: First time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel located in a great location, everything is within walking distance. Both my wife and I enjoy our stay at the Westin. The room we got was well kept, but the bathroom is quite small and could use some upgrade. Overall the experience was very good, would definitely go back again.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Everything you need is within walking distance

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: Excellent! Very quiet and comfortable. The beds were extra comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located

review.title: great weekend stay
review.reviewText: great location close to all transit. Several good restaurants close by and front desk allowed us for an early check in at 9:30 am on the day of our arrival, we had just planned on leaving our luggage and returning later but the person at front desk said let me see if I have a room ready, he gave a room and we were able to drop our stuff and go sightseeing. That was great. I would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was wonderful, staff was excellent. Hotel restaurant/bar was fair. Menus for in room service were out of date. Dessert menu lacking. Location is best feature of hotel. Unfortunately, our room was next to a service hall and elevators which was very loud and disturbing. Overall, I would say very good experience, not excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Room next to service hall and elevators
review.locationRemarks: Awesome
review.userLocation: La Jolla, San Diego, CA, USA

review.title: Comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: We had a traditional two queen room on the 8th floor. It was spacious and the beds were very comfortable. Our room was overlooking the street outside and it was next to the elevator, but unlike other posters, we did not hear any noise. The location of the hotel is great and I would definitely stay here again. Our only complaint is that the breakfast, while good, was way over-priced.

review.title: great location - nice staff!
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and a good value. The staff was very nice. The hotel is a great location for hopping on the BART or shopping. Even though the rooms are nice, the walls are paper thin.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise proofing!
review.locationRemarks: Close to BART, shopping.

review.title: The elevator had more class than the room did.
review.reviewText: My experience was good, but I will do better research on the hotel, as for night time entertainment. Atmosfere was very BORING.
review.positiveRemarks: The crew was very professional, and friendly, The map of the local area was an add bonus feature.
review.negativeRemarks: Inside Bar availibility, not just in the ajacent restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: The location was 3rd and Market St., very good for any person that wants to do shopping.

review.title: westin
review.reviewText: It was a pleasant experience except for the fact that I paid for a king bed or two queens and was placed in an accessible room with one queen bed for 1 night. They reimbursed me by giving me breakfast coupons but still was inconvenient. Overall good hotel though just not excellent. Could do better if they wanted to.

review.title: Parking
review.reviewText: Ok parking so much expensive because we already pay $200 so much wxpensive parking.

review.title: Noisy Neighbors
review.reviewText: There was significant noise coming from the room above me during the entire stay. It was banging and stomping. It was quite annoying.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise in the room above

review.title: Very nice hotel, close to Union Square & ATT Park.
review.reviewText: Staff was very accomodating and helpful. Dinner recommendations were excellent, and Freddie at the front desk was extremely professional and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Very good as is!
review.locationRemarks: Close to major attractions and easy on/off freeway.

review.title: Breathtaking city views!!
review.reviewText: I had such a wonderful time at this hotel. The floor to ceiling windows are truly remarkable. Hotel location is in the heart of the city and steps outside the hotel is amazing shopping and a bustling city. The hotel staff was incredibly accommodating and extremely pleasant. The only down part was when I was going to use the coffee maker to make Starbucks coffee provided by the hotel and there was water and coffee in the machine =/ but literally there is not a thing besides this that I didn't love about my stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The views, the bed, the floor to ceiling windows
review.negativeRemarks: Clean the coffee maker!
review.locationRemarks: SHOPPING!!

review.title: Room with a Great View
review.reviewText: There was a little mix up upon reservation, but the hotel fixed it quickly with an upgrade. I originally didn't get a room with a view, but the upgrade included that and I recommend it. Great view of the city, bay, and a little of AT&T Park. They also charge a valet parking fee, but there is a parking structure across the street for less. Walking distance to many dining places and bars.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet Parking Fee
review.locationRemarks: Great location. 15 min walk to AT&T Park

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: Upon check in, the front desk was extremely friendly, and helpful with directions to surrounding businesses. I would most definitely stay again!

review.title: Great hotel for San Fransisco vacation.
review.reviewText: Very nice, clean hotel w/ efficient staff that attended to needs.
review.negativeRemarks: CAUTION: Valets put little to no effort into helping hale cab from hotel to local restaurant. Limo drivers at hotel tried to charge $30 for $8 trip.
review.locationRemarks: Easy , convenient location to shopping, food, public transportation.

review.title: Nice room in the corner
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to San Francisco for vacation. Such a nice room! Since we selected a room that was cheaper in price, we were expecting to get a room with no windows. That was not the case! We had a beautiful view at the corner and had two ceiling to floor length windows. The room was big and clean!

review.title: Great hotel for business trip
review.reviewText:
This is a great hotel to stay in if you are going to a conference at the Moscone centre, which is around the corner. It is very easy to stay in, it has all the amenities you require especially if you have travelled from a different time zone. The gym is excellent and open 24 hours, there are tea & coffee provided in the room. The room is standard hotel, nothing exciting but perfect for a business trip. The hotel location is perfect for getting around the city, with buses, trams etc all near by, key attractions easy to get to.

The hotel breakfast is very expensive, I suggest you go out for breakfast. The wifi is expensive as well ranging from $15 to $18 a day.

The hotel has a lovely courtyard bar and eaterie at the side of the hotel with open fires to keep you warm. The food was lovely. However, they only open at weekends and also only occasional weekdays which was a bit disappointing. I did not eat in the restaurant in the evening as the room was rather dismal but I believe this is being renovated.

Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel for a business trip or first trip to San Francisco. The price was good and overall service as well.
review.positiveRemarks: Very easy hotel to stay in for overseas visitors.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive breakfast and wifi
review.locationRemarks: Easy for Moscone Centre and connections around town. Good shopping

review.title: Mom's Mother's Day Getaway
review.reviewText: Only problem we experienced at all was no chair to relax in in our room. The staff was very courteous from check in, use of concierge, the cleaning staff, and when checking out.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the courteous staff, and the relaxation it allowed us.
review.negativeRemarks: No relaxing chair in room.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located in downtown SF with easy access, wallking or cab, to ball park, wharf, and many fine dining and entertainment experiences.

review.title: A great hotel to stay at in San Fran!
review.reviewText: A great hotel! Had a wonderful experience. Would stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: The Fishermans Wharf area would have been a better area for us to stay but this hotel was alot nicer then any of the hotels we seen in that area.

review.title: nice hotel located in the city center
review.reviewText: I stay 3days in Westin and enjoy everyday. I am very satisfied with the service here.

review.title: Great Staff
review.reviewText: The Westin was nice, but the staff made it great! At check-in, Nina the front desk clerk, noticed that the room we were assigned was adjacent to the elevators. Fearing that we might be disturbed by the noise, she reassigned us to a lovely corner room that she guaranteed to be quiet. We also mentioned that we were not only in town to see the Giants, but to celebrate our wedding anniversary. When we arrived back at our room following the baseball game (Giants won), we found a cake and split of champagne waiting for us with a card of congratulations. The attentiveness of the staff was very impressive.

review.title: Lung
review.reviewText: Location is convenient to shopping places and tram

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: Westin San Francisco is a very good hotel. The room was clean, the staff were very friendly. I love their mattress, very comfortable for me, well...I have to say this hotel wasn't cheap. So if you have good budget , this hotel is good choice!!!
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: on market street, easy access to muni and bart station, close to lots of retail store, nice location.

review.title: Service
review.reviewText: Hotel staff made this a great experience for us. From great advice from the bar tender on resturants to the hotel gentalmen tht checked us in sending fruit and a personalized card with well wishes -- never experienced such a great hotel. We are always going to stay at a westin if there's an option!

review.title: Good value close to Union Square.
review.reviewText:
Chose this hotel because it was a good value close to Union Square and the Ferry Building, right along Market Street for easy access to the rest of the city through major transit lines. Because of the location, we had no need of a rental car for our 3 day stay in San Francisco. The BART runs right below Market Street, so we were able to ride straight to the hotel from the airport (Oakland).

The bathroom was the low point of the accomodations. The fixtures and tile finishes were all very nice. However, the bathroom vent, which was a constantly running vent rather than a fan with a switch, could not keep up with the steam from the shower. The shower curtain also had a funny smell (like stinky covered with detergent).

The linens on the bed were very nice and the mattress and pillows were a delight. We had free wireless access, which I think was standard with the hotel, rather than a deal through our booking (would double-check that though).
review.positiveRemarks: Location was excellent. Updated finishes. Good value for location/ammenities.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaner shower curtain. Better shower fan/vent.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and easy access to the Ferry Building / rest of the city through mass transit. Excellent location!

review.title: Hotel in the middle of everything!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and the smell entering the lobby was awesome!!! Staff was very friendly and extremely helpful, especially the concierge desk. In a perfect location with close access to everything that was needed. Walking distance to Chinatown, North Beach, West field Mall, and Union Square. Would definitely stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, North Beach, Downtown, SF Westfield Mall, Park on Mission and 2nd, Union Square, Montgomery BART station

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: Just an overnight stay before we flew home. Cable car ride and then to Alioto's for dinner and a stroll around Pier 39.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean and comfortable. Great views!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing that I could think of.
review.locationRemarks: Close to things that we wanted to do.

review.title: Nice hotel; helpful staff
review.reviewText: The Westin on Third Street (near Market) is very comfortable and the staff are great. The doorman, Paul, was particularly helpful...not just for me but I saw him help others as well. Great energy from the valet staff, too. The only thing I found wanting was the room service...it is only certain hours. I wanted to get something mid afternoon while I worked in my room, and I couldn't.

review.title: Westin on Market
review.reviewText: Hotel good. Fridge has sensor but we asked and quickly received another small fridge for our medications. Good location. Close to transport and shopping on Market Street.

review.title: My stay was very comfortable.
review.reviewText: Their concierge and the business center clerk are great services. As a results, I have spend a good time.

review.title: Not all Westins created equal
review.reviewText: When you stay at a Westin you have certain expectations. The staff here was not friendly. The concierge acted like giving directions & answering basic tourist questions was an imposition. The bed was worn out to the point I fell to the middle when my husband climbed in. There is no pool at this hotel which makes occupying young children a challenge. The best part of the stay was that the room was relatively clean (ignoring the dirty socks left under the bed by a previous occupant & found by my 8yo son).
review.positiveRemarks: The location was convenient to public transportation in the financial district of Market St.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff friendliness, amenities & room cleanliness.
review.locationRemarks: For sightseeing, the streetcar is convenient walking distance & Fisherman's Wharf is about a 20 min. streetcar ride.

review.title: Great location, comfortable stay
review.reviewText: My room was on the 7th floor. It faced 3rd Street, which is very busy. There was some street noise, and I would not have wanted to be on any lower floor, where it would have been still louder. The room was initially very warm, and after running for 3 hours the air conditioner would not bring the temperature below 74 degrees. I called housekeeping, and to their credit, they sent someone from engineering to my room within about 20 minutes. He was able to fix a connection in the air conditioner and had a vent thermometer to show me the temperature was dropping. That corrected the problem. The king bed was comfortable. I found the desk chair uncomfortable. The commode in the bathroom was ridiculously small and uncomfortable for a room that cost over $250 a night. While not very large, the room was clean and pleasant enough overall. Deserving high praise was the housekeeping staff and also the servers who took care of us during the private breakfasts, lunches, and dinner we enjoyed during our conference at the hotel. They were extremely friendly, and the food was good. Can't comment on the hotel restaurant, as I never ate there. My daughter stayed at the Parc 55 Wyndam for slightly more money, and her room was vastly nicer, and considerably larger. But she may have just gotten lucky with her room assignment. The hotels are not far apart, and both offer access to numerous restaurants, attractions, and museums nearby.

review.title: Westin San Francisco
review.reviewText: We thought we had a room at the Westin Union Square..disappointed with the location, but room and staff were very nice. The restaurant was over priced for what was suppose to be Italian food..
review.negativeRemarks: restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Not Union Square..close enough to everything else..

review.title: Love it!!!!
review.reviewText: Close to everything!! One block from the BART and the MUNI, close to great shopping and the cable cars! Walking distance to Union Square!! Forget your workout clothes? Don't worry for $5dollars they will provide you with some!! They provide complimentary juice and water in the foyer...so lovely to come back to after a day on your feet walking! The staff were so helpful giving us maps and telling us must see places!! Great experience! 30th floor was kinda high up though!! Room was kind of small but bed was very comfortable!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Small room and very high up

review.title: Conference in San Fran/Union Sq? Westin is good.
review.reviewText: The Westin is certainly not the most expensive place to stay in San francisco, but the Westen is exactly what one should expect when staying at a large international-chain hotel: daily room cleaning, nice bathrooms w/ lighting, a full length mirror, option of bed sizes and room arrangements, room service and lobby/hotel restaurant, a "couple" of good concierges, prompt service with easy check-out, small hotel gym, and the assortment of amenities (hair dryer to laundry services) and free printing for airline boarding passes. That said, the natural trade-off is ridiculously expensive food, mini-bar items, and internet access. We're not talking rocket science - You got $1,200 - 2,000 to throw-down, you're gona have a great hotel experience. Be sure to read the fine print on the in-room items, such as room-service and laundry service. For example: room service (for breakfast at least) is the exact menu and pricing as served in the downstair's restaurant. At the time of our stay, there was a 20% gratuity added, plus and additional $5 delivery charge. Lesson: don't pay the room-server a gratuity, just sign the bill and say "thank you". With the exception of the $5 delivery charge, you won't pay any more for room service. So, if you're a busy conference/business traveler, suck-up the $5 and have a relaxed start to your busy day, at your own pace. Negative, we had a connected room and the sounds of teenage girls and Taylor Swift drifted easily into our room, but not such a big deal.
review.positiveRemarks: Concierges, Toby and Jarad, were VERY helpful (others not so much), and the car service to the airport (rather than a taxi) is a must, believe us!
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel does not have an inviting space/bar for late night drinks with colleagues or friends and all food service ends WAY too early in the evening.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is not "near" Union Square (despite marketing efforts) it's close by urban walking standards, it's 1/2 mile to any nearby conference hotel

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel was perfect for jumping on the various modes of public transportation for easy sightseeing. Our room was on the 14th floor and we had a great view of the park and St. Patricks chuch. Very comfortable room.

review.title: Great Place for girls night out
review.reviewText: Great view on the 35th floor. Plenty of space in the room. Staff at the hotel are friendly and very informative.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for SF. Close to many restaurants, night life, easy to get a taxi from the hotel

review.title: Very Desirable Hotel
review.reviewText: Everyone was very very nice...hotel room was clean and very comfortable. It was also in a great location.

review.title: Good stay, cheaper on Friday
review.reviewText: Nice Clean classy all around. Great location Nice staff. I would have stayed the whole time if the price was as cheap the whole time but the price doubled after the first day so i moved somewhere cheaper

review.title: Room with a view
review.reviewText: Great room with great view of surrounding areas. Love the new lobby bar, too!
review.locationRemarks: Great for financial district and convention goers.

review.title: Good hotel with great price and location
review.reviewText: Good location, great price, good and comfortable room conditions for your rest
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Very good, easy access to public transportation on Market street

review.title: Very nice hotel in S.F.
review.reviewText: Very good location and very clean hotel. Friendly staff, daily refreshments, and location make this a great choice for visiting San Francisco. One small disappointment the bed was a bit uncomfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, daily refreshments, and helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: Uncomfortable bed!
review.locationRemarks: Very good if you are going to tour San Francisco. Close to all shopping., restaurants, and sights

review.title: Awesome spot
review.reviewText: It was a great experience. It is conveniently located in the central part of San Francisco; easy access to pretty much everything. We arrived several hours before check in and they said they would call us to let us know if the room would be available before that but they did not. It would've been ok if they did not want to allow us to check in early so I didn't appreciate them telling me they would call when in fact they were never going to. In sum, main desk service is mediocre but the cleaning staff is PHENOMENAL. The concierge is also pretty great! The reason I gave them a 5 is because I only had to deal with the front desk on my initial check in; Thank God!
review.negativeRemarks: Main desk (check in)
review.locationRemarks: Downtown; so awesome!

review.title: Perfect Location for a romantic couple getaway!
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I both loved our stay at The Westin Market Street. Not only was it located right in the heart of Union Square but it was beautiful, comfortable and exceeded my expectations. I had read reviews on yelp that kept mentioning a Starwood Rewards Membership, and I highly recommend signing up, it is free and when you check in, you are automatically upgraded to a Starwood Preferred Guest room! It is a little smaller than the regular rooms but on a higher floor and it has an amazing view! We were upgraded from the 8th to 21st floor. The room was much smaller than any other hotel that I have stayed at but it was very clean, the bed was super comfy and the ceiling to floor windows made it worth it. I would totally stay there again and I highly recommend it. You should be aware that there is not a hotel parking unless you pay for the $78- valet service but there is a parking garage directly across the street that charges $25 and our car was just fine there for 2 days. Overall I thought the lobby and the hotel itself was very nice and the staff was helpful as well. I highly recommend this hotel for a couple. Also we were within walking distance of nearly every important spot in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: No hotel parking and wifi is not free, expect to pay $14.95 and its only for 24 hours
review.locationRemarks: We were within walking distance of pretty much everything and it is right in the heart of union square.

review.title: Sf giants game stay
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. Very clean and spacious. Not a long walk from att park. About 15-18 minutes

review.title: Really nice hotel with a convenient location
review.reviewText:
We were offered an upgrade to the top floor from the fourth floor. I thought that was great. It was $30 to get a city view. Totally worth it.
Hotel room was clean, beds were extremely comfortable and in general, it was a very comfortable stay.
Only parking is Valet and it is quite expensive but to drive around and find cheaper just seemed like too much work. So while it was expensive, I paid it anyway.

Surprise - FREE bottled water in the room. Unlike so many other hotels, this one actually puts two free bottles of water in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: helpful staff which put us on top floor for next to nothing.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking was VERY expensive
review.locationRemarks: centrally located for Union Square and or Moscone.

review.title: Could step it up a little
review.reviewText: I was surprised by things like hair in the tub and dust on surfaces in my room. The lobby area is not super warm or welcoming. The bar is kind of out in the open and not as intimate as it could be. However, overall, the room and hotel were very comfortable at the level that I expect at a Westin. Great location.

review.title: A four star hotel that earns it's stars!
review.reviewText: Such a refreshing experience to have a hotel live up to it's stars in SF!!! No musty smells or water damage in the WC, and an immaculate room! The location is perfect with good "local eats" nearby and proximity to shopping. This is our new "preferred hotel" for our SF visits!
review.negativeRemarks: Our neighbors were loud but "what can you do"?
review.locationRemarks: Perfect, off main area with a nice cheap public garage accross the street!

review.title: Great service at this hotel
review.reviewText:
We booked our room months in advance, but when we checked in they were out of our room size for that night. They put us in a smaller room, but for the inconvenience we had a heavily discounted breakfast the next day (75 $ value for 15 $), and free wifi for the rest of the stay (a 150 $ package), as well as getting us settled in our room size the very next morning. The staff was extremely helpful, and apologetic and gracious.
The hotel is extremely pleasant. The room is very clean, comfortable, with adequate noise proofing.
Do NOT even touch the snacks that are for sale on a tray in the room, as you not so much disturb the item from the tray, you would be charged within TEN seconds !!???
Other then this odd system, this hotel is a great place to stay when visiting downtown SF
review.positiveRemarks: The room is clean. The service is impeccable.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit stingy on soaps and shampoos. Breakfast is expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located. Chinatown is in walking distance. Public transportation is around the corner

review.title: Less than I expected from the Westin
review.reviewText: No water pressure for the shower. AC didn't work. Long check in process. Level 4 so there was no view. 50$ for parking, around the corner parking in another garage is 28$. They also only gave us one bath robe for a room occupied with two people. I will never stay at this location again. For the money I spent for the room I expected more.
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure, view, only having one bath robe, check in time
review.locationRemarks: Great location downtown San Fran 5 minute walk to china town, 30 minute walk to fisherman a warf

review.title: "No longer great hotel near the Moscone Center"
review.reviewText: It was the worst stay at this hotel in the last several years since the hotel started. A big conference took place near this hotel and all rooms were sold out, so I understand some of the situation, but the worst services ever at this hotel. I liked this hotel so it is disappointing. Hope it gets better soon.
review.positiveRemarks: Location near the Moscone Center, and "heavenly beds"
review.negativeRemarks: Poor bath/shower equipments
review.locationRemarks: A block away from the Moscone Center, and a couple of blocks away from a BART station

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText:
Great location and very nice staff. King room has more than enough room for a second reading chair. we had to ask for a chair so that my husband did not have to sit on the bed. The only chair offered was a desk chair. they brought us a chair from their banquet supply which did but was certainly not comfortable.

Hotel is under refurbishment so patio was not available and the dining room area was shrunk but food was good. Nice main floor bar. Complimentary newspapers and a good selection.

Worth the price.
review.negativeRemarks: lack of seating in the room
review.locationRemarks: excellent. Close to shopping

review.title: Great place.....Great Location!
review.reviewText:
Friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms (bed is good!)

Perfect location to all major public transportation......for those that use it.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Good, but cost
review.reviewText: Everything is prepared well. Most things you want to do cost. If you are keen to use Wifi, simply do not recommend. US$15 per 24hr.
review.negativeRemarks: Charged Wifi

review.title: A Great Spot in Central San Fran
review.reviewText: This a very nice, clean, large, modern hotel centrally located. The staff service was superb, and it was very quiet at night.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is very expensive. And to get there, you need to follow specific paths of one-way streets.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent cental location, but there is only one way to approacj with a car.

review.title: WBC
review.reviewText: Great location but very pricey. Valet parking very expensive and inroom accomodations.
review.negativeRemarks: Charge $14.95 a night for WiFi. There is a charge even in the business center.

review.title: Perfect location for many sites and activities!
review.reviewText: Staff are friendly and helpful. Very clean and comfortable and not "stuffy".
review.locationRemarks: Perfect!

review.title: One of the best hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel location is definitely a huge plus - staffs are also very friendly
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location - just a few steps from Market St. and all SF has to offer.

review.title: Not so great
review.reviewText: The rooms are small, the hallway had a odd odor in it also. This hotel is right around the corner from a fire house and so that is all you heard ALL NIGHT LONG!! The food in the restaurant is very high priced for what you get. I love Westin hotels but not this location.
review.negativeRemarks: noise level in the rooms you could hear everything !!

review.title: Glad I booked through Expedia
review.reviewText:
Convenient location. Awesome staff. I didn't have to drive anywhere,
My car was never needed. Next to Mall and public
transportation ;)
review.locationRemarks: The heart of San Francisco

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText:
Rooms disappointingly small
Front desk understaffed and long wait to check in
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk staff

review.title: Hotel Staff very helpful
review.reviewText: I had a fantastic experience here. The front desk was pleasant and helpful and the valet was excellent. They were very knowledgeable about the area and helped direct us to some great places around town to visit other than the normal tourist sights.

review.title: Great all around hotel
review.reviewText: Would definitely recommend this hotel. Great location, staff and rooms. Very clean and comfortable.

review.title: Excellent hotel!
review.reviewText: It was my first time in San Francisco and a great hotel to stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was amazing, fantastic view. I love a shower head. They have public parking only $26/day. Excellent hotel! We will come back again.

review.title: Upscale Hotel at a reasonable price
review.reviewText: I was on a business trip at the Westin St. Francis (across from Union Sq) and decided to change scenery and moved to the Westin Market Street to enjoy a long weekend in beautiful SF. The rooms were very clean and updated and the hotel was in walking distance to almost everything! China town entrance is just up the road, the main Cable Car turn around is just a short walk, as is Union Square shopping. You have access to busses and The Bart all in close local. The dinner recommendations given by the concierge were fabulous (John's & Umbria) and the bellman outside were very professional and able to get us a car service promptly. The hotel restaurant Ducca) was under construction, but they still had everything set up nicely. Great happy hour specials every day at Ducca Bar in the lobby .
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great. Large, clean rooms and they even give you complimentary water bottles.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast buffet and hotel parking were expensive, but you pay for convenience. Also they didn't have an airport shuttle.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. walking distance to Cable Car line, China Town, Union Square and all the shops that line market street

review.title: Loud but Good
review.reviewText: The only drawback was the neighboring rooms were a party and they were extremely loud until past 1 AM.
review.negativeRemarks: noisy neighbors
review.locationRemarks: good location, close to transportation...no need for a car

review.title: Ok for families!
review.reviewText: Nice and clean hotel. Easily accessible to public transportation. Parking is pricey but expected for San Francisco. Service was friendly.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Wonderful views from the upper floors. Close to BART and MUNI and cablecars.

review.title: Efficient, cozy and comfortable
review.reviewText:
The hotel is close to Moscone. The room was smaller than some that I've stayed in, but was cozy and comfortable. TV placement was a compromise between desk and bed, but I either needed to work or sleep so I stood to catch a bid of morning news before breakfast.
Go early, if you want breakfast in a timely fashion; or get room service. The lobby was crowded after 8AM. I took a room on the 31st floor, which made things much quieter for concentration and sleeping. However, you still can't escape the sirens.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed; best night sleep in a hotel in a very long time.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet connection costs. Why? I can stay at a low end hotel and get it free; even high speed.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to BART and Moscone.

review.title: Great location, comfy room, and nice view!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location. Lots of restaurants, stores, and AT&T park close by. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was very clean, bed was comfortable but only complaint was that the bathroom was tiny. You had to squeeze in next to toilet and tub to be able to close the door. Other than that the room was great. There was a great view from the 14th floor. The room was quiet and no noise from other guests. Overall it was a great stay!
review.positiveRemarks: Location was close to AT&T, Union Square, and Embarcadero
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom was tiny
review.locationRemarks: We walked to everywhere we wanted to go

review.title: Not what I booked
review.reviewText: Interesting to know if you book this hotel via expedia they do not guarantee you the room you booked, booked a King size bed only to find out they did not have one available. Very poor for a major hotel

review.title: Good for any occasion.
review.reviewText: We had an angular room, somewhat unusual floor plan but comfortable. We'd stay there again.
review.locationRemarks:
Fabulous! Close to Chinatown, Moscone center, and BART.
]

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a great location. Near rapid transportation and within walking distance to Union Square. Excellent and friendly staff. Room was very comfortable and clean. My only complaint was room was next to the elevator banks which was a bit noisy. I have stayed at the hotel before and those rooms were very quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, clean and very comfortable room
review.negativeRemarks: Room is noisy if next to elevators
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square

review.title: Pleasant Hotel in good location
review.reviewText:
Good location for Moscone Convention Centre and all sites around Market St and Union Square.
Rooms are spacious and comfortable. I would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice hotel that meets the usual standards of the Westin Hotel chain.
review.negativeRemarks: WiFi should be included in the cost of the hotel room
review.locationRemarks: Great Location for Moscone Centre and downtown attractions

review.title: Typical great Westin hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Overall, great quality and location. Rooms were nice size with nice modern feel. Only 2 minor complaints were: 1) Exorbitant valet parking fee ($54 per night, up to $70+ for trucks) and our room was near the elevator, which sounded like we were underneath a subway system.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking fee
review.locationRemarks: Close to Moscone convention and shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Not A Completely Smooth Experience
review.reviewText: Checking in on the early side put us in a tiny room. This room would have been ok, if they hadn't taken a large portion of the space for the refreshment center they were not willing to remove. We moved to a pleasant larger space with the hotel's help. Easy to hear neighbors and people in the hall.The hotel's location is convenient with bus transport and both Peets and Starbucks coffee nearby. Shopping areas are also nearby. The Grove, next to Peets is a good place for breakfast and lunch.
review.negativeRemarks: Obtrusive refreshment center and refusal to remove it.
review.locationRemarks: Close to main shopping, farther from Caltrain.

review.title: Great and Convenient
review.reviewText: Had a great stay! It was close to Market street so I could just walk up and also close to the Moscone center where the event was taking place. Good walking location. In-room breakfast the first day was excellent. Not so good the second day and the third day I wish I didn't order breakfast in although it was still ok. It was just not as good as the first day. Not sure if there were different cooks on each day or not? Hotel staff was excellent and friendly, willing to help out alot. Kind of congested at the front of the hotel with cars and drop offs but convenient just the same.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast the 3rd day
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, good walking distance to everything.

review.title: Sydney family holiday
review.reviewText:
Our family of 4 spent 3 nights at the Westin San Francisco Market St on a family vacation. We were pleasantly surprised with the amount of space in our room which had 2 queen beds. The room was a city view and whilst it was located next to the lift shaft we did not hear a noise.
From the moment of arrival we were impressed with the service of staff including Valet, Bell Desk, Reception, Concierge. Given the location, amenities and service we would definitely stay at this hotel on our next visit to San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel, a little expensive.
review.reviewText: Perfect location for Moscone Center and downtown attractions. A bit pricey, but worth it.
review.negativeRemarks: No individual personality or character.
review.locationRemarks: perfect for downtown

review.title: Greenbay vs San Francisco game
review.reviewText: Arrived to San Francisco Saturday morning for the packers vs 49ers game. I was able to check in by 11am. The Bart and Muni are very closed by. The hotel is right in the middle of downtown. Walking distance to everything. Starbucks across the street. 10 min walk to china town. Friendly staff, clean rooms, lovely stay. I will definitly be back!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean rooms, comfortable beds, friendly costumer service
review.negativeRemarks: The toilet was very narrow and small
review.locationRemarks: Downtown

review.title: Difficult to park
review.reviewText:
The valet parking fee is so expensive, I remember it was 78 per day, excludes the tips.
If you don't want to park by valet, it is hard to park there, the entrance is beside a mainstreet, and the entrance is a small way.

But I can understand it, after all, it is located in the downtown SF. Always crowded there.

Anything else are fine with the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Underground garage
review.locationRemarks: Downtown SF, near Union Square, very convinient traffic

review.title: Nice, but not great
review.reviewText: The room I stayed in wasn't as nice as I expected for a 5-star hotel. It was nice, but was expecting more.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Great place to stay. The lobby smelled like the fresh flowers, the room was super nice. The fan in the restroom ran constantly and the food int he restaurant was expensive and not too much to choose from (the food was very tasty, thoguh), but other than that we had a really nice time at teh Westin. I recommend it!
review.positiveRemarks: The smell of the lobby and the view from the room
review.negativeRemarks: the restroom fan ran constantly and the restaurant did not have much to choose from (the food was tasty though. :)
review.locationRemarks: Excellent, right where we wanted to be in the middle of town and easy access to things.

review.title: With-in walking distance to many attractions!!
review.reviewText:
I was surprised that the hotel was able to get me into my room at 9am the day I was checking in! Upon arrival to my room, everything was pristine and clean, except for the bedskirts on both queen beds - which had multiple disgusting stains on each on one. I wasn't as concerned as my guest traveler, who asked to have housekeeping come change out the bedskirts, but they instead moved us to a different room, with a less atractive view of Market street.

The staff was very prompt and happy to accomodate the request. This was the only small issue that was rectified immediately. Otherwise, the staff, room and location served us really well. In addition to the super early check in - the front desk staff allowed us a two hour late checkout since our flight was delayed. Talk about service! I'm very pleased with my recent stay and would love to be a guest there again the next time I head to SF!
review.locationRemarks: With-in walking distance to Union Square, the city transit system, shopping and good food!

review.title: Terrible Hotel - stay somewhere else
review.reviewText:
We were not given enough towels and only 1 robe for 2 people. The Phoen didnt work. We called to the front desk several times without any response to our needs.
We had to request 3 time sfor our room to be cleaned.
We asked the front desk and concierge directions, and what bus-trolly- or cable car to takes and were never given the same or correct directions from anyone. We were sent out on a wild goose chase to find a location that was less then a 5 minute walk away. We were more then disapointed in the staff the service and the VOMIT that was not cleaned up in the hallway by the elevators near our room- fromdrunken partiers.
The heat was not turned on and there was a freezing cold breeze in the lobby as well as the hallways.
review.positiveRemarks: NOTHING It was terrible- We like the soaps but we had to 4 time sto get them!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything/ Service was terrible, It was dirty, No customer service & Staff had no clue about anything
review.locationRemarks: Location was ok, but with all the wrong directions, and staff not helping us find our way around I have no idea if it was a good location or not

review.title: Great Hotel for Weekend in San Francisco
review.reviewText: My daughter and I stayed at the Westin for a girls' getaway to San Francisco. The hotel was very nice, the staff was very courteous and the rooms were comfortable #I loved the bed and all the pillows#. The location was very convenient to Union Square shopping and eating and very close to the Bart/Muni station on Market Street. We enjoyed our stay here very much.
review.negativeRemarks: The cost for parking and the cost for food in the restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Great location - convenient walking to Union Square and the Bart/Muni Station on Market Street.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I had a good stay, staff was friendly, I would rather internet included, like the Westin Savannah I'm in This week. Also parking $72.00 for one night is steep. 30.00-40.00 would be nice for guests. The public garage was close but I needed my car before 6am so I had to use the Valet.
review.negativeRemarks: parking

review.title: Great view
review.reviewText: We started at the wrong Westin in Union Square, but THANK GOD we were booked at the better Westin! They far exceeded my expectations, expecially after an awful experieince at the wrong Westin!
review.negativeRemarks: $15.00 fee for internet usage
review.locationRemarks: Very easy in and out

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
This was our 2nd visit to this property.

At check in, the guy gave us a line about our "real room" not being ready yet, but THIS one would be just as good. When we went in, we discovered we were sent to a room that was not right. We paid for a premium room but he put us in a lesser one. A different staffer got us in the right room rather quickly, but still, we were required us to make an extra trip down to the lobby and back up to the 33rd floor with all our luggage.

Be prepared to pay to use a computer to access the internet in their "business center."

Tried to buy a pizza "to go" at the hotel restaurant, but was told to use room service, which, for various reasons, i did not want to do. I ended up walking across the street to the California Pizza Kitchen instead. THAT was good pizza.

It is in a great location for tourists. No need for a car if you're willing to use the nearby public transportation.
review.positiveRemarks: Luxurious place with a great view. Our 33rd floor room had floor-to-ceiling windows. We could see Alcatraz, Coit Tower and part of the G Gate Bridge.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of free (no-charge) access to a computer/internet.
review.locationRemarks: Near 3rd & Market. 1/2 block from bus stop & historic street car stop. One block to the underground BART / Muni train station, 3 blocks to cablecar.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: The hotel is comfortable at a good location. The hotel is located close to Union Square and close to many good restaurant. Walking distance to SFMoma and other attractions. I will recommend this hotel to my other friends and family

review.title: Good location, nice beds, ordinary services
review.reviewText:
Good location. Can walk to Union Square, Cable Car Terminal Station, many shops and department stores in downtown San Francisco. Their Heavenly Beds are really comfortable and the room was very clean.

The bathroom in our room, though, is just ordinary. Nothing special to mention. Just enough for a business hotel. Hotel staff are OK.

Be careful about the parking. If you need a vallet parking, it charges you about 50 dollars per night.

One thing I do not like is that like other hotels it has a mini fridge and a food basket which they instantly (in 10 seconds) charges to if you remove an item. We stayed with our kids and they not knowingly touched them. Though we explained it to the front desk and they did not charge us, we just did not like to feel that just one mistake can charge you instantly. I cannot feel the real hospitality.

review.title: Great Stay in Union Square
review.reviewText: Clean, friendly staff. got an upgrade without asking. Bedding was super comfortable and a good gym. Nice location on Market, away from being hassled. Will come again!

review.title: Xmas family get-away
review.reviewText: The desk clerk was very courteous and helpful. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. It was a nice location in the city.

review.title: Christmas in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Westin SF Market Street exceeded our expectations. Not only as a hotel but the location was superb. Minutes from Union Sq and designer stores for great shopping. Also...if valet seems very expensive for you...self parking behind the hotel was safe and much cheaper. The beds were extremely comfortable and the rooms size perfect for a family of 5.
review.negativeRemarks: Ducca restaurant was decorated very nice...however...they need to find a new chef. The food was not impressive at all.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Great for family, couples, anyone!!!
review.reviewText:
It was a great location. Hotel staff and concierge were very helpful
And professional!!! Would definitely stay there again!!
review.negativeRemarks: Internet was not complimentary!!!

review.title: Good hotel - expensive parking
review.reviewText: Parking is way too expensive....only good part about it is in/out allowed. But it's like 53/day. We had to go with this because we have two small children. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful!!!

review.title: Best location
review.reviewText:
A very good stay!
The best location for people that want to know the city and want to move around a lot.
review.negativeRemarks: the bed. not so confortable
review.locationRemarks: the best!

review.title: Clumsy Travelers, Quick and Friendly staff.
review.reviewText: The staff was quick and friendly when we checked in. I noticed the attention to detail on cleanliness after a spill by another traveler by the staff.

review.title: Great Location Great Rooms
review.reviewText:
The Hotel is modern and well maintained, be sure to get a room away from the public and service elevators as the staff seem to enjoy making a lot of noise day and night with the carts they use to move room service and cleaning supplies.

The front counter, concierge and cleaning staff were amazingly friendly. The restaurant and bar staff need to be retained in what hospitality means. The front entry way of the hotel seems to be a hub for towncar operators to prey on hotel guests as they exit while most hotels limit this to their own car service.

The location is the main reason I recommend this hotel, you are in the heart of it all although if you're not a regular to San Francisco that also means an abundance of very unstable street people (this is by no means the fault of the hotel - you can thank the City of San Francisco for that).

I recommend for the convenient location and great rooms.
review.locationRemarks: in the heart of the city core

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Perfect location for what we were planning to do on our visit. Nice looking, well kept, quiet room, Minimal staff interaction
review.negativeRemarks: Price of parking and internet
review.locationRemarks: Right nearYerba Buena gardens, Moscone Center, Union Square

review.title: Christmas Stay
review.reviewText: During the Christmas holiday we stayed at the Westin and my family loved it. From the valet, to the doorman, to the front desk, everyone was extremely polite and accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is expensive
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: The best hotel
review.reviewText: I will come back very soon it was a wonderful experience. My children loved the windows and the bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Minibar
review.locationRemarks: Great location to go shopping and walk distance to the Chinatown.

review.title: Great for business travelers
review.reviewText: Got upgraded ..great room with a fantastic view of the city. On the smaller side. Great location...

review.title: Great Hotel for the price, quality and comfort...
review.reviewText: Spontaneously stayed at this hotel and found it very comfortable, clean and elegant. City views are better from higher floors... Overall, this hotel is well priced and very well organized... Parking is expensive tho...

review.title: B+
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a good location, close to Union Square and to the BART station.
The hotel was clean and the king room was fairly big.
The only issue I would note here is that when I got to the hotel, their system was down after an upgrade which delayed check-in by about 3 hours. The hotel was kind enough to give free internet access but apart from that the stay was wonderful.

review.title: Good hotel, but eat elsewhere.
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was fine. Convenient location, room was well laid-out and was exceptionally clean. View was great and room amenities were good. But eat elsewhere. I had a dinner and a breakfast at the hotel restaurant and both were terrible. The breakfast buffet, in particular, as a disaster. The quiche was served cold. The scrambled eggs were runny and tasteless. Even the eggs that had peppers and mushrooms and sausage were amazingly tasteless. Bagels tasted as if they were bought from a chain grocery store....in a town with an abundance of great bagels!!! At dinner the fish was overcooked and the vegetables were, again, tasteless. Just say no and eat elsewhere.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant

review.title: highly recommend!
review.reviewText: Good service, clean room, convenience location, reasonable price
review.negativeRemarks: walls are too thin
review.locationRemarks: very convenience

review.title: Nice hotel, will try others next time!
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel, nice views. When we came in the room was not ready yet. We had to go walk in the city while they cleaned the room. I hated the fact that the conditioning duct is right on top of the bed and just blows cold (or hot) air onto your face all night long!

Long lines for check in and check out.
review.negativeRemarks: Room

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: it was a great experience, I really enjoyed the amenities. The staff was helpful and courteous. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The location was incredible for site seeing.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText:
Overall good except for the tiny bug (not bed bug) found on the bed
Great location

review.title: Thanksgiving getaway!
review.reviewText: Came on a thanksgiving weekend. When arrived, the friendly staff offered us a complimentary wifi and upgraded our room at no extra cost. Loved my room and loved the view. Friendly staffs. Only down part is that the hotel only offers valet parking.. However, the location was great, the hotel room was better than expected. Overall experience was great.
review.positiveRemarks: Great view and free upgrade if lucky.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking. The hotel only offers valet parking for almost $50..
review.locationRemarks: Good location, walking distance to many places!

review.title: SF Westin
review.reviewText: prompt service when I called main desk with a request
review.negativeRemarks: room a little small but still adequate
review.locationRemarks: Third St in San Fran

review.title: Thanksgiving weekend adventure
review.reviewText: This is the perfect location. The public transportation was accessible, lots of restaurants, short walk to premier shopping. We shall return!
review.positiveRemarks: Great room with a wonderful view of the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Fire Station a few blocks away... sirens.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for the tourist

review.title: San Fran Westin Mkt St
review.reviewText:
great location for shopping and dining.
very close to everything. loved it.
we would come here again.
review.positiveRemarks: I always enjoy the cold favored drinks @ the Westin.
review.locationRemarks: both westin's are great location for everything one would need from San Fran.

review.title: San Fran 2012
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean, and the staff was very comforting

review.title: Good overall
review.reviewText: There's no pool in the hotel - big disappointment. But the area is very nice - lots of things to do within walking distance. Service was good. Bed was very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: No pool.
review.locationRemarks: very convenient. lots of hotels and places to shop within walking distance

review.title: Good value for a hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Upgrading to a higher floor with free internet access a plus for joining their free Starwood program

review.title: Amazing Hotel
review.reviewText: The westin was in amazing location was a short distance from everything San Francisco. I would differently recommend the hotel and would stay again

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Had a very fun night in the city with some friends I have not seen in a long time. It is always nice to come back to a clean hotel with a friendly staff. Thanks!

review.title: BOO on the Westin SF hotel
review.reviewText:
Having traveled the world for 30 years on business, I came to expect certain basic services.
Most all hotels and inns offered guest access to a business center, and FREE access on a pc to simply pull up one's e-mails. The Westin SF Market St. did not!...even to preferred Star Wood members! I did not bring my lap top on this holiday stay because I thought the Westin would offer this basic service to long time hotel club members. When I asked if I could simply access my e-mails, I was told that I had to pay a minimum of $15 a day for the priviledge. I will, from now on, stay at other hotels that offer this simple basic service to loyal guests!
review.negativeRemarks: club guests not allowed to access e-mails at no charge
review.locationRemarks: excellant downtown SF property....close to key shopping and restaurants

review.title: Great Hotel, good location
review.reviewText: Housekeeping attempts to clean the rooms very early.... normally making enough noise outside your room to wake the dead...
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable king size bed. Rarely heard any street noise
review.negativeRemarks: Early Housekeeping makes noise outside the room.
review.locationRemarks: Very central location, close to Montgomery Bart and Muni station.

review.title: Don't stay next to elevator
review.reviewText: They didn't have the king room I had booked so they gave me a room with two queens. Since I was traveling alone, it didn't really matter to me and they offered me free internet for my one night stay. The room (1716) was comfortable but it was right next to the elevators and very loud - sounded like low flying aircraft. Next time I'll make sure to ask for a room that is not next to the elevators.

review.title: Great Experience!
review.reviewText:
~Everything you would expect a downtown San Francisco hotel to be.
~Very Friendly
~Very Accommodating
~Very Comfortable
~Near luxurious and snuggly bed.
~The staff was wonderful! Being a small town girl I usually feel overwhelmed and somewhat out of place in hotels like this but they really enhanced my experience and made me feel welcome. Bravo to the management of the Westin for finding such wonderful people.
~Convenient to all the tourist areas
~More expensive than I am comfortable putting on the company credit card, but not as expensive as others downtown.
~Breakfast at the hotel too expensive for the quality of the food.
~Hint.. if you're cost conscience, ask for a refrigerator and buy groceries.
~Hint.. DO NOT touch/remove anything in the snack tray or fridge in the room! Unless of course you don't mind paying for it.
~Once I learned the rules, I enjoyed my stay here.
review.positiveRemarks:
Absolutely the people! and the bed-So, So Comfortable!
Complimentary Starbucks in the room.
review.negativeRemarks:
The room was right next to the elevators.. elevator noise .... ALL night.
They also need a safe, dedicated smoking area away from sidewalk traffic.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to local attractions and interests.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: From check in to check out everything was wonderful. Check in was fast and easy, bed was comfortable and room service was prompt. Will definitely stay here again

review.title: Reliable
review.reviewText: Overall a nice hotel that is showing a little wear but very adequate.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: The Westin is conveniently located a block or two from BART, a short block to bus line F that takes you to Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf, about 3 blocks from Union Square, and about 5 block from China Town. Across the street is a Starbucks, a CPK, and around the corner a McDonalds (albeit small), a Mel's Diner and a 24 hours Denny's, not to mention a CVS and a Walgreens. Purchase your ticket from the hotel's concierge and a double decker sightseeing bus picks you up directly in front of the hotel. It doesn't get any easier.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Best location in a nice part of town. All the amenities are nearby.

review.title: Brief review.
review.reviewText: Staff very helpful. Clean and nicely kept. Bathrooms are small. Good location.
review.negativeRemarks: Received no Starwood points booking through Expedia!
review.locationRemarks: Very good.

review.title: Good hotel for business traveler
review.reviewText: This hotel is located just a block from Market St. and access to local transportation is ideal. The rooms were updated, clean and comfortable. We also enjoyed the breakfast in the hotel which offered a nice variety in the buffet, excellent service and congenial staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Check in was quick and efficient
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Location was 10 minute ride to the Wharf or 10 minutes to the Castro District with connections on other lines to every part of the city.

review.title: Nice and convenient
review.reviewText:
I thought the hotel was beautiful, and the room was comfortable. The bathroom was a little dingy, and the lighting was poor for putting on make up, but i appreciated the linens and the carpet.

One thing we thought was odd/funny was the 10 second rule for the snack and refreshment bar. It sure made for good conversation, but really? 10 seconds? And no space for leftovers in the fridge? Really?! For the amount of money we paid, I would have liked room for my leftovers without the panic and stress of accidentally moving a water bottle and being charged for it. The cabinet that held the fridge was broken.

Also, we had a room directly next to the elevators and they kept me up for a while because they were loud.

Other than that, I would stay at the Westin again in a room not near the elevators.
review.locationRemarks: Hard to drive into, expensive valet parking, but great for public transport.

review.title: Comfortable, modern style
review.reviewText: Good location. Great Westin beds. Lovely, modern sitting lobby with fireplace.

review.title: Everything was good.
review.reviewText: Stayed on the 19th floor and had a great view. Room was spacious with very comfortable and cozy beds. Public parking was right across the street which was great and very convenient. Hotel is very modern and nice but I do like the decor of the westin on Union Square but not the parking.

review.title: Great hotel for business in the heart of San Fran
review.reviewText: Great location for business--near a few other convention hotels--in a walkable and clean part of town. The restaurant served breakfast, lunch and dinner, with attentive wait staff who are very accommodating (as a person with a wide range of food allergies). i was a little disappointed that I had to wait until 3:30 for my room to be ready (I had to change for a conference in the lobby restroom and store my bags), but I understand you can't always be checked-in before the official time. The room was clean, although the outlets were kind of hidden on the side of the desk. I didn't have my room very hot, but it felt humid--but that would be my only complaint with the hotel. Otherwise, it's great for business travel. Clean, accommodating and in a great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Temperature, check-in time
review.locationRemarks: Next to some great hangouts, walkable and clean

review.title: Don't stay during Conferenec season..
review.reviewText: I'm mixed about our stay: Unfortunatley the hotel had two large conferences during both the Friday and Saturday. This caused long (~20-25min!) waits for the elevators. Furthermore, they assumed that if you looked under 35 you must be part of the conference (which we weren't!) - I hate age snobbery. Otherwise our room was excellent. Free water and a good size room for San Fran. Only neg. was no free wifi. Location is great for Union Sq. etc. Modern contemporary rooms. Friendly check-in staff.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Excellent location. Very crowded the weekend we stayed but staff handled it well.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to shopping and restaurants was great!!

review.title: Obtaining Internet access was annoying
review.reviewText:
Clean, friendly, comfortable, fancy hotel, with a perfect location.

They installed a new RFID-based keycard system. My first card was faulty and I went back to the front desk 3 times.

This is a high-end hotel, so I find the charges for basic Internet access annoying. I had more than one Internet device and had trouble getting the system to realize that I Already Paid for That. Furthermore getting Wi-Fi for my e-reader or smart phone was impossible

review.title: Very Superb!
review.reviewText: Very helpful and courteous staff. Beautiful room, looked and smelled brand new. Comfy bedding. Awesome view of bay, Alcatraz, and Golden Gate bridge from floor to ceiling corner glass.
review.positiveRemarks: It met or exceeded every expectation. Very rare!
review.negativeRemarks: No refrigerator other than mini-bar.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown San Francisco near everything.

review.title: Not what I expect a Weston to be..
review.reviewText: Expected more from a Weston, pretty disappointed espeacially for the $$. wouldn't go back there.

review.title: Very nice and practical hotel...
review.reviewText: Great Location, very nice rooms, very nice hotel. Pet Peeve of mine is internet service. Here it is $15 bucks a day for "basic" (one device) or $19 a day for up to 5 devices. I think at the prices SF hotels charge this is an add on that is unwarranted. By the way, the internet service was sporadic and slow.
review.negativeRemarks: Paying for poor internet
review.locationRemarks: Blocks from Union Square, centrally located.

review.title: Great hotel for single females traveling alone
review.reviewText: Great location, less than a block away from Market Street which takes you to the local shops, restaurants, and entertainment venues. You can also take Market to Embarcadero which leads to Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirardelli Square. It's about an hour walk to Ghirardelli which was fine with me, but might be a lot for someone out of shape. There's a smaller Ghirardelli just around the corner for those chocolate lovers like me! The hotel is very beautiful with a spacious lounging area to sip beverages and watch sports. The gym was more than adequate (stair climbers and a bosu would be great additions) and the room was spacious and clean. I love the Starbucks coffee in the rooms! I also had the most delicious poached salmon for dinner in the hotel restaurant. The staff was very helpful, it was my first visit to San Francisco and they went out of their way to help me navigate the city and make suggestions about where to go and what to see. I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Very beautiful, great location, comfortable bed, iPod radio decks, the shampoo, conditioner, and soap were great too.
review.negativeRemarks: It was pricey. I would have expected the room to be even bigger and better for the price, but the location was fabulous.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, less than a block from Market Street where all the shopping, dining, and entertainment is happening.

review.title: Small and noisy cheating room.
review.reviewText: The room was very small,a lot of noise we order a King bed and we got a queen bed, no explanation why they didn't give us a bigger bed that we paid for, will never stay in that hotel ever.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise,the size of the bed and the size of the room.
review.locationRemarks: Very dirty a lot of homeless poor customer servise.

review.title: Watch Out
review.reviewText:
The hotel lobby, bar and staff are wonderful. The room with the king size bed was barely larger than the bed, and the bathroom was half of the bed. I stepped a tiny bit awkwardly toward the toilet at night and fell backwards into the tub. The floor is slanted toward the tub. My neck still hurts.
Catching a cab from the hotel can be a project.

review.title: One Nighter
review.reviewText: Asked the bartender to make a specific drink he was not familiar with, and he gladly did a good job. Staff was friendly and they gave us a great view room.
review.negativeRemarks: Outside bar service was spotty
review.locationRemarks: great location, easy access although in the middle of town.

review.title: Safe, clean hotel.
review.reviewText:
The more senior concierge gave us wonderful suggestions for restaurants such as Fang's, Amber India, and Bluestem Brasserie. The younger concierges gave us hamburger joints as suggestions.

San Francisco bus tours was a terrible recommendation for us. First we waited for 45 minutes for the bus to pick us up. It took us on inconsequential back streets and then ended downtown San Francisco by Fisherman's Wharf. It had no connecting bus to Golden Gate Park, and that was the main destination for our day. We had to take a taxi from there for $28, and then, at the end of the afternoon, we waited for our tour bus for a long time. My husband called them at 5 pm and they said "Oh, we stopped running a half hour ago!" We then had to figure out how to catch the city busy back to our hotel. We asked for our money back for the 48-hour bus tour ticket we had purchased from our hotel concierge. We were really unhappy about our first 24 hours and definitely did not want to tour with them the next day. We hope to receive a refund on our credit card through that tour company.

A computer in the lobby, with a secure internet connection for travelers to be able to print their boarding passes would be a very convenient service to offer.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, comfortable room. The breakfast buffet food and service was excellent. We ate there all 3 mornings.
review.negativeRemarks: $14.95 for internet connection in the room. If you used the free wifi in the lobby, you couldn't get a secure connection.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is very near museums and restaurants. The neighborhood seemed safer than Fisherman's Wharf area and less noisy.

review.title: Sleep here eat and drink elsewhere
review.reviewText: Good location, friendly staff and clean updated rooms. Food and drinks at the bar were very expensive.

review.title: Helpful Staff
review.reviewText: We arrived at the hotel late morning and check with the front desk to see if a room was available for an early check in. We were told no, but the room we were booked for should be available around 2pm. We left our luggage and went to explore the city. We arrived back at the hotel just after 5pm and were told the room still wasn't available. the gentleman gave us two vouchers for the bar to wait until our room was ready. We went back at 7pm and this time it was a young lady that helped us. She told us there was an error in our reservation and the room was two queen beds instead of a king. She looked but didn't have any rooms available that was similiar to what we booked. Almost an hour later she upgraded us to the Starwood Preferred Members room and we were given two vouchers for their breakfast buffet. In the beginning I was very upset about the mix up with the reservation, but both people that helped us were extremely friendly and I feel went out of their way to accomodate us. I wish I had gotten their names because they deserve a standing ovation and once we were checked in our stay was very very enjoyable.
review.positiveRemarks: I love the location of the hotel and is one of the reasons I continue to book this hotel.
