review.negativeRemarks: The times that I have stayed here I have had issues. First time the room had a horrible odor. Second time we did not get to check in until almost 9pm.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown San Francisco without being within the crowds. Access to public transportation is excellent!!!

review.title: The Westin SF - a traffic mess
review.reviewText:
this is a very nice hotel - rooms were clean and well maintained although the bathroom was kind of small and outdated compared to the rest of the hotel. Also, the a/c was non-existent - thankfully, the weather was cool as it usually is in SF but it's nice to be able to get a little more cooling if desired. Staff was great and restaurant was also good.
'main complaint' - the traffic was a nightmare! ... to get back to this hotel, (especially at rush hour), with all the 1 way streets, you have to plan your approach as if you were landing a plane on a runway. it's on a 5 lane street, usually packed with traffic - very hard to get to. ...if you miss it at rush hr, it'll take you another hr to get back. ps- I also drive in NYC and that's 'usually' considered the worst possible.
review.positiveRemarks: the restaurant was nice and the room itself was fairly good with a very nice view of the city
review.negativeRemarks: traffic and poor a/c in room
review.locationRemarks: its in the financial district so its ok during the day but not many closeby restaurants at night. traffic is bad on the street the main entrance is on

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great rooms comfortable and spacious. Great location to all hotspots. Travelled with kids enjoyed downtime with them in evening hotel lounge.

review.title: Nice little weekend away
review.reviewText: I've never written a review before, but this hotel was pretty good. I was was disappointed that we didn't get a good view for paying extra for the deluxe room, but over all it was very nice. The hotel was clean and relaxing, I just really would have been happier had we gotten the room in the picture that we booked.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Great hotel..very clean and the staff was really helpful. Only downside is they charge for Internet access which seems silly considering it seems most places offer it for free. Overall an awesome place to stay and I'd definitely recommend it

review.title: The veiw was very good.
review.reviewText:
Our room was not good, because Elevator's noise was so irritable sound in the room.
There were some dirty junks in the gabbage box when we got into the room the firsttime!
review.positiveRemarks: Bellmen and coucierges were very kind.

review.title: NOT a 4 star
review.reviewText: Doorman and concierge not capable of providing cabs or limos and making fun of this, also. No room service after 10:30pm. And they call it a 4 star ?!
review.negativeRemarks: Service

review.title: Great hotel - terrible parking
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, but the price for parking was ridiculous. $50 a night! and there was NO self parking; you had to use valet. So we parked close by in a lot that was $24 a day. Other then the horrible parking situation, the hotel was great & I would stay here again if I didn't find something else in a less busy part of the city. Also, the ceilings were low. Couldn't imagine a very tall person staying here. But like I said, overall it was a good experience. The parking keeps me from giving it 5 stars.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were comfortable. Also liked the big window looking out to the busy city streets.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was expensive and valet only
review.locationRemarks: Its Downtown which makes it busy with a lot of one way streets and weirdly planned intersections. Not great if you're not used to driving in a city

review.title: Nice hotel in SF, good location.
review.reviewText: We had a nice stay. The concierge saw that my husband had been out running and ran to get him a bottle of water - my husband was impressed.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location. CPK righ tacross the street, easy walk to Union Square shopping.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms a bit small. The door to the bathroom nearly hit the toilet, you had to stand out of the way.

review.title: Not what I was hoping!
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel based on the great reviews to suprise my husband on a much needed datenight/anniversary celebration. I called ahead of time and talked to a mgr about getting something special for the room for our first night togehter since kids were born and she said she noted our room with a complimentry anniversary ammenity! I also saw that if you wanted robes and slippers to request them so I did. After arriving in our room there was no robes, slippers, or "special ammenity" ever brought. I was bummed by that and also the size and quality of the room. We have stayed at other westins before and seen much nicer rooms in those. I must say the room veiws from the 30th floor was amazing though and the location was great.

review.title: Good hotel in a convenient locations
review.reviewText:
Clean, well kept, well located.
Very expensive parking $ 48 per day
review.negativeRemarks: expensive parking charges
review.locationRemarks: few blocks from Union square, a city shopping mall, starbucks, walgreens and church

review.title: Good, not great
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very helpful, especially late at night when our key malfunctioned and required a service member to open our door everyone we left the room. Room was clean and view was gorgeous. The bed was uncomfortable and the drain on the tub was closed, but it was a good stay.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Average hotel, certainly nothing special. WiFi is not complimentary and is actually expensive. Valet parking is also expensive and the only alternative is nearby public parking.
review.negativeRemarks: No complimentary WiFi

review.title: met all of our families needs
review.reviewText: the room was great, comfortable and quiet, cheap shower curtain leaked in the bathrooom, but overall a very good experience.
review.negativeRemarks: everything was quite expensive
review.locationRemarks: great location near Mosconi Center, Market Street, and within walking distance of AT&T Park

review.title: Nice hotel, expensive parking.
review.reviewText: All in all a nice place, 20 minute walk at moderate pace to A T & T park for Giants game. Safe walk back with literally hundreds and hundreds of people walking back up 3rd street to hotel. Big draw back was the 70 dollar fee to park my SUV at hotel. 70 dollars for one night. but at least I knew it was safe. Paid 20 dollars extra to upgrade to higher floor, well worth the money to be away from street noise.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing really negative other than paerking fee
review.locationRemarks: Nice location if you are going to see a Giants game.

review.title: For a Great Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: All of the employees were very friendly and very helpful. The hotel was exceptionally clean and the location for sightseeing of the city was perfect along with the city transportation system. My wife and I had a very pleasant stay at the Westin and if we ever come back to San Francisco we will stay at the Westin again. If we suggest a hotel to anyone going to San Francisco, we will recommend the Westin. Thank you for a nice stay.

review.title: Great for business trip
review.reviewText:
This is a very good hotel for business trips. It is close to Moscone center and the financial district. The rooms are very clean and quiet and good place to sleep, shower and work. If you become a Starwood Preferred Guest they throw in free wifi. Free membership and worth a few email adds.

The hotel is also located in one of the leveler sections of SF if you are not one of the fittest guests.

The only complaint is their restaurant, it has very good entrees, just a limited selection. Not that you can't find a great restaurant on every other corner in this town.

review.title: No worries!
review.reviewText: Staff is helpful; attentive without "hovering," courteous of course. Met all our needs. Park your car at the hotel where you have 24/7 access to the vehicle. Great location, walk to Union Square, the Ferry Building, shopping, walk to AT&T Park, good restaurants in the neighborhood, especially The Grove and Annabelle's, but in-house "Ducca" is very nice, too. A good stay for and appropriately priced for the city.

review.title: Good experience at check in
review.reviewText: My room was upgraded to higher floor after show SPG membership card. I enjoyed good view from the room.

review.title: amazing time in SF
review.reviewText: excellent hotel, very courteous staff, close to everything, best part of the city

review.title: Great hotel, great location!
review.reviewText: We liked the Westin. I would definitely stay again. My one complaint, was the parking fee. Our room overlooked an empty parking garage. If I stay there again, I would research parking options. It seemed like there were cheaper parking garages very close by.

review.title: Great Location, Great Hotel, Fair Price
review.reviewText: There was a long line at check in but the staff was very friendly. My key card to my room initially didn't work but the front desk staff were quick to solve the problem. The location was central and restaurants, bars and shopping were all close by without the tourist traffic of the Westin at Union Square. I will definitely stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: I literally liked everything.
review.locationRemarks: very central, easy access from Bart, walking distance to everything.

review.title: Very comfortable
review.reviewText: This was a last minute booked trip, so I was worried that I would get one of the leftover rooms. Not to worry: when I arrived, I was offered a two bed room (although none had been available when I booked on the website) at no additional charge. It wasn't near the elevator nor the ice machine and the staff was charming and accommodating. The concierge helped me navigate the Muni and BART system and suggested ways to get to my destination easier. I was very pleased with the room and the service during my stay.

review.title: Consistently good
review.reviewText:
This is a well run comfortable hotel in the centre of San Francisco that doesn't over charge for the privilege.
This was my third stay here and it has been consistently good every time.
If it offered free WiFi in the rooms it would get a 5.
review.negativeRemarks: Free WiFi in the public areas is free, but at cost in your room.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the centre of town and just a few blocks walk from Fishermans Wharf

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: When we arrived to our room I noticed the tub had not been cleaned thoroughly and immediately they had someone in to clean it. Other than that we had excellent service. The location is fantastic to get around and we enjoyed the treats in the afternoon. We would definitely return to this area. Aug 28th 2012
review.positiveRemarks: Definitely the location, the service and the friendliness /professionalism of the staff.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, close to buses, restaurants, shopping (Union Square. We felt very safe walking around day or evening.

review.title: Great location, good hotel
review.reviewText:
Location is fantastic, just close to everything in downtown. We had two rooms, one much bigger than expected and the other smaller then average, same price. Bathroom was small on both of them and with tub only, no separate shower. The hotel is a little outdated, sort of twenty years old style, but confortable. I think that they should start programming some refurbishment but it's still acceptable. Depending on your room location you can have very nice views but you need to be on a really high floor. Valet parking is expensive (more than 50 usd per day) and not very efficient, it took 10 to 15 minutes everytime to have our car ready.
The assistance from the concierge was very good.
There is a fantastic place to have breakfast just across the street and around the corner.
Free wi-fi in lobby area.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms and bathrooms were a little small and outdated.Valet parking very expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic, close to everything important in downtown.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Visited solo. Felt incredibly comfortable and safe. Staff very friendly & helpful.

review.title: Wonderful hotel in great location
review.reviewText: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for three nights to tour some colleges in the area. We had a great stay. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. The area around the hotel felt very safe. The concierge recommended terrific places to eat that were within walking distance. The hotel is close to two Bart stations which was very helpful to us since we didn't rent a car. We were also within walking distance to some great shopping. Hopefully, next time we go we can do a little shopping! I would definitely stay at this hotel again when I visit the Bay Area.

review.title: Spendy and disappointing
review.reviewText: the phone and clock were very dusty. It was ridiculous to pay over $50 for a valet, especially when there was no parking anywhere - it was a hostage situation! The water pressure was low. Plug-ins were hard to find close to the bed. Everything we touched cost money! Really - $5 for a candy bar? Get serious.
review.negativeRemarks: not clean (dust), low water pressure, COST
review.locationRemarks: downtown San Francisco - crazy

review.title: Decent for the price.. not up to par for Westin
review.reviewText:
1. Excellent and accommodating staff.
2. The room lighting is very poor (either theyre saving power or my eye sight is going)
3. The AC:Heater thermostat needs constant fiddling perhaps I forget how dreadfully cold, damp, and windy San Francisco can get even the Hotel hallways were freezing. The room was either too hot or too cold.
4. The bathroom is a bit tight for the room expectations and the porcelain was visibly worn
5. Ducca is quite a decent restaurant for lunch... very reasonable too (skip the fat laded overpriced breakfast).
6. Id go back but would be more selective on the room.
review.negativeRemarks: poor room lighting
review.locationRemarks: perfect location

review.title: nice place
review.reviewText:
nice place
x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Would definitely stay there again. Good Location too.

review.title: Great View (30th Floor), Great location...
review.reviewText: Excelent Service, good price/value ratio, great location. Good food but high in price.
review.negativeRemarks: Price list in the Restaurant...too expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Exceptional Location near every SF Atraction.

review.title: Great Hotel just stay away from the resturant.....
review.reviewText: Good location, room great, except way to close the elvevator so a constant all night woosh could be heard. What helped was an ambiance unit which had multiple settings. Really anice touch. Staff were nice except for the Hostess in the Ducca resturant who said we could not sit in the resturant to eat desert. We needed to sit in the noisy bar or lounge area. Mind you the probably 200+ seating for the resturant had four people in it. So off the front desk to talk to the night manager Brandon. Good guy understood right away we had been wronged. Went and got the resturant manager who honestly I don't think got it. Not a word of appology, just seated us. Now not even fine resturants would have offered a comp of some sort, nothing. Not that I would have taken it, but still folks who are in the service business should understand what is required. He looked annoyed rather than appologetic. The hostess never came over and said she was mistaken. But we got our desert which was great, but still left a bad taste in the mouth.
review.negativeRemarks: Resturant Staff
review.locationRemarks: Downtown good spot

review.title: A great hotel for a getaway
review.reviewText: This Westin was in a great location! Walking distance to great restaurants and shopping as well as attractions i.e ball field etc.
review.positiveRemarks:
I loved my room that had three large floor to ceiling windows and allowed for great views!
Concierge was spot on with restaurant recommendations!
review.locationRemarks: Great location...walking distance to many attractions and restaurants

review.title: Minor complaints
review.reviewText: There were some marks on our bed linen and heavy dust on the curtains. We also had a leak in the bathroom. However, just minor things. We didn't get our milk sachets replaced, which was a bit annoying. Overall, a nice hotel and good location. We did get upgraded to a rewards-member room on level 20, which was nice and meant we got free wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: No free wifi in room (unless you're in a Starwood rewards room); slightly better cleaning required; parking very expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Good. Walked to AT&T stadium and close to all the shops and transport.

review.title: Reception staff unfriendly and false for USA.
review.reviewText: Average for the price, reception staff unfriendly and false.

review.title: Great Hotel for everyone!
review.reviewText: As with my United Air Flight being overbooked so was this Hotel. They did accommodate the reservation with no problems. The Hotel was very nice and the room very comfortable. Some of the products in the minnie bar had expired. I had my two Grandchildren with me and the Restaurant Menu was not diverse enough for young children but the quality of the food was very good. Everyone working in the Hotel were very accommodating. I would stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant Menu
review.locationRemarks: Very Convenient

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
We had a great stay for a convention. Personel was extremely helpful when we requested a room change bcause of problems. We requested a refrigerator which arrived within 10 minutes.( Do NOT use the minibar refrigerator!! if you accidetally remove their stuff you have bought it)
I found the lay outof the hotel a bit confusing, was always searching for escalator, bathrooms, elevator etc.
I did HATE the expensive snack tray and mini bar!. As soon as you move something it is electronically added to your bill!. We were warned but beware. I gave it all wide berth, but it took up space on counter ( a whole drawer in first room). I kept saying : do not look at anything in that fridge!!!! ) Terrible idea and I find it an imposition.( that is why I rated it a 4)
However, complimentary water, starbucks coffee, tea were nice. Bed was great. Views spectacular.
Parking rates ( which we did not use) are very high
review.negativeRemarks: the stuff in minibar and snack tray.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for walking to transportation as well as many of the sights. Usr senior discounts if you are eligible

review.title: Close to the baseball stadium, otherwise standard
review.reviewText: I rented a suite, which had large rooms and a good view. Unfortunately, the bathroom had the standard size tub, in ill repair, and so-so amenities. The room service would not take a breakfast order I placed at 10:30 am (their "cut off" time), and there were no extra pillows or blankets in the room. I basically experienced it as a chain hotel writ large, not the kind of amenities I've experienced in other hotels when renting a suite.
review.negativeRemarks: no gift shop to speak of and only adequate service
review.locationRemarks: great location to downtown and baseball

review.title: Concierge services ruined it for me
review.reviewText:
Regretfully, the concierge services were very bad. Not enough concierge on duty and as I reached around 3 pm, their shift change time, I got my luggages 40 mn later !
It was my first experience in a Westin Hotel. I was looking forward for a very nice experience, having paid more than 300 usd for the room.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: It was nice, clean And centrally located for walking everywhere.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom fan was always on and there was no off switch
review.locationRemarks: Great. Everything is in walking distance.

review.title: Nice hotel/Expedia not helpful to a family
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine-sparkiling clean with friendly, helpful staff. I'd stay there again. Great location. Expedia was the problem. I have 3 kids,one male, and wanted a roll away so as not to have to get 2 rooms for the four of us, with not only the expense but wondering what half the children are up to in the big city. I picked out a hotel I wanted then called expedia. I was told the hotel I'd picked would not allow a rollaway, but here is one that would(the Westin)--so sorry, "we can't do that" and your booking fee is nonrefundable.
review.negativeRemarks: Expedia not having it together
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location

review.title: Great for businees travel, not for vacation.
review.reviewText:
If you're not on a business expense account, this hotel isn't for you. All amenities come at a high extra fee.

The location is good, the hotel is clean and safe, the staff is friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Amenities.
review.locationRemarks: Central downtown. Good spot.

review.title: Great hotel for a vacation.
review.reviewText:
My son and I stayed here for a vacation trip to San Francisco. Everything was clean, and we didn't have a problem with noise. You could hear when a fire truck passed by, or when cars were honking outside, but it wasn't really loud. It was just back ground noise. I recommend a higher floor to get away from some of the street noise (we were on the 14th, and it was fine).
The staff was very friendly. The minibar tried to charge me for taking things that we didn't take, but the charge was removed without a hassle by the clerks.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great. We walked the 2 miles down to Fisherman's wharf and to Lombard Street with no problems.
review.negativeRemarks: Pricey food.
review.locationRemarks: It's right by Yerba Buena Gardens.

review.title: Great for everyone. In the center of everything.
review.reviewText: Great staff . Excellent service. Will be staying again.

review.title: Great hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great location in San Francisco! We stayed for four nights and the hotel was very nice and really clean. The beds were perfect but the toilets were loud! You can hear other toliets especially in the morning and late evening. Alittle pricey but worth the stay. I would recommend this hotel to others. I do think for the price of the rooms, guests should be able to park at the hotel. Cheaper parking is within walking distance and half the cost.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisey toilets.
review.locationRemarks: 3rd & Market-San Francisco

review.title: Great Location and Safe area of San Francisco.
review.reviewText:
Great location of being downtown San Francisco. Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable.
Clean and comfortable. Services were available if required. Felt safe being in this area. Within walking distance of the public ferry building.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent area. Within walking distance of major tourist attractions. Public ferry building cable cars Pier 39.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Busy weekend caused staff to be stretched a little thin. Parking was outrageous and an upcharge was added for the SUV I was driving making it $63 per night to park! Centrally located and great views of the city.

review.title: Goog Location
review.reviewText: The room we had was nice. Good view from the 24the floor. The only thing was there wasn't enough seating in the room as for 1 chair and the bed. Could have a small seating area which would have made it perfect. All else was really good.
review.negativeRemarks: No least favorites
review.locationRemarks: for us it was perfect to go anywhere and everywhere especially by foot as we were able to walk, walk and do more walking!

review.title: No the friendliest greeters.
review.reviewText: Since we flew to SF and opted not to have a rental car, the valet parking people and bellmen were not the friendliest. They did not greet us, and saw this conduct with other hotel guests too. They rarely opened the doors for you, or are very selective on who they are going to open the doors for. In general, people would not rather use the revolving doors and they were not pleased to see this. When we checked in, no hotel employees offered to take our luggage to our room. Housekeeping was wonderful. I would say that I admire the honesty of the staff who found my Ipod I left in our hotel room and turned it in to Lost & Found who was quick to respond.
review.negativeRemarks: The bellmen and valet parking people not greeting hotel guests.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of the city, just perfect. Easy to get around places.

review.title: Save yourself the disappointment and find better!
review.reviewText: The heat was broken for the first two nights. A mini fridge provided only upon request. There's no free wifi in the room, only in the lobby. If you want wifi in your room, pay an extra $15/day on top of the already high price of staying there. The front-desk staff were so-so. They didn't even ask how our stay was. There's no easy parking. Valet parking is $48/day. You have to park in a garage if you want something more reasonable. One positive: The concierge were nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything else.
review.locationRemarks: Location is good. California Pizza Kitchen

review.title: well located hotel which is fine for everyone.
review.reviewText: I had a fine experience with the hotel. It was exactly what I wanted for my stay in San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: small room and overpriced parking
review.reviewText:
I was disappointed with the size of the grand deluxe room for the price. Room had lovely views but was small. There was little room to place my 2 suitcases so I was constantly stepping over the bags the entire time. The bathroom was nothing more than what you would find in a standard room. Overall, the room was not worth the price I paid.
In regards to hotel parking, the charge of $48 plus a surcharge for one overnight parking is outrageous and a scam! I would have reconsidered renting a car if only I knew to park it would cost more than the actual daily rental rate! Very disappointing!!
review.negativeRemarks: Size of room and overpriced parking
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to shopping, financial district and short walk to Ferry Building

review.title: Overall experience was very good
review.reviewText: Even after my request during check-in, the rep put us in a room adjacent to an elevator. The elevator made noise like hurricane almost whole night. Other than that overall experience was very good. The location is superb, conveniently located for all downtown activities.

review.title: Great hotel - - - You should stay there...
review.reviewText: Very nice room. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very near places to eat and shop for various items, which is good because eating at the hotel is very pricey.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: First of all I'm happy to say there were no bed bugs. I know some top notch hotels are afflicted with those so for me this was a huge relief. It was not the cheapest place to stay but the location is unbeatable (one block to major public transit, museums union square etc). I was traveling with senior citizen aged parents and they had an easy time getting around. Starbucks, Cvs, one block away as well. Free wifi only in lobby/lounge but must pay in room about $15/day. That's the only setback but not too bad. Fitness room was great - new equipment and space to do stretching. Clean with new magazines
review.negativeRemarks: No free wifi in rooms but only in lobby lounge
review.locationRemarks: Ideal most convenient for transit shopping museums eating- generally safer than other parts of town too

review.title: Great views
review.reviewText: Only con really is steep parking price and they could invest in higher quality toiletries.

review.title: Great for vacation or business stay
review.reviewText: Location was great and the room was clean, updated, and comfortable. We were able to walk to many of the activities we had planned (Market Street, Ferry Building, AT&T Park, etc), and it was easy to catch the BART or other transportation close to the hotel. The concierge made some great recommendations for restaurants in the area and gave us accurate directions to get to places. My only complaint was that the coffee in the room was not restocked after each morning and we had to request it. Also, no free wifi, but we were able to get access at some of the surrounding coffee shops.
review.locationRemarks: Clean, nice area of the city. Walking distance to many key places, not too touristy.

review.title: Ideal for short stay
review.reviewText: nice hotel, conveniently located in centre of San Francisco. Wi-fi is expensive at 15 dollars per day but is free in the lobby area. Reception staff very friendly. Was waiting 15 minutes to collect luggage when leaving but it was late at night. All in all quality hotel in a good location
review.negativeRemarks: charge for wi-fi
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Plain Jane Westin
review.reviewText: Hotel was a place to sleep. Nothing out of the ordinary, very plain. Not close to any SF attractions. This is a business man's hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of any real style
review.locationRemarks: Good for business men, but not people looking to sight see.

review.title: Westin Hotel - Thank you !
review.reviewText: The location is just Fantastic. You are right smack in the center of downtown with very easy access to everything you would expect as a visitor to San Francisco. What you have read about food, shopping, transportation etc its all just around the hotel. We are very particular about cleanliness of the hotel room and really by our standard, pleasing is probably extremely good for most. As I mentioned earlier we were checked in by Carmen at the front desk and immediately you know that you will be staying at the right hotel. They are very pleasant, polite and very professional. Our check in took less than 5 minutes. You get great Starbucks coffee in your room. House-keeping makes sure you do not miss any towel each day. The bar downstairs has great happy hours and the exterior patio seating is really very wonderful. Oh, the museums are just behind the hotel and lots to see and do.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms next to the elevator shafts tend to be a little more noisy as we all know. It is just the architecture of the building and a running system.

review.title: nice location, nice hotel
review.reviewText: The bathroom was tiny, but other than that we had a great stay. I think it is absurd that they do not provide free WiFi. It should be routine in a hotel in the business district. also, the valet parking is outrageous. There is a structure directly across the street that charges $25.

review.title: Great hotel for anyone new to San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Westin because of its location - close to Union Square and shopping and walking distance to the Embarcadero. The room was very comfortable and clean. We would definitely stay there again and recommend it to others.
review.positiveRemarks: proximity to Union Square, restaurants, shopping, trolleys and cable car.
review.locationRemarks: right off Market Street and close to Union Square.

review.title: Great hotel, cost to park.well thats another story
review.reviewText: The hotel was excellent but you get what you pay for. The parking is a hugh rip-off...$45 plus 25% sales tax EACH NIGHT. We didn't realize it but you really don't need a car in San Francisco. They have public transportation via the trolley and cable cars so think twice about renting a car...It's a fortune just to park it at the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed comforters were very comfortable!
review.negativeRemarks: The cost of parking...RIP OFF!
review.locationRemarks: Location was okay...you're in downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel for family.
review.reviewText: Great location. But valet parking is expensive. Otherwise no major complaints.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size,
review.locationRemarks: Good location.

review.title: San Fran Find
review.reviewText: Very modern decor. Hotel staff was courteous, accommodating, friendly, and efficient. Area to hold your luggage if you arrive early and they called you when your room was ready. Accessible to public transportation, we never had to walk more than 2 blocks to catch a bus, trolley, or subway. The bed was fabulous...never slept better! Hotel was pet-friendly. Gourmet breakfast buffet...a little pricey but worth the cost.
review.positiveRemarks: The comfort of the bed, the hotel staff, and the location.
review.locationRemarks: Very optimal. Easy to all public transportation.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: In my room there were shampoo and lotion which were used by the previous guest. The fan in the restroom can not be switched off.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable beds and good quality bedding.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient location close to the bart station.

review.title: Very High standard
review.reviewText: Absolutely wonderful the staff are very welcoming the level of service was exemplary. The upkeep and appearance was to a very high standard along with the menu for room service I would highly recommend this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Very central great for a short or long stay

review.title: Great hotel for a family
review.reviewText: Many hotels only offer 1 king bed or 2 double beds. This hotel consists of rooms with 2 queen beds. It suits well with a family of 3 of 4.
review.positiveRemarks: Two comfortable queen beds with lots of pillows
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking
review.locationRemarks: Good location close to streetcars and buses

review.title: Great rooms, minor annoyances
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was great. The two issues that I had was floors 8-14 are advertised as rooms with a great view. That was not true. Parking was $53. I parked less than a block away for $26.

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: Good service and comfortable room. Concierge was knowledgeable and helpful.

review.title: Vacation
review.reviewText: This hotel lives up to the Westin name. We have no complaints except maybe that the breakfast was pricey for what they offered. But I guess that is the way of San Francisco in general.

review.title: Right next to Market street
review.reviewText: The bed and pillows were soft and wonderful. We were awaken at 3 am by some nut who pulled the fire alarm. The hotel checked it out, and did an all call to alert everyone of the false alarm. Otherwise we had a good experience.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel staff gave us a free breakfast for the inconvenience of our room key problem.
review.negativeRemarks: We did have a problem with our room key (3 times)
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco

review.title: Won't Stay Here Again
review.reviewText: The most disappointing aspect of our stay was the cleanliness of the room. I put a towel down on the floor to do my daily stretching routine and while down there got a good look under the desk, dresser, and bed. The amount of dirt and dust was unbelievable for a hotel of this represented stature.
review.negativeRemarks: Not a very clean room, no WiFi in room, ridiculously high prices for in-room snacks and drinks
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking distance to Powell street cable car turn-around and BART station

review.title: Outstanding hotel for everyone.
review.reviewText: Knowledgeable and extremely friendly staff. Very convenient location.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient.

review.title: Accomodating and comfy
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a good location just off Market Street. Plenty of food, stores, etc nearby. I needed medications stored in a fridge, and one was delivered to my room within 15 minutes of my request. The beds were comfy and the room was roomy for a large city motel. Great location near BART and other mass transit.

review.title: Good location, excellent staff
review.reviewText: the staff went out of there way to honor our requests. There were no sitting chairs in the room but the staff quickly delivered 2 of them to our room. The room was very comfortable. The Bar staff were very friendly and engaging. I would stay here again with no reservations.
review.locationRemarks: Very centrally located. We walked to the theater, and Union square and very close to the financial district as well.

review.title: Very clean modern hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: Very clean modern hotel in a great location. Stayed with husband and 3 year old and staff was very accommodating to all of us. Only complaint is $55 valet parking.

review.title: Nice visit
review.reviewText: We checked in and one room had an unpleasant smell to it. We called down to the front desk and the lady got us transferred to another room. The bed was definitely very comfortable, too many times we travel and the bed is not that great. One hint is if you're driving there and don't want to pay the hefty valet fee, park right across the street at Hearst parking for $25/day.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet fee
review.locationRemarks: Close to many things.

review.title: Great breakfast
review.reviewText: Beautiful outdoor bar area. Excellent happy hour prices. Convenient location to local transportation. Breakfast buffet was awesome!
review.negativeRemarks: Room next to elevator was noisy

review.title: Could have been better.
review.reviewText:
The room had no reading chair or coffee table. I've been therre before and they did every other time in every other room.
I needed a wake up call at 4 a.m. the day of departure since I had an early flight out of SFO. I never got the call, but fortunately I was up a bit early anyway.
Previous stays were much better. Place does have great location, though.
review.negativeRemarks: The room.
review.locationRemarks: Great, especially if you get a Muni pass.

review.title: Attentive staff and great location
review.reviewText:
I was greeting by incredibly attentive and friendly staff. All staff I interacted with -- reception, luggage service, housekeeping, bar, and door -- were very helpful and kind.

My room was clean and spacious. No complaints. I even lucked out by getting a high floor in the corner with a great view.

The location is great. Close to BART stations, restaurants, and local points of interest. My stay was for a work trip, so I was very happy that there were several office supply and copy places nearby.

review.title: internet charge
review.reviewText:
I give them 4 only because they charge for the internet.
Otherwise i`d given 5

review.title: Retreat in the middle of the city
review.reviewText: Great stay in SF overall! Perfect location for being downtown (and with kids).

review.title: Check your bed...
review.reviewText:
Generally a nice hotel with a great location. One huge problem though: The bedding was dirty. Not the sheets and pillowcases (that I could see), but the white, cotton duvet on my comforter had grease marks (from filthy suitcases, I suppose) and lipstick/makeup. The other bed had blood stains on its duvet. The evidence was clearly fresh, not left after washing. (Who knows how often they wash those things??) We threw them on the floor and left a note for housekeeping not to reuse these pieces on the bed, but sure enough they put them back on.

No matter how nice the rest of the room may be, the hotel is only as clean as its dirtiest feature. BEDS SHOULD BE CLEAN! How difficult is it to remove a white, cotton duvet and wash/bleach it?! If you stay at this otherwise nice hotel, inspect your bedding when you arrive and alert the front desk (rather than housekeeping) if the cleanliness is not satisfactory.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of bed linens

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: Expedia provided a very good price for the room. Other than having my car scraped in the garage it was fine. The hotel's parking service owned up to it, called us and promised to take care of it and gave free parking and movies

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText:
Big negative - returned to room at 5 pm expecting to relax and get ready for dinner and the room had not been made up.
Negative - tv did not have sports channel that broadcasts Giants games or local PBS station(?)
Positive - convenient location

review.title: Convenient location.
review.reviewText: Nice pillow top beds, and great high end bedding. Air con didn't seem to work and the fan in the bathroom didn't work either so not so good. Great location, very convenient. Parking fees were outrageous. Valet even seemed embarrased to tell us how much and sugested a near by parking garage. We had a room near the elevators which was very noisy through the night. Overall ok, but not somewhere that I would rush back to for the money.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds and bedding were very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of parking and noisy elevators.
review.locationRemarks: Very good for transport and sights.

review.title: Great hotel but doesn't have a pool or spa
review.reviewText: Clean and nice as would be expected. Location is close to shopping, etc. Was a little disappointed that it didn't have a pool or spa, but otherwise great.

review.title: Good hotel for conference attendees.
review.reviewText: I was attending a conference at the Moscone conference centre and brought my baby son and husband along too. The hotel were very helpful and supportive of travelling with a baby (e.g. provided us with a full-size refrigerator in our room for milk, baby food ..etc). The hotel is ideally suited for downtown and conference venues, and is very near the main public transport hubs for getting further afield.

review.title: Great location, good value.
review.reviewText: Great hotel, close to everything downtown. The rooms are good looking but I expected them to be a little bit more "up to date". I would go there again without question. The only annoying factor is that they charge 15$/day for WiFi... That should be included in the price! But you can get free WiFi in the lobby. Just look for the signs with the username / password on them.
review.negativeRemarks: Paying for WiFi is a bit "2001" ;-)
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything!

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: The hotel is good overall. Kind old. But very convenient location

review.title: Wonderful hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: I've been to this hotel several times and I just love the accommodations, staff and the location. Close to union square and fine restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: Beds are comfortable and rooms are quiet
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is expensive
review.locationRemarks: Close to shos

review.title: Fantastic Stay in SF
review.reviewText: Beautiful, clean, comfortable room and service. Loved our stay here! Very central yet easy to get to via freeway access.
review.positiveRemarks: Beds and linens were amazing, all the staff was friendly, knowledgable, helpful, and professsional.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing we didn't like about the hotel!
review.locationRemarks: Great location central to Union Square, Embarcadero, and Financial District

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Great location. The beds were so comfortable:) I'd like to stay there again, when I have chance. also I'll recommend this hotel for my friends.

review.title: Fine.
review.reviewText: Very nice for a large chain hotel. Not a lot of character. Helpful staff.

review.title: Good times in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice staff, helpful concierge, fabulous roon with a GREAT view. But gouchy bar staff
review.positiveRemarks: Concierge was very helpful - made our trip run smoothly

review.title: Westin Market Street
review.reviewText:
I had a wonderful 5 night stay at the Westin. A big thank you goes out to Carmen at the front desk who booked me into a pleasant and quiet room on the 19th floor.
I was told that the hotel had recently been refurbished; my room was well appointed and very clean.
The hotel staff were warm and friendly and appeared to go out of their way to make you feel comfortable. I would certainly stay there again and would recommend the Westin Market Street as a great place to stay with Fishermans Wharf only 10 minute drive away

review.title: Location
review.reviewText:
Happy hour - half price drinks, from 4-7pm. Comfortable bar, lounge and outside space a bonus.
Good location - easy walk to shops and Yerba Buena Gardens.

review.title: expect to pay a lot extra once there
review.reviewText: The room and staff were exceptional, but there were a few pitfalls that could be a big deal to some. When we arrived, we learned that it cost $48 a day to park in the hotel's parking. We found a parking garage very close, but it was still $28 a day (if you leave your car there all day, if you take it out and then re-park, it can cost even more). Internet is $15 a day, and we could hear everything that went on in the hallways outside our room very clearly, so if your neighbors wake early, so do you. Our baby and us were woken up by doors slamming and people talking at 7am. The location is great though, and we had no problems with the room. THe beds were comfortable and shopping and Cable car pickup are nearby. Also, our baby was able to crawl around the room with minimal hazards.
review.positiveRemarks: location, friendly staff, clean room, baby friendly rooms
review.negativeRemarks: outrageous parking costs, high internet costs, thin walls to hallway
review.locationRemarks: near shopping and cable car pickup

review.title: Beware of concierge
review.reviewText:
We had the concierge book an all day wine tasting tour for 4 of us. When we went downstairs to meet the shuttle, the concierge told us our bus had a flat tire and he would be running late. When we came back 30 minutes later, they had realized they gave us false information and the bus had left without us and never even had a flat.

They put us in a taxi to meet up with the shuttle at Fisherman's Wharf and the tour company only had us down for 1 person, instead of four. Thank goodness the tour company felt bad for us...they comped a half-day tour and reimbursed our full day tour. However, the hotel was of NO help whatsoever and it ruined an entire 4 hours of our trip. It seemed that there was a huge communication issue between all of the concierge empolyees as a whole.
review.negativeRemarks: concierge organization and attention to detail (or lack thereof)
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect

review.title: Recommend
review.reviewText:
This was my first trip to San Francisco. I had business in the finalcial district so this was a perfect location. Within walking distance of the office and all major points of interest. All forms of public transportation was available within a 1/2 blocks walk from the hotel.
I found the staff friendly and helpful.The room was clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: I had no negitive experiences
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: Room was an upgrade, fantastic views, lots of space and vey helpful staff. Well situated in SF. Highly recommended.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: right next to the museum of modern art, convenient for BART and trolley buses.

review.title: Not a typical Westin--Very Disappointing!
review.reviewText: After years of traveling and staying at Westins this was my worst stay ever. Staff is uncaring, room disappoining and for a major hotel in downtown San Francisco to not have all day room service availability is beyond belief. And allow lots of timento get a taxi at night at the hotel. It appears that taxi drivers don't frequent it. Very sad!
review.positiveRemarks: For the money there are FAR better places to stay in San Francisco's Union Square area
review.negativeRemarks: Room service vavailability and attitude of staff.
review.locationRemarks: Good location forcUnion Square an MOMA

review.title: good choice in SF
review.reviewText: have stayed here on numerous occasion~always met expectations~very helpful staff
review.locationRemarks: excellent for san Francisco

review.title: Spring break with nieces
review.reviewText: Had trouble with key cards, BUT staff was extremely helpful!
review.negativeRemarks: Which way to get off the elevator
review.locationRemarks: Gr8 for public transport

review.title: Westing at Market Street SF
review.reviewText: Conveniently located in downtown SF close to business and tuoristic attractions. I will use it again. Room is small with limited seating space.
review.negativeRemarks: Room space.
review.locationRemarks: Central to almost everywhere.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location; very central and within walking distance to most hot spots, including AT&T Park. Room was nice and very clean.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Great location. Easy access to Bart station and street rail carts. Hotel is beautiful and rooms were great size. Staff is kind and very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: No pool.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Bad lift noise
review.reviewText:
We were initially put in a room next to the lift shaft and consequentially didn't get any sleep as partygoers were riding the lift for fun and shouting & laughing past 3.30am. Horrendous!
The next day when we complained they gave us a different room overlooking a garden which was fine. they also gave us a complimentary breakfast for our 50th wedding anniversary, so no real complaints
review.negativeRemarks: The lift
review.locationRemarks: Good locale

review.title: Beautiful hotel is perfect location!
review.reviewText: Beautiful upscale hotel located in prime location near Union Square. Convenient access to all public transportation. Easy walking distance to Chinatown and Little Italy. Tons of nearby restaurants... Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere to eat, as the hotel restaurant is overpriced (only ate breakfast there, $60 for two people and that was for a buffet of lukewarm, dried-out food). Rooms were quiet and very well appointed. Spotlessly clean, with flat screen tv, in-room coffee maker, lots of easily accessible outlets for recharging or powering electronics. The bed was incredible, I'd like to buy one of those. Staff was gracious and attentive. Lovely hotel, would definitely stay again if there's a deal, otherwise I doubt I could afford it. Note: overnight valet parking is currently almost $50 a night. Keep that in mind when calculating cost. I didn't see any other parking except a Staples garage across the street. Unsure of the rate or if they allow overnight.
review.negativeRemarks: Food price. Parking price.
review.locationRemarks: Near the corner of Market and 3rd, close to Union Square, public transportation.

review.title: cockroach found in the room
review.reviewText: every thing is good but unfortunately found a cockroach in the room (actually on the bed)

review.title: Nice hotel, but watch the incidentals
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, but all the incidentals cost me a small fortune! Over $50 for a breakfast, and $15 a day for internet.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive incidentals
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for downtown

review.title: View to remember
review.reviewText: It is a really beautiful hotel tucked in right on the edge of downtown. I really enjoyed the location, the room, everything. The bed is really comfortable and the room we were in was on the 32nd floor. What a great view of the whole city. I highly recommend this place if you are staying in San Francisco. Being as close as it was to the BART made travel to and from the airport so easy.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is super close to the bart and muni. Also walking distance to the MOMA, Union Square and many downtown hotspots. Really great spot.

review.title: Upgraded!
review.reviewText: A mistake was made in the type of room I requested. I had to wait to get the correct type about one hour later. I agreed to become a Starwood preferred guest, and then was given an upgrade. The view was spectacular!
review.negativeRemarks: No umbrellas left for the only rainy day we had.
review.locationRemarks: Next to everything I needed.

review.title: Didn't quite meet expectations
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, but not as nice as other Weston locations I have stayed at. The room we had was small, and the bathroom was very cramped. The hotel bar and lounge was nice, but the restaurant menu was pitiful. I believe there were 5 total entree options, all very over priced. Luckily there are many dinner options within walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size and location
review.locationRemarks: In SOMA area good night life options, but a little far from tourist attractions.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is situated in one of the most convenience spot where you can get around easily with multi modes of transportation. The room that we stay has a magnificent view with full side window. The hotel staffs are very kind. If I have a chance to visit San Francisco again I will definitely stay in the Westin, Market Street again.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Westin Market Street
review.reviewText: Good location as within walking distance of Ferry Building as well as a cable car station. Parking very expensive & internet not standard unlike most of the other US hotels we stayed in.

review.title: Still...I like this hotel.
review.reviewText: So, here's the deal. The hotel put me in a room next to the service corridor. That is the wall I shared. It's great not to have to put up with neighbors but the early morning and late night noise from the staff didn't help to make the weekend restful and easy. It's tough to complain because you know that people are just doing their jobs. I would imagine that an individual who had an easier time sleeping at night would have been fine. That's not me. I like this hotel. The location is terrific. Staff was very helpful and the view from my room was tremendous.
review.negativeRemarks: Location of the room within the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Central to everything. Union Square, SOMA, cable cars, mass transit, all are easily within walking distance. Location, for me is perfect.

review.title: Great hotel, unless you drove your own car...
review.reviewText: Hotel was great and the service was great. Only complaint is the parking situation. The self parking lot is $25 dollars overnight and $6 dollars for every in and out, and the valet service at the hotel, the guy told me it was $40 a day with in and out, ended up being $48 a day and $54 after taxes. That is OUTRAGEOUS!

review.title: Bar
review.reviewText: Don't drink in the bar. The bar staff are not professional. The drinks are too expensive.
review.negativeRemarks: The Bar
review.locationRemarks: Australia

review.title: Hotel was ok.
review.reviewText: Hotel was ok for a couple of days. Location was good as it was easy to walk to shopping and restarants we were interested in.

review.title: Keep it up - I'll be back again soon - thank you!!
review.reviewText:
I had a wonderful time at the Westin S/Fran. I have previously stayed at the Taj also near Union Square (which is also fantastic).

Location was awesome - easy to walk to cafes, delis, Macys, Westfield, the Cable Cars, Fisherman's Wharf etc.

The sun came out on my last days there which made it amazing.

The staff were courteous and helpful. I was given 4 complimentary breakfasts after emailing management to tell them how amazing the housekeeping staff were as well as free inet for a few nights. Very nice suprise upon check out. And always important to acknowledge when someone takes the time to provide positive feedback. Excellent Business Practise.

The room was spacious, and anything I asked for they provided i.e. a fridge, help with my bags - all extremely timely and refreshing to only have to ask once and something gets done. (After 5 wks of travelling it's those simple things like a nice clean room, always having plenty of toiletries and towels and not having to ask twice that are very appreciated and impressive)

Well done - all staff are very pleasant to deal with and I'll be back.

My other stays at Westins along the trip were also luxurious with wonderful staff and everything was easy, efficient and never too much trouble... I loved all of my stays!

p.s. the eggs benedict with spinach and smoked salmon is to die for!
review.positiveRemarks: The complimentary bonus I got from management
review.negativeRemarks: Room service has a time i.e. cut-off at 10pm
review.locationRemarks: Location was awesome - easy to walk to cafes, delis, Macys, Westfield, the Cable Cars, Fisherman's Wharf etc.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: Booked 4 rooms for 4 employees; all were quite pleased. Close to convention center (walking distance); great service @ hotel.

review.title: Internet fees
review.reviewText:
Well located, 2 blocks from the conversion center and right off market street where you will find numerous shops and restaurants. Service is great but be aware of internet charges, they will charge you $15 per night per device. I was not able to get internet on my laptop after activating my ipad without paying again.

The restaurant offers good breakfast and is great for an evening drink, dinner was average and a bit overpriced.

review.title: Nice. Expensive parking.
review.reviewText: $50 for valet parking with in-and-out priveleges. $25 to park in the lot across the street.
review.locationRemarks: convenient to restaurants

review.title: WONDERFUL!
review.reviewText: It was not the hotel I thought I was booking, but it turned out even better. Staff were great. Room was beautiful. Very clean and new looking. The breakfast buffet (extra) was amazing.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Overall, rate the hotel as a 5. Only 4 was with room comfort...room was a little warm for our taste and the A/C didn't seem to want to kick on. It was also really dry in the room. Again, that was our personal opinion. Room was cleaned early every morning. Staff was friendly and professional. Hotel is convenient to many attactions, restaurants, and transit (F line, cable cars, BART, Muni all close by). Took F line to the Wharf several times. Breakfast buffet expensive, so chose one of several breakfast establishments close by (within 2 blocks). Parking VERY expensive...saved 50% by parking at Jessie Square behind the hotel. Actually more convenient than valet, but no in-and-out privaleges. You really don't need a car, but we like to do a lot of adhoc touring. Visit Muir Woods...well worth it if you like the outdoors!
review.positiveRemarks: Nice hotel at a reasonable price.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was a little warm and very dry. Parking too expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Close by many restaurants, Union Square, and transportation (muni, cable cars, street cars, BART, etc).

review.title: You won't go wrong!
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel. Would def stay again. Staff is wonderful. Felt like home, but with a fabulous view of S F if you get one of the top floors. Wow!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the view, the great bkfst buffet at lobby restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Great for one but room only big enough for one comfy chair, also no table for eating for two.
review.locationRemarks: Best possible location. Central to everything.

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, have stayed in better and better Westin's but actually it was comfortable, good views and reasonably priced, would stay again
review.negativeRemarks: small bathroom
review.locationRemarks: amazing

review.title: 5 stars hotel
review.reviewText: We had an awesome experience here!! The hotel n room was super clean. Prompt n friendly services. Located in the middle of all the shops n restaurants. Would stay here again next time I am in San Francisco!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room. Free starbuck coffee!! Friendly staff!!
review.negativeRemarks: The parking is expensive if u have a rental car
review.locationRemarks: It's walking distances to shops n restaurants

review.title: Nice hotel in a very convenient area.
review.reviewText: The Westin San Francisco Market Street is a very well-appointed hotel in a very convenient area. The shopping in Union Square is walking distance. Chinatown and Little Italy is not too much further, and the BART has several stops nearby. Even the fun SOMA (South of Market) area is nearby.

review.title: Chick weekend
review.reviewText: Nice location. Mediocre view from room. Service very good. Nice people.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown Union Square area, near BART, near shopping, walking distance to many SF places.

review.title: What ever happened to the Heavenly Bed?
review.reviewText:
What ever happened to the "Heavenly Bed"? I used to love crawling into bed at a Westin because the bed was so comfortable. But they seemed to have cheapened them quite a bit over the last few years. I stayed at the St. Francis a few months ago and thought the same thing.

If you are going to advertise it, you need to have the goods.

review.title: Great hotel except for the $55/night parking fee
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a good location. Just beware that parking is an unbelievable $55 a night. You read that right! So make sure you are adding early $60 to the quoted price if you have a car.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking $55/night
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Bad experience
review.reviewText: Parking sucks!! Bad experience!! We'll not stay at the Westin Hotel again!
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: Good location. Walking distance to alot of things

review.title: Comfortable and anonymous
review.reviewText: Very expensive unless you plan to use more hotel facilities than just the room. Quiet, well appointed and comfortable rooms. Zero personality.
review.negativeRemarks: The bar where employees complained about their jobs.
review.locationRemarks: Market Street, San Francisco.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Tiny rooms. Innatentive and expensive room service. I have stayed at many Westins across the world and this one was by far the worst.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size and layout.

review.title: Conference
review.reviewText: This hotel was exactly what I expected. The rooms were very nice and clean and the workout facility was great. It is located close to the convention center, Union Square, and pubic transportation but not very many tourist attractions.

review.title: Ok Hotel, terrible chain.......
review.reviewText: Hotel is OK but very expensive for what it provides, moreover, if you are a business traveler and use Expedia note that despite the site asking for your SPG number for rewards they do not recognize price you paid for the room for rewards - all 3rd party bookings are ineligible, apparently despite modern technology they are unable to get these details - presumably as no one in the chain ever check the payments directly made by Expedia!!!!. Is this Expedia or Starwood? as a customer I do not care but most hotels will not inform you that the cash paid is of no benefit to the program so you may want to make other decisions, I am as over and above this since complaining to Starwood no one has returned the call or responded.
review.negativeRemarks: reward program and customer service around this
review.locationRemarks: center of town, good for conferences.

review.title: Westin
review.reviewText:
Overall the hotel is comfortable. I stayed on business for 4 nights. Restaurant is limited for dinner choices but excellent for breakfast. There is a California Pizza Kitchen directly across the street--not that I'm recommending that but it's convenient.
My only real complaint was the bathrooms are ridiculously small. Was a little disappointed with how small they were and if I was staying one night it would be alright but 4 nights I would have preferred a larger space.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast, valet parking and easy to catch a cab.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Nice location you can walk to shopping and food.

review.title: Great location but bed bugs and no free internet!
review.reviewText: My daughter and I took a 3 day trip down to San Francisco and decided to stay at the Westin San Francisco Market Street hotel. We LOVED the location of the hotel as it was convenient to a lot of good shopping and dining options. Although we loved the hotel room, my daughter found a number of bites on her leg after sleeping in one of the queen beds (Room 812) so there may have been bed bugs on her mattress. I did not experience any bites this time, but have in other less expensive hotels. It would also have been nice to have free internet access in the room. When I went to print out my boarding pass, I was told to go to the business center which was located on the conference room floor (level 2) at the back end of a hallway. I was a bit nervous heading to the business center at 10:00 pm at night when there was no one in the conference room area. It would have been nice to have had the business center located on the first floor closer to the front desk or concierge's desk where there would be a bit more foot traffic later in the evening.

review.title: Spring 2012
review.reviewText: The room was clean and the hotel amenities were good. The desk staff was very friendly but the parking valet staff was a mix; some were very helpful and congenial, others were brusk and not very cordial. The location was relatively convenient to Union Square, China Town, and the cable car line. However, I think I will look elsewhere for my next stay at these prices.

review.title: Meh
review.reviewText: This hotel was about as nice as a decent Motel 6. There was nothing special about it. It was basically a bed and a (very expensive) parking space.The rooms were plain. The parking at the time I stayed was an additional $55 per night. Internet access was another $15 per night. The hotel is in a good area though. Walking around Market and Third was pleasant. The view was good. There are some decent restaurants within easy reach. There's good 4G reception in the area.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and view were excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was bland, and the cost was exceptionally high for what the hotel offered.

review.title: Great, Reasonably Priced Hotel
review.reviewText:
This is a nice place to stay when you are in town for business or perhaps a couple in their mid to late 30's. Youngsters will probably not find anything excited about this hotel and there isn't anything remotely entertaining for children so parents should stay away. Now, considering the Yerba Buena is a bit of an adult oriented part of town, my observation should be obvious as parents and youth will probably be wanting to stay closer to the piers.
The hotel staff are very polite and this extends to Ducca which is the restaurant attached to the hotel. The waiters are extremely nice and really make you feel important. I've also forgotten personal items from time to time like a toothbrush. The hotel staff gladly bring you up a complimentary replacement.to your room. As far as the area is concerned, it is downtown SF so expect insane bums and plenty of drunks (especially wandering around on market street). This particular area also tends to smell of rotten sewage when it rains. But again, this is SF, you'd be hard pressed to find a "clean" area.
That small thing aside, I see no reason to ding the hotel review for the area. Also, for those of you looking to visit that haven't been in a while, I think it has improved quite a bit in the last couple years. Give it another chance if you didn't like it before.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean rooms, polite and attentive staff, Ducca Restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: The internet is $14/day which is messed up since most hotels offer it for free. I paid more for service in less than a week than I do a month at home.
review.locationRemarks: If you're familiar with SF, Yerba Buena is not a bad place but does have some seriously seedy parts. Definitely higher than average spot though.

review.title: Disappointing Stay
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was thin and most of the time the phone would just ring when trying to talk to conceirge or hotel front-desk. Additionally; room-service is limited.
review.positiveRemarks: The gym facility was very good and available 24 hours.
review.negativeRemarks: Front Desk and Conceirge were disappointing in the quality and speed of service.
review.locationRemarks: Location was very convenient to Moscone.

review.title: Great getaway
review.reviewText: The Westin is located just south of Market at 3rd St - you have multiple transit options within a block's walk, if you don't want to take one of the every ready taxis. The interior of the hotel is nicely decorated, but not overly done. The rooms have a modern feel to them.

review.title: I'd stay here again
review.reviewText: I only stayed one night, but overall had a good experience. Room was clean and spacious. Staff was professional and friendly. Great location, walking distnce to convention centers and Union Square. Aimed more towards professionals.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location and accessibility to entertainment.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The location was great, easy access to public transportation and areas of interest. The hotel was beautiful, clean and staff very helpful. My ONLY complaint is we had to pay $15 a day for internet access in the room. As my daughter said, "In today's world, it's like charging extra for air conditioning. This is something that should be provided for free". I heartily agree. Other than that, we enjoyed our stay. Oh and we did not realize but they have a car available. We had taken a taxi from the airport to hotel which cost $50 and when leaving and waiting for a taxi, they offered the hotel's car #much nicer ride and cleaner# to the airport for $50. AND if you need a rental car on Sunday, all the local offices are closed. Enjoy your stay!

review.title: Ok for business
review.reviewText: Good business class hotel. Restaurant service was a bit lacking.

review.title: Recommend
review.reviewText: Great, reliable. Friendly staff. Nice accommodations. Inexpensive for the location and quality.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location. Comfortable and luxurious. Highly recommended.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a great location near Union Square.

review.title: Overpriced with only so-so amneties
review.reviewText: The Westin has really gone down in value in my opinion. The staff was only so-so. My biggest disappointment was that room service was only offered for breakfast and dinner. They do not accomodate lunch or so late night dining.
review.negativeRemarks: Room Service
review.locationRemarks: Good location in downtown San Francisco

review.title: Westin~ you'll be glad you did!
review.reviewText:
What a great find! The hotel staff were very responsive and welcoming.
The hotel was lovely with a spacious clean room ~the bed and pillows super comfortable.~ location perfect.

review.title: weekend vacation
review.reviewText: the staff and convenience of the hotel was the best...the size of the room was really nice...everyone we came in contact with was helpful and smiling...
review.positiveRemarks: the staff at the front desk was very helpful...

review.title: Too Compact
review.reviewText: The room was small (5-8floors) including the bath. It was very compact. Bed was not very comfortable. There was no relaxing sofa in the room.

review.title: Beware the parking ripoff!
review.reviewText: The parking for one night cost $54.72! I believe that's outrageous.

review.title: No sleep thanks to noise.
review.reviewText: My entire issue with my stay stems from the people staying in the room next to us and down from us on the same floor. My family and I stayed 2 nights, both of which we were kept up by loud people between the hours of midnight and 430 am. The first night there were young women screaming, laughing, and knocking on doors at 130 am. When I called the front desk, I got no answer as I let it ring over 20 times. We eventually confronted the girls and they eventually stopped making noise. The following evening, we were awoken by gentlemen in the room next to ours at 330 am. The were yelling and laughing in their room so loud that it kept us awake. I got up and went down to the front desk and explained the situation to the lady and she apologized and said she would send security right up. Security did arrive within 5 minutes and talked to the noisemakers. This issue can happen to anyone. But the lack of making an effort to right what had happened is what bothered me. When we went to check out of the room. They asked how our stay was? When we replied honestly, their comment was, "Sorry to hear that!" "That will be $97.90 for the valet. Would you like to leave it on your card?" They made no sincere effort to take care of our issue in any sort of manner. When we got our vehicle from the valet, the same thing happened, a quick, "Sorry about that! Have a nice day!" They really are not interested in your stay, they just have to ask as part of their job.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of effort by staff.
review.locationRemarks: Tough getting in and out if not familiar with location. GPS struggles due to high rise buildings all around.

review.title: Trade Show Heaven
review.reviewText: Great location for Moscone trade shows! Staff was realy vague on parking locations when I called twice listing Valet as only choice... there is a City lot directly across the street for $23 for 24 hours and another lot behind hotel neither could be missed by staff. Overall a nice stay.
review.locationRemarks: great for Moscone far from wharf tourist things but can take cable car or Muni to wharf.

review.title: loved the stay at westin- wish view was better
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel and location.wish view was better - My view was blocked by buildings . Will say its better to take lower floors - those are a bit cheaper.

review.title: Great experience!
review.reviewText: Great Experience! I've stayed at many Westin Hotels and have never been dissapointed. This was my first time at the San Francisco location and I loved the proximity to all of the shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Chinese New Year Parade
review.reviewText: Loved our stay at the Westin. Easy access to Union Square and China Town as the location is within walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: I liked that you welcome dogs, but not too sure about the possibility of getting a room as dog was previously in as I do not have a dog.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for the shopper and all the restaurants.

review.title: Nice clean room, don't touch the mini-bar!
review.reviewText: Room was bright- lots of whites and creme colors- felt clean and spacious. The chairs in the room were a little dirty/stained, but overall v. nice! Workout room had good variety, 4 treadmills, several ellipicals, stair stepper, recombinant bike, weights and free earphones. Concierge very helpful and friendly. Doormen also very nice. Mini-bar in room was annoying- weight activated- charged me for stuff I didn't take. The hotel was in a very good location, especially for Marcone visitors.
review.negativeRemarks: Need to lose the mini-bar
review.locationRemarks: Great location for Marscone visitors

review.title: Parking is expensive
review.reviewText: Parking was too expensive. Otherwise very nice accomodations.

review.title: Great location, miniscule bathroom.
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in a very central spot in downtown San Francisco, convenient to almost anything you would want to do. The room was comfortable, nice, and spacious. The biggest negatives for the room were that the bathroom was very small. The sink area was in a space outside the bathtub/shower and toilet, which were in a separate room. The bathtub and toilet room was so small that the floor area where you could stand covered the area where the door swung open. Also, nowhere on any of the wall space were there any towel bars. You either had to put used towels on the sink counter or on the floor. Otherwise, it was a nice room for the price.
review.negativeRemarks: bathroom, no towel bars, wifi hard to connect to, street outside hotel can get very busy and congested.
review.locationRemarks: great! central to downtown, shopping, transportation, walkable to other areas of San Francisco.

review.title: Recommended
review.reviewText: Room was clean and very comfortable, service was superb but quality of food in the dining room was disappointing. Concierge and all other staff were very helpful, polite and professional - a pleasure. I would use again but would not dine in-house.
review.negativeRemarks: the restaurant
review.locationRemarks: ideal - central to everything

review.title: Easily a 4+
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, Great Location, really enjoyed the weekend....

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel has a friendly staff, is close to Union Square, and is very clean and comfortable.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: I cannot say enough about how great our stay at the Westin was. After a long and torturous flight to the city, the manager got us an upgrade to a suite, since there were three of us and we each needed a bed. Everyone was very pleasant and helpful and the place was in a great downtown location.

review.title: Cold Winter in SF
review.reviewText: The room, amenities and the staff of the hotel were outstanding. I was a bit shocked by the price versus the quality of the breakfast buffet. It certainly did not add up. I recommend to future guests to go across the street to Starbucks for a real coffee rather than pay $5.00 for a small cup of filter watered down coffee. While the weather in San Francisco was unusually cold, the hotel common areas were too cold and needed to be better heated.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant and Coldness of the Common Areas
review.locationRemarks: Great for the Moscone Center

review.title: OK, wouldn't recommend it
review.reviewText: The fact that there is no window makes the room smells a little and the no air. I had to set my ac to 60F for the night. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to others simply because the pricing of this hotel and the room don't worth it. I would like to choose another hotel that is closer to union square next time. The price is high and it is only higher for the view at night. Felt like location is more important after I spent a weekend there.

review.title: Nice hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a good location - close to BART to airport, rental cars, museums. Staff was friendly and the room was comfortable with a nice view. I would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was cold

review.title: Vary disappointed!!!!
