review.reviewText: I paid extra for a city view but all I got was a view of the street. The room we stayed in was right next to the elevators so I never got a good nights sleep.They charge for every little thing and it isn't cheap. $5.86 for a can of coke.

review.title: Excellent Experience
review.reviewText: Friendly staff who gave us a free room upgrade and the hotel was next to Union Square and the bus stop to Fisherman's whorf. Very clean and room condition was excellent.

review.title: While in SAN FRAN...stay at the WESTIN on Market!
review.reviewText:
I have stayed at the Westin a dozen times while in SAN FRAN. The location in Union Square is perfect. Close to everything! The only thing I would like to change is the gym. Fitness is a huge part of my life and I found that the gym was inadequate. The weight equipment was awful. I had to pay $15 to work out at the YMCA each day.
Other then that, I love the WESTIN and will go back again!
review.positiveRemarks: Extremely clean rooms as well as the entire hotel very clean
review.negativeRemarks: gym...very poor
review.locationRemarks: perfect location, close to everything!

review.title: Overnight Trip
review.reviewText: We stayed one night, our experience was pleasant. I would recommend staying at this hotel.

review.title: Overall, pleasant stay. Great location.
review.reviewText: I had a very pleasant stay with my husband during the holiday season. The hotel overall is very comfortable. We used the gym and it was good. Nevertheless, I though the bathroom a bit odd and the internet access sux. Very expensive (U$15 per day) and slow... The cable did not work, only wireless connection. And it was also linked to the computer and not the user. For example, my husband bought it in his computer and I couldn't use in my, I would have to buy as well. This was a putty, it should be per room... Anyway, the breakfast at the hotel was also expensive (U$ 25) and it wasn't superb. It was ok.
review.positiveRemarks: size of the room, concierge service, environment.
review.negativeRemarks: internet access.
review.locationRemarks: great location, 5 blocks down to Union Square. Bart and Muni right there, one block walking distance.

review.title: An excellent place to stay in San Francisco.
review.reviewText:
In general I can find little to fault this hotel. With the exception of some slow service in Ducca one morning for breakfast, all of the staff were excellent, many of whom recognised me from a previous visit. Courteous, friendly and beyond helpful, you couldn't ask for better. On presenting my SPG card when checking in, I was even given a room upgrade, many thanks Westin! I take a good look round when checking out to ensure I've got everything, and the room was spotless, even in corners, behind curtains, under the bed etc. The bathroom, if a little small, was also in excellent condition.

One thing to note: There is an electronic system that monitors the in room refreshments, and will add items to your account within seconds. You are cautioned to this, but the system seems a little too enthusiastic to register knocks to the tray as items being used. A word with the staff on the front desk had these charges voided, they know it can cause false alarms which is good, but curious children repeatedly lifting items could be a problem.

They lose a mark for the cost of in room internet access - just shy of $15 a day these days is a joke. The Westin isn't the only one charging this amount either but thankfully you can get access for free in the Starbucks across the street and in a few other places. I did use it a couple of days to use Skype and the performance was excellent.

I can't see me looking to stay anywhere else if I ever return to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The convenient location, excellent staff and complete no-smoking policy.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive in room internet charges. Even if it appears to be the norm for hotels.

review.title: Pre-Christmas Vacation
review.reviewText:
This was my mom and I's first time in Frisco and we were all about doing the tourist thing. The concierge was very helpful in helping us find a site seeing tour bus.

The breakfast buffet was yummy, but it doesn't change and it is limited so it's easy to get tired of it if you have a prolonged stay.

We had dinner at the hotel restaurant on our last night and we were really upset about our limited menu choice, but our meals ended up being very delicious.

review.title: Great hotel but the valet parking was a nightmare.
review.reviewText:
This is a nice hotel and a very good deal compared to the other hotels in the neighborhood. Everything is relatively new and in great condition. Service was generally good. We had a breakfast in the room which was nothing special but still nice.

The big problem with this hotel is the parking. They charge $50 a night. When I asked if I could self-park, I was told that there was no parking in the vicinity. That turned out to be a complete lie as the public parking is just behind the hotel building! In fact that is the exact same parking where the valet staff parks the guests' cars!
On the day of departure we called the valet from the room before coming down. 20 minutes later there was no sign of our car. After we inquired, the valet guy said that he was going to "double-check". He never got back to us. Eventually we had to complain to the valet manager before someone bother to go and get the car. Overall, it took 45 minutes from the time we called on the phone.

Don't bother with the valet parking, just make a left right after the hotel building and park your car yourself.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is a nightmare.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient, close to Union Sq, MOMA, Metreon, and other attractions.

review.title: Rude staff
review.reviewText: Everything was great except the staff. About 75% of the staff were just rude and/or seemed very uninterested in speaking with or helping guests. Everything else was great.

review.title: Undisclosed parking fee
review.reviewText: Everything was great until check out when we were charged $56 for parking. We were also not told about the public parking garage accross the street.

review.title: Definitely will stay here again.
review.reviewText:
Excellent location. Very convenient. Short distance to the BART, Cable Car, Union Square, Chinatown. Great restaurants nearby. Starbucks is just across the street, Coffee Bean not too far away and there is also a 7-Eleven just around the corner.

Valet parking is $54.75 per day which is pretty pricey but standard for similar hotels in SF. There is a parking structure right across the street with lower rates if you wish to park there instead.

The room and bathroom were both clean and the Heavenly Bed was heavenly comfortable as always.

Housekeeping did a nice job and they're always friendly when I saw them in the hallway. Front desk service was a bit slow. They only had one person working there when I checked in and checked out and when I checked out, the line was pretty long.

review.title: Loved our stay at the Westin!
review.reviewText: The room far exceeded our expectations for the price we had paid. It was clean, nicely furnished, had a great view and quiet. Good location; close to Metreon, shopping mall, stores, restaurants, museums, etc. We were very happy and will return again.
review.negativeRemarks: parking was a bit expensive, but seems to be at all hotels down town
review.locationRemarks: close to Metreon, large shopping mall, restaurants, bars, museums, etc.

review.title: Review
review.reviewText: Very good overall. Very central position, clean and comfortable rooms.
review.locationRemarks: In the center, very hard to park on the road. Expensive to leave the car at the hotel's garage.

review.title: Nice hotel-easy walking access to many places
review.reviewText: We checked in around midnight after a long flight and proceeded to the front desk to retrieve our keys. We were checked in quickly and took the elevator up to find a nice room with a comfortable bed. The carpet outside the door was a little threadbare and someone kept leaving the stair door open which let in a cold draft. I liked the fact that the elevators required a room key to work for security. Housekeeping has a great balance of cleaning the room but also being environmentally aware.

review.title: One of my best hotels yet
review.reviewText: Everyrhing was awesome. The food, staff, location and price are perfect.
review.locationRemarks: Awesome location

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff, very helpful. Great view of the city from our room and very convenient to walk to Union Square, cable cars, Yerba Buena Gardens and St. Patrick's Church.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: Great place, but a little slow in checking in and getting my luggage because of a huge rush. But overall i love the location, its close to everything, shops, offices, and great restaurants. The service was very good and very friendly. The room had a great view and was clean and comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel for my next stay.
review.locationRemarks: right on market and 3rd. so it's very close to shopping and good restaurants

review.title: Nice, but is it nice enough for this location?
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and quiet, and the staff was very friendly and efficent. Not very many amenities for a hotel of that size, though. There are many wonderful hotels near this one, and I don't know if this one stands out enough.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of health club facilities.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to many attractions in Union Square.

review.title: One of my best hotel experiences EVER!
review.reviewText: I could not ask for a better deal on a wonderful location, with a wonderful staff. From the moment I pulled up, the Valet, Eddy, was very helpful and attentive. Wendy at the desk did an exceptional job in getting me checked in, and the room was impeccable. The view from my room was mind blowing and inspiring. It was a wonderful and memorable experience! I cannot wait until I return, which I most certainly will.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the room, the location.
review.negativeRemarks: That they eventually expect you to check out.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect spot in relation to what I was in town for.

review.title: Not recommended
review.reviewText: quality of the staffs &n hotel service is not good. I will not return to this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff Service

review.title: Great little trip to SF!
review.reviewText:
I would stay here again - great location, comfy bed, great view (if you are in a deluxe city view room). There were 3 of us in the room and there was plenty of space for even a 4th person.

The hotel was great, but we were on the 22nd floor near the main elevator and next to the service elevator -- it was very loud (all night and early morning). We were there 4 nights and by the 4th night I was getting a little irritated. I know every hotel has an undesirable location/set of rooms - we just ended up with one of them! I should have said something on the 2nd day but I didn't so I can't comment on how the staff would have resolved this.

Again, can I mention the location? It is great! Use Muni and BART and you can see everything in just a few days!
review.negativeRemarks: Room by elevators
review.locationRemarks: Great location -- easy access to Union Square and all the stores/restaurants

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Rooms are nice and clean, amazing bed. The only issue is the parking cost $48 per day.

review.title: be conscious of the parking.
review.reviewText: The Condition, Confort , location and service was great, however it was a bit shocked when i was presented with the parking bill 54.75 per day.
review.negativeRemarks: concierge was very busy to help
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Perfect Value For Money
review.reviewText: central location, better than being in Union Square

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText: the room was spacious and the overall experience was really good. Ensure you keep your hands off the minibar

review.title: Good bargain for staying in the city
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly from the time I pulled up with my car to the time I left. The room was nice with a good view of the city. The price was a bargain for a good night.

review.title: Westin SF
review.reviewText: thin walls - could hear neighbors use the bathroom!
review.negativeRemarks: poor sound proofing

review.title: Perfect location, wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: I totally recommend the Westin San Francisco Market Street. Union Square and all major attractions are within a walking distance. Bart and Muni stations are 2 blocks away. The hotel is clean, comfortable beds.

review.title: Super
review.reviewText: It is very good in term of the price and location and I really recommend it.

review.title: Very central location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, but not quite as nice as other Westin properties. Parking is obscenely expensive. I parked across the street in the Hearst Garage for half the price.

review.title: not good
review.reviewText: I can't use wifi in my room and lobby for free. it costs 14 dollar.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Rooms were very nice and the views are outstanding of the city. The restaurant and bar was comfortable and had great service. The staff was extremey professional. I would stay here again.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: we didnt find the hotel as we expected . the rooms smells bad and the bed sheets didnt look clean , the television screen was very bad it was hazy but the lady in the reception was very friendly.

review.title: Home Away from Home
review.reviewText:
My Wife and I stay at the Westin on every trip to San Francisco. We love the location which is close to shopping, Movies and nice restaurants. Just around the corner you can take the trolley to Fisherman's Wharf for a nice stroll.

We usually just leave our car in the private parking lot in the rear for the whole visit. And don't miss Buca Di Beppo's two blocks away. Its an Italian chain, but very few around, so enjoy. Just don't plan on bringing leftovers back to the room - no fridge.

review.title: good for dog lovers
review.reviewText: The Hotel is in a great location...the rooms nice but small..Westin has great beds...and they have a great pet policy..NO PROBLEMS having dogs under 40 pounds...We had a great stay..

review.title: Won't book this hotel anymore....
review.reviewText:
Level of service did not meet expectation at all.
Waste customer's time in many aspects.
Business center only has one computer functioning, wait for long time to get access.
Will never come back unless major improvements are made.

review.title: Loved the location
review.reviewText: Loved the location. Only problem was that the walls are very thin. I could hear the couple next door to me... even though our beds were on the opposide side of the room. I could hear them having intercourse!! I travelled with my two teenage daughters and I'm just thankful they are heavy sleepers!! And luckily it was only for Saturday night, so at least I got 1 night of good sleep. Other than that we really enjoyed our stay. It is in a very good location.
review.locationRemarks: We just loved the Westfield mall down the street!! We visited Chinatown and Fisherman's wharf.

review.title: Like
review.reviewText: Very nice and very well located, very comfortable room
review.locationRemarks: Muir woods & Alcatraz

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Met all the expectations of a Westin. No surprises await you here. The location is FANTASTIC! Just off Market Street, the hotel straddles the financial core and the prime shopping area around Union Square. I would recommend the hotel on location alone. It's nicely tucked away from the bustle and noise of the city. Trust me, you don't wanna be directly on Union Square. The hotel restaurant service was to be desired though. But, given that it was Thanksgiving, i'll give them a pass. Only issue is that WiFi is not complimentary in-room; when are hotels gonna get with it. You shouldn't have to pay 15 bucks a day for in-room internet - especially if it's a giant worldwide brand such as Starwood.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Two Nights

review.title: better hotels around
review.reviewText: way to expensive for what you get

review.title: Gr8 experience
review.reviewText: Had a nice time

review.title: ADORABLE
review.reviewText:
i loved my stayed, everything is so close(all the good stores for instance) and good connection with metros also.
The only bad thing is that you have to pay 15 dollars per day for internet and valet parking at outrageous prices.
Else, a perfect stay.
review.locationRemarks: THE CASTRO.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a very convenient located hotel. The Finance District, shopping, dining and museums are just a few walking minutes away. The BART/Muni underground station station is just around the corner. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. And your room very clean and comfortable. We truly enjoyed our stay at the Westin SF Market Street and had the greatest time in San Francisco.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: Enjoyed it.

review.title: A nice stay.
review.reviewText: The bed was very comfortable. We had a corner room on the 9th floor. We had no view but we didn't spend much time in our room for it really to matter. We were provided free wi-fi during our stay. Each time we had an issue with something (needing additional towels, a light bulb changed, the safe reset) assistance arrived quickly. As we were on a low floor street noise was an issue but setting the heating fan on high blocked out the noise. The bathroom (shower/toilet) area is really small. The floor to ceiling windows on two sides of the room was really nice (even with no real view).

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: This hotel was the best we have stayed in. Clean, great food and excellent location

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
Stayed over thanksgivig, hotel is very nice and well maintained. Loads of stores in yhe local area for shopping. People were talking about fishermans wharf but I think we made the right decision to stay here rather than in that area. It's a $10
Taxi ride or 20mins walk.

Cons - maid knocking at 8am. Beer from mini bar cost $9+ after fees etc.

review.title: Can't believe it's a 4 star hotel
review.reviewText: This is hotel is not good. Although I stayed at 23th floor, I can still hear the noise. The service is also not like a 4 star hotel.

review.title: Great value, great view
review.reviewText: This was our first time at the Westin. We go to San Francisco several times a year. The Westin more than exceeded our expectations.

review.title: Westin hotel at market street
review.reviewText: The receptionist offered us a room with double queen size beds and a nice city view even though we arrived very early in the morning. She gave us a call while we had breakfast nearby. The concierge was very knowledgeable about sightseeing places, restaurants, things to do with kids. In the afternoon, the hotel has fruits and apple cider for guests. The only thing we wish we had was free internet access but you can get it from restaurants nearby. This hotel is also walking distance to many local attractions, kids playground, movies, great restaurants, subway, cable car, and buses. We didn't need a car. We enjoy our stay!

review.title: Happy Customer
review.reviewText: The only blemish on an otherwise perfect experience were the towels.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: great hotel! seriously. straight boss. in the center of downtwn, short cab rides to all districts and its really really nice...

review.title: Good location and Service
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located and close to the main CBD life and a walking distance to several locations of interest. The reception staff is friendly, the concierge staff depending on whom you get, the clerks can be more attentive, but this is me giving the hotel an opportunity to improve, if they are interested. Otherwise, I am satisfied with the hotel, the receptionist originally from the Philippines was very cordial, helpful and always put a smile on my face (THANK YOU). I would recommend the hotel and would come back to it.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco is a great city, the bay area, the City and surroundings are enjoyable.

review.title: Left my heart in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Great hotel, located close to many of San Francisco's attractions. It was a few block away from the Tenderloins. If I did not go in that direction I would have never know it was there. I did walk several blocks through the area. If you have ever walked through some parts of Brooklyn or The Bronx, it's very similar (not bad at all). The hotel loby had a stand with hot tea, water and fruit for the guests. It was very pleasant after walking the mountainous terrain in San Fran. The Concierge was amazing. They knew all the great restaurants and bars to go to. Not the typical touristy place, but the true authentic San Fran.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Market St, and Fishermans Warf... Must see.

review.title: San Francisco Westin
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel for sure. Great accomodations and they even had little extras here and there in the room that was great. The restaurant's food was great but the cleanliness was a bit rough. I had to have the waiter come over and sweep underneath our table because it was pretty filthy. They took care of it right away however.

My only hiccup was the concierge service. Not very helpful or too enthusiastic about sening you to the best places.

Would stay again for sure

review.title: would go back,great location
review.reviewText: Did not like the fact that the hotel charges extra for internet access.

review.title: Walk and Shop!
review.reviewText: We visited San Francisco twice in a three month period. The 2nd time we stayed at the Westin on Market Street. This location was prime! We were within walking distance of Union Square (downtown) and never walked too far to catch a bus or trolley. The hotel was what we expected for a Westin; clean rooms and excellent hotel service. We had the queen double bed room and it was very cozy even though it wasn't a suite. If I had a complaint, it would be that after the first night there, we fell short on full bath towels (we were a party of four). But that's trivial, really. Check-out was a breeze. If you are looking for nice accommodations, we recommend this hotel and location. We will definitely keep this Westin in mind for future visits.
review.locationRemarks: Visit Union Square (trolley turn-a-around), Ghiradelli Chocolate Factory/Shop, The pier, and the Alcatraz night tour. If you purchase a City Sightseeing all loops tour (red double decker buses) and you take the downtown tour, there's a stop right in front of the Westin. Very, very, very cool for those days when it's raining and you just want to get back to the hotel and change! The Golden Gate Bridge is beautiful! Pacific Heights has a nice area for shopping, too.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with the service at the hotel and the location.

review.title: good location and comfortable
review.reviewText: Quiet and comfortable, within walking distance to everywhere!!

review.title: Very impressed hotel!
review.reviewText:
- Hotel's overall service is very above standard.
- Location is very central and easy to find.
- Hotel is very child friendly. (they gave me complimentary cookies and milk for my 3-year-old daughter)

-The only dislike is the bed was tooooooo soft that I felt no support. And the pillow was too sag as well.
review.locationRemarks: The fisherman's wharf; lots to see and many gift shop for visitors as well as many restaurants. The bay cruise is definitely a must-go, it sails under the Golden Gate Bridge and the notorious Alcartraz jail.

review.title: I will definitely stay there again
review.reviewText: I loved the view and big fluffy bed

review.title: Satisfied
review.reviewText: The only issue at this hotel is Parking a very high price if you have a car. (55dollars a day) Besides that the hotel is nice. The staff is very helpful when needed.

review.title: Union Square Best Hotel
review.reviewText: My stay at the Westin SF Market Street was a wonderful experience. The hotel staff was so friendly and kind it made us really enjoy our stay. The room and the hotel itself was very clean. This is located in a GREAT and SAFE area of the city all within walking distance of many restaurants and attractions such as the Financial District, Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, and North Beach. The views from the room are beautiful of the city and the bay. Again, the hotel and staff was a WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE I highly recommend this hotel. Management at this hotel is doing a wonderful job.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Financial District, Fisherman's Wharf, Alamo Square, Golden Gate. The best way to get a tour of the city is to purchase a ticket from "hop on hop off San Francisco open top tours". Its a $35.00 ticket good for 24hrs and will take you to 21 attractions across the city (Pier 39, Chinatown, Little Italy, Alamo Square (full house), Golden Gate Bridge etc. You can get off at any stop and busses run every 20min from every attraction. You can purchase a ticket in Union Square across the street from Macys in the park (its a stop and they will have employees in yellow/green jackets selling tickets).

review.title: San Francisco comfort
review.reviewText: extremely comfortable bed and the room was spacious.
review.locationRemarks:
SoMa
Union Square
Embarcadero

review.title: "Excellent hotel"
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel

review.title: Consistently a quality experience
review.reviewText: Good people, great facilities and convenient location

review.title: Good hotel downtown SF
review.reviewText:
Price was affordable when bought as a package through Expedia. Everything else was fine, one of the better hotels in SF (several others cost more and are older, rusty, etc).

I just wish internet was included with room price... $15 a night. Had it been free/included I would have given the hotel 4 stars.

review.title: need to be less stuck up and more laid back
review.reviewText: I had some great customer service with about 2 of the employees but the rest were not helpful and extremely rude to me. They made me feel like i didn't belong.

review.title: Felt a bit over priced
review.reviewText:
Nice enough hotel but for the money thought it should include wi-fi at least in public areas.
Breakfast was extortionate.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

review.title: SF
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Front desk not so welcome, but in general hotel is ok.

review.title: SO ready to go back!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was like the cherry on top for the whole trip. I was very impressed.

review.title: it was AWESOME!
review.reviewText: It was great, everything was clean, great location and very confy! . only thing I dint care for the tv been on the side of the bed insted of front but it was a big screen so o well !!!!.. great hotel!

review.title: Great location for the Moscone Center
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean, bar was nice, convenient location to Moscone Center. Only ran into an issue once at the start of my stay. My umbrella went "missing" and after asking the front desk about it, it showed up later in my room after the crew came through and made up the bed. I suspect they accidentally put it on a cart or something when they were turning the room and forgot about it. It all worked out in the end. I think it was an honest mistake.

review.title: Very good Hotel, very nice location
review.reviewText:
This is a very good hotel, great location. (Close to Union Square, Moscone center...). The room are large, and the bed very comfortable.

The only downside is that the internet access was not included in my reservation and can be quite expensive ... specially when some coffe shop nearby offer the connection for free...

review.title: Not in a great location
review.reviewText: Weekends are pretty dismal in this area

review.title: Eight Great Nights
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Westin for a week. Upon check-in on Saturday night, the man at the desk (Jacob) noticed that I was there for an extended stay and made a point of finding me a room away from the elevators. He also suggested a good place for Sunday brunch. Requests for extra hangers and other amenities were quickly answered. The room was comfortable; quiet and effective air conditioning; good view. I would have liked the internet access to have been complimentary, but the cost was moderate. The hotel restaurant /bar (Ducca) was acceptable. Good neighborhood and close to useful public transportation (MUNI and BART). Overall a great base-of-operations for my extended visit.

review.title: Was not impress by the staff!!!
review.reviewText: I booked this trip to celebrate my husband's 40th birthday. When we arrived at 830a we were told we couldn't check in until 300p. The staff that morning were all extremely rude and were very snotty with us. I actually felt like they were looking down at us! When we came back, we were handed our room cards in silence by Jacob. The first room was very unpleasant and reeked of body odor and the the floor to ceiling windows looked out to air conditioning units, plus they didn't provide a complimentary birthday gift like I requested. I went back to the lobby and stood there while no one offered any assistance instead the staff that available only asked the business type people if they needed anything even though I been waiting in line. Finally someone came out from the back office and asked if I needed some help I told him how unpleasant the room we were in was and he immediately looked to see if another room was available. He put us in a room on the top floor and was the only person that was very pleasant and helpful I wished I had gotten his name. What turned out in the beginning as horrible wind up being quite a pleasant vacation. At the end of our trip I went to the concierge desk to print out my boarding passes for the flight home and was having trouble no one helped me with the system. The lady told well go upstairs and use the business office. Well thank goodness I did they were very very helpful and helped me print out my passes.

review.title: Tired hotel
review.reviewText: If you need somewhere to lay your head give it a go. If you're looking for a bit more then give it a miss. This worked in 1990 but in 2011 the world has moved on and I'm afraid it's just a bit tired.

review.title: Very Comfortable and Convenient
review.reviewText: Location was great. Close to shops and 15 minute walk to AT&T Park one way and Chinatown the other way. Felt really safe. Public transportation around the corner. Room was really clean and beds very comfortable. It was quite easy to fall asleep simply by laying down on it. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Location,location,location
review.reviewText:
Place is right in the middle of everything San Francisco.
Public transport,restaurants,shopping and culture.
Check-in clerks were fab in spite of a huge crowd checking in at the time.
I took heed of other reviews and requested a room higher up.Got a fridge upon request which was seperate from the one stocked with booze.Nice touch.
T.V. had quality audio.
Recommendation that if one needs to print anything like boarding passes that one go outside the hotel as it seemed abit pricey to me.
Definitely would stay there again if I'm in the area.

review.title: Great for Business Travel
review.reviewText: I was worried because a collegue recommended that we stay in Union Square and this hotel didn't fit that criteria exactly. However, I thought it was a great location. The hotel staff was very helpful and the location was very close to shopping, food, coffee, etc. They also always had cabs when I needed one, which was great.

review.title: Perfect San Fran stay!
review.reviewText: Great hotel and great location. We wanted a place a little outside the hustle and bustle of the city, but still central and this was great.

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: Good stay, had to upgrade room as front desk at checkin advised our room would be next to the elevators.Bathroom rather small but adequate otherwise. Great views from our room on 32nd floor. Central location.

review.title: Next to elevators :(
review.reviewText:
I've stayed pretty close to elevators in a hotel before but never in a room where I heard and felt the elevator cars go up and down. It must have been the expedia rate room...make sure you don't get a room by the elevators. I mean it calmed down btw 11 PM - 7 AM and it didn't feel like a freight train coming through however if you're a light sleeper, you will not be happy.

Other than that the hotel was lovely. Don't pay $5 for coffee or a coke at breakfast, I waited to get my caffeine later, out of principal. :)

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great and the hotel staff were very polite and helpful. Location was great. I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great place to stay--avoid the restaurant
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was great. Great location. We could walk to Union Square area with ease. Returned from an all day excursion and used the hotel restaurant. Menu was short and service was lousy. Food was not impressive either. Eat elsewhere. The rest of the hotel staff was very accomodating.

review.title: Central, Comfortable, Friendly
review.reviewText: Overall, a great stay. Location is close to everything (Market Street & transport), Union Square etc. Rooms were very clean & comfortable. Staff very friendly and helpful. You could also avoid the hotel bar - you'll find much better drink prices elsewhere.

review.title: PA Traveler
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is very convenient to a lot of attractions in the city. The room was very clean and comfortable. Most of the staff, with the exception of the girls at the front desk, were very unhelpful and didn't seem to care that we were there or were bothered by any questions. At 11:02am the bartender told us that they were no longer serving any coffee because breakfast was over and we would have to wait until lunch started at 11:30 to be able to order any. This while they still hadn't put away any of the coffee items (creamers, sugar etc) from the morning. While it is a great location I wouldn't stay here again...there are many other hotels to stay at.

review.title: Better Than Some, Worse Than Others
review.reviewText:
Convenient Location close to major attractions such as Union Square, Chinatown, North Beach, and Port Terminal; and, taxi stand outside hotel a plus.

Hotel Rooms are a bit smaller than other comparable hotels, with low ceilings. Ridiculous policy regarding mini-bar and impulse goods offered in room (i.e., if item is moved from pressure plate, even if by accident, you get charged within ten seconds).

Cleaning Staff was friendly and cooperative. Front Desk staff accomodating and helpful.

Internet service sub-par and needs improvement. Hotel also doesn't provide free internet access in lobby to print boarding passes and check in at airlines.

review.title: Westin on Market St., SF
review.reviewText: Very comfy, Heavenly bed. Bathroom extremely disappointing with a bath just about half the size of a regular bath. Bathroom itself was so small you couldn't close the door while 'using' it. The location is a few blocks from Union...and has a few 'undesirables' in close proximity. I would probably stay at the Westin St. Francis next time.... But the staff were really, really nice! Kudos to their customer service all around....:)

review.title: Disappointed with this Westin
review.reviewText:
We have always enjoyed our stays at Westin's. We found the location, the facilities and the employees very at this Westin to be very good. Our disappointment was the mold in our bathtub and the filth on the window curtains. To their credit, when we pointed these things out, the housekeeping manager rectified the situation.

We have stayed more than a half dozen times at the Palace Hotel one block away. We think it is a better alternative for the price.

review.title: Westin San Francisco
review.reviewText: Fantastic place to stay in downtown San Francisco! I recommend it highly.

review.title: Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Great location, beautiful hotel, exceptional staff. Easy access to so much.

review.title: Out of the hustle and bustle of Union Square
review.reviewText: Just a few of blocks to all the action but also just a short walk to ATT&T Ballpark to see the Giants play. A short walk to Pier 39 and if you are a "walker" to Fisherman's Warf as well. Had a great time!! All Expedia arrangements went very well.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Indifferent staff, bordering on rude. Not Westin quality!

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: I go to SF every month for business and I will come here every time from now on!

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was fantastic. I would like to suggest one improvement, though! They should provide free access to the internet!

review.title: Beautiful Hotel!!!
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel was exquisite! While the financial district became somewhat desolate after working hours, North Beach restaurants/nightlife were within walking distance, as was a BART stop. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: The concierge was the most helpful!!!

review.title: Great location, Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Had a great time at really nice hotel. No issues at all.

review.title: A good pick
review.reviewText: A lovely hotel very convenient to the Art Center and museums. Personnel were very helpful and friendly. Room was small but very comfortable. Decor in Bar was a bit dated, too frilly for my taste. All in all a good choice.

review.title: Very nice and friendly service
review.reviewText: Fantastic, would definitely recommend. Staff were helpful, gave us a room with two beds instead of one, with a beautiful view. Room felt luxurious, and the the hotel was well located. Near the BART station, as well as some good restaurants and a yummy cream puff store! Good enough for me.

review.title: West in SF
review.reviewText: Great location, friendly staff. Bathrooms are a bit outdated. definitely would recommend for the price.

review.title: Great Hotel, but splurge on an upgrade
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay in San Fran. This hotel has a great location, especially if you intend to use public transportation--I DO NOT RECOMMEND A CAR UNLESS YOU INTEND TO GO OUTSIDE OF THE CITY--$$$$ TO PARK. The staff was friendly and courteous. I would go back again. The deluxe room that comes with the package was small with no view, so we upgraded two levels for add'l $ a night--we got a great view of the bay and both bridges, and a lot more space (500 sq ft vs 290). Ask them for a mini fridge and an extra robe (only one was provided and the mini fridge is free).

review.title: Great hotel and quiet, two blocks from Union Square and great restaurant across the street CPK
review.reviewText: Enjoyed this hotel. It was quiet. We were on the 20th floor. My only complaint would be that the doors to the rooms are heavy and make a loud noise when you shut them. Bed was extremely comfortable. Would have been nice if wifi was included. Loved the restaurant across the street called California Pizza Kitchen.

review.title: San fran
review.reviewText: Great location.

review.title: Mario
review.reviewText: Excellent . Great hotel, great service. Will be back soon .

review.title: fine, but services not that great
review.reviewText: Hotel was as expected. rooms are clean and well maintained. we were not impressed with the quality of service in the restaurant/bar. I am not sure if the staff was new or if they had "lost the will to really care". Slow, expensive and underwhelming quality would summarize it.

review.title: Pass
review.reviewText: The service was hit and miss., and arbitrarily selective. For example, I asked a bellman for directions and he brusquely and rudely told me to, "ask the concierge." Yet the day before he was very helpful (could it have been due to my $20 tip?) I tip generously in order to obtain prompt service - my mistake at the Westin. Another frustration was the $14.95/day charge for internet service. What? Just seems to be a nickel and dime approach. Why not just include it in the room rate for heaven's sake? I am happy to pay up front. Not to mention that each time I subscribed to the service I had to call the provider to manually connect since the internet sign-up billed my room but failed to allow access. Finally, the room was only vacuumed twice during a five day stay. Come on.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: San Fransicso's Best Hotel

review.title: Consistent SPG/Westin Product
review.reviewText:
We recently stayed for two nights at this hotel and once again appreciated the Westin/SPG product - great service, nicely appointed & comfortable room/beds, great cardio equipment and some weights for a reasonable workout in the gym, fantastic location close to Union Square and SoMa neighbourhoods, great shopping nearby and easy to get to from the airport.

Drawbacks: room right beside the elevators is too loud, might be OK for some; our room keys were VERY sensitive and needed to be changed five times in two days - a bit of a hassle to say the least. Fortunately we were on vacation and weren't in a hurry at any time.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: People were very nice - no issues

review.title: The staff made my vacation excellent
review.reviewText:
The Staff (From the Concierge, Valet, and the check-in/out) are very helpful and concern about your needs' and questions about the area (specially the where and how to get to the place you're planning to visit).

On my last night the Business Center computer/printer were down and I cannot print my Flight Boarding pass, the Check-in/out counter staff that night was able to print them (Thank you all). Note: the hotel provide "Free" the printing of the Flight boarding pass.

We would definitely use the hotel again on our next vacation.

review.title: Stay and dine in style in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Westin Market Street is a great citybreak hotel away from the hustle of Fisherman's Wharf. It is 2 blocks from the terminus of the cable car and is great for shopping (Westfield Mall). The rooms are well maintained and the dining room, although pricey, has a nice atmosphere withe usual great American service. The bellhop can always get a cab or you can use the streetcars on Market Street to get around. There is a small fitness room if you have the energy!

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The bed was uncomfortable I had to sleep in the chair. However my mother thought the bed was ok. The comforter had blood stain on it. The mirror still had a drawing from the last guess when the bathroom steamed up. The room could be much cleaner.

review.title: family friendly luxury
review.reviewText: I was extremely happy with the hotel and its service. I searched for a hotel for a long time searching for certain ammenities and i found it with this one. A very welcoming staff and very helpful. With two itty bitty children i was extremely worried about their comfort. But with a kids backpack for each and all the extras i might need. The only concern is the traffic and entrance to the hotel but thats a city problem not a hotel. When we go back i willnever stay anywhere else.

review.title: Well maintained, very comfortable hotel.
review.reviewText: Loved the end room with views in multiple directions, size of the room, the convenience to downtown attractions, and the afternoon happy hour.

review.title: Great location - all the amenities!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, great service and close to restaurants and shopping!!

review.title: Near other hotels with similar rates and more comfortable...nO RECOMEND THIS HOTEL
review.reviewText: tHE BATHROOM WAS EXCESIVELY SMALL...NOT COMFORTABLE...

review.title: Great Beds - Expensive parking
review.reviewText: Overpriced parking - $73 overnight for valet. I parked it myself for $25. The beds are very comfortable. The rest of the room was pretty ordinary. Our room was only on the 10th floor so our view was of a brick wall. If you want a view, get a room higher up.

review.title: Very Impressive Hotel in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: The Westin Hotel on Market St. was within walking distance to everything. Dining was never a question with CPK and Subway across the street. The service at the hotel was excellent, and we probably would not know where to go or how to get there without the help of the concierge. This was our second stay at The Westin. Within 10 minutes of walking, we were at the doors of the magnifent mall, the cable car station, and China Town. The staff at the hotel was prepared to help at any given time, and the hotel view was definately unforgettable. We cannot wait to go back again!!

review.title: Nice location won't be disappointed!
review.reviewText: Have been in San Francisco a few times this hotel in is in great area to get around. Hotel is clean the only thing if you want free wi-fi this hotel doesn't have it. Staff were helpful and friendly. Would stay there again .

review.title: San Francisco trip
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel with great staff and service. The concierge staff were all very helpful with suggestions and advice. Room service was prompt and food great. Heavenly beds live up to their name. Location was central to most attractions with many great restaurants nearby. We had a great time and would happily stay there again.

review.title: good
review.reviewText: good

review.title: should have been grander
review.reviewText: staff was nice, not friendly, 3 of us,1 robe,had to ask for shampoo,phone book.,not as many towels the next day. BUT we loved the out door area,and the bellmen were great. oh yea and no free WIFI....great location,but far to expense for what one would expect..

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Very disappointed we were charged $55 a day to park our car at hotel, total price gauging! The hotel advertises a fire pit to sit at and enjoy a cocktail so my husband and I did but within 15 minutes, a drunk homeless man came up and started harrassing us for money so we had to go back inside. If it is advertised by the hotel I feel it should have had a gate around it for protection or a security guard to keep all the homeless away. Very disappointed with whole experience! We have gotten treated better at holiday inns before.

review.title: Loved the location!
review.reviewText: We just returned from our trip to San Francisco. We had such a wonderful time. The best thing was the location, it couldn't be better. Everything was close to our hotel. The only thing that I didn't like was that I needed to print a coupon to go to a restaurant and they charged me $5+ to open my email and print the groupon. It should've been complementary, especially if you spend only one minute on the Internet and print one page. Besides this, everything was what we expected. Nice hotel and nice staff!

review.title: Westin SanFran Market St
review.reviewText: Has the ambience of a very commercial motel. Sofa chair in room was badly stained. Needs upgrading badly. Will NOT recommend for stay. Even the name is deceptive. It is NOT on Market st, ratherclose to it.

review.title: Good Location and Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location in Union Square - near lots of shopping and restaurants. Able to check in early - efficient process. Very clean and comfortable/large room.

review.title: Perfect location!!
review.reviewText: One wierd thing where someone had opened something in the minibar before we ever entered the room, but the Hotel Front Desk was very quick to remove it from our charges.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText:
Great location SoMa. Close to everything; restaurants, shopping, museums.
Cable car steps from the door to Ferry Building or Fisherman's Wharf or the Castro. Very convenient, staff helpful and hotel clean and well kept.

review.title: Nice hotel; Good location; Rooms coulda been better
review.reviewText:
It's a good hotel, and the location is great, just steps away from Market Street and near the Moma and the Jewish museum. The restaurant, Ducca, has a very cool patio, and a handy happy hour.

We had a small bit of trouble with our rooms, though. The first one they put us in was oddly shaped, and so, felt a bit cramped. The easy chair in it was a bit dingier and more stained than I would have expected from a Westin. And there was an alarm blaring on the street outside that was there in the morning, and still going when we returned that evening. I told management, and expected they might investigate and make sure whoever owned the building that had the alarm was alerted so it might be shut off, but they said they weren't able to do that, and offered to move us to another room instead.

We did, and it was a much nicer room, with an awesome view, but we found out the next morning it was next to the service elevators, and the utility room where the housekeepers put their carts and things together, and it was quite noisy against our wall. Also, ours was a room designed for adjoining to another room and we could hear the neighbour clinking his ice bucket. Also, they didn't seem to know that ice buckets require plastic baggies (even after I requested one, they said they didn't stock them).

So, some drawbacks. But generally, a good experience.

review.title: Close to main venues: Giants Stadium, Performing Center, Museums, Wharf.
review.reviewText:
I was pleased with the convenience and access to the various venues I intended to visit this time. I walked to Giants stadium, walked to the Davies Symphony Hall, took the bus to Fisherman's Wharf. Very good access to and from the freeways.

I could have used more regular coffe in the room without having to ask.

When I asked for advice from the person at the lobby, I got the impression that they were in a rush, and pretty much had to "extract" the information from them. They provided basic answer to the question posed and then they were eager to move to the next person in line. It was a good thing that I am a little familiar with the City, pretty much gave me a map and let me figure it out. They were helpful though.

Wait was a little more than what I expected for the valet parking; especially when people that came after me got their car first.

review.title: Best place to stay in SanFrancisco!
review.reviewText:
This hotel is incredible. Located right off Market you are within walking distance to all the good shopping and China Town. We even walked to the Warf from here with our kids. It was amazing.

Also, if you have a dog that weighs 40 pounds or less, they are an amazing pet friendly hotel!

review.title: Location is perfect, great patio in back, room was exceptional for the price!
review.reviewText: Great location, we didn't know anything about SF, close to Muni, great eating and easy to get everywhere.

review.title: Really good place when you visit San Francisco.
review.reviewText: The hotel was really nice. Service at the front desk was really good. The view was really nice. Location is just perfect, since you can walk to Union Square, China Town and take the cable cars and other MUNI very easily. The only downside was no pool... I didn't check prior to making my reservation, but I though all 4 stars Hotel in major cities had them.

review.title: nice and functional
review.reviewText: Rooms were clean and new and stylish. Staff was stretched a bit thin. Look out for $5/ day parking.

review.title: One of my favorites!
review.reviewText: I have traveled all over the world and stayed in many hotels, so I have to say that the Westin is one of my favorites. First of all the location was perfect for me. We walked to the Giants game, from China Town and all the way back from Pier 39. Granted, it was a long walk but what a wonderful way to see the city and sights. There are bus lines close to the hotel so you can just hop on and ride to your destination. The hotel was very clean and I loved the body pillow they had on the bed. I need to get one of those. The concierge was very helpful getting me directions to different places to eat and the desk clerk who checked us in was very polite. I loved the floor to ceiling windows in our room and the outside patio was beautiful! The resturant (Ducca) at the hotel was a bit pricey so we ate at other places. I loved the fitness room which had a lot of machines to workout on and everything in working condition. I will definitely go back to the Westin and recommend it to all my friends. Next time, I'm going to the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art which is one block from the hotel. There's a great exhibit there until September with paintings by Matisse, Picasso, and Cezanne just to mention a few.

review.title: No free Wi-Fi
review.reviewText:
Really clean, nice sheets, pillows and towels without that chlorine smell. Hate the fact that it has not Wi-Fi anywhere!
Typical boring downtown hotel.
Very close to all public transportation.

review.title: Not too bad...
review.reviewText:
The room was kind of small but that was OK. The problem was the bathroom. You had to almost climb into the tub to close the door to use the toilet. It was VERY small in there. Also, the fan in the bathroom and the fan for the AC were very noisy. And, for a four star hotel, it seemed like they chose the cheapest toilet paper available. I also didn't like they placement of the TV to the bed. It made it hard to watch. We like to watch a little TV before bed so it wasn't too bad. It wasn't like we were watching 4-5 hours of TV a day.

It is in a pretty good location though. You can go right out the front door and catch the #30 bus that will take you very close to Fisherman's Wharf. That is quicker than going to take the cable cars. We took the cable cars the first day to try them out but if you want to go quicker, take the bus.

review.title: Good location, decent value
review.reviewText:
Not outstanding, but a decent choice due to its convenient location - especially if you can book at a good price.
You probably won't be wowed, but neither are you likely to be disappointed with this hotel selection.

review.title: Check the air
review.reviewText:
Our visit to San Francisco and the Westin Hotel was fantastic. The only
down side was the air conditioning system in the room. It was not working
properly and took until the next day to be resolved and fixed. The temperature
gauges in the room did not adequately reflect the actual temperature or the desired temperature. Next time, check to see if air is working properly before
assuming this funciton, then leave the room to sightsee.

review.title: wish we stayed there longer.
review.reviewText:
Westin on Market Street is a very nice hotel. They let us check in 4 hours early which was great. They were all super friendly. The room was small, but still large enough for 2 adults with lots of luggage. Very clean. and very comfortable.
location is ideal. Very safe and walking distance to a lot of attractions.
$9-10 cab ride to Alcatraz. (cheaper than the cable car)
we left SF and went to monterey for a few days and when we came back we stayed at Fishermans Wharf in a more $$ hotel and we regret not returning to the Westin.
the restaurant in the hotel (Ducca) was deliicious.

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: Our room did not come with a Do Not Disturb sign, we had a late checkout and the maids knocked on the door every hour beginning at 7am. Also, the walls are VERY thin, we could hear conversations in the next room as well as the maids loudly vacuuming and cleaning the adjoining rooms. It sounded like a circus was going on next door.

review.title: I never coming back
review.reviewText:
He surcharge my bill

Music too loud

No power the morning before we left

review.title: WELL WORTH IT
review.reviewText: NICE, COMFORTABLE, AND STYLISH

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: hotel staff went above and beyond!

review.title: Very nice hotel close to everything.
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel in a great location 2 blocks from Union Station and all the great shopping areas in that area. The staff was for the most part very helpful (concierge was indifferent). My only gripe was that in room internet was $14.95 per day!

review.title: Union Square good stay
review.reviewText:
One night parking is expensive
Bathroom small compared to the size of the room
For the rest a top of category hotel

review.title: Great location and great service
review.reviewText: Enjoyed staying at the Westin on Market street. Rooms were clean, nice view and very convenient to most locations.

review.title: excellent stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Especially receptionist services were excellent! Example to other hotels. Wish it was always so.

review.title: Very nice hotel, awesome bed - but no pool
review.reviewText: This hotel has a great location and very nice room, nice beds, flat screen TV, very clean. There is a good bar downstairs. I wish there would be a pool and a hot tub.

review.title: Clean and Comfortable
review.reviewText: Just spent a weekend at the Union Square Westin. Seems suited to a clean comfortable stay. Smaller rooms and especially tight bathroom. Not a luxury standard but service was excellent, lobby and rooms were clean.

review.title: Overated
review.reviewText: Deluxe King room was slightly larger then a jail cell. 24 hour rate to park is high. Bring lots of money to the bar, you will need it. Staff was good, but for the price they can't afford to be anything else.

review.title: The Beds Are "Heavenly"
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel is wonderful, expecially the beds. The most comfortable ones in the world.

review.title: Excellent hotel in central location
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel in central location

review.title: Happy Kids Make a Happy Vacation
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a prime location. The staff was so friendly and polite, even to our two "tween" sons! The boys had a blast and loved the view from our hotel room. They really felt like they were living it up at the Westin! We will definitely stay at the Westin when we return.

review.title: good to go
review.reviewText: pleasant and easy

review.title: Anniversary Trip
review.reviewText: My partner and I chose this hotel to stay for our 1 year anniversay trip to San Francisco. We are both pleased with the service we received from the staff. Everyone was curtious and very informative/attentive to any questions or concerns that we had. The valet could be a bit more courteous but overall we had a great stay here.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText:
This hotel is everything you expect from Westin. From the doorman to the concierge... Ameneties, decor and more importantly the staff were all above my expectation.
Location is incredibly convenient... Right off 3rd street and Market street, a short walk to Powell & the Westfield Shopping center. Starbucks, CVS, Liquor store and 24 hour Subway accross the street. The neighborhood is safe to walk at anytime of the day or night. F line train/Muni bus stop is right off 3rd & Market.
The room is extremely comfortable, clean, and the fridge was stocked perfectly. The hotel offers a business center on the 2nd floor and allows free access to check-in and print Airline Boarding passes... Great!!!
I definitely will make this my First Choice in Hotel Accomodation for all future San Fran trips =)

review.title: nice hotel but they charge for everything step you do at the hotel
review.reviewText: the hotel is nice and well located. the problem is considering the price I payed they charge for internet, brekfast is not included an what really surprise me was they charge for the service to receive package bought thru amazon.

review.title: Would love to go back!
review.reviewText: Our stay started with a no-hassle, EARLY check-in with pleasant service. The lobby was drowning in the intoxicating fragrance from the fabulous flowers, i loved being welcomed by them every day. Our room was one of the most comfortable we've ever had, and our view of the city was decent from the 19th floor. Our only complaint would be the slow water pressure in the shower. The concierge service was very helpful, and we would like to say a special thank you to Franco who sent us to The Waterfront restaurant ...wonderful service and a delicious dinner! We would love to come back!

review.title: Westin was very nice
review.reviewText: I really liked the hotel and the location was very convenient. It's a well priced and lovely place to stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: The hotel was close to public transportation and walked distances to the cable car and baseball game. The view on the 4th floor was terrible and the room had a slight smell but overall - I would stay there again.

review.title: Would stay again if the price is right
review.reviewText: The only thing lacking at the Weston is a towel rack in the bathroom. With no place to hang towels, they all go into the tub & have to be changed every day. All the extra laundry is not a good advertisement for a "green" hotel.

review.title: Good place to stay in SF financial district
review.reviewText: The Westin was comfortable and the staff friendly. The concierge was extremely helpful. Close to the trolley lines so we could get around easily. We would go back!

review.title: Great central hotel
review.reviewText: Found the location incredibly central - right near Union Square. Beds were awesome, about the only issue was flying halfway across the world and being unable to check in earlier than the standard 3pm. I would have appreciated at least being able to have a shower and freshen up before killing some time...

review.title: wonderful view
review.reviewText: My husband and I enjoyed the view of the city and the bay bridge from our room. We arrived an hour before check in and had to wait an hour for our room to be ready. We decided to walk around the city and checked in later. Maybe because we checked in later,but our room was right next to the elevator. I am a light sleeper and the noise woke me up several times during the night. Otherwise, the room was great. Would have liked a bigger shower.

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText: Within walking distance of the Ferry Building, the Ballpark, the Warfield, great restaurants and shopping!

review.title: The Best Hotel I Have Been To in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I want to say that i make two trips a year to San Francisco and this was the best trip my wife and i have had in the 7 years we have started traveling there.The trip started out rough at the airport and when we got to the hotel our room was two double beds instead of one king. The manager quickly made a mends and the room we had was amazing.The view was unbelievable.The staff was extremely courteous and very helpful in our stay.We have stayed in alot of hotels in San Francisco and this by far the best.I would reccommend this hotel to anyone staying in the city. The first thing you notice is the beautiful aroma of fresh flowers as you walk in the hotel. As stated we go to San Francisco alot and the location was awesome,alot of hotels have vagrants all around and this one didnt. It was perfect walking distance to everything like public transportation and union square.Thank you for a great trip we will always stay there in the future.

review.title: A Great First Time Stay
review.reviewText: The overall experience and stay was excellent. I can tell this hotel is managed well and they take pride in housekeeping and maintenance repair work.

review.title: A Positive Experince
review.reviewText:
I felt completely welcomed to stay here. The staff operations
ran extremely smoothly. I was greeted by name whenever I
used the phone to make requests. The service was quick
and given with a smile...

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Westin has easy access to transportation. We arrived back to the Hotel late in the evening and I felt safe walking from the bus stop to our room.

review.title: Great Union Square Option
review.reviewText: I have stayed in most of the Union Square hotels and I prefer this hotel over all of the others at this price point. This is a consistently good hotel with convenient city parking behind the hotel. You can't go wrong with this choice.

review.title: Nice hotel, central location
review.reviewText:
Overall Westin treated us quite well. It is a fairly nice hotel 5 mins away from Union square and just round the corner from Market street.

It is not a hotel that will blow your minds off, but it definitely provides a pleasant and clean accommodation. I have not stayed in any other hotel in San Francisco, hence can't compare it to other hotels in the area.

Vallet parking was the only option and was quite expensive, hence we parked our car at the parking opposite the hotel for $20 per night.

review.title: Good Price at a Great Location
review.reviewText: There are certain expectations that come with staying at a Westin and the comfort of the bed is certainly one of those expectations. Quite frankly, the "heavenly bed" fell a little short for me. I'm not sure if the chamber person accidentally put the feather bed with the comforter rather than as a mattress topper where it should have been or what but there was no "cloud-like" feel for me. Also, because the window could not be opened, I found the down comforter extremely warm, and ended up using the feather bed as my comforter. The A/C vent in the room kept making a clanking sound all through the night, which made sleep a major challenge. I was able to avert that next day by cranking the A/C on really high throughout the day and just turned it off before bedtime. This allowed the room to stay relatively cool till morning. Other than these two factors, everything else was great. The hotel upgraded us to the 18th floor with a view of the Yerba Buena Gardens and the Bay. The location could not be beat. We were minutes from Union Square but we didn't have any of the noise factor. I did have one other beef though...I think $14 for internet usage is ridiculous and they didn't even offer free WI-FI in their lobby and/or business center. Thank goodness for the iphone.

review.title: Excellent hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Only down side is atrocious price of parking ($50/day).

review.title: Seamless experience
review.reviewText: I stayed here for one night on business. Check in was excellent and speedy, the room was super clean and comfortable, the service was impeccable. The lounge that they have in the hotel was really nice as well. The hotel was located about 5 or 6 blocks from the office and close to Market and the Embarcadero where there are lots of shops and restaraunts. I would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it to anyone else. Had a great time!

review.title: Will definitely stay here again, you should too!
review.reviewText: At check in I had to drop bags in our 10th floor room and run to an event my friend and I were organizing. It wasn't until my friend and I returned to the room at 1:00 am that I noticed that it was a single king, and I had reserved a 2 queen room. Called the front desk and a staff member was at the door in less than 5 minutes with a key card for a new room and a bell cart to move with. Due to the error, the hotel upgraded us to a premium room on the 33rd floor, with spectacular city and bay views. The hotel ammenities were outstanding, and all of the staff we had interaction with were extrememely helpful and courteous. We were VERY happy we chose to spend a little more to stay at this hotel. Many of our friends attending the weekend event had chosen other nearby hotels with lower rates, and were NOT happy they had done so. Highly recommend the Westin Market!

review.title: Super nice, super value!!
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Fantastic shower. Concierge and front desk people very helpful! I'd definitely stay again if I go back to San Fran.

review.title: Perfect SFO Trip
review.reviewText: Perfect location with various attractions in walking distance. Nice hotel and friendly staff. Really satisfied.

review.title: Where is the Bell Hop?!?!
review.reviewText:
LACK of CHECK IN SERVICE: There was no assistance when we pulled up at the Westin entrance in a taxi from the San Fran airport with 4 extra large luggage and 3 carry-ons. There was no bellboy to be seen or heard. We waited at least 5-8 minutes before I decided to get the luggage rack trolley. After all the luggage was placed on the rack by me, I rolled it into the lobby and yet no one noticed. It was not until I was waiting to check in at the line for another 5 minutes before anyone cared to come over to ask for assistance. Upon checking in, I made this complaint to the check-in clerk. She said she would pass this information to the manager and the manager would get back to us. During our Thursday to Tuesday stay, no one from the hotel contacted us about this issue or anything else.

ROOM CLEANLINESS: The maids do an outstanding job cleaning and maintaining the room. Not enough kudos go to these unsung heroines.

review.title: We pass on the word already and friends are planning a trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: The moment we entered the hotel we felt welcomed. Everybody at reception was very helpful and actually offered an available room on a higher floor. The view was spectacular and the neighborhood had a lot to offer: museums, cinemas, restaurants and easy access to public transport.

review.title: Good value for location
review.reviewText: High quality hotel, centrally located, and a great value. Watch out for the $55/night parking fee.

review.title: Great place crappy Internet
review.reviewText: Needed to do some work related webexes but Internet was so slow and useless it was impossile

review.title: always love the westin!
review.reviewText: We love staying at The Westin anywhere we vacation. Heavenly Beds are the best!!!

review.title: Average in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Everything was fine with the hotel and the service, but it was rated a four-star and is clearly an old three-star. Valet parking is an extra $48/day. In-house restaurant was average and overpriced. Rooms were clean, quiet, and well-maintained, though somewhat small. The desk clerk rapidly and politely fixed a billing error on checkout. The car pull-up area is very small and easily missed in heavy traffic.

review.title: email problems
review.reviewText: This is the only hotel I have bee in where I could not access my email because of the hotel's firewall, i had to use wifi at starbucks. This caused me no end of grief and discomfort and as a result i would not stay there again until that issue is resolved. Too bad because it was a nice hotel..

review.title: Can't wait to go back.
review.reviewText: It was our first time in San Francisco, the hotel front desk employees were so nice and they help us with a beautiful smile, very friendly. The hotel location was very convenient for us we didn't rent a car and don't have to because everywhere we wanted to go we could walk. Union Square was 3 blocks away, Westfield mall just 5 minutes walk, Star Bucks, McDonald just around the corner we didn't have to eat in the hotel restaurant (saves us a lot of money) so many places to eat just around the hotel. My daughter was so happy because her favorite store is right there at Union Square (Disney Store). China town is only a few blocks away and so does embarcadero.

review.title: "I will never stay at another Westin hotel, the service was the worst I have ever experienced."
review.reviewText: This hotel was pretty, but the service was beyond lousy. The bar was very over priced and once again the service there was bad too. The room was very warm and the air conditioning did not work. If you want to surprise your mate on his birthday, don't try to use their concierge. Not only was the surprise not there as promised, they were extremely rude when I called to see what had happened. The only thing good about it was the location. It was close to the things we wanted to do in San Francisco. There was a beautiful patio off the bar, but it was open to foot traffic and you could not have a drink without a vagrant coming up and asking if you had spare change. Also, even as a guest at this hotel they wanted to charge me $52 dollars to park. The going rate for the neighborhood is $32 a day. I will never stay in another Westin hotel.

review.title: Will definitely return
review.reviewText: Wonderful Hotel! Terrific view, kind staff and perfect location!

review.title: Centrally Located Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is huge and very modern. The location is ideal, it is situated d near public transportation. The hotel lacks the charm and character of other hotels and in my opinion bland. However, it was a great place to sleep. The bed was comfortable, room was quiet, and the black out curtains blocked out the morning light.

review.title: No Free Wifi! But clean and nice!
review.reviewText: Title say's it all.

review.title: Very comfortable and conveniently located
review.reviewText: We attended an event at Moscone Center and this hotel was just a couple of short blocks away. It is also convenient to Union Square, and there is a large shopping center nearby with a fantastic food court just perfect for a light meal.

review.title: Not worth the money -- there are much better alternatives
review.reviewText: Been going to downtown SF 2-3 times a year every year for the last 10 years, but somehow never stayed at Westin Marketplace. So I was looking forward to it -- but was very disappointed. The interior decor is very tired, and 80s looking. Restroom, corridors, and furnitures look straight out of HoJo's, definitely not something you'd expect from a hotel that can cost several hundred dollars a night. The workout room consisted of a tiny room with a few treadmills, ellipticals, and 3-4 workout stations. No free weights, and no shower facility. You must take the elevator back to your room all sweaty and smelly. The room had a great view of a grimy parking structure. Location is convenient, but for the money, there are MUCH better alternatives in the same area.

review.title: Stay here
review.reviewText: Clean and pleasant staff, this is a nice place in a good location.

review.title: A mom and daughter celebration weekend!
review.reviewText: We were pleasantly surprised with the Westin. The location was great and the room was clean and spacious. The employees were quite helpful. We arrived early and there was an available room for us. We had a great time!

review.title: westin
review.reviewText: just about everything met or exceeded my expectations, however, upon checkout, there was a charge for parking although i did not have a vehicle. the hotel waived the fees after i brought this issue to their attention. had i not paid close attention to the invoice, i wouldve been charged for unnecessary fees.

review.title: San Francisco Market Street Westin Hotel
review.reviewText: I would have liked a room with a nicer view of the city.

review.title: Weekend in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The room was a little small, but clean and the bed was very comfortable. The only things that I found annoying about the hotel were the revolving door entrance and the fact that every time we wanted to consult the concierge, the desk was not manned. Other than that, it was a great weekend stay.

review.title: lost 2 nights of sleep on a 3 night stay
review.reviewText: Our room vibrated, the water in our water bottle bounced. We must have been over the air vents or something. The alarm went off at 4:40 am the 1st night and we could not figure out how to reprogram it so we unplugged it. It had battery back-up so it went off the second night too. From 4:40 am on we heard what sounded like bowling next door - maybe the laundry room? We felt like the walking dead because we were so sleep deprived. They moved us to a lovely room on the 30th floor for our last night but it was too late. Our vacation was shot. I guess these good deals are not so good. Wish I had known we would not get a 4 star room because of our "good deal price".

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel had very comfy beds and great service. It's down the street from a fire station so we heard the trucks go by quite often. I asked the front desk if they had a fan for white noise at night and they tracked one down for me - I thought that was going above and beyond. A great hotel if you want be right in the middle of the all the goings-on downtown and only a few minutes walk to the cable cars.

review.title: Would go back to Westin only if they got new trained & well-mannered front-office staff
review.reviewText:
Westin staff did not show any interest in giving us an additional night. They gave us a price, which was quite reasonable, but next moment, they turned around and said that we should book on line. It is kind of strange that you are asked to book on line while you are staying there and talking to their front-office staff. We made that additional booking through Expedia.
Later, they charged us for that night [that we booked through Expedia] and the Mini Bar that we never used.
I am still exchanging emails to sort this out.

review.title: Best location at down town easy to go everywhere!
review.reviewText: Nice city to enjoy.......walking around or take the cable car go all around to some area.......Hotel ocation is best of all near by any Public transportation....

review.title: can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: elegant hotel at a fair price. This is my first choice of a hotel in SF!

review.title: Good. Will stay again
review.reviewText: Good downtown location. Close to restaurants, shopping, public transport. Nice, clean hotel. Friendly , helpful staff. Business centre was closed all the time we were there.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: The Westin Market Hotel definitely lived up to our expectations. Friendly staff, clean rooms, and beautiful lobby. We asked to be placed on a higher floor as to see views of the city, and were easily accommodated. The bedding was sooooo comfortable we didn't want to wake up to check out! Bathroom was very clean and new. Would recommend!! NOTE: Internet is an additional charge and the only thing we were dissappointed with.

review.title: A definite highpoint of our trip!
review.reviewText: My wife and I love San Francisco and travel here at least once a year. We have stayed at many different hotels in the past 20 years, but this was our first time staying at the Westin San Francisco Market Street and it will definitely not be our last.
