We throughly enjoyed everything about the Hotel from its convenient location to world class shopping at the Westfield Center and Union Square, the unlimited dining options, the Jewish Museum next door, as well as the Metreon on the next street over. We also loved coming back after a long day of exploring the city to relax by the outdoor fireplace. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and what can you say about the view from the floor to ceiling windows and the Westin Heavenly Bed! We also enjoyed the smaller more cozy feel of the hotel as opposed to the larger more crowded ones. Overall a wonderful and unforgetable experience!

review.title: Urban Oasis
review.reviewText: This hotel is a great spot for a visit to SF - for work or play. The rooms are luxurious, comfortable, and clean. There are ample delicious restaurants near by (including just a short walk to Chinatown and Italian Food in North Beach). SF MoMA is on the same block as the hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel and very convenience, but almost got chagred unused item
review.reviewText: The hotel is very pretty. The room is clean and comfy. We parked in the parking structure behind the hotel instead because the hotel parking is very very expensive. The location is super convenience too. Walking distance to Union Sqaure, the F-line Trolley, and the Bart. The only complain is that when we checked out they charged us bar items that we didn't use. After talking to the front desk lady, she removed the charges but you should definitely double check your bill.

review.title: Great Hotel - Avoid Room Service and Parking
review.reviewText:
The hotel decor, and comfort of the room were great. The cost of parking is obscene for hotel guests - you'd think they would cut you a break since you're already paying for a room. And avoid the room service at all costs. The prices are crazy for pretty horrible food...frozen pizza from the grocery store tastes better. The pizza tasted like cardboard and the spaghetti was totally bland.
If you just need a comfy place to crash then the beds are great and the room was spacious and well appointed - just hope you don't mind the cost of parking.

review.title: Not Impressed but it was good.
review.reviewText:
It was very comfortable, clean and very good location, close to everything. What i did not like it is that cleaning room last day was very annoying , they wanted me to get out of the room at 10 because they needed to clean it but checkout was at 12:00pm. These girls open the door four times even that we told them we were inside and one of them told me something in Chinese. it was annoying.
I dont like that they dont have a refrigerator and if we move something inside of the bar they will automatically charge for it. you need to very careful.

review.title: Good location in SOMA neighborhood
review.reviewText: I spent two nights here with three teenage kids in tow. It was a great location for not having a car - just around the corner from BART and from the F car that runs down Market and along Embarcadero. Close to lots of shops and restaurants and a 10 minute walk to Union Square. This is a business hotel - so not as enticing as some of the great little boutique hotels that San Francisco has to offer - but we got an excellent rate and the room was large for San Francisco with a floor to ceiling window that offered a great view. I would definitely stay here again if the price was right.

review.title: Westin Market St - San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Westin hotel brand has a great reputation and there was no disappointment upon arrival just before Christmas. The hotel was warm and welcoming for the weary traveller, in a great location for access to the main shopping areas, Union Square and public transport. The room was clean and very comfortable, with staff very helpful. The only downside is the block + walk from the BART station - luckily it wasn't raining.

review.title: LA
review.reviewText: good for the money.

review.title: Great Choice for DT SF
review.reviewText:
This isn't the Ritz, but it's very nice, well maintained, simply and elegantly decorated, and as many previous reviewers have noted, has amazing views in many of their rooms.

We were given a corner room which did have an odd shape, but this didn't detract from the gorgeous view and many niceties which added to our total satisfaction with our stay. The Westin 'Heavenly' bed certainly was cozy, LOVE the scent of their bath products, and they supply Starbucks coffee and Tazo tea in the room. Yes, the fridge is stocked with their overpriced drinks and if you breathe on anything in there too hard, they will charge you within 10 seconds, but we didn't care about this. There is a note on the front of the fridge that empty fridges are available upon request. If we had been staying longer than one night, we probably would have asked for one.

All of our encounters with the staff were very pleasant. It's standard service at nice hotels, but I was still impressed when the doorman opened my cab door and gave his hand to help me out.

Very pleased with our stay and will definitely stay again when we have our next weekend across the bay. Thanks Westin SF!

review.title: Nothing but comfort
review.reviewText: Had a beautiful view from our room on the back side of the hotel. Loved the bed! One of the most comfortable mattress's I've slept on. With the number of different size pillows just added to the pleasure of a good night sleep when out-of-town. Also very good location for shopping and dining. The only negatives, check in took a little long and fabric chair in the room needed to be cleaned.

review.title: will absolutely return
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay in San Francisco very much. We wished we had planned a couple of extra days. There was so much to do and we could practically do everything from our hotel without a car. We were in walking distance to trolley, buses, cable cars and plenty of taxis. It was a great location!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great centrally located hotel. Easy walking distance to shopping, china town and all the great San Francisco food. Easy to catch a cab and great views of the city from the room. I would definately stay here again.

review.title: good deal and close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel; booking thru Expedia causes problems, however. Rooms and flowers in lobby and in general it's a gorgeous place. I liked that it is blocks from Union Square.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: I will probably choose the hotel next time.

review.title: Well located SF hotle
review.reviewText: The Westin Market Street is perfectly located to explore San Francisco. Walking distance to the Ferry Building, Union Square and the terminus of the Powell Street cable car line. Also, easy access to the Market Street trolleys to Fisherman's Wharf, etc. The rooms are comfortable and well-maintainedd and the rates are reasonable for the area. Also, you're near SF MOMA, a terrific museum and all the shopping on Market Street. Overall, a great pick for an SF visit.

review.title: Impressed with the hotel and Expedia's pricing.
review.reviewText: The place is centrally located and not difficult to find. Bart station is only two blocks away. Easy walk to Union Square for shopping. Definitely would return and stay there for my future conferences...

review.title: Andrea A M
review.reviewText: Everything Perfect!

review.title: Christmas in SF
review.reviewText: We went to see all the Christmas sites in San Francisco so for location it is a great hotel. Very nice rooms. Although not sure if it is because we booked through expedia but we got a room next to the elevator and it was as though you are sleeping next to a train station. With 2 kids already settled in we didn't have the energy to switch rooms but I did wake up several times to the rush of the elevators. 2nd time in 2 weeks westin put me next to an elevator and I am a starwoods member? Just make sure to request a different room. Otherwise would definitely stay there again.

review.title: I'd definitely go back!
review.reviewText: It was a beautiful room with floor to ceiling windows facing out to the street. Very clean and modern with a big screen television. The internet was choppy, but was told that b/c of the sheer number of business people from the conference, that was the reason. No complaints other than the fact that the internet was charged out at a high rate which I find interesting being as Canadian hotels, it's free.

review.title: Central Location
review.reviewText: Good location for the price (though the Westin in Union Sq would be ideal). The weekend of our stay appeared to have many young rowdy folks. Service was as generic as other hotels would be.

review.title: Great hotel...
review.reviewText: The hotel was very good.. great location...the only complain the lobby was always empty after 10pm again were weekdays maybe thats the reason...

review.title: A New Favorite
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was excellent. It was convenient to the Muni, the F Street Line and a short stroll away from Union Square. The hotel itself, while somewhat nondescript on the outside, was a beautiful oasis, with comfortable rooms and elegant but welcoming public areas with modern flair.

review.title: Great value!
review.reviewText: The place was more than you would expect at a reasonable price. Requested an upgrade in surprising my wife for her 40th birthday. They were nice enough to give us a corner suite with a great view - very cool of them. We had an awesome weekend! Service was good and location was ideal. No complaints.

review.title: Great Thanksgiving in the City
review.reviewText: Everything about this experience was great. First of all, the hotel is located in an excellent area. We were spoiled for choice of restaurants and activities. Room was very nice and the view was excellent. Staff were warm and friendly. Restaurant and bar area were also great. Can't wait to come again!

review.title: Excellence
review.reviewText: Some of the previous reviews made me a little nervous about choosing this hotel for my little GNO Thanksgiving kickoff. However, I was more than impressed throughout my entire stay here. Staff may not be quite as plentiful as they are at a high end hotel like the Fairmont, but their level of service came close. Through the revolving door and in under 10 minutes, we were checked in with a complementary room upgrade, bags whisked away, and seated in the bar with one of the best martini's I have had in a long time. The rooms were clean and ample enough by San Francisco standards. The beds were wonderful and the bathroom/ counter space was more than sufficient for a couple of ladies. The location was awesome and the views were impressive. Moreover, the next day we requested a late check out and they said "of course". When I told them 2 pm would be sufficient, they one upped me and told me we did not need to be out of our room until 3. The only downside I noticed was the parking rate, but there are plenty of parking garages nearby with more reasonable rates, if you don't mind walking a 1/2 block or so with your bags. Overall, the staff was gracious, the room was nice, and the location can not be beat for shopping, museums, and nightlife. I will definitely be visiting here again!

review.title: OK Hotel, not as nice as before
review.reviewText:
I stayed at this Westin once before and was quite happy with the room. On this stay, the room was fine but the bath room was not as clean esp in the tub area. The tile grouting was stained at various places. The tub drain plug had been ripped out. I informed the desk clerk who contacted the hotel engineering department who repaired by sticking the plug into the drain hole without bothering to reattach it to the mechanism that moves it up and down. The next day, after the tub was cleaned, the plug was again sitting some distances from the tub drain.
I had the breakfast buffet at the hotel restaurant. It wasn't bad but not worth the $25. $15/day for internet was a bit of a rip off too.
On the positive side, the location is very convenient and the staff was polite and helpful.
I didn't mind the occassional homeless person asking for money in front of the hotel. Being from Vancouver, BC, it's like having a toned-down touch of home whilst on holiday.

review.title: Great location and good price
review.reviewText: The location was just perfect, only few blocks away from union square. Hotel was just as we expected. The room was neat and clean.

review.title: Great Location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Westin Market San Francisco is in an ideal location just a block and half from the Montgomery BART station. Within minutes of the hotel are restaurants, coffee shops, convenience stores, etc. The famous shopping district of Union Square is just a 10-minute walk from the hotel. You can walk to Powell Street to catch the cable car to Fisherman's Wharf. There is an Italian restaurant in the hotel, but a little pricey. Also, snacks are provided in the hotel room, but expect a hefty price for consuming them.

review.title: Comfortable room, good for a weekend getaway
review.reviewText: I expected better service and more greetings from the Hotel staff. Nothing stood out to me as impressive, but the hotel was clean.

review.title: Very UNPROFESSIONAL - ATTITUDE Concierge lady
review.reviewText: Hotel itself was wonderful. On Thanksgiving Day, we just needed to ask a coupe of questions, so went to the concierge desk. Anyway, that lady who was at the desk around 10am on Thanksgiving day (2010) was so RUDE, at least made 3 people (including us and the lady before us...) so so upset. The other lady just needed to pick up the map, and we just needed to ask 2 questions. We waited at least 30~40 minutes just to make some kind of eye contact with her, she intentionally IGNORED us completely!!! Just a simple word, "I will be right with you" could have done the job. But this rude lady was just purposefully trying NOT to look at us, trying NOT to hear us. I finally snapped and said, "Is there ANYBODY else who can help us, please? She totally ignored me anyway. I was having such a great opinion toward this hotel until I encountered this lady. The hotel needs more training on the service people. She changed the whole trip to SF experience into negative. Also I wrote a complaining NOTE to the hotel directly, however ZERO response. I think that is rude too. So the service at this hotel scores the LOWEST ever. I am still upset big time.

review.title: worth it
review.reviewText: nice hotel

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We had never been to San Francisco and this Westin was recommended to us by a friend. It was very impressive with the friendly doorman, incredible fresh flowers in lobby and friendly front desk staff. We booked on Expedia and were told that we might be only on the lower floors. When we checked in they had put us on the 16th floor with an amazing view, the floor to ceiling windows are fantastic! The beds were so comfortable and rooms were spacious, bathroom could have been a little more updated but clean. Location is walking distance to the trolley, F-train and Muni. Union square and China town are walking distance too. Two things we were disappointed in was there was no pool or hot tub and the restaurant was a limited menu and pricey.

review.title: Best Choice
review.reviewText:
First time at the Westin on Third and absolutely satisfied!
The city was booked for the playoffs and my first choice was soldout.
I stayed at the Westin in Whistler, BC and enjoyed the service and quality so I chose the Westin again.
I was very impressed with the service and staff but the view from the room was to die for.
This was my sisters first trip to S.F. and she loved the hotel room especially the comfort of the beds. She said it was the best sleep she has experienced in a long time!
I will definitely choose Westin again!

review.title: No free Internet
review.reviewText: Internet too expensive

review.title: Excellent Location!
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a great location for visiting San Francisco. We were pretty much near all the main sites in the downtown core and the piers were an easy street car ride along Market St. We would definitely stay there again when visiting San Francisco!

review.title: very good
review.reviewText: good

review.title: Great Location, Easy Access
review.reviewText: Had easy access to the convention center, museums, and BART. Concierge was helpful in answering questions. Also had an easy, early check in and a slightly later check out to accomodate a final session at a conference. Didn't get to try out the hotel's restaurant so can't comment, but very close to several lunch and dinner locations as well as shopping.

review.title: Nevertheless- we'll be back!
review.reviewText:
We were upgraded; therefore, we had a nice room and a beautiful view. Just before arriving at Westin, my wife bought a sandwich near the hotel....could not finish it, so she brought back half a sandwich. We decided to place half a sandwich in the refrigerator along with a complimentary water we discovered in our room.
One problem- refrigerator stocked with booze and soda so there was very little room for anything else.. We read a note saying you take any of the items in the fridge or candy on the bureau...within 10 seconds you are charged. Naturally, we reminded each other...do not touch anything. We found just enough room to place a half sandwich & bottled water on top of the booze. You guessed it- we were charged "big time" when I checked the bill...seems just the pressure on top of the booze would be enough for the sensor to record. As I checked out - I pointed out the disappointing issue and the desk clerk immediately deleted the cost of the booze.
By the way, the bar at the hotel is too expensive....went to Dave's across street and beers were more than half the price.
Now for the positives! We keep coming back: lovely, quiet room, most of staff is very eager to please, location near Union Square offers easy access to just about every mode of transportation.
Pointed out a lot of flaws, but I just want to give an honest review.
Yes- we would stay at the Westin San Francisco Market Street again.

review.title: wish the weather was as great as the hotel
review.reviewText: This Westin has what you would expect from a Westin. Clean, comfortable, and great staff. Compared to other Westins I have been at it seemed at bit more geared towards the business clientele than families although I would not hesitate to bring small children there. The location is fantastic.....5 min walk to major shopping area and dept stores. Note:Westfield mall has a fantastic food court.....restaurant quality food at food court prices!) 7 11 and walgreens around the corner as well as a great wine store and many cafes and restaurants all in a 3 block radius. Public transit stop is also very close by making getting to the sights simple and affordable. Concierge is very helpful and offered great recommendations for dining and sight seeing. A little on the pricey side but worth the peace of mind. Would stay again.

review.title: Great hotel in a great spot!
review.reviewText:
Only down-side was parking. If you didn't want to pay $60/day for valet, it took a bit of work to find a parking lot nearby. It turned out there is one right behind the hotel and behind the Four Seasons. Take a left into the alley just past the hotel entrance.

On the up-side, I could bring my dog with us.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: it was a nice hotel and in a good location. I would go back.

review.title: Great Get-Away
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel in a great location. We enjoyed the super-comfortable bed and exceptional views of the city. The only complaint is the very over-priced breakfast buffet. There aren't many breakfast options in the neighborhood, but at this price, there weren't many takers for the buffet. We saw TWO when we went in to check it out. Needless to say, we didn't dine. We got a great deal from Expedia but this isn't a very price conscious hotel, in general.

review.title: "pretty nice for san francisco"
review.reviewText: Rooms were nice and clean. Self parking is conveniently located across the street. Good location although not in the center of union square. Beds were comfty and modernly decorated.

review.title: Good location, nothing more!
review.reviewText:
Very poor experience for a Westin hotel...

- almost $15 for wi-fi access per day is just not acceptable anymore. Even two star hotels offer wireless access for free.

- sound insulation is poor the very least! you can hear the conversations from the next room!

- Halloween at the hotel was a dreadful experience with security and then the SF police being called to the floor.

I'm not returning for sure to this hotel.

review.title: Impressive
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised by the size and amenities of the room that had the lowest price.

review.title: Best Hotel in SFO for Conferences
review.reviewText: This was a best pick for any conferences in Moscone Center. Other hotels in the proximity were way more expensive. The hotel staff was very accommodating in all our service request.

review.title: Nice View
review.reviewText: Excellent

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: This Westin is very comfortable and modern. The service is excellent. We requested a refrigerator and it was brought immediately. After one day, we discovered that it was not working and, not more than 3 minutes after reporting it, a new working one was brought. The location is great. A few blocks from Union Square and great shopping. Close to a BART station as well as bus stop.

review.title: Great Stay in a Great City
review.reviewText: This was our first visit to San Francisco. My husband and I traveled with my parents, and all four of us were very pleased with our accommodations. The staff were very friendly, and the concierge desk did all they could for us. The bed was very comfortable, but the pillows were terrible! The restaurant was overpriced. However, the most important thing to us is the cleanliness and quality of the rooms, these were excellent. There is also not free wireless in the hotel. It is VERY expensive to use the internet, I hope that the hotel changes this soon. This is the first time that I have stayed in a hotel where we have had to pay for internet usage. All in all it was an excellent experience. Great restaurants within walking distance, fabulous shopping and super close to the cable care and BART. We will stay there again.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was OK. Catered to business travellers which we we not. We had to change rooms due to elevator noise. The front desk did not allow us to move to a higher floor since we booked a special price cover only rooms below a certain floor. The biggest downside was a particular concierge whose attitude towards service left a lot to be desired! Each of the four encounters we had with her left us feeling like we had to fend for ourselves and we were putting her out. When she suggested that we pay cash to reserve show tickets (her reason being it would be easier to refund us if there was a problem vs. using a credit card) did not seem legit.

review.title: Good Choice
review.reviewText: I have stayed in several downtown hotels and choose the Westin this time. I was not dissappointed as it was what you would expect from a four star hotel. Also, the location was convenient as it is on the edge of the financial district, a few blocks from union square, and a little over a mile from the wharf. I had no complaints and would strongly consider staying here the next time I am in San Fran.

review.title: Worst choice
review.reviewText: Will never stay this hotel ever again. Requested for high floor during reservation and was giving low floor. Very unpleasant front desk service. Extremely and loud noise from hall way as well as street traffic. Too many homeless around the block. Very poor concierge service when asked for tourist info. Could not get a good night sleep.

review.title: Not bad, not great
review.reviewText: Way too expensive, but we happened to pick a week when few hotel rooms were available in the city due to several events.

review.title: nice brit
review.reviewText: very nice

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel centered in the financial district of San Francisco. My wife and I were on our honeymoon, and the location was perfect for getting out and exploring the city.
When we arrived, we were warmly greeted and even provided an upgrade at check in to a room on the 31st floor with a better view. The view was, indeed, superb as we could see all the way to the bay and Alcatraz.
The room was small but well-equipped. The bed was comfortable. Also worth noting, the concierge was especially helpful and informative. He was able to recommend a wonderful restaurant and secured reservations for us.
Our only complaint would be the cost of breakfast. No breakfast should ever cost $75 (french toast, coffee, two croissants, and orange juice). Live and learn, I guess...

review.title: Awesome hotel!
review.reviewText: We had a room on the 20th floor with a nice view. The hotel was very conveniently located to the conference I was attending and the staff was very helpful when I had questions about the area. The housekeeping staff did an excellent job keeping the room in beautiful condition. I was very happy with the entire stay and will stay there again when in San Francisco.

review.title: Good choice for downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Westin San Francisco Market Street is a nice hotel with a good location and a reasonable price. Room on appx. 16th floor was fairly quiet with only an occassional, muted siren from the streets below. I don't have any complaints. The "view" rooms higher up cost more because you can see the bay, etc. Our room just had a view of a small portion of downtown. No biggie since we were rarely in the room. We were out seeing the city, of course. High praise to Cafe Roma in North Beach for their consistently good coffee and great customer service. Thumbs down to In 'N Out Burger...a much overrated California obsession. Texas-based Whataburger has nothing to fear. Trust me. Parking tip: The Moscone Center Municipal Garage 4 blocks south is a much better deal than the $50 per day hotel valet.

review.title: Westin San Francisco - Not Quite Up To Par
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby was very well manicured and smelled wonderful. The room was decent, although it was a smaller corner room. The bathroom was very tiny and you could barely close the door without straddling the toilet. The ceilings were also very low and the tub/shower combo was tight quarters for me, and I'm only 5'9". Anyone taller would be hard pressed to stand up straight. We were very surprised to have to pay for wireless internet service, which was spotty at best. They did have an option to use a provided ethernet cord, although it was only about 2 feet long, so you were tethered to the desk. Ultimately, the $14.95/day charge for in-room access was not worth it. The "Heavenly" Bed was nothing to speak of and the towels also were quite rough to the touch. I did like the location, as it was very close to most everything we needed and only 10 blocks from AT&T park, where we walked to a Giants game. For the price we paid, I'd say it was okay, although I wouldn't pay anything more than the Expedia prices.

review.title: Good hotel, good location
review.reviewText: Good hotel in a convenient location; 5 min walk to Union Sq.

review.title: Great location but oh so more potential
review.reviewText: Staying for five days gave us a good insight into this hotel. Location is great, rooms good and overall e hotel is well worth any online discounted rate you get - so the niggles are; with a great outside terrace the dining options are very limited, couldn't believe there was no Sunday brunch, parking, despite 'in/out' privileges is expensive - a package offering would help here for those staying for more than a few days, also the mini-bar billing is crazy.....$88 charged and nothing used......so overall good but could be better.

review.title: Nice hotel for the price in that location. much cheaper than the others in the area.
review.reviewText: I was in SFO attending a family function and most of them stayed at the four seasons next door. I found a cheaper rate at the westin through Expedia and really enjoyed my stay there. I had stayed there in the past and I still it's worth the price. All the workers are really nice and professional. outstanding service!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: the only thing i didn't like is that our room was next to a where the cleaning ladys store their carts and it was noisy.

review.title: Friendly Staff Experience
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and the room was clean. Everything way was ready for us when we arrived.

review.title: "Can't wait to go back"
review.reviewText: I love Westin, the room was clean, the staff was excellente. Location was everything. it is in a walking distance from everything. I will highly recomend it and I will defenitly will use it again.

review.title: Great hotel, service, and location
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our experience. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We especially appreciated the gentleman responsible for hailing cabs. Such a nice man and so helpful (I want his hail-a-cab whistle for when we're not at the hotel)! The hotel is in a great area. You can walk to the cable car terminus at Powell St very easily. We did a lot of walking, but also took cabs, cable cars and buses. All were very easy to get to from the hotel. On Saturday morning, we walked to the Ferry Building for the Farmers' Marker--wow what a great experience--highly reccommend. It was a little further from the hotel than we realized on the map, but it was all flat. Great hotel, great location, great staff. Very clean and relaxing environment. Really cool bar/lounge area and outdoor lounge area (except for the smoking that is allowed outside--yuck!). For the price (compared to the Westin St. Francis), in San Francisco, I think you get a lot of great perks....OMG, the bed was so comfy!! Definitely book this hotel.

review.title: Problems with Mini Bar
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a good location, a little away from the crowds at Union Square but close enough that we could walk to Union Square, Chinatown, and the Ferry building. The room was clean, and staff did a good job in keeping things clean. Front desk was very helpful and pleasant. Our one complaint was the mini-bar. If you opened the refrigerator just to look to see what was there, you were charged for it. Because of the previous reviews, I knew that this was a problem. The evening before we checked out, I asked for a copy of my bill to review. They told me no problem, my balance was zero. Yes, because they had charged $88.00 to me for the mini bar and had already run it through on my credit card. When I explained that we had not taken anything from the mini bar, they credited my account. So when we left at 6 am the next morning, the bill put under my door, had added another $44.00 to the mini-bar bill. We had not opened the mini bar or consumed one thing, and yes my bill was zero again because they had already charged my credit card again. We did not have time to talk to the front desk, so after arriving home, after several telephone calls, the amount was credited back to my credit account. Very annoying and if I had not read the previous reviews I would not have known about this problem.

review.title: Location is good, but the facilities are not so much good.
review.reviewText: Everything was quite good, except the facility itself. The staff were very kind, the location is quite good, but the interior of the room was not so much impressive. And the overnight parking fee was 54 dollars including tax, I think its too expensive though it has a convenient location.

review.title: Westin = 4 stars!
review.reviewText: Check-in was swift, friendly, and the front desk person offered us the option of an upgrade to a room with a fabulous view. The bed was clean, comfortable, and the room was always spiffy when we returned from the day's activities. The price via Expedia was hard to believe - we will definitely stay here again!

review.title: Very happy!
review.reviewText: Great bed!! Fantastic view of SF. Lovely staff. Very clean. Super close to Union Square. Great coffee shops nearby. Close to all amenities and transport. Very happy!!

review.title: Can never go too wrong with a Westin
review.reviewText:
When we first checked in, our card key wouldn't work. After going back down to the lobby two more times to reactivate the card, the front desk decided to send security up to the room to meet us. It's been a good half hour at this point. Security comes up and can't open the door either. He calls the tech guy who says over the walkie talkie that "maybe someone already occupies the room. It's happened BEFORE." Sure enough, we knock and someone answers, "hello?" This is a bad start. Apparently this person has the same last name as me.
Anyway, before the boyfriend and I get too grumpy, the lady at the front desk kindly offers to upgrade us to an executive suite on the same floor and comp our wireless internet. The room was great! Views to the north of the bay bridge and the east, spacious bathroom, and of course the always wonderful heavenly bed of Westins. Thanks to the wireless internet, we quickly researched that the in house Italian restaurant had terrible reviews and decided to order from Cheesecake Factory a few blocks away. I do wish that the front desk mentioned there was a CPK right in front of the hotel instead of being completely unhelpful when we asked what we could order from around the hotel.
Parking is expensive ($54 after taxes) but it's for 24 hours - if you plan it out right, you can leave your car there and walk around the city or take cable cars around to the sights. Unfortunately we didn't have time to take advantage of that. Overall, I'd stay there again!

review.title: Beautiful Comfortable Hotel
review.reviewText: Both the concierges we spoke with were extremely helpful and both had recommendations that were spot on. Close to all the art museums and within walking distance to most of the sights in SanFran (i.e. Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf, great food). Very clean. The beds were really comfortable. Would definitely stay there again. Would reccomend parking across the street though. It is only $20 a day at the parking garage vs. $50 a day at the hotel.

review.title: Recommended Hotel
review.reviewText:
Everything are pretty standard for its class, neither surprising nor disappointing. For my family, cleanliness is our first priority, especially bathroom. The bathroom (including towels) was spotless, I love it!

I am a little disappointed with room cleaning, my husband found a can of half drunk coke at the back of a sofa on day 10 (we stayed there 14 nights). It must be previous guest's coke (we do not drink coke).

In general, I would choose the hotel if I go to San Francisco again.

review.title: A better alternative to Union Square
review.reviewText: We booked the Premier room and were very impressed. Nice view, very clean, no traffic noise, no partiers next door, great Robo-bar, great location. Walking distance to financial district, Chinatown, and of course all the shopping on Market. Bar was good, didn't try the restaurant. Really helpful valets out front.

review.title: Loved my stay!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, along with the staff. Location was perfect for all of our needs and shopping. Will most definitely stay here again!

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: Very nice Hotel, Hint: For parking -- take a left at the end of the Hotel, almost looks like an alley, there is a underground parking lot for a lot less.

review.title: Very nice hotel with pleasant staff.
review.reviewText: Clean and beautiful hotel; great staff.

review.title: Look forward to coming back...
review.reviewText: My stay was pleasant and would be happy to reccommend this hotel to my friends and others

review.title: Westin San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great hotel, and location couldn't be better. Tons of shopping close by and public transit right outside the door to Fisherman's Wharf, etc. Concierge staff was a bit hit or miss. One gentleman was extremely helpful, while another woman seemed annoyed we were even asking her questions. Overall, very happy with the hotel.

review.title: San Fran vacation
review.reviewText: I would certanily recommend the Westin San Francisco hotel as a place to stay for anyone visiting. It's close to the financial distrcit, the museum, the shopping area and a number of fine restaurants. Access to the rest of the city was very easy by F-line or taxi. The doorman were very helpful with getting around and the hotel staff very friendly and knowledgeable of the area.

review.title: Not what I expected
review.reviewText: I have mixed feelings on this one. Te room was clean and the bed was comfortable but the smokiness rined it for us. There should have been some kind of discount on the parking if you are staying in the hotel

review.title: Good hotel, great location
review.reviewText:
Stayed a few nights at the Westin Market Street in August 2010. Location of this hotel is excellent - it is within easy walking distance of AT&T Park, Yorba Buena Gardens, the Moscone Center, and plenty of shops in the Union Square area and at Westfield San Francisco Center. Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf are about a 35 minute walk along the Embarcadero.

This hotel allows easy access to the above areas without being directly in the crowded bustle of Powell Street and Market Street bordering Union Square. That being said, if you're on a lower floor, it can be noisy in the morning and evening when traffic picks up, as well as at night on the weekends.

Like most higher end hotels, they gouge you with the internet fee, but there is a Starbucks across the street if you're looking for free WiFi for smaller tasks such as checking email.

review.title: great location with easy access to the muni, and all transportation.
review.reviewText: We had a lovely stay at this hotel. As stated the location was primarily why we selected it and our room didn't disappoint either. The staff was friendly and the concierge helpful with providing accessible transportation options . We walked everywhere and the burger s at this hotel are fantastic-huge and are number 1. We would recommend this hotel to other travellers for sure as we were accomodated very nicely with no problems !

review.title: Luxury hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful and comfortable. When I made the reservation online it showed up as a King Size Bed and there were 3 of us. There was no trouble at all to change that once we checked in. Everyone was very nice and professional. The only complaint I would have was I decided to have a beer from the in-room bar. There was adequate information stating that I would be charged, etc., but I was disappointed when the beer was lukewarm and not cold. There was a bill on the floor in the morning, which was convenient, although extremely expensive! This hotel was recommended to me and I would recommend it to someone else.

review.title: CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK
review.reviewText:
WE HAD A GREAT WEEKEND IN S.F., WOULD LOVE TO GO BACK TO THE
WESTIN ON MARKET, GREAT LOCATION WONDERFUL SLEEPING BEDS AS WELL
review.userLocation: OUTSIDE THE WASHINGTON, DC AREA IN GREENBELT, MD

review.title: Westin Market Street
review.reviewText:
Good value for downtown. Very convenient to walk to Chinatown, AT&T Park, or public transit/walk to Golden Gate, Fisherman's Warf, Ferries. Easy to access subways to Airport (BART) or Muni.

Would recommend

review.title: had a great stay
review.reviewText: beautiful hotel. great location. very friendly staff. nice restaurant in the hotel that we had dinner one night. cons: parking is expensive. there is a cheaper public lot across the street. we also had to ask for soap if we needed it for the bathroom. the rooms are a little small. other than that we had a great time!

review.title: Westin - you cant go wrong
review.reviewText: Hotel was reasonablty placed and well located. The rooms were comfortable and a great size . Location is central to the shopping district . Overall pleased and met the expectations of a Westin hotel

review.title: Good times by all.
review.reviewText: We were impressed with the hotel location and especially with the cleanliness of the hotel. My husband loved everthing about the hotel. We had always stayed at "Parc 55" which he loves. However, he said this hotel might take the other hotel's spot in his heart.

review.title: Great San Fran locaion
review.reviewText:
This hotel was in a perfect location. The staff was wonderful, the room clean, quiet and wonderful.
close to shopping and eating and in the heart of San Francisco.
I wouldn't walk alone as a female late at night however due to the people hanging around at night. 'The hotel was in a great location.
Would highly recommend this hotoel

review.title: very good location, very nice view from the room, extremely small room for two persons
review.reviewText:
Very disappointed that my room was not ready when I arrived for the check-in. It was 2.40 pm and I was coming from a long trip (FRom Europe with 2 flights, one of 1h30 and the second one of 11h30). The room was equipped with a queen bed instead of the requested and confirmed King bed. The room was narrow and not adapted for 2 persons.
Location of the hotel is top! View from the room was exceptional.

review.title: Will definitely stay here again
review.reviewText: This hotel was in an excellent location - an easy stroll to all public transportation and shopping. Our room was clean and the bed comfortable. When asked for a local map, the concierge was a bit unfriendly, but maybe she was just having a bad day.

review.title: Great hotel and prime location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Great staff. Very comfy beds. Strongly recommend this hotel. Very competitively priced.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Great location. Within walking distance to many attractions and great access to public transit. Rooms were comfortable, quiet and clean

review.title: Top notch hotel!
review.reviewText: I've stayed at this Westin a couple of times. It's always consistently excellent. Staff service is top notch, the rooms are excellent, and the beds are wonderful. I highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Too Expen$ive
review.reviewText: A nice clean hotel, close to all of the San Francisco attractions, but with the lack of free Wi-fi and parking charge the deal I got on Expedia was just about negated.

review.title: Reccomended!
review.reviewText:
At first we got a room with crappy view. But what do you expect when you order online for discount. When we asked to be upgraded they did so without any fees. Extremely helpful concierge. Parking is overrated - $$ , where down the street self park is only $. Location is great for shopping and good restaurants. Make sure you visit french cafe food there is really good ( by China town).
Overall, room was really clean. We really liked the smell of the hotel itself - green tea scent. Very friendly staff. I dont have any complaints.

review.title: Nice place but the "hidden" car parking charges weren't Funny!
review.reviewText: The Hotel was very nice and well situated downtown. The extra "hidden" expense of parking fees was not appreciated! It added 50% to the bill. And room service for breakfast was less expensive than the buffet in the Hotel restaurant.

review.title: Unexpected surprise
review.reviewText: We decided on this hotel specifically because they offered a two queen bed option in Expedia. When we checked-in, we were told that the hotel did not have a two queen bed room available. Since we booked through Expedia, we were told that they do not guarantee the type of bed in the room. They offered us a king bed room with a rollaway cot to make up the difference. Not amused by our situation and remembering distinctly selecting the Westin because of the two larger bed option, I asked to speak with a manager. Although he reiterated the Expedia booking issue, he was sympathetic to our problem and offered to pick up the breakfast for the rest of our weekend stay there. The free breakfast was a nice touch, but what I cherished about my interaction with the manager was his sincere attempt at making our stay at the Westin as comfortable as he could. Although we settled for the single King bed room, he put us up on a higher floor with a great view of the city. When we checked into the room, we realized that the bathroom did not have a tub that we could use to bath our child. When we called down to be moved to another room, the same manager personally helped us move our luggage to another room with a tub. In fact, he had visited the second room personally to visually confirm the tub. I've stayed in many Westins and W Hotels, but I've never had a manager make a sincere effort to make our stay so comfortable. Yes, this is the first time I felt compelled to review a hotel.

review.title: Great Location, but not worth the price
review.reviewText:
Apart from the location, I can't see myself staying at this hotel again. The Westin looks at every and all opportunities for generating revenue. There is water in your room (for a fee), a snack bar, where if you accidentally disturb one of the items are automatically billed to your room. We asked that the snack bar be removed after my wife accidentally knocked over one of the $7 peanuts with her purse. Finally, there is no wifi, instead you can purchase high speed internet from the Westin for an exorbitant fee.

This was our second time to the hotel, and we've noticed that the costs keep going up and the amenities are few. The rooms are small, a little dated, but clean. Save your money and stay at one of the 3.5 star hotels, which are scattered around town. Most of them have free wifi and breakfast included with the room.

review.title: Easy to see San Francisco and easy to shop
review.reviewText:
We waliked to ROSS. We walked to the Mall.
Food court was up scale with great food.
Location, location, location!!

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this lovely hotel. Room view was spectacular!

review.title: Good hotel find in San Fran
review.reviewText: Overall stay was very satisfactory. The only hiccup was at check-in when our room was not ready even after they told us to come back after 3pm. However frustrating it was to be told that our room still wasn't ready and to wait for them to figure it out, they redeemed themselves by finding me a room and then seamlessly moving our luggage to the room we booked the next day.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is located near downtown, all you can do walking, near buses, near cable cars. near restaurant, shopping...etc.etc ..excellent location. The room is comfortable and clean. The hop on -off vehicle has a stop right outside.

review.title: From culture to couture.
review.reviewText: A quiet room in a noisy city. Loved to proximity to art collections, shopping and dining options!

review.title: DIRTY ROOMS - AWFUL SERVICE
review.reviewText: we will NEVER stay at this hotel again...

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: Very comfortable room, attentive staff and the location couldn't be more convenient to shops, museums, theatre, restaurants--fabulous!

review.title: happy again
review.reviewText: 2nd time here in 6 months, was as good as the first time. Great location and staff would go back any time.

review.title: Good Choice
review.reviewText:
Went to SFO in a family trip and had the chance to stay in very nice and comfortable hotel.
Located in a perfect place, in the middle of the Financial District, close to everything a common tourist might need and visit (Stores, Restaurantes, SFOMOMA, Cable Cars, etc) and with easy access to transportation.
Service was good, clean rooms, nice beds, fast elevators (might sound weird, but, weve had bad experiences before in other places with slow elevators) and very dedicated staff.
Only had problems with the bed sheets, which were shorter than they should, but nothing taht a small note to room service personal could not fix.
I would definetly consider this place for our next visit to SFO.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText:
Overpriced!
$54.00/day for parking!
$24.00 for breakfast!
$8.00 for a beer!
I wouldn't mind paying if it was a four star hotel but it was nothing special.
Didn't even have a table and chairs in the room.
The Marriott is much better.
Don't stay at this overpriced motel 6.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: I would go back to this same hotel in the future.

review.title: Traveling parents think twice!
review.reviewText: I had requested a pack n' play when I made the reservation and had called 3 weeks prior to our stay to ensure that we would have a play pen for our daughter to sleep in. Upon arrival, I was told there were no cribs or pack n' plays available and they offered no other alternatives. I explained that I had contacted them twice to make sure we would have somewhere for our toddler to sleep and was told by the front desk attendant that 'you only make requests, we cannot guarantee that you will get one'. When I brainstormed to create a make-shift bed out of a comforter and pillows on the floor, I requested we have additional pillows delivered to our room to assure our daughter's safety - the pillows never arrived. I had also asked if I could simply use a microwave to heat up a frozen macaroni and cheese dish for our daughter and was told that they could not let me use a microwave because of the liability they would assume. NOT A CHILD-FRIENDLY HOTEL FOLKS!!!! I will not stay there again and will think twice about staying at this hotel chain again.

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: Great location for shopping and seeing China town, not so great for the harbor.

review.title: Perfect Vacation
review.reviewText: We planned to stay at the Westin for a few days, then rent a car and drive to Yosemite, and then return to the Westin for a few more days. On the first leg of the trip we had a two room suite. It was a beautiful room with a comfortable bed and a great view. The staff at the hotel is excellent and the location is great. On our return to the Westin we had an upgraded room but not a suite. The view in this room was even better so we didn't mind being in the regular room. We were very happy w/the Westin.

review.title: So Impressed!
review.reviewText: The Westin Market Street is a wonderful place to stay. The location is amazing and within walking distance to many popular places in San Francisco. The room were spacious and clean and the beds are SO comfortable. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful. I will definitely be staying here the next time I travel to San Francisco!

review.title: Will go back!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful with our standard room on the 25th floor with a view of the city and the bay bridge in the distance. The lighting in the bathroom was perfect for applying makeup (important to me!! ha). There is a complete gym on the 4th floor that we enjoyed. The hotel itself is close to the F-line pick up, as well as cable cars and BART. The park is close and very beautiful. Staff is very friendly. We'll definitely be back.

review.title: Great Hotel - Great Location
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel in a great location! No need for car or transport. EVERYTHING within walking distance and about 5 min away from Tram turnaround. We hired bikes to go across the bridge which was great! Highly recommend. If you are hiring a car - dont get it while in SF - Parking costs a FORTUNE... it cost us $180 for 3 days parking:(

review.title: Nice Hotel - A bit expensive
review.reviewText: This Hotel was conveniently located, in very good condition, clean and easy to get to from the Airport; over all we had a positive experience. However, the two negatives were the high prices in the hotel restaurant and the cost for valet parking. We were traveling with our three children and parents and having to spend $30+ a person for breakfast (Brunch cost) was a bit ridiculous. Luckily we found a great little place around the corner from the hotel, The Grove, which had really good food (breakfast and lunch) and was much more reasonably priced. The nightly valet parking charge was very high.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: Very good experience and wonderful location for families

review.title: Enjoyed our stay at The Westin Market Street
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice & our room was exactly what we hoped for. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to others.

review.title: Great Hotel location
review.reviewText: Great location and very nice, Market St. and F -line to the Fisherman Wharf only steps away. Trolly's just around the corner. Very nice staff, had fun.

review.title: Lovely hotel in Chinatown!
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was very nice and the staff very welcoming and helpful. Other than wishing that a light breakfast would have been included in the price, all was very nice and comfortable. Updated look to the rooms and lobby made it feel like we were in a very fine hotel. Several great restaurants were across the street, making dining convenient and enjoyable.

review.title: Satisfactory
review.reviewText: Not happy that check in was at 3pm and my room was not ready until 5pm. I thought that arriving at 2pm would be enough time for our room to be ready but I was wrong. I was asked to return in an hour. After an hour I checked again and was told to return later again. I asked for a number to call back while we shopped. Calling the hotel and attempting to bypass the automatic telephone answering service was a nightmare. Once I did get a hold of a person, they simply switch you to that person without a word. Literally, there was no "please hold" or "let me transfer you", just sudden ringing. Poor telephone service and the hotel seemed way understaffed.

review.title: great place to stay in san fran!
review.reviewText: this hotel was very conveniently located if you want to walk to most of the attractions in san fran. close to trollies and busses. It was very modern and very clean. the staff was great and ready to meet any need. The only drawback? It didn't have a pool. havinga pool would have made it perfect!

review.title: Overpriced hotel needs work to make leisure travelers feel welcome.
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel, however, it is not very friendly or accomodating for leisure travelers. The hotel restaurant is grossly overpriced, and the food quality is sub-par for the premium price they charge. The room was small, but nice. The bathroom was also small and not cleaned well before our arrival. This hotel does not have complimentary internet (or anything else for that matter). This is a fine hotel for business travelers, but does not do well taking care of it's vacationers. Overall, this hotel did not live up to my expectations for a downtown 4-start property.

review.title: Business Person's Hotel
review.reviewText:
The Westin San Francisco Market Street Hotel is a nice hotel, particularly if you're a business traveler.

That's pretty much what the hotel is, a business person's hotel. They don't really have much of a lobby and the place was kind of sterile atmosphere-wise.

My room was clean and orderly, but watch the minibar; the bar is tracked by electronic device and they charge you if you move any items. I was charged 35 dollars for items I didn't consume.

Otherwise, the hotel was a nice venue in a lively section of San Francisco; especially for a business traveler who books on websites such as Expedia.

review.title: Get location to tour San Francisco
review.reviewText: clean, hotel in heart of city. Access to my streetcar lines.

review.title: Good value/Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice with a lounge to sit in and relax. The conceirge was very helpful too.

review.title: I'll be back to the same hotel
review.reviewText: Good location just minutes from union square,clean and nice amenites

review.title: a great visit to SF
review.reviewText:
Experiences with staff were all excellent. Concierge was particularly helpful over this initial visit to the area.
Clean building, with good restaurant.
Convenient central location.
Would certainly recommend!

review.title: A great place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: It was a fine hotel. The front desk was extremely helpful each time I had occassion to be there.

review.title: Not the usual Westin experience
review.reviewText: Have stayed at other Westin's, so thought SF location would be just a great as the others. Wrong....long wait times, small crowded lobby, inexperienced concierge staff and overall unpleasant stay. Will not return or recommend to others.

review.title: Location, location, location.
review.reviewText: Everything was perfect but for one thing. Great food, modern hotel, fast elevators. Room big enough for 2 adults and 2 teens. I only hated the $48 charge a day for the parking of my car. I found is extremely expensive.

review.title: Would stay again!
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and the room was clean and comfortable.

review.title: Chicago's Hotel
review.reviewText:
I liked San Francisco's city a lot, historical and at the same time modern.
I suggest to walk a lot for the city, to know the places and the local habits.

The Westin San Francisco Market street hotel is well located and there are a good services with a good price.

review.title: Fun trip...great [place to crash
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect for our San Francisco vacation. It was very close to mass transit, which we used a lot. It was also very close to the SF Museum of Modern Art and Zeum, a children's museum. Behind Zeum is a great city playground that my grandson loved. There were some good restaurants nearby and the concierges were great.

review.title: Heavenly Beds!
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a hotel with a comfortable bed, look no further. You can even buy these 'Heavenly Beds' (I think they run about $3000 for the queen size. Room size was good, great view towards the bay. We got upgraded at no charge. Only gripe was that breakfast in the restaurant was expensive and so-so, and the bar closes at 12 on Saturday night!! Good tip - parking at the garage right across the street is approx $20/day - compare that with the Westin's over $50!

review.title: Would recommend in a heart beat!
review.reviewText:
Excellent hotel. We were upgraded to a room on the 27th floor and what a view! Stunning. Service was fantastic.
The overall vibe was upbeat and the hotel has a great. lively hotel bar.
Only draw back was that the cleaning maids are super noisy in the the mornings cleaning out empty rooms. OK if you are traveling on business and up early, not so OK when you are on holiday and want a sleep in :)
Fab hotel, great location, off the craziness of Union Square and great room and amenities. We would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice, clean hotel. Centrally located. Not many parking options other than the valet the hotel offers, however, even when they are very busy with multiple cars they are fast. Stayed with two small kids in double queen room and enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Good location at a great price
review.reviewText: This hotel is a great proximity to Union Square. It is also convienently located near a Starbucks and a California Pizza Kitchen. I don't really have a bad thing to say about this hotel. The only advice I would offer is use the parking garage right across the street instead of the valet parking at the hotel. It will save you about $30 a day, and the hotel parking can get crazy busy and backed up.

review.title: "Worst Experience Ever"
review.reviewText: Our room was next to a very noisy elevator, we talked to the clerk at the front desk without hesitation claimed the hotel was full and there were no other rooms available. Sounded more like he didnt even want to try. The valet staff was VERY unfriendly. This was our first visit to San Francisco and didn't realize you have to pay $48/ a day for valet parking in the hotel. We chose to park ourselves and paid only $20 a night across the street. We've been to many other Westins,and by far this was the worst one ever. I can't express how unfriendly the staff was.

review.title: Good Hotel to Stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to shopping district and nearby public transportation. It's clean and nice interior environment. Somehow the hotel could not satisfy my booking request on Expedia at the first night,due to high volume customers. However, the hotel did compensate and upgrade my room for the rest of nights. I am happy to stay in this hotel and I will choose this hotel next time.

review.title: Family from Australia - 2 adults 1 baby June 2010
review.reviewText:
Great location. We travelled with our 7month old daughter and they gave us a corner room as its slightly bigger so we could comfortably fit the cot. Bathroom basic but adequate. Business centre had to locate and no free wireless which in 2010 is suprising. Comfortable bed, good TV and ameneties. Perfect for a few days; China town a 10 min walk, Union square a 5 min walk, trams 2min from hotel but wouldn't do an extended stay unless you could afford a BIG room.
Staff were not very helpful about finding internet cafes or laundromat, but we found an internet cafe next door - no laundromat though!

review.title: absolutely!
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is beautiful and the location was great. Just wish we had more time to stay.....

review.title: Great Value, Great location.
review.reviewText: We had a great time! The location was good for art museums. The Yerba Buena park was very nice and right outside the hotel. Too many things to see and do in just a week. Muir woods is a must, take the morning tour because you can stay longer if you like and take a afternoon bus or ferry back, dont drive or you may have a long walk on the side of the road to get to the park entrance. Concierges are knowledgable and very helpful, and recomended several good spots for dinning. Short walks to most places and we didn't need to rent a car, public transportation was excellent We had great sea food at Scomas at Fishermans Warf, best food we had while we were there. We are looking forward to our next trip but like Mark Twain said the coldest winter I ever spent was the summer in San Fran, bring your coat!

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: This hotel is centrally located. It's very comfortable. We had a great view of San Francisco. We requested a refrigerator and were given one right away, they try very hard to please and we were very happy with our stay! We would go back again!

review.title: Highly Recommended!!
review.reviewText: Fabulous hotel in the perfect location. Its located about a block from one of the BART stations which made getting to and from the airport easy. Its minutes from Union Square and has many good restaurants within walking distance. The room was very quiet and comfortable. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful and offered great dining and sight-seeing recommendations. Would stay there again!!

review.title: San Diego
review.reviewText: I'd been to San Francisco many times and knew the area I wanted to stay. The rooms were very nice and the service was quick. I choose the Westin whenever I can and they rarely let me down

review.title: "convinience"
review.reviewText: I went to a concert at AT&T Park and the hotel's location was great. Out the front door and a 15 minute walk on 3rd Street and you're there.

review.title: Will definitely return.
review.reviewText: The hotel was fantastic. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. We had lunch and watched the final of the World Cup Soccer game and even though the restaurant was packed, the staff was still cheerful and happy to serve us.

review.title: very nice
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. We arrived earlier than check-in time and a room was available. Unfortunately it was tiny!! The consierge was very helpful and the location of the hotel made it very easy to navigate the city with public transportation.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to Yerba Buena Gardens and museums. Within walking distance of Union Square, BART system, and trolleys. Bathrooms were smaller that I would like but still managable for 3 people. Didn't try the onsight resturaunt walked down to Powell and Sutter and ate at Lori's Diner, great breakfast. One morning just had breakfast at Peet's Coffee on corner from hotel.

review.title: clean & at a great location
review.reviewText: My husband & I did not drive so we relied on public transportation. The hotel was very close to bus and train routes that took us all around the bay. It was also within walking distance to Union Square, the Embarcadero & Chinatown, which took anywhere from 10 to 20 minutes. The bank, a 7-Eleven, and Walgreens were right around the corner. The rooms were quiet and very clean. The surrounding area wasn't too bad after dark b/c there were always ppl & other tourists in the streets. Good hotel for a decent price. Will stay there again.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel has a great location and comfortable beds. It is not a top of the line property, but a good mid-range type westin.

review.title: Don't Hesitate to Book This Hotel
review.reviewText: Before booking this hotel I read many of the reviews and had some hesitation about staying here based on some of the things I read. I have stayed at Westins before in New York and Atlanta and have never had any complaints. I am pleased to say that this is a fine Westin Hotel. From the moment I walked into the lobby my fears disappeared. The staff were all friendly and helpful, the lobby was very nice, so was the room, we were on the 20th floor in a Grand Deluxe ( I did read that upper floor rooms are nicer, don't know if that's true) and yes the bathroom was not big but it was fine and it had great shelving for toiletries. And of course the Heavenly Bed - the reason I stay at Westins - there's nothing like it. The location of the hotel is excellent - right around the corner a couple of blocks is Union Square. Also around the corner are the streetcar & bus stops. We didn't have a car so the parking cost was not an issue but you don't need a car in San Francisco - their mass transit options are everywhere. Also we didn't have our computers so not having WiFi was not an issue. As far as the MiniBar goes - if you don't touch the stuff you don't get charged for it. I read reviews that made it sound like if you just breathe on the tray you get charged - that's ridiculous. This is a fine Westin Hotel - do not hesitate to book your stay here.

review.title: Great location and comfortable accomodations.
review.reviewText: The hotel is quite nice. There wasn't a pool and I can't recall if there was a gym, tho. We ordered in food one night and the kitchen staff was not that friendly and I found a hair in my pizza. Took the pizza and two beers off my bill. Bed was too soft for me but I like stiff beds. Everything except the pizza experience was great! Great location and really safe. My favourite is the double headed shower head.

review.title: It was just too, too industrial--the entrance--no chairs, sofas, etc. Cold--no where to sit
review.reviewText: My issue was when I had to wait for friends, there was not a comfortable place to sit and chat. It was way, way too unfriendly!!!! There were a couple of 2-chair--very stiff looking--arrangement but not comfortable and only 2 at each separate section of the lobby. I was just very, very disappointed with the ambience of when one enters it. Room was fine--love the bedding. Just the lobby was very ugly. And I felt that the food was way too expensive!!!!

review.title: San Francisco Shines
review.reviewText: We stayed at The Westin over a long weekend, and enjoyed our getaway immensely. The Westin staff were very friendly and helpful and the concierge service exceeded our expectations in setting up some city tours as well as reservations for dinners. The rooms, while on the smaller side, were always well maintained and stocked. We did not lack for anything. The hotel boasts a fire pit just outside the bar area which was a wonderful place to relax and unwind after a busy day of sightseeing. The location is quite accessible to Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, and Union Square. All were in a nice walking distance. There is fabulous shopping just steps away from the Westin. We look forward to returning in the near future.

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: Good location, nice hotel. Park next door... hotel parking priced too high. Very convenient parking for half the price.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: All we require when we travel is a clean room in a convenient location. We got that at this Westin property. They gave us a choice of floors and view, and a choice of bed size. We had no complaints at all.

review.title: Excellent hotel, service can be improved
review.reviewText: Overall, an excellent hotel. Nice, clean, convenient. Great location. Parking is overpriced for any city but SanFra. Some staff members can benefit from a course on how to be nice to guests, though; specifically, the manager of the bell desk.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location on Market Street with a nice gym. Close to both the Powell Street and Montgomery BART stations. Take a stroll around the corner to visit St. Patricks Catholic Church and across the street is Yerba Buena Gardens. My only disappointment with The Westin is that I had booked a room with 2 double beds and they gave me a room with 1 king. I was travelling with my 2 daughters. When I called the front desk the clerk without hesitation claimed there were no other rooms available. Sounded more like he didn't even want to try. Also, beware of touching anything on the honor bar. If you remove an item for more than 10 seconds you will automatically get charged for it!

review.title: The Perfect Hotel in the Heart of SF
review.reviewText: This hotel was essentially, in my opinion, perfect. From courteous staff at the front desk and valet parking, to amazing vistas over the city of San Francisco from my room and very comfortable "heavenly" beds, I really have no complaints. Indeed, the valet parking is quite expensive, but I would rather have my car in a secure location than in a cheaper parking garage, and service was always prompt and as expected. The location of the hotel is ideal, with a short walk to Market Street's shopping district and the entrance to Chinatown only about a ten minute walking distance away, and there are many restaurants nearby--including a California Pizza Kitchen right across the street, which offers takeout and is excellent after a long day of sightseeing. As for the condition of the room, it exceeded my expectations. The bathroom was a bit small, but was fully functional. And the signature Westin Heavenly Beds are indeed just that. The views from the upper floor rooms are simply stunning, especially at night. If ever I find myself in San Francisco again (which I certainly hope I will), I definitely know where I will be staying . . .

review.title: excellent hotel at a great price
review.reviewText: excellent hotel in a central location

review.title: Nice location, nice room, but annoying.
review.reviewText: Generally nice, comfortable hotel, conveniently located for tourists (walk to Ferry Building, cable cars, Chinatown, etc). Room was reasonably spacious and comfortable. Our main complaint was that there was no wireless reception in our room at all (despite the ads/promises), which seemed a bit bizarre for a hotel in downtown SF, not to mention extremely annoying. Wired internet worked ok (albeit slowly) in the end, but we did have to call IT support 3 times. The "revenue enhancement" features are another annoyance: the snack tray you can't move out of the way; the fridge you can't use to store your own stuff, and the internet charges. And the concierge was frazzled and snotty.

review.title: Very comfortable stay.
review.reviewText: The Westin Inn Market Street could not have been more comfortable and convenient to SanFrancisco visitor activities.

review.title: ESPECTACULAR VIEW
review.reviewText: This is definitely a 4-star hotel. Very conveniently located, close to all the stores. Our room, although small, was very clean and functional. The bed was one of the best ones I slept in so far. I booked a standard room but was upgraded to a 23rd floor level room with a spectacular corner view. The Hotel is very clean and very modern, and the staff is very accomodating. Everyone I had to deal with was very helpful and friendly. My only complain is the drinks at the bar downstairs. They're expensive and not very good. Everything else was very much to my standards and expectations.

review.title: Extremely good value
review.reviewText: Everything was better than hotels that charge considerably more. Elevators went off line for a few minutes from time to time.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: We had a oleasant stay. I would happily use this hotel again.

review.title: Great Hotel South of Market
review.reviewText: This was our second stay at this hotel. It is everything that you would expect of a Westin--excellent service, nice room, and heavenly bed. Easy access to Union Square, Embarcadero, shopping, BART. Defintely recommend.

review.title: Value for money, excellent location
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a no frills very decent hotel in an excellent location (minutes from great shopping venues), this a great choice. Westin had a 3 night for 2 night stay special, so great value for money. Hotel parking is expensive. Suggest to park across the street ($20 / night). We were upgraded to the 40th floor. Show your SPG card at check in to improve your chances. Friendly service. Concierge was very informative. Not sure about F&B, but suggest to wine and dine outside of the hotel, and enjoy the charm of SF. Will certainly stay again, if on a budget vacation.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Perhaps the best vacation we've ever had!

review.title: Room was dirty upon Checkin
review.reviewText: When we got to our room the lotion and shampoo's had been used. They were not replaced by new ones and 2 towels were dirty. We called the front desk requesting new towels and lotion and shampoo. Nobody delivered them, I ended up falling asleep. Next morning complained to the front desk. They apologized and sent to the room a cheese/fruit plate and some water in afternoon. That kind of made up for it...but the room just wasnt clean overall. I wouldnt stay here again.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The room was very nice and well kept. HD TV actually had HD channels, which I found astonishing. Staff was friendly, helpful and courteous. They do, however, nickel and dime you for niceties like internet acces and parking on site, so be aware of these charges if you require either during your stay.

review.title: Loved San Francisco, but not Impresses with our room.
review.reviewText: Our hotel room was the smallest room i've ever seen. The bathroom door scraped the sink counter when you opened the door all the way. The hotel was booked so I couldn't upgrade my room. Other then the size of the room, the hotel is nice. Dont get a corner room.

review.title: Rough start but great stay overall
review.reviewText: I reserved 2 rooms, requesting they be across from each other, and away from elevators and ice machines. We arrived to find our rooms 5 floors apart, and one was near an ice machine. I was woken up very early by horrible noise and found my headboard was secretly up against the service elevator the maids were using for their carts. However, when I requested a change, the hotel accommodated me immediately and I was actually given a room even nicer than the first one. The rooms were clean, the hotel was ideally located, the beds were comfortable and, after a bit of a rough start, it was pretty much everything I have come to expect from a Westin. The location right next to the cable car and near the mall was perfect. I never pulled my car out of valet during the entire stay.

review.title: a great Westin as always
review.reviewText: Great hotel and conveniently located to "the N" subway

review.title: San Fran June 2010: Nice time
review.reviewText: Great location, very close to street car and walking distance to Ferry Building, China Town, Union Square, etc. If you are interested in attending Catholic Mass, St. Patrick's is just behind this hotel. Starbucks, Walgreens and ATM very close as well. Saw "Wicked" at Orpheum Theatre. It is a must see but take a cab even though just a few blocks because you must pass through Tenderloin area. Nice, quiet room for a great price. I couldn't have been more pleased.

review.title: san francisco is the paradise
review.reviewText: SAN FRANCISCO IS THE PARADISE OF EARTH

review.title: Great San Francisco Downtown Hotel!
review.reviewText: The Hotel was Great, Everything Expected.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: PARKING IS UNBELIEVABLE, $75 for a standard SUV, would not stay here again. I can't believe these hotels charge for parking, and more for a standard SUV....

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly, room was clean, no issues with anything in or outside of the room. I have nothing to complain about and would definitely stay again.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: hotel is centrally located,easy to get around to all the tourist spot in S.F. excellent staff and helpful in providing information on getting around town.rooms are clean and comfortable.

review.title: Great Hotel Perfect Location!
review.reviewText: Beautiful Hotel in an excellent location. Will stay again!

review.title: Great hotel in the middle of SF. good for family with kids
review.reviewText: We stayed ther ewhere attending a friend's wedding. The hotel was way above average for SF at very acceptable price. My wife was very happy :-)) and my 9 month-old son enjoyed the view from windows hours. Very clean and the stuff was immediately responsive to our requests (baby crib; extra fride in the room etc.) Great location - steps form Yerba Buena and public communication. Highly recommended!

review.title: Great Location for Shopping!
review.reviewText: Everyone was very friendly! Rooms were nice, enjoyed the starbucks coffee in room every morning! Our room was on the 7th floor and on the smaller side but big enough for the two of us. There was some hallway noise, doors shutting was loud I think due to the rather large gap between the floor and the bottom of the door.
