Street noise was what we expected for being downtown in the middle of the city. Hotel bar was nice, service was great! This location was great for shopping everything else was a cable car, taxi or long walk away. Not too many restaurants near by. For first timers to San Francisco I would recommend a hotel closer to the Wharf, not a whole lot to do but shop around the Westin Market Street.

review.title: My sure stop next time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great service, cleanliness, nice staff and great location.

review.title: san fran
review.reviewText: this hotel is a wonderful place to stay. I had a room overlooking the park and I could see the bay in the distance. I recommend a room on one of the higher floors if you want a spectaular view

review.title: Would definitely rebook at this hotel.
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Westin and Four Seasons. We were more comfortable at the Westin.

managementResponses.response: We look forward to be of service to you again soon when you come back to enjoy all the amazing things our hotel and this city has to offer.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Well located hotel, nice room, good shopping area surrounding the hotel. I will stay again when visiting the area, good price.

review.title: great spot
review.reviewText: We found this motel exceptional value for money, it was clean , in a great location and the srvice was fantastic , we will stay again

review.title: Wireless rip off
review.reviewText: great location, but pricey for what you are getting. biggest rip-off is the $15 charge for wireless - which should be free at this price - and that it is slow to useless. Pathetic really. Restaurant in hotel is quite good, but again, expensive and staff pretty slack.

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: The Westin was a great place to stay in San Fran. The location is unbelievable for the price. I would definately stay there again.

review.title: Great, as usual,
review.reviewText: As usual, the Westin SF Market street does not fail in the comfortability they offer.

review.title: Great location!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is so centrally located we were able to see so much of San Francisco that we might not have been able to. The view of the city from our room was wonderful and the happy hour at Ducca's was the best!!

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText:
Great hotel, location.
Parking was expensive but self park was close although expensive as well.

review.title: Review
review.reviewText: Just a medium OK hotel, nothing special. I Liked the Parc 555 hotel that is nearby much better. Bathroom was small. I was told it was an old office building remodeled into a hotel. Nothing wrong with hotel, just OK. Location is excellent! Right near Bart and main attractions in SF, almost everything is walking distance. Bed was nice.

review.title: Great location - close to everything!
review.reviewText:
We arrived at the hotel at 9:30 am and were given our room right away. This was unexpected surprise as we arrived on Good Friday and were expecting to drop our bags and go sightseeing until check in time.

The only thing that future travelers may want to be aware of, is the hotel windows do not open and thus the air can be somewhat stale and have that "recylcled feeling". It should be also noted the bathroom does not have a fan either adding to the poor air quality.

review.title: My New Go To Hotel Chain
review.reviewText: This was a great, comfortable hotel and the pricing through Expedia was just right. I will be seeking Westin hotels for my future travel plans.

review.title: Westin downton San Fran
review.reviewText: The hotel was great except for the tiny room. For a Westin I was shocked as to how small it was. Getting into the bathroom you had to open the door and slide in or else you run into the toilet or door. The location was great, close to Union Square and shopping.

review.title: The best beds ever!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Westin for four days and were extremely satisfied. It is well situated and the quality of the beds was the best! The beds were so comfortable and the thread count of the bedding high. Added real comfort to our stay. This Westin is also well situated for getting around, shopping, etc. The buses and BART were close by and easy to use. Even with two days of rain using the buses was pretty easy. The cabs were also plentiful and reasonably priced. Often cabs were cheaper than a bus for the three of us.

review.title: Westin - SF
review.reviewText: Great value for money - good location - only issue was that breakfast was extremely expensive for me and family

review.title: "I would return"
review.reviewText: Overall, we were very satisfied with this hotel.

review.title: Not a 4* Hotel by my standards
review.reviewText: This Hotel though charging 4* prices for Room, parking and meals does not come close to 4* service in my experience. The room while comfortable was small and Noisy. Breakfast and meals for what was on offer in the restaurant were overpriced. The Bar lacked any atmosphere though the bar staff were efficient and courteous

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was great! The view wasn't too great but for the price, it was amazing. The bed was comfortable. The only complaint is that the bathroom was smaller than I expected. Other than that this was a great hotel!

review.title: great location and great bargain
review.reviewText: Perfectly located in the middle of shopping, feels luxurious but not too big, and I got a fabulous deal!

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Wonderful view of the city from the floor to ceiling windows in our room. Would love to stay there again when visiting San Francisco. Very convenient location to all the attractions too and yet right in the heart of the city.

review.title: Not the St Francis, but . . .
review.reviewText: Wall tile around tub needed serious cleaning. My major disappointment was not being able to watch my local sports team as no premium channels were available.

review.title: Best Location in SF
review.reviewText: Great Location. Just a few blocks from Union Square and one block from the BART station (train from airport). Could not be easier to get to. Nice, modern hotel. Concierge booked tours for us and everything. Highly recommended!

review.title: Don't go to this Westin when you're in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very disappointed in this Westin!

review.title: Average for a 4-star hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel itself was very nice but for being a 4 star hotel and for being a "Westin" I wasn't very impressed with the room amenities, especially the bathrooms...you got the bare minimum.
Of course parking at any hotel in SF is expensive so that's always a downfall. Otherwise we had a nice stay at the hotel and luckily it didn't cost us an arm and a leg or I would have been much more disappointed.

review.title: It was wonderful!
review.reviewText: We made last minute reservations online and expected to be somewhat disappointed but, were extremely surprised at the quality, location and condition of the Westin-Market St. It was a beautiful hotel with efficient, friendly staff and wonderfully appointed room with clean, updated amenities. We will do everything we can to stay there again and again!

review.title: Good Location, Efficient Service
review.reviewText: The Westin Market Street (despite not actually being on Market Street) is centrally located for both business and pleasure. For events at Moscone Center, the hotel is only a couple short blocks to the convention center. For vacationers, the neighborhood is safe and clean and centrally located and only 10 minutes walk to the Powell Street cable car and less than 5 minutes to the nearest BART station. The rooms were large, clean, and the staff professional and efficient. I will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Very nice hotel for the money
review.reviewText: Nice clean hotel, very conveniently located in the middle of downtown San Francisco. The staff was very helpful and polite. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Very happy with this hotel.
review.reviewText: The Westin Market Street was a great place to stay - professional, efficient and friendly staff. Lovely clean, comfortable room and all in a very handy location. Would be very happy to stay there again.

review.title: San Francisco's best hotel with a great location
review.reviewText: This was my second stay at this hotel in the last year. We came back because of the accomodations, cleanliness and location of the hotel. Very convenient to Union Square, easy trolley ride or bus ride to fisherman's wharf. Short walk to China Town.

review.title: Great hotel in a great city
review.reviewText:
I was in San Francisco for the King Tut exhibit and chose the Westin for its name. I was very happy with location and was surprised and impressed with the hotel. The front desk staff is very accommodating. The bell hops are all ready and willing to help you with baggage or just get you to a taxi. The concierge desk was also very accommodating. They checked us into our flight and printed out our boarding pass. The waiter at the lounge was so helpful in giving us directions to places we wanted to go to and find a theme restaurant that we were looking for.

Hotel has a nice outdoor garden with a fire pit for its guests. Nice feature for a night cap outdoors. The bed was very comfortable and so were the pillows. I had a bad fall before I arrive to San Francisco so I was pretty sore and banged up, the comfortable bed and pillows helped me sleep. Clean bathrooms, room was made up every day. Complimentary newspaper is a nice touch. Will definitely recommend this location to traveling friends!

review.title: Sucka Free SF
review.reviewText: Private, clean and modern rooms with a comfy bed. Add to that a view of the city and great location whether catching a cab, BART or a movie at the Metreon and you have a great place to set off any trip in SF.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: The best hotel we've stayed in. Very nice atmosphere and staff. We were treated very well. The room was perfect for us.

review.title: ok but nothing special
review.reviewText: Modern hotel -- not the best Westin by far -- lacks personality -- ok location -- rates often competitive

review.title: Really good GDC hotel
review.reviewText: The Westin Market Street is a perfect hotel for the annual GDC conference, as it offers a friendly and modern environment in a very convenient placement. Make sure you stay on the 19th floor or above for a great floor-to-wall view of the SF harbor every morning.

review.title: Great Hotel for the service and money
review.reviewText:
My stay at the Westin was exceptional. I was greeted in a nice manner when I arrived. Anytime I had a question (taxi pick-up, gym, etc) I was helped promptly and professionally every time.

The room was always clean and restocked with coffee, soap, etc. when I got back from work everyday.

The gym was the nicest, cleanest, and well-rounded equipped gym I have ever been to in a hotel.

Great place to stay!

review.title: This was my third stay.
review.reviewText: The Front Desk was extremely friendly and accommodating. The room was well designed with a great view. All the staff that we encountered were very helpful and friendly. I love the location of this hotel, as it is so centrally located.

review.title: Decent Hotel - Poor Internet & Air Conditioning
review.reviewText:
Had an odd room. It was kind of in the corner on one of the floors and the room was really long but narrow. The TV was probably 15 feet from the bed which made viewing it a bit difficult. It was also warm in my room. I had the A/C turned down to 63F and it still didn't feel like cool air was coming out. Made it a bit uncomfortable at night as I like to sleep when it is a bit cool.

Biggest issue though was definitely the Internet connection. I spent the first two days on the phone with tech support trying to get a faster connection and nothing worked. It was VERY disappointing that in this day and age they didn't have better Internet connectivity.

review.title: Great Hotel Experience
review.reviewText: From the moment we stepped out of the car we enjoyed our experience at Westin Market Street. The hotel is modern and the rooms spacious. We had a deluxe King Room on the corner overlooking 3rd Street. The staff are friendly, knowledgable and ready assist with any query. We will stay here again when in San Francisco.

review.title: Ausi. travelers at the Westin in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
A great experience at the Market Street Westin in SF.
Great location and very comfortable accommodation with friendly staff and sevice.

One minor irration though was the Mini bar and the automatic deduction. I have travelled extensively throughout Asia and to a lesser extend Europe and never come across this. The mini bar and availability of a fridge in a hotel room is a given throughout the world. but not necessarily in the USA.

review.title: Pretty good
review.reviewText: Overall, this is a good hotel. Howver, there are a few minor issues with it: bathrooms are rather small and outdated (not bathroom fan); there is no room service after 6PM; and finally, front desk personnel was very unfriendly.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and well maintained. The restraunt staff and bartenders were fantastic! The beds were not your typical hotel beds. Felt like I was at hom!

review.title: My new fav hotel
review.reviewText: I went with a few friends to celebrate a bday and although we were only in the hotel a few hours...I would def. recommend this hotel. The location and staff are great!!! And you can't beat the price. We parked in the valet parking garage across the street for half the price of westin parking.

review.title: Horrible experience. VERY noisy after 2 PM
review.reviewText: Horrible experience. Shouting in the halls after 2PM. Vacuuming hall at 3 PM.

review.title: A great place to stay downtown
review.reviewText:
I really liked my room. It was extremely quiet, which I appreciate because I have sensitive hearing. The view was nice and the service was prompt.

My only complaint was the bed. Not all that comfortable, given the expense of the room. I have a memory foam mattress at home, so maybe I'm just used to that, but the bed at the hotel felt like a wooden board over very wobbly springs.

review.title: Great hotel at Great location
review.reviewText: We stayed for 2 days. Staff was helpful for getting pointers to getting around. Great starbucks close by across the street. Room was very comfortable. Location is great for getting around popular stops for visitors (can walk to chinatown, little italy, market). Would definitely stay again...

review.title: Nice hotel if you want to stay in the downtown area
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, staff was very helpful. In fact my daughter got very sick on our trip and we needed to find a local doctor. The hotel referred us to a local doctor who saw us within 45 min of our call - he was very thorough, competent, convienent, helpful. I appreciated the help the hotel gave to us when we needed a doc.

review.title: Best hotel for pets and people who love organic food
review.reviewText: We loved our exprience there although parking was $50 for overnight parking we found a garage next door for $20 a big bargain. Duca the restaurant at the hotel was fantastic serves organic food from local farms too. Also get there for happy hour best kept secret in the city $5.50 for any mixed drinks now that's a bargain. Also used the gym and they had the best equipment. Took our dog with us and we did not have to pay a deposit. Love this place.

review.title: one of San Francisco's finest
review.reviewText: within walking distance of shopping

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The Westin had larger than average rooms for an SF hotel! Service was great, people were friendly and helpful. And of course we had the legendary Westin bed which was amazing!

review.title: Worth the Trip!!
review.reviewText: We were here celebrating with a nights stay, dinner and a jazz concert. The hotel staff was very friendly and met all of our request. The facility was clean and very pleasant.

review.title: Nice hotel and location - check in long - will not give any advice over the phone
review.reviewText: I called the Westin and asked for transportation advice. I was told that there is no public transportation to the hotel and the only option would be a taxi or their hotel shuttle ($55 a person one way). I spent a great deal of time on the internet trying to figure out the SF transportation systems. If you prefer to ride public transport and save your money like we do, the BART subway takes you from the airport to the Montgomery station for $8.50 and you are only a few blocks from the hotel. You can then buy a 3 day pass at the trolley station for $20 and ride all MUNI transport around the city (trolley,cable car, bus). After doing this research, I called back the Westin to confirm my plan for transport to the hotel and the clerk told me that they did not know anything about BART! We were able to easily get to the hotel, but at arrival there was a very long line of people waiting to check in. It was a looong wait with only two people checking in and each having some issue with their current guest. The manager would pop out of the back room once in a while without acknowledging the line or offering to assist. Our assumption was that this was the norm at the Westin SF. Once checked in, we really enjoyed the hotel. We were able to get restaurant advice from the staff, the room was nice with floor to ceiling windows and the area was convenient for late night dinners and walks after spending days touring the areas.

review.title: Not what I expected
review.reviewText: When I booked this room I was assured a deluxe room with a king size bed, when I checked in there was only a queen, this was not acceptable to us as both my husband & me are tall. The floor was wet where the minibar was, which was on the floor! The tile in the bathroom was dirty. When I tried to switch rooms I was told there was nothing else available as the hotel was booked. For the price I paid for this room, I expected a larger room with more space. To top it off I had to pay $48 for valet parking!! I would not recommend this hotel if your looking for a comfortable, relaxing, cleam room.

review.title: GREAT HOTEL FOR A GREAT PRICE
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay at the Westin Hotel. It was conveniently located and the price for a basic room was really good. They even upgraded our room without charging us for it. The only negative point was the restaurant food, which was expensive and not very good but San Francisco has tons of wonderful restaurants so I wouldn't worry about eating well.

review.title: Weekend in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I took my 10 and 6 year old grand kids to San Francisco for a long weekend. We loved our hotel and the location was great. We could walk to Union Square, and the South of Market complex with museums and a kids center. There was a California Pizza Kitchen right across the street which was perfect for them. The rooms are fairly spacious with floor to ceiling windows with views. Absolutely would stay there again!

review.title: Great visit to San Fran!
review.reviewText: The rooms were very nice, clean and what I generally expect when I stay in a Westin hotel. As is becoming the norm, not only is the Westin not offering complimentary Wi-Fi in the rooms, they charge for accessing Wi-Fi in the lobby, meeting rooms, etc. My internet connection at home is $35/month and the Westin charges $15/day! Ridiculous. It seems crazy to me that cheaper hotels like Holiday Inn, etc. can offer free Wi-Fi and these nicer hotels refuse to. Oh well.

review.title: Pretty Good
review.reviewText: Just look into the valet fee prior to booking the stay. For in/out privelages, it was $52 a day. Everything else about the stay was nice.

review.title: Minibar touch sensitive
review.reviewText:
Minibar is very sensitive, you touch you buy. Mine was not even plugged in so everything was warm. I plugged the fridge in. Drank/ate nothing and was charged $20.27
Apparently it's you touch you buy. 2 weeks later still have not resolved charge dispute.
Other than this it was a nice stay..
I was assured this would taken care of before I checked out, however this was not the case.

review.title: great view
review.reviewText: huge window opened to impressive cityscape

review.title: Great Location with little cuatomer service
review.reviewText: Slow moving front desk staff, and lack of assistance when my room was not ready and I needed to change from my travel cloths for a meeting. I was told to change clothes in the lobby bathroom which was far from ideal. Room was clean, and location is superb. If service is important I suggest Parc 55 down the street,

review.title: Wouldn't recommend
review.reviewText:
The room that I was guaranteed was not available. I requested 2 double beds, they only had a king bed and the option of a roll-away bed. They placed me on a higher floor as compensation, but it was an inconvenience to not have what I originally requested.

It was a Saturday night, my birthday, and hotel guests were complaining about the radio and loud noise at 10pm!!!!! Hotel staff threatened to "kick out" non-registered guests.

Parking was high priced. Would not recommend.

review.title: close to union square but expensive and poor valet service.
review.reviewText:
great, clean hotel and close to union square.
overnight valet was close to 45 dollars but there was a self parking garage close by that was half the cost. we just kept our car at the garage overnight and walked around during our stay at the hotel.
it has a decent view of the area from the room.
i would definitely go back.

review.title: Excellent, modern hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText:
I chose this hotel based on the Westin brand. I was very happy with my choice. The price was very reasonable, considering the high level of quality. I travel a lot, and this was my first stay in SF. I was happy with the location as well, there were plenty of restaurants and bars, and shopping areas in very short walking distance.

The best was extremely soft and comfortable. The 'clock-radio' allowed me to dock my iPhone, so I could listen to my own music. The bathroom was clean, modern and contemporary.

My only complaint would be the lack of free wifi in the room. I paid $15 for all day access. Not bad, but its 2010. Wifi should be free- everywhere.

review.title: If you're driving in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
There's a large self-park garage directly across the street from the hotel, providing affordable parking as opposed to extremely expensive valet parking charged by all downtown hotels.

The down side is that some rooms overlook the garage (ask for a room overlooking Yerba Buena Gardens.

review.title: Stay elsewhere next time
review.reviewText: Not at all what we expected from a high end hotel near Union Square San Francisco. At check in, we were told we needed to wait for check in of an hour, but they would call so that we could change clothes before our theater show. No call. I went to front desk again, since we now needed to have our bags held, and we ointed to the Bell Desk and told to just leave everything. The bags would not be put in our room when we returned later in the evening, we would need to retieve them. We did that, and found that no one knew where our bags were, so we needed to go back and just ppick them out ourselves. This is not a safe practice for holding bags, and not what I expect from a high end hotel. And... 1230pm the restaurant was closed for lunch, and apparently the bar too. I asked the Concierge if the bar was closed, he called someone who appeared but then disappeared. I expected service from the bar as we waited, and so did several other guests in the same situation. Saturday night, after returning from dinner, we tried the bar again, butnight bartender was uninterested too. It seemed as though a lot of business was being directed across the street. The room was comfortable, but not perfectly cleaned bathroom and no bath mat. And what is the 10 second candy bar cady about? Ten seconds and your room is charged for a candy bar if you pick it up to look at it? I think there are other high end hotels to stay with next time.

review.title: Total nightmare., worst hotel ever
review.reviewText:
It was a total nightmare.
I could not sleep any of the three nights.
The first night they put me near the electrical room (terrible noise)
The second I ask them to move me to a quite room, they put me between the Ice machine a teenage party that lasted until 5h30 AM.
The third night the ice machine.
When I ask the manager to move me to a room where I could sleep, he told me they were sold out and he could not help me.

review.title: Not satisfied
review.reviewText: they also take $100 from your account in which I did not like... They dont even do this in las Vegas.

review.title: Totally meets expectations.
review.reviewText: The location is extremely convenient for tourists. The staff are courteous and professional. The hotel quality meets our expectations (of a 4-star hotel). We mistakenly moved things around in the fridge and didn't realize that the items are set up for easy tabulation of costs, the phone to the service desk quickly corrected our record and we did not have to worry about paying for items we didn't use.

review.title: Parking Bait and Switch
review.reviewText: Parking a small sized Toyota truck and being charged for an over sized truck was sad. The room has seen better days. A remodel is over due. There were stains on the walls and carpet. Ventilation is poor.

review.title: Luxury at an affordable price
review.reviewText: This was my second stay at the hotel, two week-ends in a row. It was nice to see familiar faces. I got out of the Saturday conference early (around noon), and went to the check in to see if leave my bags there. I was delighted to learn that my room was ready and they let me check in early. Everyone from the doorman to the conceirge, to the cleaning staff to my cocktail server were a delight to deal with. The conceirge was most helpful getting me a reservation for dinner, and the doorman got me a cab lickey split. I'll be back soon!

review.title: always enjoy our stay!
review.reviewText:
Have stayed at this hotel thru all the name changes. Wonderful rooms.Wonderful views and great location. Walking distant to just about everything
The Westin has remodeled the restaurant and the lounge area. The lounge area has always been a unique and inviting area when it was the ANA and the ARGENT. However, the new remodel isn't as "glam" or inviting. We would fore go the busy city "hustle and bustle" just relax and enjoy the beautiful interior design with a glass of champagne. The lounge now, is much too stark and cold. Sometimes change is good...not so much this time. Find the interior designers that did the original design and bring them back....please!!

review.title: will go back
review.reviewText: Great Hotel,service was fantastic, great area and can't wait to go and stay again,simply in love with San Francisco

review.title: Great hotel and location. Staff very helpful. Rooms excellent.
review.reviewText: Only issue was with the bell men not friendly with holding baggage for later departure. Front desk said no problem but they acted as if it was bothersome. Actually had to go back and find own bag.

review.title: Best stay I have ever had in San Francisco and I go every year for the Fancy Food show.
review.reviewText: Stay was the best I have ever had in SF.

review.title: A Surprise Gem
review.reviewText:
While at first disapointed that we were staying at the "wrong" Westin, we came to be totally happy with this unexpected choice. The hotel was modern , bustling ,and the staff helpful. The location was excellent and was in walking distance of the Ferry Plaza , Sf MOMa ,and much more. The hotel was newly renovated so it had all modern touchs....flat screen TV and sufficient plugs for electrical equipment. While the room was small there was a large lounge area to sit and enjoy a good wine selection and a generously long "happy hour".
A real find for the price and location.

review.title: Well Placed in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel is well placed in Market Street and an easy walk to Union Square and major shopping malls. It is an unpretentious Westin with the type of service you would expect from this hotel chain. There was a lack of complimentary bathroom products including a shower cap which was surprising for this class of hotel but my booking was on the extremely competitive rate so this was not something to complain about.

review.title: Nice hotel - staff not as friendly as the Omni or the Meridien..
review.reviewText:
Clean, comfortable 4* hotel right of Market Street so easy for public transport options - loads of MUNI trains and buses less than three minutes away. Easy to get to the BART stations for airport too and it's only ten minutes from the Ferry Building so great for transport connections.

Hotel was as expected - staff fairly disappointing across the board after our experiences at the Omni and the Meridien where all staff - from check in, to cleaners, to porters - went out of their way to be friendly and go the extra mile with our two year old daughter. It wouldn't stop us staying there again, but it was a little disappointing to drink sparkling wine once you've tasted champagne!!

review.title: Great hotel except for...
review.reviewText: My stay was very pleasant. Nice, clean rooms and an elegant, modern overall atmosphere. However, for a place that charges so much for rooms they should relax their prices elsewhere. For example, they charge (exorbitantly in my opinion) for wifi access (~$14/day) and to use the computers in the business center. The prices at the in-hotel restaurant are offensive. $8 for a small bottle of Heineken, give me a break.

review.title: Overall great stay, only minor things to complain about
review.reviewText: I picked the Westin because of its location. I took BART from the airport and the hotel is really close to the Montgomery station. Also, tons of restaurants and shopping nearby. Check-in was a little slow. My room was tiny compared to the room I had the last time I stayed there. And it had a view of the parking garage. But for one night I really didn't care. Great bedding, great little reading area, Internet fast but expensive. Nice tea. Lighting in the bathroom was not sufficient.

review.title: Good SFO Location
review.reviewText: nice, friendly staff. clean, quiet rooms. good location for touring downtown

review.title: wonderful experience
review.reviewText: The hotel was fantastic, close to everything. The staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. Carlee was wonderful and helped make our vacation a fantastic experience.

review.title: nice
review.reviewText: nice

review.title: Poor Front Desk Service, But the Hotel is Good. Excellent Location.
review.reviewText: I have stayed in this hotel before when it was call Argent, the quality of service and facilities are well maintained. Room is clean is nice. Bed is very comfortable, comparing the Westin in Pasadena, CA, I still like Pasadena better. We had a little problem with the front desk manager when checking in. Over all this is one of the top rated hotels in SF for us. Rates are a little high, as for New Year, it's OK.

review.title: Nice hotel for the money
review.reviewText:
Hotel was nice, 2 blocks from BART station, one block from the streetcar so pretty convenient location.
Rooms are large, clean, and comfortable.

The only negatives were
1. That the service in the restaurant in the hotel was awful - in fact they refused to serve us because we did not order a full meal (we just came in for some snack/drink before goign back to the airport)!
2. The water pressure and temperature in the shower was not what i would expect (and I am not picky with these things at all!) The water pressure wsa rather weak and the temperature rather cold even on the hottest setting.

review.title: Nice hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is a lovely modern hotel located near market street. It is close to the bus route which is helpful. There is a starbucks and a CPK right across the street which was do convenient. As for the room, it was a good size and clean. There are floor to ceiling windows which allow a maximum view of the city. They also had an ihome in the room so I could charge my iPhone. I did have an issue with water leaking from the vent in the bathroom, but the hotel was able to fix it quickly. I would recommend the wastin San Francisco market street to anyone planning a trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Road Trip to SF
review.reviewText: The Westin SOMA was a very nice hotel. The staff is really friendly and helpful. The location is great, you're a block away from Union Square and the cable cars. The neighborhood was kept up and I had no problem when walking around with my girlfriends at night on the main streets. The room was comfortable and relaxing, bathroom was somewhat small. You are also very close to a bunch of cute little restaurants, I suggest you look up "Plouf", and you'll find a dozen restaurants in a secretive alley. I would recommend this hotel if you find a deal because you'll be paying $50 for parking night as well.

review.title: Rude Service, Mediocre Room, Great Location
review.reviewText: Our overall experience at this hotel was mediocre. We figured by going with a Westin in the Union Square area we could not go wrong. As soon as we arrived the gentleman at the check-in desk was rude in response to us nicely asking for early check-in. We checked our bags with the bell-hop and sat down in the lobby to figure out where we would go while we waited for a room to be ready. 15 minutes later another woman at the check-in then told us that the other gentleman gave us misinformation and in fact there was a room to check in to. We were given keys and were relieved to be able to settle in after our flight even though it was strange to have to then get our bags from the bellhop again. When we entered the room it was small with very low ceilings on a very low level of the high-rise hotel. We did not complain because at that point we were just happy to have been able to check-in early. We thought we were pretty much guaranteed to have a great experience because we've always had a lot of luck with Westins and it was in a great part of town. Ultimately the bed was comfortable and the location was great, but everything else outside of that was mediocre.

review.title: Excellent choice.
review.reviewText: The Westin Market Street is a great choice in San Francisco. Close to all the public transportation options, it is very convenient to all attractions. The staff was extremely professional and courteous. We had a few dealings with them under what could have been stressful situations but they resolved everything in an expert manner. The beds were extremely comfortable, the view from the 30th floor was fabulous looking right down 3rd street with views of Union Square and both bridges. Everything was in perfect working order and extremely clean.

review.title: Wonderful downtown experience
review.reviewText: I recently stayed at the Westin Market Street and found it to be a wonderful experience. The room had a wonderful view and was exceptionally clean. The bed was very comfortable. My girlfriend and I were looking for some restaurant recommendations and the concierge was very helpful in finding us a great seafood restaurant. I would definitely stay at the Westin the next time I go to San Francisco.

review.title: Very nice and warm hospitality
review.reviewText:
Very nice and warm hospitality; people are very kind to us
Very convenient location

review.title: Would like to return, with some cautions
review.reviewText: Overall, our stay at the Market Street Westin was very good and you can't beat the location for getting to Union Sq. the Embarcadero, the SFMOA, Metreon, etc. The only reservations I have are in two areas: Fed Ex shipping and spotty housekeeping. Housekeeping was good on some days and not on others. For example, a dirty glass was left in the room, the thermostat had a note on it to keep the room cool and when we returned it was set to 85 degrees and stifling. We used the wine glasses provide one day and they were never replaced. We had to repeatedly ask for extra towels, etc. Other days everything was clean, in order and exactly as we wanted it. On the Fed Ex, I dropped off a box on New Year's Eve. very early in the morning. I had hoped it would go out that day, or Monday at the latest--but it did not get sent until the following Wed--not acceptable

review.title: wish i good live there!
review.reviewText: LOCATION! This hotel is so close to everything. We walk our entire trip it was that close. The service was excellent. It was def. for a lot of business proffesional. I would def. go back!

review.title: Great Hotel, only a few niggles.
review.reviewText:
On checking in they upgraded the room, which was nice but for the connecting door which channelled noise in from the loud family in the next room. I went back down to the front desk and they could not have been more helpful in giving me an alternative room. This may have been the reason for the overcharging to my charge card, but upon realising their mistake they went above the call of duty to address the issue, both refunding the excess very quickly and cancelling a couple of charges. All of the staff I dealt with were helpful, friendly and accomodating, they were even very helpful with parking the motorcycle I had for a few days. The hotel is in a great location, with useful facilites nearby.

A few niggles let things down slightly, glasses would disappear from the room for some reason, meaning you'd to retrieve the ones from the bathroom and I wasn't impressed with the automatic snack tray and minibar charging. I didn't have any issues myself, there are warnings about items being charged to your room within seconds if anything was moved, and I didn't even think of opening the minibar fridge. It's fine if you're careful, but I could see a pile of grief coming if anything was knocked or picked up by mistake.

If I'm ever back in San Francisco I'd be more than happy to stay there again.

review.title: excellent hotel,
review.reviewText: Great location, staff are very friendly.

review.title: Excellent stay at The Westin
review.reviewText:
Excellent service. Nice rooms. Clean hotel. Upscale. Friendly staff. Close to almost all major attractions in SF. Highly recommended. Worth the money.

Beware, they charge $54 per day for parking with multiple entry. Comparable to almost all major hotels in SF.

review.title: Excellent hotel and location
review.reviewText: Conveniently located in downtown SF. Close to all the major stores and shopping centres and close to the BART and trams. Excellent hotel with friendly staff. The rooms are large and spacious with comfy king size beds. Good gym facilities on 4th floor. Highly recommended

review.title: Excellent stay!
review.reviewText: This was a beautiful hotel! It was close to everything - union sq., chinatown, wharf, etc! You can take any transportation just steps from the door. The hotel linens were beautiful and I had a very restful time there!

review.title: Great hotel for travel with dogs!
review.reviewText: Clean rooms, great housekeeping, beautiful views, very comfortable beds and linens. Would absolutely stay here again.

review.title: Wonderful stay in the heart of SF
review.reviewText: Had a great time during our stay. The hotel room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly. The hotel can also boast a great locale with nearby shopping and many restaurants to choose from.

review.title: Want to move into the hotel!
review.reviewText: Always a great experience and best trestment at a Westin.

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel, great location.

review.title: Westin Market Place, Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
Westin Market Street was a fantastic hotel, great location, ideal for attractions and shopping. Upon checkin we were upgraded and given free wifi for our 7 night stay. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Would not recommend flying Lufthansa nor United Airlines for this (London - San Francisco return), as these planes do not have individual tvs, even though its a long flight. The return on UA was better as the plane was new and we were given seats in the first row of economy, which were more spacious and ideal for seeing the tv also.

review.title: I'll stay there every time I'm in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Our trip was 3 days long, and although we were not at the hotel much, it was a great experience all around while we were there. The room was comfortable and spotless... no complaints. Before we left, we received a bill for items missing from the mini bar that were not taken on top of items that were actually taken. Upon checkout we brought this to the attention of the staff and instead of refunding us the charges for the mistaken items, she refunded us for everything! Awesome stay at The Westin. I love this place... the lobby, the lounge, the staff... Great experience I'm looking forward to again!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Very comfortable room, friendly staff, and the free wine tasting each evening was a great plus! Unfortunately, the wines were the same each night but free wine is good wine!

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Good Value, Good Location, will stay again.

review.title: Westin on 3rd off Market Street San Francisco
review.reviewText: The lobby was very welcoming and seasonally decorated - with a warm [has a fireplace] pleasant seating area just off the lobby. Staff very helpful and gracious. The concierge had several good tips regarding transportation and things to do. The room was quiet and the bed was luscious. The only thing that marred the experience was the business center and the method used to charge for copies and/or computer use.

review.title: San Fran trip
review.reviewText: Hotel is relatively new and in good shape. Not as convenient as being located in Union Square, but it was walkable to most sites.

review.title: Would Go Back
review.reviewText: The hotel looked exactly as the photos on the website. The room was beautiful and spacious although I had a view of a parking garage,and the roof of another building. My heat was not working, but in less than 5 minutes an engineer was at my door to fix the problem which he did. The only disappointment was that the website said 24 hr room service which was very important in my decision making on choosing a hotel, yet, room service stopped at 10:30 pm. Also in trying to get a ride to the airport for my return trip, the woman at the front desk said that I was too late in asking, and proceeded to explain how to take public transportation which I felt was ridiculous even with just carry on luggage.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel!
review.reviewText:
The Westin on Market St is a wonderful place to stay in San Francisco. It's centrally located and near several tourist attractions.
The staff at the Westin is very friendly and accomodating, they will go above and beyond to provide an excellent stay. I've been staying at this property for over 10 years, and it just keeps getting better.
The rooms are well appointed, the beds are FANTASTIC. There is a nice lounge and resturant on site and room service is also very good.

I would reccomend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco, it a beautiful property and an excellent value.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: This hotel is very clean and nice. We had a great view from our floor.

review.title: Excellent downtown stay
review.reviewText: Great clean downtown location. Great friendly staff and excellent hotel service. Very central (within a few blocks)for Cable car, Street car and BART.

review.title: Westin Market St, SF
review.reviewText:
The location is fabulous (easy to BART, shops, Union Sq, and the cable cars, the very heart of the city), and the hotel is clean and well-serviced.

The general problem with the Westin chain is that a number of things are extras there - and quite pricey. Internet access - $15 a day, breakfast no included (and expensive in the hotel), but here one can eat out a few steps from it for a fraction of the cost. Didn't make much difference for me, as I was on business, paying OPM, but not so good for holidaymakers.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is very close to Union Square and all the boutiques nearby. There's a bus stop right across the street that takes you anywhere in SF. It is also pretty quiet since it's off Market Street. Overall, it's quite convenient.

review.title: Very comfortable and close to downtown.
review.reviewText: Great hotel, close to alot.

review.title: great location, fantastic view
review.reviewText: Our room was located by the elevators so there was some noise when trying to get to sleep. But overall a great place.

review.title: great location and staff
review.reviewText: we have stayed at this hotel many times and have always had a good experience. the location can't be beat and the "heavenly" beds are great. the staff is always helpful.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: Great hotel, service was excellent and rooms were clean. However, make sure you do not get a room by the elevators. You can actually hear the elevators moving up and down and it can get quite loud. We managed to sleep through it since we were pretty exhausted every night.

review.title: San Francisco was great and i would go back and use the same hotel or hotel chain .
review.reviewText: We found the Hotel people very friendly the Door man where nice and informative . Glad to be there .

review.title: Nice downtown hotel
review.reviewText: Pleasant hotel although the first concierge we spoke with seemed a little condescending in his tone. The directions he gave us were inaccurate. The room had a king size bed and was on the small size as was the bathroom. It was colder than we thought, especially since we used public transportation. I lived there years ago and had forgotten how many homeless people there are! The bed was very comfortable.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: I highly recommend the Westin

review.title: Money's Worth
review.reviewText: Did not get the room advertised at the rate. The rooms on the website look great but then we get stuck in a small corner room overlooking offices.

review.title: Tim
review.reviewText: GReat!

review.title: Loved the Westin
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay here and had a wonderful view of San Francisco. We didn't have enough towels in our room, but housekeeping was quick to respond and solve that issue. The bellmen were full of information and the concierge were great with directions, what to do and where to go. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Not the best value in SF
review.reviewText: We have stayed in several different hotels in the downtown SF and Union Square areas. We chose the Westin Market due to the location and the fact that we have had good luck at Starwood Hotels in the past. We reserved an upgraded room which indicated it would be on a higher floor, but that did not happen. Also, the snack tray was not stocked and there was no soap for the shower/tub. Giving that the room rate was quite high, we expected more and were left feeling that we would have been much better off at a small boutique hotel as we have done very well in SF at those locations. Bottom line, find a smaller boutique hotel with good reviews for the next trip.

review.title: Great Place!
review.reviewText: Walking through the revolving door and seeing the decor of the lobby gives one the sense that this hotel was going to be a good one. And, indeed, it was. The staff was extremely friendly, helpful and accomodating in finding good places to eat around the area, giving directions to places, attending to our room needs, or even just hailing a cab. The room itself was very clean and nice: the king size bed had a lot of pillows, the sheets were fresh, and the mattress felt great! The leaf shape soap was a nice touch and the shower felt awesome. The hotel was an easy walking distance to union square or a short cab ride to places in SF. It's also nice that you're close to a BART/MUNI station. I definitely wouldn't mind staying here again!

review.title: would definitely go back.
review.reviewText: Excellent location, and a very helpful staff. A couple of things are a bit over the top, such as the parking--it just seems that when parking costs nearly half of what the room was, that is a bit much. Other than that, really enjoyed the rooms, the views, and again, an extremely helpful and friendly staff.

review.title: Great location and comfortable
review.reviewText: Generally very pleased, only negative thing would be that the service was that of a three star rather than 4 star e.g. charge minibar when none taken (can explain and get money back but really sould not happen in four star hotel).

review.title: San Fran Trip
review.reviewText: This was a exceptional location close top all local trasportation in a good area.

review.title: OK if you just need a homebase to explore San Francisco
review.reviewText: We went here on vacation and found this hotel to be focused for business travelers. It made a good starting location to explore San Francisco (convenient to BART and MUNI) but that is about it. The price for wireless internet was a little crazy so be prepared to find a starbucks if you don't want to pay that. The room was clean (except for some chinese left in the minibar fridge) and they did bring us up a personal mini-fridge which was nice. The workout room felt a little dated. I would recommend this hotel only if you only intend on sleeping here and your main focus is exploring San Francisco.

review.title: OK but expected a Best Westin to be a bit more up-market
review.reviewText: No real issues with this hotel, but for a 4 Star it was at the basic end of the scale. I would go for more up-market next time.

review.title: Convenient, but on top of subway trains
review.reviewText: We stayed on the 26th floor of the hotel, but we can still hear the squeaking of the subway trains underneath through the ventilation ducts. It was not loud, though. The big window, from ceiling to floor, is impressive, if you are not afraid of height. The view is good...you can see the harbour, the fog, and the distant streets on the slopes. Close to Chinatown and subway stations. No swimming pool, though. Computers for clients' use were not working the evening I wanted to use the internet. Staff is courteous. Environment is clean. All in all, a four-star hotel with a cheaper price. Again, a good choice, if you don't mind the distant trains!

review.title: Good hotel, good location!
review.reviewText: The overall quality of this property was impressive; it was at a pretty good location for seeing the main sights, even though it is located in the business district. I also liked having a convenience store and pharmacy around the corner, not to mention a very upscale mall with a movie theater. I would gladly stay at this location again.

review.title: San Francisco's finest
review.reviewText: From the time we embarked at the hotel until we left the service and atmosphere was outstanding. I hadn't been back to San Francisco in years but found that the hotel and its location also contributed to a very wonderful stand. I will definately return

review.title: Comfort and Location
review.reviewText: The rooms at the Westin are clean and well furnished. The bed was excellent. Not to firm and not soft. The location is close to everything and the staff was great.

review.title: Nice place, great location.
review.reviewText: I recently stayed at this property with my fiancee and would categorise it as being great value for money in a super location just off Market Street. The Westin is clean and comfortable with good amenities. The location is first rate, just metres from San Francisco's main tram and bus line that leads from Fisherman's wharf right up to the Castro. It is also just a few blocks from Chinatown. We would certainly stay there again.

review.title: Lives upto Westin reputation
review.reviewText: Was happy with the hotel. Originally thought it would be too far from Union Square but was pleasantly surprised how close it was to walk there. The beds are AMAZING! Usually have trouble sleeping the first night when travelling, but not here (out like a light). Only complaint was a bag containing a pair of socks was left behind from previous occupant that was not removed before we check in (ewwww)

review.title: Great View from the upper floors
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, quick check in, friendly service. Our room had an incredible view of downtown, Alcatraz, and a partial view of the GG Bridge and the Bay Bridge. Its only two blocks from Union Square which was great for shopping.

review.title: Covenience
review.reviewText: The Westin is in a very convenioent locatoion from the standpoint of being able to reach any destination that one would have in mind. The staff was pleasent to deal with, and we will definetly stay there again.

review.title: excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Great place! Beautiful room .... Wonderful View!

review.title: you get what you pay for...
review.reviewText: It was quite affordable, but the room was small, walls are thin, bathroom smelled funny. For the price, I can't complain too much, but I would never pay full price for that room.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Westin is located off of Market Street, within easy walking distance to downtown shopping and theaters and within easy access to public transportation.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: The beautiful hotel is conveniently located. The concierges are very friendly and helpful. The room is clean and well maintained but very noisy eviroment.

review.title: Nice, but parking is expensive.
review.reviewText: The hotel was terrific, but you are charged quite a lot for parking--$48 + per night.

review.title: My stay at the Westin San Francisco-Market St.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice-clean,comfortable and a great location!!! This hotel is in a great location you can use public transportation and save money during the day and then just take cabs at night. The room service food was delicious!!! (and right on time!!) I would definitely stay there again!!!

review.title: Westin Hotel Market Street San Francisco Review
review.reviewText: Great location - across the street from Starbucks, California Pizza Kitchen and a host of shopping and eateries within a few blocks! I stayed in a suite which had plenty of room both in the bedroom and living area. Requested extra blankets at 11:30pm and it arrived within 5 minutes! A little pricey but definitely worth every penney..!

review.title: Nickle and dime
review.reviewText: This Westin strives to project an aura of luxury, but it is truly pedestrian. Rooms are small with minuscule bathrooms. Beds are comfortable, but the same cannot be said of the only reading chair. Every additional item, including local phone calls, entails an extra charge and merely moving one of the items in the minifridge or the goodies tray automatically adds a (huge) charge to the bill - requiring added time at checkout to permit verification that they were not consumed. We'll find true luxury in S.F. the next time we travel there.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the location of the hotel. We could walk to Union Square to shop or catch the train to any part of the town. I would stay at this hotel again.

review.title: impressed but not great
review.reviewText: convenient location with easy to access all sightseeing places, shopping centre & Union Square. Very comfortable bed and soft pillow and blanket. Will stay again next time in SF.

review.title: A very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: We had a short (3 day) stay in San Francisco and found The Westin San Francisco Market Street perfect. It was close to the central city and the trams making walking around a great option. The hotel and our room were perfect. Great big comfortable bed (we did ask for a King), plenty of room and all services provided, with the exception of the internet, we had to pay separately for that, something we have rarely had to do in other hotels. Felt that was a bit mean spirited. But overall a great hotel and we would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Could not have asked for more
review.reviewText: We decided to go San Francisco for our one year wedding anniversary, and we could not have asked more. We had such great time. When we first walked into our hotel there was 5 min wait to check in. No biggy. The first room we got it was on the 15th floor and we had view of balcony with pipes. It wasn't the greatest. I called front desk and within 5 minutes are room got changed and we got room on 27th floor. With the most beautiful view. It was incrediable. I didn't think they would have changed our rooms so quickly; My husband and I were surprised. Our hotel was walking distance from everything. I loved it, for our first time in San Francisco we had no problems finding out way around. Will be back again.

review.title: Very Comforting
review.reviewText: Its location is great and offers everything you need. Except parking is $50 extra.

review.title: It was great can't wait to go back, Thank you
review.reviewText: Rooms are clean good service could not ask for anything better, Thank you again.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel & rooms. Very convenient!

review.title: Overall satisfactory experience
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located. The front desk is very friendly and helpful in helping me deliver the flower to my room prior to my visit. The room is clean and well maintained. However the comforter is not comfortable. It gets too warm at night but when you remove the comforter, it gets too cold.

review.title: Amazing
review.reviewText: I was extremely impressed with the Westin and the hotel service was superb. I will definitely recommend the Westin to friends.

review.title: Location, Location ,Location!!!
review.reviewText: Great location. We came to SF to see a Giants game. I brought my son to the city for the first time. We had a great stay. There were several problems with the room, one being the bathroom fan didn't work, and some delamination of the entry door. I was suprised to notice these problems in such a nice hotel. We were in walking distance to everything. AT&T park was about 6 blocks away, and Chinatown and little italy were not far at all. Market street has plenty of public transportation just 1 block from the hotel. Just across the street is the Hearst parking garage, you can park for $20.00 for 24hrs. Expedia got us a fantastic rate. The beds are heavenly by simmons very nice. comp news paper. I will stay here again.

review.title: Not impressed at all.
review.reviewText: Not worth the money. I've stayed at better Quality Inns for a fraction of the price. Also, had to pay $48.00 per night to park our rental car at the hotel. Our room was very small and nothing special. Hotel is all pomp and no substance. One plus, the concierge was very helpful.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because of the location and for the fitness facilities. Both were excellent! We would recommend this hotel, and can't wait to go back.

review.title: perfect City getaway
review.reviewText: great central location with easy walking to Chinatown, Union Square and the waterfront areas. We found it good value, but know in advance the parking doesn't come cheap...

review.title: Late Night Check In
review.reviewText: I was traveling and arrived at the Hotel at 3 AM. The check in was smooth and welcoming.

review.title: 4-Star hotel amenities but charges for WIFI internet access!
review.reviewText: Most other 4-Star (or less) hotels and even regular motel rooms along Lombard St offer FREE WIFI INTERNET CONNECTION. It's a basic need of life today for business and personal use. To charge for it while paying 4-Star hotel rates is abusive- exploiting and taking advantage of this basic need.

review.title: Great hotel to be in on vacation in downtown San Fransisco
review.reviewText: The hotel is well loacted very close to all the tourist visitng areas, lots of eating places and above all very safe to walk around at all times of the day or night. Also very proximate to the financial district and most offices in downtown. Made affordable by expedia. thanks for a great vacation in San Fransisco. Would want to come one more time. R Ragunath

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Located just off Market Street it gave great access to local transport(Buses, trams, BART etc). Hotel was very stylish from the Lobby to the beautiful room with its full length window, was only on 8th floor so didnt have great view. Didn't have much contact with staff however Reception were friendly & helpful while porters and concierge not so good. Easy 20 min walk to A&T Park for baseball. Found it good value for quality of Hotel and only slightly off Union Square.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful bed and a very nice hotel with a great location. If you're driving and don't want valet parking they have an underground car park at the back of the hotel that's convenient, friendly and reasonable - $25 per 24 hours. Avoid the other rogues in the street nearby who wanted $21 a day - 40 hours was 3 days in their book - and your car wasn't accessible.

review.title: Close
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine, better price than others nearby and I believe just as nice. Good bar, great location, close to convention center and mass transit.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Loved my stay at the Westin San Francisco. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The building is clean, beautiful, and it's at a great location. I highly recommend it.

review.title: Would Go There Again
review.reviewText: Definetly would recommend this hotel. It was clean, the staff was helpful, and it was close to transportation for all the touristy spots.

review.title: Pleasant Stay & Helpful Concierge
review.reviewText: We stayed here for four nights over the Labour Day weekend. It was a great location to explore the city from. The concierge was very helpful in recommending great restaurants for dinner. The only issue was the small size of the shower/WC. The sink and vanity was outside the bathroom, but the shower and WC was in one small room. It would be nice to see them combine the two together and have a larger feeling bathroom.

review.title: Excellent hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Very impressed with The Westin Market St. I was able to check-in early (very good after a long flight) and was even upgraded. Very quiet room in a central location, close to shops and transport (train, buses and cable car stops). I also got a great rate on Expedia. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

review.title: Wonderful place to stay;central and cozy
review.reviewText: GREAT place to stay - central to everything. We were upgraded to a high floor and it was super quiet.. can't say enough about the cleanliness and staff ...very courteous and helpful! thanks!

review.title: great location, great price, very comfortable!
review.reviewText: no complaints at ALL! for once a GREAT mini-bar too...not just lame over-priced stuff. definitely would recommend this hotel in every aspect.

review.title: Highly impressed
review.reviewText: This hotel was great. Stayed one night as a stop-over on the way home and was very impressed. The room was stunning - clean and very well furnished. Large bathroom. Comfortable bed and sunny room. Friendly staff. Opposite starbucks :)

review.title: this was a bad choice
review.reviewText: I reserved a premium room and was surprised that there was no chair in the room - only a bed and desk like a motel. however the view was great. i requested a chair and received a dining chair! not at all what i had in mind. The bathroom fan cannot be controled, so it made noise all night. I will not stay there again. Also, i would recommend that the hotel disclose the parking fee of $54/day on the website.

review.title: Great Hotel and Super Location
review.reviewText: Convenient location to get to shopping, the Cable Car routes.

review.title: Family Stay at The Westin San Francisco Market Street
review.reviewText: My family and I were very satisfied with this hotel. The rooms were clean and spacious. We had rooms on the 22nd floor and the views were spectacular. I could see the Golden Gate Bridge, Union Square and the Bay from my room! The location is ideal; it is near a Bart Station, Union Square and is walking distance to the Bay, Chinatown etc. The entire city is a close cab ride away.

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: no complaints at all

review.title: EXCELLENT
review.reviewText: EXCELLENT

review.title: Great Service!
review.reviewText: I had a great stay at this hotel. I was really impressed with the staff and how helpful everyone was. We got an upgraded room for free and their concierge held our luggage for the afternoon after our stay even though we had checked out of the hotel already. Pretty cool! :)

review.title: Westin Market Street is great
review.reviewText: stayed here for a long weekend with my sister Aug 20 - 23/09. I had gotten a great rate through Expedia but wasn't sure what to expect. Check in was quick and when we asked if we could have 2 queen beds instead of a king, the clerk easily made the change. She did say that it's a little noisier since it's right beside the elevator. I could hear the elevator but it was more background noise than anything so it didn't bother my sleep. The beds were super comfortable, we had plenty of towels (and more were brought up quickly when we called housekeeping)and the bathroom, although not that big, was clean and the shower worked well. It was nice to have complimentary toiletries as well as a coffee maker in the room. The temperature of the room was comfortable. We didn't get to the complimentary wine tasting but it looked like it was busy. The location of the hotel is very convient to Market Street, the cable cars, the street cars, and the BART. I would definitely recommend this hotel as a comfortable, affordable place to stay in San Francisco!

review.title: Had a very pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Housekeeping services of this hotel is outstanding. The location is quite central and everything is within walking distance (Union Sq, Chinatown, Embarcadero, MOMA etc). The only complaint I have is the extremely poor Internet connection for which they charge a daily rate of $14.95. For a 4-star hotel and a city such as San Fran, that's inexcusable! Fortunately, I was there on leisure and not business. I wouldn't recommend business travelers who rely on Internet connections to stay here. But if you're here to just have a good time and Internet access is not an issue, then this is an excellent hotel to stay in!

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Car parking expensive, public carpark 50% cheaper nearby. One member of restaurant staff in the morning was unhelpful and rude, exception to the rule in the Hotel. The hotel was well placed for exploring the city and easy access to freeways. The hotel was clean and efficient. Reception staff were exceptionally helpful.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Staying at this Westin made for easy access to affordable overnight parking across the street at the Hearst garage. We were then able to walk to dinner at Belden Place, and walk to the Ferry Building for breakfast and the Saturday morning Farmer's Market.

review.title: Westin Market San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel is well situated, close to major shopping and Union Square. Our only negative comment is that they charge for internet service. The reception staff is friendly and check-in was a breeze.

review.title: Great stay in San Fran
review.reviewText: The Westin on Market Street proved to be a great location for a combination of vacation and business. It is easy to reach by BART and on the main lines for city trains and buses. Hotel staff were outstanding and the room very nice.

review.title: Heavenly Beds....
review.reviewText: The room was beautiful, the beds are lovely to sleep in and the location was very good. If I have any complaint it would be that the concierge was not very helpful and didnt know much about the city and suggestions on what to see and do there....

review.title: What you can except from Westin
review.reviewText: We stayed here August 2009 for 2 nights and were very impressed. Condition and cleanliness was what you can expect from other Westin hotels, which is much above par. Considering we got a good deal on the hotel, it was more than worth it to stay here. We ate at the restaurant downstairs also, which to our surprise was great. The food was great and our server Ethan was awesome as he even treated us to a glass of wine and desert for our anniversary. If we're back in San Francisco we would pick this hotel again.

review.title: Clean, safe, convenient hotel in heart of the City.
review.reviewText: Very business-like approach. Good amenities. Expedia pricing made this a good value for our 3-night stay. Convenient to BART and MUNI systems.

review.title: Excellent place to stay
review.reviewText: Convenient location to everything San Francisco has to offer. Everything about this hotel was perfect.

review.title: ALL STARS ALL AROUND
review.reviewText: EVERYONE FROM THE SWEET, HARDWORKING HOUSEKEEPER TO THE INFORMATIVE CONCIERGE WAS JUST FULL OF PLEASANT WARMTH AND HAPPINESS. THEY ENJOY WHAT THEY DO AND THEY ARE GOOD AT IT. YOU GUYS ARE GREAT! I LOVE THE NO SMOKING...IT HELPS FILTER OUT ALL THESE CARCINOGENS...I WAS SO RELAXED. THANK YOU.

review.title: Absolutely will go back!
review.reviewText: The room was very comfortable. Not the cleanest, there was a bag of cheetos from the last visitor still in the room. The staff extremely helpful and so nice. The porter was exceptional! Beautiful hotel inside and out. My only grip is that parking was a bit steep. But I guess in the city, it is every where and you pay for the security of your car being in the hotel lot.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is very conveniently located and is well maintained. This was our second stay at this property and we would go back.

review.title: Fine Experience, Great Location
review.reviewText: Parking is overpriced, and rooms are small, but, that's to be expected. Overall, the hotel was nice, and had a great location

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel last year around the same time (August) and have always been impressed with the service and recommendations the staff make with regards to restaurants, sites to visit and visitor attractions. The hotel is very central and within walkable distance to all central amenities which is why we love the location. Our room was a good size with good views and lots of light. There is an adequate fitness room for those fitness buffs. My only concern was with the bathroom which is small and the shower/shower curtain was not clean when we arrived - yuk.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The Westin San Francisco Market Street is a nice hotel in a great location. The people and the service was great. The only complaint would be the workout facility being too small and very stuffy.

review.title: Great views - dirty windows!
review.reviewText: Stayed at end of a trip - this hotel was a great location and the room was excellent but the piece de resistance, the floor to ceiling windows giving views out to San Francisco, was spoiled by being filthy! Desperately needed a good clean. Other than that I'd fully recommend a stay at this hotel. Very courteous staff.

review.title: The Westin is great!
review.reviewText: The beds were heavenly! Everything was great. I recommmend it!

review.title: Beautiful hotel, but some front desk girl was not so nice.
review.reviewText: My husband, son and I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. Our room was beautiful and comfortable. The house cleaning staff was really nice, but unfortunately one of the front desk girls was not very nice. I'm sure there is one of these people everywhere. Also, the parking per day at the hotel is outrageously expensive in my opinion. We parked there one day and then parked our car in a public lot nearby the rest of the time and saved half the amount.

review.title: enjoy the hotel San Fran was great
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time a the hotel. The room service was prompt. and the breakfast we had in the resturant was excellent thought pricy. There was only one problem and that was with the consigniere services which were horrible. We called them twice and they never return our calls.

review.title: Always a great place to stay
review.reviewText: I've stayed here before and always find it to be terrific. Great location, great service and great rooms.

review.title: Westin Market Street
review.reviewText: Excellent location, great rooms and friendly service. Easy to get to from the airport using BART. The stop was only two blocks away. Definitely recommend the hotel.

review.title: Wont be back
review.reviewText: Very dissappointng. The snack bar in the room charged you if you just picked something up,and then put it back. No sign saying anything about that except inside the refrigerator.Had to call front desk twice to make sure I wasn't charged. Payed 15.00 a day for wireless and lost my connection several times. Called manager and he asked me if I had called the tech number. I told him for 15.00 a day the wireless should work and I wasn't on vacation to call a tech line. He did credit my bill. Also, we booked a tour with the concierge and when we went to tour location they had no record of our reservation. Took sveral phone calls to receive credit on our credit card. Overall, very dissappointing. Will not return.

review.title: Great Hotel for the Price
review.reviewText: This hotel is very conviently located in downtown San Francisco. I would stay there again. We paid a little extra for a high floor which was debatable since we didn't spend much time in the room. Overall I was very satisfied with the value.

review.title: parking is expensive
review.reviewText: we stayed at this hotel because it was centrally located and it was a good deal compared to all other hotels. but - do not park at the hotel - it is outrageously expensive. park across the street yourself! the front desk staff is not very friendly and the elevator stopped at every floor because there were so many people staying there. the tv was awesome - the beds were comfortable - and the doorman was cute.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: This hotel was awesome. We were upgraded from a regular King standard room to a Grand Deluxe room on the 23rd floor, for no extra charge. The view was great! The only thing I would say is that the bathroom was a bit small. But, everything else was top quality. The bed was extremely comfortable...didn't want to get out of it in the morning! The hotel was rated at 4 stars, but I would definitely give it a 4.5.

review.title: Fantastic Location!
review.reviewText: This was our first time in San Francisco and we couldn't have asked for a better location! The hotel room was very comfortable, and perfect for the business travellor. We never used any of the hotel amenities, but loved that they were available. We could walk everywhere we needed to go. The hotel was a block an a half away from the Bart and half a block from buses, streetcars and a couple of blocks to where the cable cars ran. We were also 8 blocks or so from the ferry terminal. There were great restaurants very close to the the hotel as well.

review.title: Not Impressed had to pay for internet connection
review.reviewText: I originally chose the Westin for its proximity to the Moscone and the great beds they have.....well I was disappointed regarding the beds, I can only guess that they are not the same across the entire chain. Don't get me wrong it was comfortable but not what I have been used to at the Westins. Then to top it off they charge for Internet connections (14$USD/day) and don't have a business center....so not top of my list for the next trip

review.title: Great location; front desk service is mediocre
review.reviewText: Remember the wine service from 5:00 - 7:00 pm daily is only during the week; we were not impressed when they did not offer the service during the week-ends. This is one of the reasons why we chose this hotel over the other 4 star accommodations we were contemplating. Needless to say, we were disappointed this feature was not provided during the week-end. Front desk service is okay. Room service and cleanliness is excellent however, as well as the location.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Everything was great, from the minute we checked in (we were given an upgrade at no charge)to the friendly valet when we left. We walked everywhere we went, Embarcadero, Fisherman's Wharf and AT&T Park. Service was great and all the staff were friendly. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to SF.

review.title: Great location, great night life
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with a great view right in the middle of the San Francisco city life we walked to a great restaurant a fun bar and we able to walk back to our hotel all in one.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel has a great location. It is near every place you want to go specially if you like shopping. The rooms are great and you sleep very well. I'm sure I will go back

review.title: No Comment
review.reviewText: No Cmment

review.title: The Hotel is central to everything that I needed.
review.reviewText: The Westin Hotel was excellent value, efficient and polite staff and we had a very enjoyable stay. I would highly recommend to anyone including business travellers and I will be back next visit to San Francisco.

review.title: Not too much
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and very close to numerous attractions. The staff had great suggestions to great places to eat and assisted with everything.

review.title: it was comfortable
review.reviewText: this was not the standard I am use to in a Westin hotel. However it was clean and the bed was very comfortable.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Hotel and rooms were nice and clean. Loved that everything was within walking distance. everyone was nice and helpfull with any questions I had. lots of resturants to choose from, can't go hungry in this town.

review.title: Would use this hotel again
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a very central position and very close to shops and transport links. The staff were helpful and friendly.
