Our room was on 28th floors and had excellent view over the city and had very little traffic noise. I would recommend this hotel for a visit to San Francisco.

review.title: Pictures are a Sham
review.reviewText: I looked at the pictures of the hotel rooms at the Westin. We stayed in a room with a king sized bed. That was all that fit in the room. Not sure if it was due to being a corner room, but it was small. Loved being in San Fransisco but the room left something to be desired.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great choice in the heart of the district.

review.title: Great Deal!
review.reviewText: The beds were Awsome!

review.title: Unattentive Staff, Great Facility
review.reviewText: Service from front desk staff and concierge took forever. During check-in, a line of 10-12 guests formed, with only 2 hotel employees managing the check-in. This might have been okay, but one employee was completely out of commission chatting with a hotel guest about world travel, art, and food preferences. We were second in line and it took almost 30 minutes to check in. Who knows how long the back of the line waited! After an exhausting flight, this wasn't a welcome first impression of the hotel. The gym facilities are fabulous and the hotel is generally conveniently located and well furnished.

review.title: Wonderfull stay except..
review.reviewText: My only complaints were that we were placed in a corner room that was small and we were a 1 block away from the fire station. The other rooms of our traveling companions were much bigger (tip: request a room with two double beds.) Unfortunately, since we were so close to the fire station we heard the sirens throughout the night.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is right in the middle of everything you want to explore in San Francisco. Staff was extremely courteous even with the huge influx of people on Friday for the Gay Rights Parade. I would definitely go back.

review.title: We WILL be back to this hotel
review.reviewText: An excellent hotel close to both the financial and tourist parts of town. It is five minute walk from the tram terminus and three minutes to the BART.

review.title: Hidden Cost
review.reviewText: Service and food were very average, while being expensive. Valet parking was almost half the amount of the room rate, that was a surprise. You can save with Expedia on room, but the hotel will get you with excessive cost for parking, food and drink. However, good location for walk to San Francisco Giants ATT Park.

review.title: Great quality
review.reviewText: Size and quality of room great.

review.title: Westin Market Street
review.reviewText: I recently stayed at the Westin on Market Street. I was impressed with their service and the room they offered. I stayed there for 4 days and I did not come across anything that I can complain about. The location is great and is next shopping malls, trains stations and tourist attraction. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to SFO wanting to stay in quality accommodation reasonably priced. I would also like to thank the staff for making my stay as comfortable.

review.title: Super Time!
review.reviewText: A great stay, very convenient to everything San Fran. has to offer. We stayed for 5 nights, and were always pleased. Have to say that eating at the hotel was a little pricey. Great spot "La Boulangarie" just past 3rd on Market ALSO check out California Pizza Kitchen across the street, wonderful!

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: The beds were very comfortable, the room was clean, the staff was friendly, overall very nice.

review.title: Great Hotel, Service, Amenities
review.reviewText: My dog, Sandy, and I were welcomed with open arms. I loved the "good feeling" I had in the hotel. Everyone seemed as though I were the only person there and they just wanted to make my stay as great and memorable as possible. They were wonderful to my Sandy and made him feel welcome too. Thank you for such a wonderful experience. I will definitatly stay at the hotel again.

review.title: Would definitely recommend and would use again
review.reviewText: We were very happy with the location, both for shopping and easy tourist access and staff assistance. would stay there again.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel is very clean and you feel very safe. Rooms are more than big enough and service is prompt and attentive to your needs

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is located right near union square - about a 2 minutes walk. It is very convenient for public transportation - lots of restaurants and shops close by. The rooms were comfortable - the beds were great. I would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Friendly and knowledgeable concierge
review.reviewText: Hotel was top notch. Good location. Great value. Particularly impressed by helpful advice from concierge with regard to local restaurant scene.

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: This was an ideal location after going to a Giants game.

review.title: Relaxing Time in SF
review.reviewText: The Westin SF Market Hotel was just lovely and the location perfect for sightseeing. We could walk or catch the F Line to the Warf/Ferry Building and also to Hayes Street - which is especially super. Back to the Westin - the room was clean and quiet and best of all were the staff - front desk, service, etc. Everyone one was very helpful. Definitely would stay there again.

review.title: Planning to Return
review.reviewText: This was a fantastic experience, especially considering the value. We had a huge King bed with sumptuous down comforter and lots of pillows. It was very comfortable and the bath was also very nice. There was internet in the room although we did not use it. We had a lovely view of a church, the room was large, and everyone was very polite.

review.title: great location, nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in the down town, all the attractions are just a stone throw away.

review.title: Very beautiful room but excessive charges for 'extras' which are not extras in other hotels
review.reviewText: Front desk advice on places to visit and eat was fantastic. Beautiful room but in my 3 week stay in America and Canada no other hotel charged for in-room use of telephone if international card was used and every other hotel offered free internet on a hotel desk top computer. I think $7.50 per 15 minutes, is excessive for use of the internet when every other hotel I visited, use of the internet was free and untimed! Also, $1 surcharge per phone call regardless of whether the number was answered, is extremely excessive when the phone was in the room! No other hotel charged such a surcharge! I paid a hefty price to stay at the hotel for 2 nights and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay - it was very comfortable, but for the price, the extra charge for the use of internet and the telephone was surprising and I will mention this negative to any recommendation I make of your hotel. Dont be too greedy!

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: It was a good hotel, it's very well located

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The bathroom was so small it was impossible to turn around without banging into a wall, toilet or shower stall. No hooks to hang towels or clothing in bathroom. No refrigerator or microwave. Items in mini-bar very expensive.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great room, great location.

review.title: Great experience at the Westin SF Market Street
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel "blindly" based on its Market Street location...we were going up to visit our son in college, and rather than stay in his studio apartment, decided a hotel would be better for everybody! We've stayed at Westin hotels before and loved them, so this was my first choice. We LOVED this hotel. You cannot beat the location if you're thinking of taking commuter trains/buses, and you cannot beat the Heavenly beds for comfort...added bonus, we had a HUGE TV in our room! Great patio/bar area outside, Starbucks across the street, Walgreens around the corner...very, very convenient location and a great place to stay in the city.

review.title: Excellent hotel, excellent location
review.reviewText: Like so many other Westin properties, this one lived up to what you would expect from a Westin Hotel. The central downtown location was the real advantage. Only downside was the lack of hot tub.

review.title: A great place to stay
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel based on proximity to the Moscone Convention Center (2 blocks away). It is very centrally located, 2 blocks from BART, and quiet, being not directly on Market St. but rather on 3rd St. For tourists, the Powell St. cable car line ends just a couple of blocks away as well. There are many restaurants, a movie theatre, and the SF theatre district not far away. The staff were helpful and the hotel was very comfortable.

review.title: BAD ATTITUDE OF EMPLOYEES
review.reviewText: THE HOTEL IS LOCATED IN A PERFECT PART OF SAN FRANCISCO. SOMA IS A RISING AREA THAT HAS A LOT TO OFFER. BLOCKS FROM UNION SQUARE, CHINATOWN ETC.. HOWEVER THE ATTITUDE OF THE FRONT DESK PEOPLE AND THE CONCIERGE WERE VERY BAD. IT SEEMS LIKE THEY ARE DOING YOU A FAVOR IN TENDING TO YOUR NEEDS.

review.title: Overall a nice stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is closed to all shops around the union square district. you will be able to walk to several central locations. The transit system is really good and will be easy to transport if you are looking to be a tourist at San Francisco. Be sure to get the 2 or 3 day pass, is a great value you can get it in any transit booth or where you buy the tickets for the cable cars. The hotel is great, don't expect the resort style, but a good hotel for business trips or short stays in the city.

review.title: Great view....
review.reviewText: Right at check in they immediately let us know that there was another room at a higher level with a better view available for no charge... and we got a beautiful city view!! The staff was great and they have a very hidden lounge in front of the restaurant with mood lighting and cozy chairs to wait around til your flight comes in which was really great (wish I had known it was there before the last day of our trip.) But we were right in the middle of a bunch of shops and the cable cars were close, but everyone walks there so you don't even really need to worry about it. And Bart is pretty close too so there was no need for the rental car or taxi to the airport. Definitely recommend it. Just don't touch anything on the mini bar...it's sensored so they can charge you if something is moved...I brought up the fact that I was charged even though we never ate anything and they removed it from the bill with no further questions:)

review.title: comfy beds, great location
review.reviewText: westin beds are so comfy. location was great to get everywhere around San Fran. No matter where you stay in SF bring comfy shoes cause lots of walking involved. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Very good value
review.reviewText: Convenient location for attendance of conference at nearby (much expensive) hotel. Less costly parking was also available across the street. Desk clerks very helpful and upgraded room to higher floor with view when we requested.

review.title: Great Location/Great Service/Great Room
review.reviewText: Spent a long weekend here and found the location convenient to Union Square, the SOMA District, and public transportation. The hotel accomodations were fresh, soothing, and comfortable. The staff was helpful.

review.title: nice room, expensive parking
review.reviewText: Great location, nice room, but parking was $50 plus tax extra a night, which made the stay much more expensive than expected

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Within a block of Montgomery St BART stop - no need for cab from airport. Close to museums (SF MOMA and Jewish Contemporary Museum) and a few blocks from Union Square. Two minute walk to Buena Vista Gardens, MLK memorial, and Metreon movie theatre

review.title: very good hotel
review.reviewText: this hotel was very clean and had a very comfortable bed, as promised. our room was on the smaller side, but was more than adequate. the hotel is in an excellent location, walking distance to union station and the cable car system.

review.title: Terrific
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel in a great location, spacious rooms especially when travelling with an infant. Very soft and comfortable beds. Lots of pillows! Concierge helpful. Could not have asked for more. And we paid less than half the rate than a higher rated hotel thanks to Expedia.

review.title: Return Visitor
review.reviewText: WElcoming helpful Bell staff & front desk. Nice. Clean, good work desks, great windows -although view not scenic, GREAT BEDS, has romantic memories from it's Argent days. Familiar. I keep returning & dining close by.

review.title: Convenient hotel to stay at
review.reviewText: Centrally located. Easy access to all major attractions.

review.title: San Franciso Treat!
review.reviewText: This Hotel was spectacular! Everything was pristine and Westin's heavenly beds are just that, heavenly. The only surprise was the price of valet parking (the only option of course) which was about half of the nights rate for the room. Overall a great property with a fantastic location in an amazing city!

review.title: SOMA Style
review.reviewText: The Westin at Market Street combines style, convenience and great comfort. The staff was courteous and allowed us to check in early. Our rooms were spotless and very well appointed. Room service was prompt and the food was delicious. While this is not a 'view' hotel - the views are mostly of other buildings , it made for a wonderful stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed in hotel for 1 night and it was really clean and the staff was very helpful and friendly.

review.title: Expensive, but convenient
review.reviewText: Where are the ammenities?????

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: We stayed three nights here. The location is excellent-right on the bus lines and near the cable cars. The staff was friendly and so helpful. I would love to return here.

review.title: Awesome View of downtown San Franciso!
review.reviewText: Room was very comfortable and Bed was the best I ever slept in. The huge windows give a great view of the city. I highly recommend staying there.

review.title: cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: it was beautiful and clean

review.title: Central location, no need for driving in city
review.reviewText: Very quiet comfortable, close to famous trolley, able to see San Francisco on Bart, Bus,Trolley, and metro, just a block from hotel. Across from Moscone Center and on Market stree with all the shopping.

review.title: Excellent value found through Expedia!
review.reviewText: Very good value

review.title: Great Hotel Great Location
review.reviewText: Wonderful room with fabulous bed very upscale hotel. Would stay there again! All the staff was helpful. Conceire desk booked tours and gave great suggestions for additional attractions. Booked our cab to airport on departure date, staff including the doorman were available 24hrs. Have already recommended this hotel to friends!

review.title: good location, staff not so helpful
review.reviewText: This hotel is very centrally located. The rooms are large and tidy. We encountered poor service from the front desk staff from the moment we checked in. Upon checking out we came across one staff member who was most helpful, but unfortunately she was the only one. Great hotel if you don't require assistance and do not mind brash staff members, very conveniently and centrally located

review.title: Pretty good
review.reviewText: It was very nice and clean. The room was smaller but for the price we paid it was worth it. Convenietly located, walking distance from AT&T park.

review.title: Not the typical Westin
review.reviewText: Overall it was not too bad, but not what you would expect from a Westin. There were a few maintenance items neglected, such as a malfunctioning drain in the sink and in the bathtub. There were no robes. The computer in the lobby for getting boarding passes was marked " out of paper" during my entire 3 day stay, with an Office Depot across the street. The single restaurant they have doesn't have a sandwich menu for lunch, just finger foods. I was clean, the beds were good, the desk was good for business, and the flat panel TV was good. Handy to Moscone.

review.title: Thanks for such a great view!
review.reviewText: When making a reservation and adding a special request, I asked for a nice view. However for the price I paid, in reality I did not expect to have such a great view of the bay, yerba buena park and the new Jewish Museum additon. I really appreciate their consideration to my request.

review.title: Excellent Stay
review.reviewText: The only thing that ever bothers me is 2 1/2 star hotels give free internet and these nicer ones all charge, it makes no sense ... Great location and a great room!

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: I wasn't sure what to expect after booking the room. I heard a few horrible reviews about the length of time it took to check in. We arrived at the hotel earlier than expected (11:00 am) and was very pleasantly surprised that they allowed us an early check in. We only waited 5 minutes and the employees were very friendly and gracious. The parking in San Francisco is horrendous and we planned on taking everyone's advice and parking in the garage across the street from the hotel but decided to just do the valet parking at the hotel so that we didn't have to walk down the street with our luggage. It was $50 plus a $7 surcharge but we expected that ahead of time. The location was great. We were close enough we could walk to the ball park and also within walking distances to Union Square. The rooms were very clean and the bedding was very nice and comfortable. Our room was close to the elevators but you couldn't barely hear them - plus we agreed to that location because of the early check in. Overall it was a great hotel and we will definitely book our next trip at the Westin San Francisco Market.

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: Rooms small but cleans and comfortable

review.title: Loved my room. It had a tread mill in it!
review.reviewText: Busy hotel but everything ran like clockwork.

review.title: Great Hotel, Terrible Parking
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, but the parking situation was insane. It costs $50/day to park at your own hotel. Public parking, located right behind the hotel or across the street, is $3/hour with a $25/day max. But the max clock resets every time you exit. Which means the hotel could actually be the less expensive alternative. Of course you have to tip the hotel valet every time you use your car, so...

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: we went with a few friends, we asked if we could all be on the same floor and they were very accomidating, no hassel at all. Rooms were nice and beds were comfortable.

review.title: Great room!
review.reviewText: nice room. seemed newly remodeled. clean

review.title: Great location, a bit pricey
review.reviewText: The Westin San Francisco is a wonderful location, within walking distict of the SF Moma, shopping on Market Street, and situated between 2 main subway stops. It is a nice hotel and as such, less ammenities are included with your room. Internet is not free, phone rates are high, and no breakfast is included with the room. Staff was reasonably friendly, but the consierge was not very helpful. Overall very nice, but I'm a bigger fan of mid priced hotels that offer more ammenities included in the room fee.

review.title: Heavenly like comforter is right!
review.reviewText: We had the most INCREDIBLE view of the city. The comforters were like clouds, and even the decoration in the room was neat, which is rare for a hotel. Loved this hotel. 3 of us split the room for a very reasonable price. We would absolutely go back.

review.title: Awesome Stay
review.reviewText: The price was great, the service even better. As far as the location and ease of parking you will not be dissapointed. Will definately be back.

review.title: Very nice place
review.reviewText: Great place to stay. Good location and very comfortable.

review.title: Extremely overpriced
review.reviewText: While the price of this hotel was artificially inflated due to the RSA security conference, I've gotten a much better price during that conference down the street from another property in the same chain.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is in great condition and location. Just a few feet away from Market street and a couple of blocks away from union square. The room was awesome with no complaints at all. I know where I'm staying at again when I go back to SF! They have a computer downstairs so you can check in and print your boarding passes, total plus!

review.title: Value for Money
review.reviewText: good location, only few blocks from Union Square. Rooms are small, but bed very comfortable. Concierge was very helpful.

review.title: Recommendable Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Good location, nice service, and comfortable stay at reasonable charge.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was a pleasant surprise. Everyone was helpful and the location was central. It was a very nice three nights and four days in SF.

review.title: Can't wait to go back.
review.reviewText: We always have a lovely time at the Westin in SanFrancisco. The stay is very comfortable and clean. Staff was very helpful and friendly.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Location is great. You are just across from many restaurants and arts and cultural destinations making your stay in San Francisco fun and comfortable. The hotel had a great view and accommodations.

review.title: Great location for shopping
review.reviewText: Great location for shopping

review.title: Wish there was a pool!
review.reviewText: It was a really nice hotel. Pros: Heavenly beds, brought a microwave upon request, very nice rooms, plasma TV, close to Union Square, big windows with great views, quiet, parking garage across the street Cons: No pool even though one of the receptionists told me there was a pool, windows don't open, parking is WAYYYY to expensive

review.title: Great price for this hotel in SFO
review.reviewText: Very conveniently located

review.title: Excellent choice for centralized visit
review.reviewText: Very clean and modernized with one of the few that have King sized beds as an option. Don't expect large rooms, but very, very clean and quiet compared to other heart-of-city hotels.

review.title: Unhelpful Concierge
review.reviewText: Everything was great...until we asked the concierge for advise. He told me I could not get into a certain restaurant that evening, however, when I called myself I easily got a reservation. Then, I asked (different man) the next day about getting back to the airport for 2 people and he recommended the airport shuttle. This seemed acceptable and economical, so I booked. It only came to my attention later that a cab ride straight to the airport was only $5 more. I was highly irritated that we were recommended the shuttle as we JUST made it in time since they picked up 4 other people on the way. The hotel was great, but the concierge was highly unhelpful.

review.title: Great experience!
review.reviewText: Everyone at the hotel was very pleasant and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

review.title: nice place with the perfect view
review.reviewText: very nice and clean and over-looking a nice view, would recommend to others,, good location and good service,, except bathroom drainage is clogged.. everything else was awesome!

review.title: The Westin is a great place to stay for a good price. It is located downtown.
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the Westin and would go back. It is a bit of a walk to the bridge and the Pier 39 and the fun going on up there but you can get a bus or a taxi or the cable car! I walked up and took the tour bus round the City and I really enjoyed it.

review.title: very sad for a 4 star hotel
review.reviewText: for the amount you pay you do not get the service you expect. Experience with the front desk was terrible, flat out right rude. Did not want to help us. After checking in we notice that we were surronded by kids on both rooms to the left and right of us, we went down to ask the front desk if it was possible to change rooms, the front desk lady was very rude and did not even want to help us. checking out was just as bad, we had no service for 15 to 20 minutes to get out bags stored for the last day. You have to pay about $50/day for parking but the parking people were nice. also, even with a do not disturb sign outside your door, they still knock and come into your room, dont expect to get good rest.

review.title: great hotel, great price
review.reviewText: Great hotel from the check in throughout our stay. Helped in planning and finding our way over a long weekend vacation. Room was great with a wonderful view of the city. Will definitely go back when visiting SF again. Also, easy way from the train if you don't want to rent a car or take a cab.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Preccious

review.title: my trip
review.reviewText: the parking was way too expensive. It is far from the shopping. Very hard to find

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The rooms themselves are nice, but the service is extremely rude and unfriendly, where I have to say that my service standards are actually very low. I'm not sure why room service shows up at 7:30 in the morning, and I've actually never encountered such an unfriendly porter as the old man present at the time who first let me haul back my heavy bags into the storage room myself and then started shouting at me when I placed them in the wrong spot. When looking at the hotel price, do keep in mind that parking at the hotel itself costs $45 overnight!

review.title: Good Hotel and great view
review.reviewText: Good hotel nd gret view ( stayed on the 22nd floor) . I had to wait 20 minutes to talk to the front desk on a Friday night to check-in. It would have been good if they had free internet service. 14$ a night for internet usage is a bit too pricey.

review.title: Nice Experience
review.reviewText: At first we were worried about the location as weren't familiar with the city, but it turned out to be great. Only a few minutes walking to cable car and Union Square. The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly. We will be back. Soon I hope.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The concierge service was great! The beds were extremely comfortable. Our room was very close to the elevators and we could hear the elevators. Also, the walls are thin. You could hear everything through the walls. Great location. Close to Union Square and cable car line.

review.title: Great Bargain
review.reviewText: I stayed here with a few friends. Definitely worth the money. Friendly staff. We stayed in a lower level room and at first were concerned with outside noise, but once in the room, there was NO NOISE at all. Great bargain, would stay there again.

review.title: Very Satisfied
review.reviewText: The Room itself was quite spacious, and very comfortable. I enjoyed the room very much and the restaurant located on the ground floor. The breakfast was delicious, highly recommended (buffet).

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: This is our second time staying at this hotel. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The beds are the best I have ever slept in any hotel. Make sure to park in the structure across the street. At only $20 per day it beats the hotel parking which is $48 per day. Also make sure to get the MUNI passports which allow you to use the buses and cable cars.

review.title: Excellent Service
review.reviewText: The service was excellent! The views from the room was unbelievable! Great, great location!

review.title: Will stay there again...
review.reviewText: Loved the Hotel. Good location, great staff, and even got an upgrade at no cost.

review.title: Newly renovated hotel
review.reviewText: A couple of years ago this hotel has renovated and has made the Westin. This hotel is clean and convenient to go around Soma area...

review.title: I'll be back~
review.reviewText: Convenient Location, Clean and Comfy Rooms.

review.title: Excellent Centrally located Hotel
review.reviewText: My wife and I are relatively experienced travellers and we rate this Hotel very highly. We needed a central hotel in San Francisco to spend one night post-cruise before flying back to the U.K. The Westin Market Street was ideal for the purpose. Located just off the main thoroughfare, Market Street, this is a modern building with up-to-date decor. Our room on the 22nd floor had a great outlook on to Kearney St across from Market St. Room was spacious and well-equipped - large flat-screen TV, twin Queen beds and luxurious bedding (Starwood Hotels standard). The Hotel has an excellent restaurant which was packed in the evening indicating its popularity with non-residents. Internet access is available at a fee but is free in the Business Centre for airline check-ins only. At the special offer rate we got through Expedia this Hotel was great value for money, even at present exchange rates. Highly recommended.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful room, amazing view, comfy bed.

review.title: Good Location but lacks the comfort of a Westin
review.reviewText: Arrived at the hotel and found out the hotel had no kingsize bed which I had requested for. Ended up taking 2 queen beds in my room. I found the beds quite uncomfortable and the pillows too. Overall the hotel is in a great location. It is close to everything and the subway is like 3 blocks away. The staff were friendly and helpful.

review.title: Decent Stay
review.reviewText: The price for parking was extremely high. Internet was only offered at an exorbitant rate. Overall, the hotel was very nice. The hotel employees were very friendly and went out of their way to greet you, however, the concierge desk generally seemed understaffed with long lines.

review.title: Very Enjoyable Stay
review.reviewText: Conviniently located, its only 2 blocks from the Moscone center. The rooms were big and comfortable. Linens were top notched and awesome fitness center. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

review.title: Well connected and close to all the shops!
review.reviewText: Arrived Friday afternoon - long queues for check-in. Well-appointed room, very clean with nice furnishings and very comfortable bed. Bathroom small but clean. The hotel is well-located for the financial district and the retail area around Union Square. The BART, street and cable cars are all very close by.

review.title: OK, but expensive and definitely nothing special
review.reviewText: Room was small, aircon noisy and not worth the cost

review.title: Great comfort and location in SF
review.reviewText: My girlfriends and I stayed here for one night for a bachelorette party, but I would've been happy to spend multiple nights in this nice hotel. This location is in between the Montgomery and Powell Street BART stations, only two or three blocks in either direction. Walking distance to Union Square, Museum of Modern Art and more. Check-in was quick and painless, we got a room with two double beds on the sixth floor. View was OK, nothing awesome, but did have a nice tall window. Everything about the room was up-to-date and we easily felt comfortable. Would easily recommend.

review.title: More than a Nice Surprise
review.reviewText: The staff goes out of their way to help you. The interior of the hotel is clean and stylish. On par with other resort hotels and way better than your average boutique hotel in SF. I wish I could stay there for every visit.

review.title: Impressed with customer service and quality of hotel
review.reviewText: This was the first time staying at this hotel under the current name. I was impressed with the responsiveness and positive attitude of staff as well as the quality of the room. The location of the hotel is quite convenient from various sites.

review.title: Was comfortable, but unfriendly, conjested atmosphere
review.reviewText: The room itself was very clean and comfortable, but the overall feel of the hotel was stuffy. We had a long wait for check-in and concierge assistance, as they did not have enough staff on desk duty for the amount of guests waiting.

review.title: I would definitely go back.
review.reviewText: This hotel was more in the shopping district. We took a bus and a cab to get around to Fisherman's Warf and other areas. I would recommend to use the parking garage across from the hotel. The hotel parking is pricey.

review.title: Relaxing stay in SF
review.reviewText: The Westin was a great place to stay for the price! Right in the heart of the city close to BART. I had a corner room that was a bit off-center, but it was part of the charm. I would definitely stay again...

review.title: Location & Value
review.reviewText: Great location 1 block from Moscone and just a couple blocks from Union Square. Ducca, one of the best restaurants in the city is in this hotel.

review.title: Nice Place & Staff
review.reviewText: Lots to walk to close by, Union Square etc... Staff is very friendly! Free Wine M-F 5 to 7

review.title: Excellent location and close to freeway; is in the center and close to the mall, the trolley car, et
review.reviewText: Excellent room and service.

review.title: Lovely, except...
review.reviewText: Everything was wonderful, comfortable, etc. But one of the nights I was staying there, an ongoing noise was not taken care of. There was a huge banging in the stairwell that lasted for an hour. I called the front desk numerous times and it wasn't taken care of. It was loud enough that people in the neighboring rooms complained about it in the morning as well.

review.title: Overpriced for what you get
review.reviewText: The best part of the hotel was the prime location in San Francisco, but I found the rooms to be poorly thought out, the bathrooms overly dark, and the room service food to be overpriced and poorly made. Also the wifi connection in my room was incredibly poor, and would drop often. At these prices, I'll be finding somewhere else to stay next time.

review.title: dog lovers take note
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel for anyone, but especially if you are traveling with a dog. They accept dogs under 40 lbs and are very gracious about it. They don't charge an extra fee for it either. Also, the beds truly are heavenly. We slept in later than we have in years because it was so quiet and comfortable.

review.title: The Best View In Town!
review.reviewText: The very best thing about my stay here was the BEAUTIFUL views I had of downtown San Francisco from the HUGE floor-to-ceiling window in my room. I kept the curtains open day & night because the view was Amazing (especially at night). The staff was so friendly and the little things they did for me meant a lot (i.e. offering my an umbrella when it was raining one day, and holding my bags after checkout). I've been telling everyone to book their stay at the dowtown Westin!

review.title: This place is great!
review.reviewText: My third visit within a six week timeframe was really nice. They upgraded my room without me asking, and the beds at this hotel are outstanding. If I had a bigger suitcase I would steal it.

review.title: Nice room!
review.reviewText: Our room was on the 22nd floor. It had a great view of the bay with floor to ceiling windows. It was clean and spacious. The bed was very comfortable. We got a good deal on the room through Expedia. We enjoyed our stay and would stay again if ever visiting San Francisco. The only downside was that there was a loud motor noise that started during the night and woke us several times on the first night and once on the second night. When calling to report it, the complaint was just dismissed. That was disappointing because service was otherwise very good. We just figured that it had something to do with the cold rainy weather because after it cleared the noise did also.

review.title: Bed was so comfortable
review.reviewText: The room was clean and quite away from any type of noise

review.title: Westin Market St
review.reviewText: It is centrally located to all the shops and museums. It was a great location. I was suppose to get a king size bed and I was given a queen in a very small room. I was dissapointed by that. I used 1 bottle of water and was charged for two. I requested that it be deducted and it was. When I got home I was charged for it anyway. I would stay there again. I got what I paid for.

review.title: $48.00 per Night Parking???????
review.reviewText: $48.00 per Night Parking??????? Nice hotel, great location

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location near SF MOMA, shopping, restaurants, BART. Would have been nice to know that a la carte breakfast was not available afer 10:30am on Sunday since we didn't want expensive breakfast buffet.

review.title: Inaccurate billing and ignoring phone calls
review.reviewText: The hotel billed me for the refreshment center when I never used any food or drink from it. When I called I got routed to their accounting and after repeated calls, I all get was message center and they never returned their call. Its happened before with Westin and may be a poor policy.

review.title: Comfort and Convenience
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a perfect location. Close to everything I like to do in the city. The room was quiet, clean, well thought out, plenty of electrical outlets. Nice lounge to meet people, parking garage. Very pleasant. I'll use this hotel many times in the future.

review.title: What a fabulous hotel at a great price!
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Westin near Union Square for the past few times I was up in SF. The experience was just wondeful. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and homely. I can't wait to go back there!

review.title: Review your bill when you check out
review.reviewText: Nice place and I will be back, but it was difficult to get the robotic lady at the front desk to remove bogus minibar charges from my bill, even after I explained the errors several times to them. All I wanted was the bill to be calculated properly but that almost required a manager to solve the problem.

review.title: Overall satisfactory bad very poor IT service
review.reviewText: If you are not a computer person, this hotel is definitely recommended. However, if you may need any kind of computer related service, wifi or printing out boarding pass, etc, you may want to look around and see if there is anything better available. The people in Westin are nice and willing to help, but not at all have any ability to solve this kind of problems with their own system/machines.

review.title: it all began at the door...
review.reviewText: First, let me just say there is valet at the hotel, but they don't pressure you into parking your car there by scaring you into thinking your car is going to be broken into. The doorman opened my car door, asked if it was a business trip and then gave me the run down of if it is being footed by the company, valet is added to the room tab, if you are paying out of pocket, there is a secure parking lot that is half the price around the building. Then he took our luggage out of the trunk, held it while we went around the building, and then had it at the check in desk when we got back. We checked in, got a room on the 20th floor, not the 4th, and the view was great. The only drawback was that our room did not have the double showerhead that was stated online. Not sure if this was only our room or all the rooms, but definately a 1 head shower. The bed was great, like all Westin beds. Would definatly stay here again if I had to choose a hotel downtown. Just a few blocks from the hustle and bustle of the shopaholics haven, but without the crowd.

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: Excellent value particularly the hotel is situated in downtown San francisco.

review.title: Great weekend stay
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. We were just a couple of blocks from the Union Square and the Mall. We had a great time taking the cable cars to Pier 39. Parking at the hotel is 50.00 per night.

review.title: great location nice hotel
review.reviewText: this is a westin so the hotel is nice the location is great next to union squar and market streer

review.title: Centrally Located in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel room was clean, comfortable, nicely decorated. Bed was good to sleep in. Quiet. good view (they were nice when I checked in a bit early, and upgraded me to a room higher up with a view as they had that available) Did not care for the wifi/internet surcharge... And the fridge was chock-full of stuff they were trying to sell, leaving no room for me to put in even a water bottle.... Was just a couple of minutes away from transit and trolley system. Shopping heaven if consumerism is what you're there for. San Francisco Modern Art Museum is just half a block down the road.

review.title: NEEDS TOUCHING UP
review.reviewText: Desk staff was gracious and very professional despite confusion re type of room reserved and room presented at desk.This may have resulted from our late check in.Our room may have been given as upgrade earlier despite being paid for in advance.The room was"AVERAGE" with nothing special other than the excellent beds.

review.title: Great Value - Central Location
review.reviewText: This is a really nice, four star hotel in an excellent location. The Montgomery BART Station is 1 1/2 blocks away and the Cable Car Line is 2 blocks in the other direction! Big screen Plasmas in the room and one of the BEST hotel beds I have ever slept in were also notable. I will definitely return! Especially at the price!!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Good 4 star hotel,very well located.the quality of the rooms was ok, they probably need to be renovated but it's still acceptable. I would come back to this hotel again.

review.title: Good Experience
review.reviewText: The hotel was very comfortable and close to our event. Location is great and maintanence also.

review.title: Small rooms
review.reviewText: Somewhat outdated bathrooms, with carpet in the sink area (less than sanitary). Quality of room service food was poor.

review.title: Westin on Market in SF
review.reviewText: I was attending a conference at a nearby hotel but chose Westin for cost purposes. I obtained a roomate the second night and they moved me to a room that had 2 beds with NO PROBLEM! The room i was moved to was STUNNING on the 28th floor with a view of the bay. SERVICE WAS GREAT

review.title: Great Service
review.reviewText: Great Concierge and Bellman staff!

review.title: One of San Francisco's best!
review.reviewText: This hotel is fantastic, you can walk to all the best attractions in San Francisco. Moscone Center is right behind the hotel, San Francisco MOMA is right in front, Union Square is literally a 7 minute walk and the largest mall in San Francisco is probably 150 yards away. Also, the metro is next to the hotel and the cable car station is also super close. The hotel is very nice, clean and fashionable, and the staff rocks, super friendly. Dont waste your money on the other ones, this one is super nice.

review.title: Great views, excellent location, modern nice rooms.
review.reviewText: Close to everything and transportation in very nice area. Incredible views. Confortable beds in nice rooms. Very good overall.

review.title: Great location for walking to downtown destinations. Comfortable rooms.
review.reviewText: Close to SFMoma and Yerba Buena Garden. Great views of city and bay. Easy walking to Union Square, Chinatown, Asian Museum. Very convenient and comfortable.

review.title: Good Location/Small Room
review.reviewText: I booked this reservation through Expedia. The rate was very good, but the room was matchbox in size without an easy chair. The hotel and location of the hotel were wonderful, close to Union Square and China Town. I would stay here again, but in an upgraded, larger room. If you have a car, park in the parking lot in front on the hotel and save.

review.title: Thoroughly enjoyed it
review.reviewText: We really liked this hotel. The location was excellent, the servie was outstanding, and we felt very pampered. I would go again.

review.title: the location of the room
review.reviewText: i got the room next to the elevator and was not able to change it. I could hear the noise of the elevator in my room clearly. If you would like to stay here, make sure you are not stying in those rooms next to the elevators.

review.title: Overall...a great place
review.reviewText: The service at this hotel was truly exceptional, as was the room. Also, the concierge staff was outstanding. That said, I had two complaints about the hotel: 1) It is $55 (including tax) to park; and 2) The room walls are very thin, so you will hear just about anything.

review.title: Beware
review.reviewText: While the hotel was clean and the rooms were very nice, the attitudes and the less than helpful concierge desk spoiled this location. It appeared and was confirmed that kick backs to the Concierge's was the main motivation to suggest dining and attraction. From convincing us that the cost were fixed, we discovered discounts on attractions after we paid full price, the resturant suggestions were not what was requested, even down to trying to convince us to pay twice as much for airport transport... put a sour taste in our mouths about Westin in San Fran.

review.title: One of the Best Hotels I have ever stay!
review.reviewText: This hotel is just perfect. Every thing is great, the location nearby union square, the room service, the room was very clean and the mattress are incredible. I really enjoy staying at the Westin San Francisco, and not only I recommend this hotel to other guests, but also I am looking forward to my next trip to San Francisco to stay again at this great Hotel.

review.title: Modern Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The stay at the Westin was very nice the hotel the location was walking distance to everything we wanted to walk to Union Square and a taxi or a trolly away was everything else. One of the reason we stayed there was because of the size of the rooms and they turned out to be as nice as I was hoping for. We will go back and stay there again. Donna

review.title: We enjoyed our stay in this modern SF hotel. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
review.reviewText: We cane here for our 36th wedding anniv. We got a great off season rate with expedia. Half the fun is shopping for a good rate on their website. This hotel had a perfect location, and great reviews. Upon arrival, we found out why. The clerk that checked us in shared our same last name, and we enjoyed visiting with her. I asked for a room with a view, and she was nice enough to give us a great room on the 32nd floor with a great view of the bay, and At&t park. We could see all the activity in Mosconni Park as well. We enjoyed the Christmas season and all the decorations at nearby Union Square. We parked accross the street at Hearst Parking for $20.00 per day, and used the public transportaion to get around. Many places are within walking distance. China town, little Italy, and there seems to be a Starbucks on every corner these days. We also enjoyed the complimentary wine in the lobby from 5-7pm. I would stay here again.

review.title: Good Choice
review.reviewText: The Westin San Francisco Market Street was a great choice Hotel to stay at. The Main reason is the size of their rooms. Comfortable large rooms. Great Location and Quite nights sleep. Recommended

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice and spacious room.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Very helpful concierge and staff. Everyone was friendly and I was upgraded to a beautiful corner room on an upper floor with two walls of views! The hotel was centrally located and great for Christmas shopping and sightseeing. The bar was really busy on a Friday night, the restaurant was not my favorite and a little overpriced but there are tons of great restaurants within walking distance. Parking is extremely challenging so pass on the rental car if you can. But I would definitely stay there again. The room was comfortable and quiet. The bed was great but the bathroom was very small.

review.title: Be careful where your room is located
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, well located but make sure your room isn't next to a housekeeper supply room...very noisy!

review.title: Great centrally located hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: First time we have stayed since it was bought out by the Westin. The remodel is nice. The bed was extremely comfortable. The room was clean and well appointed. Loved the ceiling to floor windows and the views. Did not have the opportunity to eat in the dining room but understand it is wonderful. They have added a nice outdoor seating area. The staff were terrific. We took a town car to the theater at a very reasonable price. Love the location.

review.title: GREAT hotel, parking- not so much
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I had a fantastic time at the Westin. The room was great, the food was delicious, and we had excellent service. The only complaint I had was with parking, which was about $50 for 24 hours, which is ridiculously overpriced. However, if you're flying into San Francisco, and don't have a car then there's I highly recommend the Westin.

review.title: Location A+ Traditional Room / Basic Room C
review.reviewText: The location of the Westin is in the heart of both the Financial and Shopping hub of San Francisco The area is safe and cleaner than most with minimal homeless people panhandling. The Westin is good for a one night stay maybe 2 if you are strictly on business. For more comfort for a few extra dollars I would stay at "The Palace" one block over as the rooms are much more comfortable and set up in a way where you can relax. The room set up at the Westin is very awkward with the TV being 20ft from the bed and when you enter the room you practically walk right into the restroom.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location along Market Street. Parking at the hotel is extra and can be pricey.

review.title: Great Location, Good Value - Noisy Aircon
review.reviewText: Overall, a very good stay. Loved the location, people were helpful and friendly. Rooms clean. Even got an upgrade. One peeve was a noisy aircon/heater. Small squeaks aside, I'd definitely stay there again.

review.title: Practical and Pleasant
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very knowledgeable in providing assistance on how to plan our trip. They extended a helping hand when we needed an extra hand (like on searching parking places, routes and even packing the wine bottles we shopped for - the concierge was super nice!) Thanks and hope to come back to SF soon!

review.title: Very comfortable and convenient location
review.reviewText: Stay was great. The hotel is very close to Union Square, about a five minute walk. Great holiday shopping! Eateries abound the moment you walk out of the hotel. Our room was clean and pretty spacious. Amenities were great...especially fitness center. One of the best and cleanest Westin hotels I have encountered on the westcoast.

review.title: Nice Place To Stay
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly. Room was very clean and comfortable. Definitely would recommend for either business or pleasure.

review.title: A good, affordable option
review.reviewText: We recently stayed at the Westin Market St. in SF, at a very low rate for a Westin. The property is well located (just down the street from the Metreon, MOMA, Moscone Center, etc) and brand new. The appointments, service, decor, and maintenance are all what you'd expect from a Westin -- excellent, though not luxurious. My only caveat is that this is clearly a renovated property from a lower-scale hotel. The ceilings are low, and the bathrooms are small. It feels very much like a hotel geared toward the business traveler. Very sleek, but not a lot of charm. Having said that, I think this property is an excellent value for the price and would recommend it strongly.

review.title: Classy Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is classy and elegant. The rooms are clean, spacious and very comfortable. The plasma screen TV in the room is terrific and the Italian restaurant on the ground floor is excellent - great food and very willing to please customers. The chef even whipped up a non-dairy desert for my vegan daughter. Parking is very expensive though. It will set you back about $54 a night - you're better off parking in the lot across the street. Also, printing out a boarding pass was a bit of a hassle - the front desk won't do it for you. Instead you're instructed to go to a business office on the second floor. Overall though, the hotel is well situated near a movie complex and a lovely park nearby. I would definitely consider coming back next time I'm in SF.

review.title: ask about parking costs
review.reviewText: It cost $54. for parking one night

review.title: Westin Market Street
review.reviewText: I almost passed on the Westin Market Street, as I do not care for the Westin Union Square. I'm glad I didn't Great Stay, would highly recommend.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: hotel room was very small but for 1 person (only in the room to sleep) it was fair All amenities you expect from a business hotel were available - also coffee maker - charged for wireless internet access but rate is fair compared with european city hotel internet rates for 24h Location is perfect - shop till you drop at Market Street - Moscone Center a few blocks away

review.title: Loved the Westin
review.reviewText: Loved the proximity to Union Square. The staff was very professional, kind and helpful ALWAYS!

review.title: They should call it the Bestin
review.reviewText: I only stayed a short time so it didn't really give them an opportunity to mess anything up. However, I'm always pleased with the service at the Westin and this time was no exception. Service was great, room was perfect and the location is unbeatable.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: The bed was so awesome and the room was very quiet. We had a great time! Our only disappointment was the lady running the bar had a major attitude problem! When you pay $15 for a cocktail I don't think the bartender should be rude. Even one of her co-workers said to tell the manager. Maybe they have had problems with her in the past. Other than her being grumpy I would certaintly go back to this hotel.

review.title: Can't wait to stay there again
review.reviewText: Centrally located to everywhere in the city. We were able to walk to Union Square. Loved the hotel. Accomendations were one of the nicest we've stayed at.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: relatively clean, nice gym, good service, no pool sauna hottub and pricey parking

review.title: Most Bang for your Buck!
review.reviewText: This hotel is a nice 4 star hotel in my book. It has the feel of an upscale hotel but the price of a middle of the road hotel. The huge flat screen in the room I had made it difficult to leave the room but when you're in the city, you have to get out. Great recommendation, thank you!

review.title: very comfortable and clean well priced - we will return
review.reviewText: its on the edge of union square the hub of the city, a warm and friendly hotel with excellent valet parking facilities. it smells nice as you walk in and each room has a clean air aroma. beds are large and comfortable. excellent tv and room facilities (beware the internet is slower than a one winged carrier pigeon!!!!!)

review.title: great price and location
review.reviewText: upon arrival, we were very impressed with the interior and decor. it was simple yet elegant. the rooms were very clean and had beautiful views. ours was of the park and the church. our friend had a view of market street. it was beautiful both day and at night. the hotel was just a short walk away from market street, union square and china town and we didn't have to use our car at all during the entire weekend. it really is a very ideal location.

review.title: very central
review.reviewText: A great place to stay as walkable to Union Square, Chinatown - I even walked back from Fisherman's Wharf but don't try that unless you're fit! Rooms were always promptly cleaned in the morning and the happy hour is a good way of swapping notes on SFO. Definitely recommend the Westin on Market.

review.title: Nice hotel with affordable rates. .
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable. Would go back.

review.title: Good place to stay.
review.reviewText: A lot of shoping is very close, China town is few blocks away, trolly stop is not far either.

review.title: South of Market Hotel
review.reviewText: Central location near Market street and convention center. Well maintained and good service.

review.title: Not impressed with room
review.reviewText: The room was so small it could not accommodate an arm chair. I watched the TV from the bed and my wife sat in the desk chair.

review.title: Not the best, but it worked!
review.reviewText: I was overall happy, but the night (2am) I flew across country to be given a room key to a dirty room and then transferred to a conference room with a roll out cot. After the following day everything was nice.

review.title: Walk everywhere
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel so we could walk to AT&T Park for a baseball game. Great location. We also walked to Union Square and the Ferry Building. Wonderful way to see this beautiful city. The view from the room was great.

review.title: Good Location!
review.reviewText: It was a close walk to AT&T park, Which i was in town to watch the "Giants" play! If anything closer, cheaper, i would like to know! Thank you!

review.title: Clean, comfortable hotel near Market Street
review.reviewText: The Westin San Francisco Market Street is conveniently located near Market Street on the 3rd street. It is close to Moscone Center so if you look for a place for conventions taking place there, this hotel is a great place to start. Rooms are clean with a new bed with white sheets.

review.title: Very impressed!
review.reviewText: Other than the extremely rude woman working the check-in counter...wish I could remember her name, the service was wonderful. All employees were exceptionally nice and very helpful. When we travel back to San Francisco we will be staying at the Westin again!

review.title: Very comfortable, safe, quiet
review.reviewText: I stayed at this location when another company owned the hotel. The Westin has turned the rooms into very comfortable, quiet havens. I loved the bed. I found the hotel very comforting while staying alone on business.

review.title: Will be staying here again
review.reviewText: I was only in town for one night, but wanted to stay longer after I saw this room! The front desk staff person who checked me in was very helpful and friendly. Upgraded my room. This place is close to a lot of cool places and is so incredibly priced for what you get I don't know how they do it.

review.title: bath tub water stuck
review.reviewText: Better clean up the shower tub's thingy, seems there are hairs stuck in it, water can hardly flow out from the tub

review.title: Fine but nothing special..
review.reviewText: Room was a good size but bathroom was tiny - really tiny and also very dark. Good location, just off Market and concierge staff pretty helpful.

review.title: Not good value for money, really
review.reviewText: Nice enough hotel, but questionable if worth the money, particularly if touring. Avoid rooms near the lifts, impossible to sleep from the news. Sounds like trams outside the window all night!

review.title: The Westin was Fabulous!!!!!
review.reviewText: We loved the Westin! The lobby had beautiful filled with flower vases with fuschia orchids!!! The personnel very helpful and we were able to check in early. The rooms were clean, extremely comfortable beds, loved them!!!! We will be back !!

review.title: Perfect!
review.reviewText: Great location! Walking distance to SFMOMA and Union Square shopping and restaurants. Great service and the beds are devine!

review.title: Nice Stay Near Market Street
review.reviewText: Was very convenient for going on a quick trip to the SF Museum of Modern Art just a block away. Plenty of places to shop and eat within walking distance.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was close to shopping and dinning and offered help to find areas of interest.

review.title: Excellent allround experience at hotel, highly recommended
review.reviewText: Great location and VERY good Hotel in the heart of San Francisco.

review.title: Nice hotel!
review.reviewText: Got a great deal on a suite through Expedia and stayed on the 25th floor with great views of the city. Right around the corner from Union Square. Parking was ridiculous so I parked across the street for a lot less. Tried to fit the Heavenly Bed in my backpack but it didn't fit...

review.title: Clean and comfortable
review.reviewText: The Westin is clean and comfortable and the employees were very friendly. The only disappointment was that the window washers left huge white streaks all over the windows (not just in my room, but apparently on that whole side of the building as evidenced from rooms in the common areas). That somewhat spoiled the very nice city view from the 26th floor. Other than that I have no complaints - the service was excellent, the location is great, and I would stay there again.

review.title: Not good at all
review.reviewText: We booked through expedia and I called to see if we could request two beds and a rollaway. They added it to the notes but when I got there I was told it was a fire hazard and could not be done. The room we were given smelled like wet stale smoke, and our rollaway (with 1 bed, not 2) was not delivered 12 hours after the request. I would not go back

review.title: Great Hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Great hotel

review.title: Great location, nice amenities, pleasant service
review.reviewText: I recommend generally -- nice hotel, the location is fantastic, and the people seem nice. Also has an awesome restaurant Ducca right in the hotel, though a 1000 more restaurants are right outside the door. If there is anyone out there travelling with a dog, as I did, I particularly recommend this hotel. They were nice to my bassett hound and right next to the hotel there is a good grassy area to walk the doggy (I'm not sure it was intended for such, but it's part of the hotel so I think it was -- no one kicked me out.) One small negative is that there is a small bank of elevators and no express elevator to the top -- so there was sometimes a wait for the elevator and the ride had lots of stops. Though, that is the only neg I can say about the hotel. Thumbs up, particularly for you doggy people.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: I was very please with the location, it's near everything.

review.title: mixed response
review.reviewText: it was a great hotel but i found a half drunk bottle of juice in the mini fridge, an extra water charge was given but they took it off and there was still emory boards, a compact and a digital camera left in the room. So i dont know how thorough the cleaners are.

review.title: comfortable and close to everything
review.reviewText: SF moma is just down the street m union sq a 5 min. walk. this is a practical choice

review.title: Short break in San Francisco
review.reviewText: An excellent hotel. Travelled BART from the airport - station a few hundred yards from the hotel. Great view of San Francisco from rooms on 33rd floor. The rooms were big, beds very comfortable, bathrooms well equipped - all in all an excellent choice, especially with the 3 for 2 night deal. If you want a beer go to the bar across the street - very friendly.

review.title: Wonderful staff, couldn't have been better.
review.reviewText: They really treated us like they weren't trying to squeeze every last penny from us - very rare, unfortunately in this day & age. Very gracious staff - we will only recommend this hotel to anyone we know who comes into town.

review.title: Nice San Francisco Downtown Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice room, great location.

review.title: Spectacular Scenery
review.reviewText: I got the room which is at the corner on 30th or 36th floor that I can see all scenery from SFO to GG Bridge Its so amazing I love it so much but the room size is too small maybe bcoz i took just the traditional room but it's the best!

review.title: Great Italian Restaurant
review.reviewText: The Italian restaurant on the 1st floor of the hote, off the lobby, is a hidden gem. We went there on a local colleague's recommednation and were delighted-a bit noisy given the adjoining bar, so better for a boisterous meal with friends/colleagues than a date. Friendly, helpful staff and great food. Enjoy!

review.title: our favorite spot in sf
review.reviewText: love this place. great location, fair price, great everything...

review.title: Can't wait till next year. I will definitely stay there.
review.reviewText: The hotel was in great shape and condition. The view that we had in our room was wonderful.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Nice and clean. Close everything!!!

review.title: Excellent central location for San Fransisco
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay here. Good location. Beds to die for.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The Westin San Francisco Market Street is in a great location that is within walking distance to public transportation, SF Moma, the Yerba Buena Gardens, and great neighorhoods like Chinatown and the Financial District. The hotel room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. The staff was helpful and polite. I would definitely go back if I could get a similar great deal through Expedia.

review.title: EXTREMELY FRIENDLY AND CONVENIENT
review.reviewText: Westin San Francisco was an excellent hotel. Right in the downtown area - only 3 blocks from Union Square. Staff were extremely nice and very helpful during my 7 day stay. Couldn't have been treated nicer!

review.title: one of the best in san francisco
review.reviewText: the hotel is in the middle of everything. you can walk to chinatown, shopping centers and other sites.

review.title: Pleasant stay but a little disapointed
review.reviewText: Whilst the hotel is nice, it is at a completely different standard to the impressive Sydney version. Upon check in we were given an upgrade to a corner room on an upper level. The room was extremely small, which made for an interesting stay with suitcases. However the plasma was great to watch the 4th of July fireworks, seeing as the fog rolled into the bay. The fitness centre was very impressive. The concierge arranged Giants Tickets over email which was very convenient seeing as we are located in Sydney. We had fabulous tickets. Whilst we enjoyed our stay in the city, the staff are a little snobby.

review.title: Great hotel if you can get a deal
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice and the beds are truly "heavenly". If you can get a deal on this place, it is worth it. Good location.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Interaction with staff waspleasant and helpful. One chair only in double room which was also dirty.Computer facility not adequate, yet not informed and overpriced. Breakfast very poor selection and quality, overpriced eg one bowl of porridge, juice and coffee cost the same as a full breakfast buffet. Inflexible to meet a variety of needs.

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText: Room was not available on arrival (5 pm) had to have different room and swap next day. Bathroom extractor fans ran 24 hours and were very noisy, had to ask for it to be shut down. Standard hotel, location good but not great value

review.title: My Review ; )
review.reviewText: This hotel was a perfect choice for us! We visited all of the galleries and museums nearby. Many other attractions were within walking distance. The MUNI and BART were close by for transportation needs. I would love to see the Westin upgrade their Wi-Fi capabilities to each room.

review.title: Not As Good As It Thinks It Is
review.reviewText: San Francisco hotels tend to be quite expensive for what you get and many near the centre tend to be set up for business men. The Westin looks like a business man's hotel that is attracting vacationers as well, probably by discounting, although it continues to have the business and conference/convention types. While bedrooms are perfectly pleasant, in a chain hotel style, the public areas are reminiscent of an upmarket airport departure lounge with little of distinction and certainly no atmosphere. However, the staff all seem to be very attentive and keen to meet the needs of guests. While bedroom cleaning was adequate, some of the passageways looked as though they would welcome the attention of a vacuum cleaner and one of the ice machine rooms had an empty wine bottle and a beer bottle top lying on a badly stained floor for 4 days. The offered room was not what had been requested and this did not seem to be a unique problem as others booking in at the same time also failed to get what they wanted in a fully booked hotel.

review.title: Close to All
review.reviewText: We stayed here last year and we came back this year. The hotel is located in the central of shopping, restaurants, farmer's market, chinatown, and the trolley to pier 39, and fisherman's wharf. If we go back to SF next year, we will stay here again. The people at the hotel was friendly and the service was excellent.

review.title: good centrally located hotel
review.reviewText: Clean hotel , helpful staff, centrally located , everything in walking distance.

review.title: Very good service
review.reviewText: Check in was quick, room was clean, service was fast and friendly

review.title: Good choice
review.reviewText: I visited with my family for 3 days. This is a business hotel primarily, but offered a great level of service and comfort for our holiday. It is very conveniently located for the trams, China town, art centres , MUNI, etc The staff were very helpful and the services very good.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel idealy located with friendly helpful staff. Not neccessarily cheap but excellent quality.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Kind of dreary, dull, and dark lobby. The Marriott is a block away and much nicer.

review.title: A Great Stay, Great Location, Great Service
review.reviewText: Another great stay at a Westin for 3 nights. Location is brilliant if you don't want to be right next to the bustle of Fisherman's Wharf. Central for shopping, restaurants, some of the sights. Very easy access for all public transportation. Service was 1st class and experience tells me if anything is wrong you simply ask, be polite and explain reasonably how they can resolve the issue to your satisfaction - Westin's have NEVER failed me and I've stayed at loads of hotels of different hotel chains of all classes. Be warned, parking cost at the hotel is $50+ per night - even the hotel staff tipped me off on this so it is an embarressment for them in my book! If you plan just to do sights in SF you don't really need a car in my opinion. This Hotel hits my Highly Recommended category and top of the return list for San Francisco.

review.title: Great service and atmosphere
review.reviewText: The staff were very attendant to guest service. Highly recommend

review.title: quick review
review.reviewText: great location, quick walk from the mall, shops, transportation (bart, bus, trolley) and plenty of restaurants don't touch the frig or the tray of snacks unless you plan on paying for them. their wired with sensors.

review.title: Fantastic location- excellent hotel
review.reviewText: The only thing I might find lacking in this otherwise great hotel was the concierge service. They didn't really answer my questions about public transportation very well. All Hotels should have printed schedules and routes of public transportation.

review.title: Realy Good, room, view, service
review.reviewText: Very pleasent and helpfull staff, every question answered immediately and correctly. I made a small complaint about the internet (should realy be included in today's world) and the charge was removed immediately, no questions asked. Can recommend this to anyone, great location 1-2 blocks from Union Square and shopping.

review.title: I really can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very accessible to attractions, restaurants and shops. I love how it was in the middle of downtown so to speak. THe hotel was clean, fresh and very nice. Our room was very nice, clean and comfortable.I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

review.title: devil is in the details
review.reviewText: beautiful hotel, beautiful rooms, great location, excellant restaurant. but is 3 star in the details/ service. room came with 3 bags of decafe coffee, took 45 minutes and two phone calls to get a bag of regular. very expensive in room internet, didn't work or worked poorly when it did. no newspapers delivered to rooms on weekends.

review.title: Good Customer Service
review.reviewText: Upon check in, we were assigned a room on the 36th floor (top floor). When I got to the room, I realized that with my vertigo, I could not stay there. I called the front desk and they found a room for me on the 4th floor. It was actually a bigger, nicer room with a king bed.

review.title: Stains on bed; used bubblegum on picture frame; Westin didn't care
review.reviewText: Hotels can't be accountable for the filthiness of their guests but when we discovered suspicious looking stains on the underside of our quilt and used chewing gum stuck to a picture frame we expected things to be dealt quickly and urgently. Instead there seemed little interest in our complaints and we had to make several calls to the front desk and to room service to get any response at all. There was no follow-up, no management apology, no apparent commitment to the standards of client care that Westin supposedly espouse. Very, very disappointing - not, as I say, that the soilage was undiscovered but that Westin's response was so slovenly.

review.title: Perfect view of the city
review.reviewText: Very friendly check-in, housekeeping, and dining room staff. We had one of the smaller corner rooms that feature two walls of windows. Spectacular view of the city and bay. Comfortable bed, linens, and everything else you want in a hotel room. We'll definitely go back.

review.title: NICE
review.reviewText: NICE ROOM, GREAT BED, SIMPLE AND CLEAN

review.title: Westin SF
review.reviewText: When we arrived our room hadn't been cleaned, so I would expect that they would of compensated us for this inconvenience with a free drink or something. Other than that it was fantastic! The "heavenly dream" mattress is awesome to sleep on!

review.title: Recommended +++
review.reviewText: Hotel is very convenient for Market Street & the transport to all sites. Very comfortable.

review.title: Lovely room and great location
review.reviewText: The hotel room was just like the website photo: Queen size beds, pillow top mattresses, duvets. Big flat screen TV. Lovely bathroom with great toiletries - they provide soap, shampoo and conditioner and body lotion but no shower gel. Hairdrier and a large magnifying mirror was a bonus. We had a downtown view next time I would try for a Bay one. Try the hotel restaurant - Ducca - the food was excellent and great value. We only had one problem and that was with the internet connection via the TV. The front desk quickly removed the charge from our bill when we mentioned it. Location was excellent with a short walk to the transit station and to shopping - many drugstores and boutiques as well as stores such as Bloomingdales and Maceys.

review.title: Will always book Westin.
review.reviewText: The comfort of the rooms, the location, and the helpfulness of the staff means that I will choose to stay in this hotel again, and that I will also choose Westin hotels to stay in on future trips in the expectation that they meet the same high standards as Westin San Francisco Market Street.

review.title: Excellent location for business or leisure: close to restaurants, shopping and transportation.
review.reviewText: Service varied greatly, from a warm and extremely helpful arrival to a "could not care less" departure. Overall, the room, the location and the food was very good.

review.title: Very nice and reasonably priced hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was great - nice room, great view, clean, and a friendly staff. The only drawback was the distance from the Fisherman's Wharf. I'd recommend using the bus system (MUNI) as a means to get to and from the Wharf.

review.title: This is a great hotel, but....
review.reviewText: our room was on the side that doesn't have great views. Also, the bathroom was very small. I have stayed at this Westin one other time and was totally blown away by the room. Evidently, not all of them are quite as spacious as that first. Beyond that, our stay was very pleasant. The hotel is within walking distance of fabulous San Francisco shopping and public transit that can take you just about anywhere in the city.

review.title: Service not what I expect from a Westin
review.reviewText: The location, cleanliness and comfort of the hotel was what I expected and enjoy when I visit a Westin but the pleasantness of the staff at the front desk, concierge and bell desk was definitely not up to Westin standards. We were upgraded to a "higher" room after waiting for a room (which was very nice) and we could see the Bay Bridge from our room!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a convenient location and is nicely decorated. The rooms are comfortable and have large plasma t.v.'s. The lounge has couches and is quite comfortable after a day of touring and concierge was very helpful! Check-in was very quick.

review.title: great location, great price, great hotel
review.reviewText: We thouroughly enjoyed our stay. All the things we wanted to see were in walking distance (some good long walks and some not so far) and the service and atmosphere were welcoming. We especially enjoyed the complimentary happy hour wine.

review.title: Good experience at the Westin on Market Street
review.reviewText: Location: Excellent. In the middle of Downtown off Market Street. Between 2 BART stations (recommended for ease of use, speed & low cost from SFO airport). 5 minutes to Union Square, 5 minutes to Westfield Shopping Centre, 5 minutes to the 2 major Tourist Tram stops, get the idea?
