You've got buses, streetcars and trams within a few minutes walk that service the majority of the City, and public transport is decent cheap in San Fran so there's no reason not to use it. The Hotel: We had a standard Queen-bed room on the lower floors, but asking politely at the front desk got us moved up to a higher floor, corner room with nice City views! Room was well equipped, good TV, nice bathroom and a very comfy bed. Soap / Shampoo etc all good quality and a free daily USA Today. Good quality Starbucks Coffee / Tea, however we had a gripe with the paper cups (it's a hotel, not a coffee shop!) which took 2 days and a couple of conversations with housekeeping before they would bring us proper mugs. The fiance said the shower wasn't hot at times, though I never noticed myself. For international travellers, the hotel doesn't provide complimentary power adapters, so don't forget them! The rest of the hotel was very pleasant, nice lobby / lounge area and a good bar, however we didn't try the restaurant or the gym, so can't comment there! Service was great, housekeeping were pleasant and very quick to respond to requests. The Concierge was very pleasant and helpful with the queries we had.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Everyone at the hotel was nice and helpful! beds are comfaterble. The only thing is the big window(from ceiling to floor) was dirty. otherwise very nice.

review.title: WESTIN - MARKET STREET (nice place)
review.reviewText: the WESTIN SF - MARKET PLACE is a very nice hotel. its in a great location just tucked away off of MARKET ST on 3rd. we were able to get an "END" room on the 28th floor and had an awesome view of the city. i am convinced that there is no bad view from any of the rooms. the staff was VERY helpful and made sure we had what we needed. my wife needed contact lens solution so i asked the staff where the closest drugstore was. they asked what i needed in case it was available in their little gift shop. lo and behold, they had it and just charged it to the room. room was clean and quiet (which is VERY important to me). hotel is in a great location....just a few mins away from shopping, china town...etc. no complaints.

review.title: Very happy........
review.reviewText: ...with the choice we made for our stay in San Francisco. Location was excellent, room was good (twin/higher floor) with a great view. - the only reason we didnt give it all '5' ratings was because we've stayed in one or two slightly better elsewhere. Would stay there again without doubt.

review.title: Great business hotel...
review.reviewText: This places is clean, efficent, and comfortable. It's near a starbucks and they have a decent bar and outside area as well. I didn't test the gym but heard from others staying there that it was quite good.

review.title: Wonderful Daddy-Daughter Trip
review.reviewText: Every time you walk into the hotel you're greated by the aroma of flowers and I think a scent generator of some kind but who cares it's great! That's just the begining of a great experience. The place is beautiful and the room was the cleanest I've ever stayed in. This trip was a gift to my daughter for her outstanding school work this last year and for just being a wonderful young lady. IT WAS IMPORTANT TO ME THAT SHE HAD A GOOD TIME! That she did and the hotel staff, room and view of the neighboring buildings including Market St. helped make that happen. The location was perfect. We walked to Pier 39, hitting China Town and North Beach where we dined at each one the two nights of our stay. We also were within comfortable waking distance to the Warped Tour Concert we attended on Pier 30/32. If your stay encompasses these landmark stops this is the perfect place for you. If we used a taxi the fare was less than $8.00 in all directions we needed to travel.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is good, expensive but relaxing, parking is way too expensive $50+ for overnight stay

review.title: Hotel is tired
review.reviewText: People helpful but rooms are very small and in need of furniture and upgrades. Plaster around base of toilet etc. Only 1 small bottle of shampoo (refilled) and conditioner. Basically a Red Roof Inn

review.title: Westin on Markt street
review.reviewText: My only wish is that the hotel has a free parking. It costed me $49/24 hr to park at the hotel. I would go somewhere else if the parking is included.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location for shopping! The exercise room had more than enough exercise equipment (treadmills & bikes) and plenty of free weights. Large work-out room.

review.title: What a difference!
review.reviewText: Whenever I visit San Francisco, I always like to stay at the W-Hotel. This time I couldnt get any room there so I went across street to the Western, which also owned by Starwood. The experience I have with the Western was quite different from the W's hospitality. I pulled up to the front door, the guy didnt offer help to unload luggage. Then he asked me if I were to have the car valet, I said yes, then he said its gonna be around $50 per night. He gave me a look of "you really want to valet??". It is very much like a business trip hotel. If you are going to SF for pleasure, dont stay there.

review.title: My Preferred Business Travel Hotel
review.reviewText: When traveling for business, as long as the price is feasible and close to my meetings I try to book the Westin. Mostly because it means I won't have to worry about anything. The rooms are comfortable (love the Heavenly Bed!) and the staff is usually helpful. This most recent trip I was arriving early to check in on a flight from NY and need to get to a business meeting and they were able accomodate an early check in so I could shower and change. Also their concierges are usually very helpful in booking restaurant reservations and making suggestions. During this trip I really didn't use the concierge service, or any other extra services, but things overall were up to par. I found this Westin looking particularly new and clean.

review.title: Well pleased with hotel and service.
review.reviewText: Only hiccup was a small bath tub with sides approximately twice the height of a normal bath tub. I was informed that this tub was a leftover from the old hotel which was Japanese.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The Westin is located close to Union Square, Financial District, and the Westfield Mall.

review.title: Hotel for the business travler. Also, comfy, but Mini Bar fiasco!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very comfy, but I was charged for a mini bar item that I did not comsume. I brought it up to the front desk and instead of fixing it over the phone, they wanted me to come down to the front desk. I was not happy because it was the morning of our check out and I wanted to do some last minute sight seeing before my flight left. Therefore, I wanted to do the express checkout. I figured it wasn't worth wasting my time. Overall, The hotel was comfy and concierge was helpful. Our room view was a disappointment and there was no free wi-fi. It seemed like a hotel geared more toward the business travler.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: Nice, comfortable place in a good location.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: A very nice, centrally-located business hotel that was fine for a personal weekend

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Chose hotel for its location and on a level, no-steep-hill street. Booked 4 "traditional" rooms on 4,6,7th floors for travellers aged 19-82. Easily accessible by BART from airport, 10 min. slow stroll from Montgomery station. (Seniors took airport shuttle). Rooms were clean, comfy, quiet, facing Third St (midway down hall). No view except from 7th floor. Rooms in alcove near fire escape may be very noisy on windy days. Rooms with 2 beds were spacious; room with 1 king bed was tiny (for the same price). Market Street-1/2 block away-has direct street cars/buses to Fisherman's Wharf/Ferry Bldg/Haight-Ashbury/Golden Gate Park. 10 min. stroll to Powell St. cable car terminal and Chinatown. Take the bus or walk to North Beach (we walked). Used gym daily-great facility. Front desk/conceirge-indifferent, not really helpful or friendly but not rude. Did not eat in hotel because there are a lot of good, inexpensive places close by. Hotel allows pets but the allergy-sufferers in our group were given a choice of rooms in case leftover dander affected them. We had no problems.

review.title: Convenient for 1st timer to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very satisfied with the Westin on Market Street. One block to Moscone Center. Within 6 blocks of cable car loading area.. 2 blocks from indoor mall- nice stores. Restaurants and drug stores (ie:Walgreen's) within 1-2 blocks. Supershuttle pickup at hotel. Great for a 'non-business' traveler on business trip!

review.title: More of a 3-Star Hotel
review.reviewText: A lower satisfaction score is due to poor service in solving a problem with connection to the Internet. We were unable to use a laptop in our room despite three lengthy calls with a technician. No one came to our room to solve the problem. Using the "Business Center" was a joke. The "one" computer available was out-of-order for our entire stay, four days. Poor service for a 4-Star hotel.

review.title: Close to it all
review.reviewText: Beds are extremely comfortable, very quiet rooms,close to all transportation,quiet,adjustable room thermostats.

review.title: Perfect Location, A little spendy and snobbish
review.reviewText: I'm from Santa Cruz so I like luxury without the attitude. We rented a "luxury suite." The room was very nice, better than a comparably priced room at the W in terms of size and features (two flat screen TVs, iPod dock, fridge, three room suite, etc.). The hotel location is perfect. Easy and safe late-night walks from the nearby Warfield Theater. The people that work at the hotel are a bit snobbish, but they were nice enough one on one. The typical guest at this hotel is a 50-something, rich, white executive. The "bar" here is filled with flavored-martini-sipping women and scotch gulping men. The restaurant offers "Venetian" food and theme, but not really (I've been to Venice). It is provincial Italian food with a Bay-area touch and price. It is good food at "great food" prices. Better to eat elsewhere. The same is true of the room-service, though they will deliver your over-priced food within 20 minutes, which is impressive.

review.title: Comfortable Beds
review.reviewText: The doorman are in cahoots with Limo Drivers. It is almost impossible to hail a cab when the doormen are getting kickbacks from the limo drivers for placing people. Doorman on cell phone, calling more limo drivers, with a line of people ready for cabs. Elevators broke down as well had to take the grimy service elevators which looked like they were never cleaned.

review.title: One of the best in SF
review.reviewText: From the valet to the comfort of the room, this hotel is definitely one of my favorites.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: From the bellman to the front desk clerk, the staff was friendly and very helpful. They gave us a room on the top (36th) floor with a great view. The room was most comfortable and relaxing. The location was convenient as well. So we truly had a great experience.

review.title: Beautiful Place
review.reviewText: I've stayed a couple of times in San Francisco for the JavaOne Conference. This Hotel is just perfectly located and provides high class comfort. I highly recommend this Hotel as the service and quality is just great.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: I think that for the price I could have got a better location hotel. Anyway, rooms are outstanding.

review.title: This was a great hotel!
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel! My husband and I, along with our 7 month old daughter and my mother stayed in one room. (a standard room with two queen size beds) I was concerned about space at first because one reviewer complained that the rooms were too small. Even when we had the hotel bring a crib into the room, we had plenty of space. We were very comfortable! The room was very clean and despite one reviewer warning travelers that the hotel does not provide toiletries, we found all of the normal stuff in our room. (Shampoo, conditioner, soap, and lotion) The room itself was great, but the best part was the location. It is perfect! There are lots of restaurants all in walking distance (star bucks and California Pizza Kitchen are just across the street). Walgreens in less than a block away, just in case you forget your toothbrush like I did. (or run out of baby wipes) There is a mall and lots of shopping just blocks away. We only had one tiny issue with this hotel....don't pick anything up from the mini bar or the snacks left out on top of the dresser. They are very expensive and as soon as you pick anything up you are charged. We didn't realize this and picked up a few things just to look at them (the snacks are very enticing and exotic looking) then we place them back without eating them or disturbing the packaging and found we were charged anyway for them. So don't pick anything up unless you really want it. :)

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: We spent a very enjoyable weekend in downtown San Franscisco... and one of the highlights was the hotel. Very centrally located. We were able to walk to great shopping, good dining and the Muni transit was almost out the front door. Valet parking is very expensive but ample parking in a secure garage in the back for a more reasonable price. Would definitely stay again!!

review.title: First class all the way
review.reviewText: A big plus was that this hotel was centrally located. I was impressed with our room's appointments....very upscale and modern

review.title: Large room, great location
review.reviewText: This is one of the best rooms I've ever had in SF, most of the hotels have tiny rooms. This one had two queen beds and a large bathroom with plenty of storage space. The location is excellent, minutes from shopping.

review.title: nice place to stay
review.reviewText: the bathroom is small but everything is perfect

review.title: Great location, close to many landmarks, easy access to public transportation
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay, will definitely fit into any future plans of ours to visit San Francisco.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: This hotel was great!! very close to the shops. the only thing is that parking gets expensive!!!

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: The hotel was very comfortable and clean.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We loved the Westin. The hotel was newly renovated. Everything was clean and the service was great. We would love to go back to the Westin!

review.title: Excellent Choice in D'town SF
review.reviewText: Overall experience was excellent. Hotel was very clean and in great repair. Staff extremely polite and professional.

review.title: Good choice
review.reviewText: We visited san francisco several times before. This time, my family stayed in the westin hotel for 2 days and overally speaking we enjoyed our stay there.

review.title: Very well situated
review.reviewText: Brilliant position for walking/public transport. Beds were the most comfortable I have ever had in a hotel. We had to request extra towels because their standard of two small bath towels, two small handtowels and one average size bath sheet wasn't enough for two people. We also were only given one bathrobe. Any request made to the hotel was fulfilled quickly (extra towels, free fridge).

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The Westin Market Street is a perfect holiday location. Its close to Union Square, China Town and all the main shopping areas. Loads of places to eat and enjoy yourself nearby and all forms of transportation are just a few minutes walk away. Plus the lovely Yerba Buena Park is literally on your doorstep - don't miss it!

review.title: Dirty washcloths hanging from the shower curtain rod
review.reviewText: I've stayed at this hotel several times and this was by far the worst experience. The biggest issue? Those dirty, crusty, old washcloths that were hanging from my shower curtain rod when I checked in to my room. I complained the next morning to the concierge desk and when I returned that evening THEY WERE STILL THERE! Absolutely disgusting. I had other problems, too. The ethernet cable in my room was broken and I had to request a new one. My TV did not work correctly. A technician came the first evening, but since it sounded like it was going to be extensive work to get it fixed, I told him to come back the next day when I was going to be out of the room. As I was leaving the hotel that morning I told the concierge that the repair tech could come to my room anytime. When I returned in the evening, the TV had never been fixed. Other problems: the toilet took two flushes to drain completely. And one morning I received a checkout statement for a different room by mistake. I love Westin ordinarily, but this was a really disappointing stay.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful, very well kept. It was a bit hard to get service at the front desk though. Other than that room service was great, the rooms were very clean and comfortable. They have a great little firepit and sitting area in the back of the hotel.

review.title: Convenient to Moscone Convention Center
review.reviewText: The best feature is the proximity to the Moscone Convention Center. My room was very clean, quiet, and comfortable. I was dissappointed by the lobby bar. It was uncomfortable and noisy, and the service was poor. I left after waiting 20 minutes for my drink order to be served.

review.title: Great hotel near Moscone Center
review.reviewText: This is the second year in a row I have stayed at this hotel (although it was the Argent in 2007) but it is great, the location is within walking distance of the Moscone Center where my conference was and Union Square where we had dinner a few nights. Strongly recommend.

review.title: Will go back again
review.reviewText: I was satisfied with the hotel and room. I will go back no hesitation for furture business and/or leisure trips to San Francisco.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: We requested a king bed on the first 10 floors 4 months prior to our vacation; when we checked in at 11:00pm the rude hotel clerk advised they didnt have a king bed, but he would upgrade us to the 29th floor with double bed. What he failed to advise was that the room was next to all the elevators and maintenance room. We experienced extremely difficult sleeping throughout our entire stay. We did requested a change, he accomodated with a new room. When we asked to see the new room, he stated that that was not possible and we had to make our decision right away. We accepted the new room because we were not sleeping and when we opened the door on the new room it was a tiny room on the end of the hotel that was in an angle shape would hardly accomodate our suitcases without keeping them on the king size bed. We went back down to he hotel clerk and complained and he was insulted.

review.title: Fantastic Views
review.reviewText: We were very lucky to have stayed in a room on the top floor. We had fantastic views overlooking the city. We could see Union Square, Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz Island.

review.title: excellent service & accomotations
review.reviewText: After a long flight and business day; arriving to a clean room with everything it was heaven.

review.title: Something inconvenient but good location
review.reviewText: Car parking is very expensive. Internet and phone are also very expensive. Safety deposit box was equipped but not prepared to use. But hotel location is good for shopping.

review.title: Comfort!!!!!
review.reviewText: The most wonderful bed. GREAT Location. everything is in walking distance to everything.. Would stay there again for sure...

review.title: Dirty Sheets
review.reviewText: After a late night event I arrived in my room at 11:30 p.m. ready for a good night sleep. When I got into bed I felt something between the sheets at the foot of the bed. Throwing back the covers I found a pair of DIRTY socks! They had not changed the sheets! I contacted the Manager on Duty and he had no idea what to do. I insisted on a new room with a clean bed. Within 10 minutes one was located and at midnight I was traipsing down the hall to my new room. The new room was next to the housekeeping closet and early in the morning I woke to the housekeeper stocking her cart. When I left the room to go to the gym, the housekeeper asked, "when are you leaving". That made me feel quite welcome. I left a voice mail for the General Manager and now one week later, I have yet to hear anything. What a nightmare. I've stayed in this hotel numerous times when it was the Argent. This may be the same hotel but the Westin customer service falls well below the Argents. They have increased prices and lowered standards. Fortunately, there are many fine hotels in San Francisco to choose from.

review.title: Going back to the Mark Hopkins
review.reviewText: The most impersonal hotel we have ever stayed at. From the car valet to the desk clerk, it was as if we were invisible. The coldest darkest hotel we will never again stay at.Pay a little more and stay at a nice hotel.

review.title: Great location, great staff.
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and efficient. Great location...close to Art Museum, Theaters and Great Food.

review.title: Everything was great! AAA Service!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was excellent! They were very helpful and courteous.

review.title: Dirty Sheets
review.reviewText: My friend and I got to our room about 11:30 p.m. after attending an event. When I got into my bed I felt something in the bed. I threw back the covers to find someone's DIRTY socks in the bed. They had not changed the sheets between guests!!! Management on duty did not know what to do. I insisted on a new room and at midnight I'm traipsing down the hall. They gave me a room next to the housekeeping closet so I was awake at first light by the housekeeper loading up her cart. That morning I called and left a voicemail message for the General Manager and haven't heard a word from her since. As I was heading to Starbucks in the morning, the housekeeper asked me when I was leaving. That made me feel quite welcome! [I wanted to tell her it couldn't be soon enough.]. As if I hadn't had enough bad situations, I asked the concierge to map directions for me and he mapped the wrong address. I used to love this hotel when it was the Argent. The Westin has raised prices and significantly lowered standards. Not to worry, there are plenty of hotels to choose from in SF.

review.title: Great Stay, Great Location.
review.reviewText: This very comfy hotel is just steps from Market St.and only a few blocks from Embarcadero. Perfect location for just about anything you might want to do.

review.title: Very comfortable
review.reviewText: Essentially as advertised. Only advice is to call in advance for in/out valet parking service if you're in a hurry to get your car. Otherwise expect a 30-45 min wait since the hotel is busy.

review.title: Overall...nice
review.reviewText: nice and friendly staff at the hotel, the only down side was the noisy room that backed up to the elevator. very clean and confortable...

review.title: the worst westin i've ever stayed in
review.reviewText: Room is comfortable and clean, but the service is the worst I have ever had in a Westin. Staff were not hospitable nor helpful. Good location though, many attractions within walking distance. I'll think twice if I want to stay there again...

review.title: Great bed. Slept like a baby!
review.reviewText: Upon checking in we were told of the many amenities and made to feel welcome from the start. The front desk was very informative and courteous. After a hectic pace of shopping and sightseeing, the hotel offered a quiet and comfy place to rest and get ready for another busy day. We definitely enjoyed our stay and wiil be back in the fall!

review.title: Very convenient
review.reviewText: Extremely well located hotel, great service, great views, very beautiful and classy lobby and common areas, great bedrooms and probably the best deal in SF.

review.title: Awesome Stay
review.reviewText: We were very satisfied with our selection. The service and the people here were very nice. I would gladly come here again.

review.title: Make sure you check your bill
review.reviewText: The rooms at the Westin are very comfortable, everything was new and clean. The only problem I had was when I checked out, I did not notice 3 separate charges from the Ducca Lounge for the previous night. I did not go to the lounge and found that someone with the same last name indicated a room close to mine so Westin automatically charged my room. After I returned home, I called the Westin - it took them 3-4 days to admit it was their fault, but that was after they sent copies of the charges to me - all the same handwriting with the same name but different room numbers - I had to point that out to them before they confirmed to reverse the charges.

review.title: Beautiful hotel and great location!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great! It was just recently renovated and everything was brand new and clean. Hotel staff was terrific and we will be staying there everytime we go to San Fran for a visit. It was a great location..very quiet at night and located right near union square.

review.title: Great Hotel, great location !!
review.reviewText: It couldn't be better, the hotel is very good, and the location is prime, only a couple of blocks away of the main attractions and half a block from Market Ave.

review.title: Great Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very pleased with hotel! Fantastic location and great room. Lobby smells amazing! Everything in the room looked new, bed was very comfortable. Plenty of towels and pillows. Great amenities in hotel: workout room, lounge area and bar. Helpful staff. Very impressed, our first time in San Fran, would definetly return and stay with Westin Market Street again!

review.title: great SF downtown location near high end shopping
review.reviewText: much prefer staying here, a short 5 minute walk to shopping, around 10 minute walk to Union Square which we feel is way too touristy. If you like SF amenities in a high end hotel, then stay at Westin SF Market Street. Starbucks and California Pizza across the street. You won't be disappointed. Can't wait to go back!

review.title: Perfect place to treat your loved one
review.reviewText: An excellent hotel, with superb location, friendly staff and a modern comfortable room.

review.title: Great location, beautiful rooms
review.reviewText: Apparently,the higher up you go in the hotel, the better the rooms get. Although we got a free upgrade and received a beautiful, large room on the 8th floor. For the location and the quality of the room, the price was very good.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed with my family for 3 nights, 2 young kids that they treated great! Got a quiet room with a view without even asking! It's a great location, close to Bart and all transportation. We would love to go back!!

review.title: Great experience!
review.reviewText: Location is fantastic, walked to the fashion district and tons of restaurants nearby. Food was great in the hotel. Employees were very friendly and accomodating. We loved the 'modern sophistication' design throughout the property lobby, rooms, restaurants... Ask the concierege for the brochure to take a Segway tour of the harbor, great fun. We had a great stay!

review.title: Will return to this Hotel
review.reviewText: Very central and convenient for all attractions

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the Westin SanFrancisco Market Street when I was on my business trip. It is a very well maintained hotel with excellent service. I liked the location too.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: This was nice, affordable and the staff was both friendly and helpful. Would stay there again.

review.title: Loads of hidden fees
review.reviewText: for the price there should be free high speed wireless. It was 14.95 a day for 2 bars of signal. Slow internet at a daily rate of what I can get it for at home for a full month.

review.title: Look out for Parking Fees
review.reviewText: Hotel is nice and I would recommend, however be aware that the hotel will charge you $46 for overnight parking on top of your nightly stay. OUCH.

review.title: VERY WELL located, elegant and not expensive.
review.reviewText: The room is comfortable, modern and with a big TV screen, you have a nice desk and chair to work, unfortunately the business center is poorly so its better to take your laptop and other gadgets with you.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was loacated in walking distance to shopping and great places to eat. We stayed for leisure and were more than satisfied.

review.title: Very Handy Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is very close to the shopping area which I love a lot.

review.title: Westin in SF
review.reviewText: I took my husband to SF for his bday this year and we enjoyed this hotel This hotel has an amazing location. our room had an amazing view on the top floor.... The staff at the front desk was mostly helpful expect for the guy that checked us in....but thats just one out of many! I would def recommend this hotel.

review.title: Not a four star hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel service and concierge service was poor. When I complained about scratching noise in air vents that kept us up all night long the front desk said "sorry cannot do anything about it, its nature." I had the worse night sleep that night as a result that I regret staying there. They do not have a gift shop either and no HBO. Rooms are very small but clean. If you stay here, make sure you bring your own toiletries, cotton balls, q-tips, soap, shampoo (poor quality soaps) everything!

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: I am a former San Franciscan who stayed here for a week on business. The location is fantastic. The doormen and front desk staff are great. The rooms are clean and the beds comfortable. However...the restraunt (and room service) is pretentious, very expensive and of poor quality by San Francisco standards. Eat elsewhere-which is easy in San Francisco. If any problems occur, management is unavailable.

review.title: Vacation
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a GREAT location. It is very close to shopping,dining and the cable cars. The beds are extremely comfortable. The hotel staff was not very helpful when we were trying to find locations of different shops etc. However, the cleanliness,comfort of the rooms and convenience of the location super cede the staff's incompetence!

review.title: Very good location
review.reviewText: The Hotel is well located and the room comfortable, I would not recommend to have breakfast at the hotel, we found it expensive and not worth the price.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: This hotel is a great location in San Fransisco especially for the novice to the area. It is easy to access all public transportation, and allows a first time visitor to walk to many local attractions. I especially appreciated that the hotel gave me the "best room available for a Starwood Preferred Member" even though I booked this through Expedia.

review.title: Great location in downtown S.F.
review.reviewText: Excellent customer service, great location to shopping & multiple dining spots

review.title: pillow talk
review.reviewText: Did not like the pillows. All pillows were too fluffy.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: Best Hotel I have stayed in, great location and the employees are very friendly.

review.title: Fabulous!
review.reviewText: Granted we only stayed for the weekend, I loved this hotel. Its gorgeous, the room was big (2 queen beds), with soft comfy down bedding. Also, the staff is awsome. When we needed a cab hauled they hauled us a limo instead at an awsome price. At the end I was double charged for parking but they took care of that quickly with no questions asked. The staff never made us feel pushed into tipping (like some hotels can)..which made us feel like tipping more!

review.title: Great location and accommodations
review.reviewText: Besides the "dream beds," the location (close to shopping) and accessibility to public transportation was wonderful. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Westin San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great central location and only 5 mins walk from Montgomery St BART station. Clean comfortable room with very efficient daily room service. Only a couple of minor gripes. Firstly, don't waste your money on the pay per day internet service through the TV - very poor speed and limited service - I will definitely take my laptop next time. Secondly, beware of the sensors on the mini bar. If you pick something up to look at it, you will be charged, even if you put it back. Finally, the hotel restaurant had very efficient service, but the quality of the food was disappointing for the price. Despite these gripes however, would definitely stay here again if in San Francisco.

review.title: Perfect hotel, perfect location, impeccably clean...
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights and cannot wait to go back and stay there again. I believe the hotel just recently underwent a rennovation and re-branding and we were lucky enough to reap those rewards. The rooms are modern and impeccably clean. The location is perfect to get right into the action of San Francisco. Located just yards from the subway system and street-cars, it is super convenient too. The bed was huge and comfy and the furniture was modern, making this hotel one of the best genuine 4-star hotels we've ever stayed in!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice, rooms were great, with 42 inch plasma. The only problem we had was the bath tub kept clogging up, there were no shower caps or q-tips in the bathroom. There were two of us staying in the room but only one bath robe provided. They had the sensored refrigerator in the room so we asked for another empty one and they sent it up right away.

review.title: will not go back ever
review.reviewText: booked a smoking room when arriving at hotel was informed that they dont have smoking rooms in my opinion i should of been aware of that while making the reservations , also they are a bunch of snobs . I will Never stay there again.

review.title: Luxury Hotel
review.reviewText: Very classy hotel and great location. It is close Chinatown and Union Square. Great locale for places to eat and shop. Very good service at this hotel.

review.title: Can't wait to return
review.reviewText: a fantastic hotel for downtown, everything close to hand that you can ever think off... certainly worth the stay

review.title: Perfect hotel, perfect location, impeccably clean...
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights and cannot wait to go back and stay there again. I believe the hotel just recently underwent a rennovation and re-branding and we were lucky enough to reap those rewards. The rooms are modern and impeccably clean. The location is perfect to get right into the action of San Francisco. Located just yards from the BART subway system and street-cars, it is super convenient too. The bed was huge and comfy and the furniture was modern, making this hotel one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in!

review.title: Can't Wait To Return.
review.reviewText: This was the first trip to San Francisco for my mom and I and I could not be happier. The check in and check out were a breeze and the recommendations from the concierge were excellent. Also love the fact that the liquor store right next door is open until midnight for late night snacks. The bedding in the room was so soft and the view was amazing.

review.title: Nice room, slow service
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is comfortable and well kept. There was plenty of helpful staff members around, except for when I went to check in. The gentleman at the desk seemed overwhelmed and upset that no one was able to help him. He was apologetic for the wait, and that is always appreciated.

review.title: Great stay at the Westin Market Street San Fran!
review.reviewText: Central location for the shops. Great service. AMAZING beds - they are truly and experience. Got a great deal on expedia.co.uk incl flights. Wouldnt fail to recommend.

review.title: Great location, very comfortable
review.reviewText: the hotel is in the center of all, perfect location, reasonable prices. one of the best hotel i have ever stayed. i have stayed all over the place, and this is up there for sure. the only tip is that if you are driving and staying there, please be aware that parking in SF is expensive so please be prepared to pay some bucks for the hotel parking or any parking lots nearby. BUT I REALLY RECOMMEND IT! me and my wife had a blast!

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: We found we were able to walk most everywhere we wanted to go. Only fault was the air conditioning/thermostat was not working properly. Someone came to look at it immediately after we called to report the problem. He got it to cool, but thermostat was set for 63 and no way the room was that cold. Also, fan in the bathroom ran the whole time. We shut the door so it wouldn't bother us.

review.title: Great Views
review.reviewText: Excellent location; views; food and Westin beds. Nice fireplace area for drinks. Walking distance to Union Square/shopping.

review.title: Great Location. Big, comfortable rooms.
review.reviewText: You really can't beat the location of this hotel. The new Westin brand experience is really consistent (comfortable beds, linens, modern/clean design, etc.). And the standard rooms are spacious compared to the other Union Sq hotels in this price range. Only thing that separates it from a 5 star hotel is that the concierge/doorman service was a little greedy with the tipping. I love to tip! but it's always awkward to have and empty palm in your face all the time :(

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: great hotel experience. went for the weekend to get away and would definitely do it again!

review.title: Clean, quiet and extremely comfortable.
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, quiet and extremely comfortable. The breakfast was pricy. The only negative, more of an annoyance than anything, was once you insert the card key to open the door, you have to turn the door handle up instead of down to enter the room as in most hotels. It initially gave me the impression the room key did not work. Highly recommend the hotel. Nice plasma TV in room. Not much interaction with the staff but when there was, it was friendly, helpful and courteous.

review.title: Excellent Pick for SF
review.reviewText: Great Westin property. Excellent location, ambiance , service and great rooms.

review.title: Loved It
review.reviewText: Check-in was at 3:00, but we arrived at the hotel at about 1:30 and was able to get an early check-in without any problems. Check-out was at 12:00, but we were able to have a late check-out at 1:30. Booking the reservations through Expedia, we received free breakfast for two, at the hotel restaurant.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The lobby was unimpressive. I didn't see any good art hanging. The view from the room is okay -- just looking at the other buildings' roofs. It's fine, but not for the price I paid.

review.title: Great Hotel in the heart of SF
review.reviewText: I am from the Bay Area, and decided to stay at the Westin for a few days while I was back in town visiting. It is a great hotel. Get the premier room with a nice view of the whole city at the top. The location is central to everything. I was able to run on the embarcadero, hit up Union Square for shopping, and able to take short cab rides to visit my friends in the city.

review.title: Great!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a prime location! Only 2 blocks to Union Square where all the shopping is, Macy's, Virgin Records, Apple, Westfield Mall etc. And only a 10 minute walk to China Town, which I highly recommend. There are many great restaurants around as well. The BART station is just around the corner. The hotel is VERY clean and the staff was excellent. The concierge was very knowledgeable and knew where everything was. The beds were very comfortable and the t.v. was very large for an average room. Our room was on the 27th floor and the view was quite a sight! I would return to this hotel many times!

review.title: Great location...
review.reviewText: Great location and service. Only suggestion would be to have more food/restaurant selections... This reservation was for my parents who were visiting from out of town...

review.title: Reasonably nice location close to SOMA dining
review.reviewText: Nice hotel close to Union Square and Market Street shoping and SOMA dining. Good Bay views from upper floors but avoid rooms anywhere near elevator bank.

review.title: LOVED IT!
review.reviewText: Great location, walking distance to everything. bus stop's right out front. Great lounges to watch TV in.

review.title: Wonderful view from the room. Very efficient service.
review.reviewText: Very courteous staff. No complaints at all. Concierge very helpful in arranging transportation to the airport for a six a.m. departure.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Conveniently located to all transit. We had a corner room and had plenty of room. Would highly recommend!

review.title: Great place for a city weekend
review.reviewText: We live half an hour away from downtown San Francisco so normally we just go for a day or evening, but we recently stayed at the Westin one night. The room was extremely comfortable, we had a great view looking down at the Metreon and Yerba Buena gardens, and it was close enough to walk to shopping and the ball park (the ball park is a long-ish walk, but doable). I'm hoping to do another 'city night' next time my parents are in town to babysit and will stay at the Westin again.

review.title: so so
review.reviewText: neat room, nice amenity set, nice bedding, slippers-out of stock?? (sounds strange!), staff not professional enough. over all am quite satisfied with the service but will try other hotels for my next visit.

review.title: Would use again
review.reviewText: I was with a party of six over the Christmas period. We were all extremely happy with this Hotel. All I ever ask is a clean room and easy access to the sights. This Hotel more than ticked these boxes. Very freindly and helpful staff and top bed. If you are ever in San Fran over the Christmas period I would recomend Xmas Dinner in the Top of the Mark.

review.title: good location and new
review.reviewText: only compliant is the housekeeping, can't understand why it is rather absent-minded on refilling the starbucks paper cups.

review.title: golden gate...no... westin gate
review.reviewText: Wonderful time......not just the hotel but the city of san francisco. Anybody considering a trip to San Francisco.I thoroughly recommend the Westin,the staff were very helpful,the room was excellent,the view especially..Hoping to go back in SUMMER 2008.

review.title: Fabulous
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel Great location...i blk from Market and 3 blocks from Union Square, walking distance to Embarcadero and Market Delicious restaurant Cozy fireplace in one lobby's Beautiful place to spend the weekend!!!

review.title: Westin SF
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice especially for the price. Good location, good service, nice rooms. Expedia saved me about 50% off retail.

review.title: Overall Good location
review.reviewText: Good location and very friendly, helpful front desk staff. Valet parking had significant delay. Head bell man very accomodating on extremely busy holiday Friday night.

review.title: Hotel parking is a disaster! Don't touch the mini-bar
review.reviewText: $50 to park in the hotel. Took 40 minutes to get the car on Saturday, causing us to almost miss our dinner reservation. Sunday at check-out a guy was screaming at the attendents because they had not brought his car. Most unpleasant parking experince ver. The Westin should fire the company that contracts with them. They also would not answer their phones, causing more delay in getting your car.To the credit of management, they did credit us for one day of parking after I complained to the bell man. Be careful of the electronic mini-bar! It chages if you pick up something to look at it.

review.title: Very nice hotel and close to my office.
review.reviewText: Recommend to stay, especially if it's on sale. It is close to Union Square, SF Shopping Center and other attractions. In my case it was within walking distance from my office, which is great.

review.title: Just O.K.
review.reviewText: Stayed there since there was a "deal" on internet and I knew the location was convenient for shopping at Union Square. Clean but rooms are really small -- parking was $45 a night so deal was not so great after all. It was fine but with so many choice in area I wont be back

review.title: good call
review.reviewText: used to be the Argent, great location rooms little small but very well kept, good staff, renovated, one block from Market St. and cable cars, but also quiet. would recommend. If not staying at fisherman's wharf this is a good call, one block to union square and one block from the BART from the airport, save big time on airport transport and it is safe and quick

review.title: Nice hotel. Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice. Good views from upper floors. Walking distance from Little Italy (great for dining), Chinatown and Beach Blanket Babylon (about one mile). The staff is friendly and informed. The room comfortable.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: one of the nicest i have stayed in loved the beds ofcourse and the television!!

review.title: Great place to stay.
review.reviewText: The hotel was recently renovated and were very well done. The beds were great. The location was great and in walking distance to so many places. The staff was friendly and helpful. We utlized the lounge area as a great meeting place. Our family had three rooms and we all agreed that it was a great place to stay.

review.title: We will stay there again
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very accommodating and friendly. The rooms were very comfortable. We were especially pleased with how quiet the rooms were. The hotel is centrally located.

review.title: great hotel and location
review.reviewText: Everything was great but had to ask every day for enough towels as there were 4 of us

review.title: Westin San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very Comfortable and clean

review.title: In the thick of it...
review.reviewText: The Westin Hotel, is convenient to the heart of the shopping district, that contains such fine boutiques such as Ferrigamo, Coach, Armani, plus ALL and I mean ALL the major department stores..Macy's, Sak's Bloomingdales, etc.. The Westin plays host to a high trend restaurant known as Ducca. Service staff, very friendly and seemingly knowledgeable. The hotel boasts a 24 hour room service, although, being in a city such as San Francisco, there's no point in staying in the room. The hotel is also walking distance to the Metreon and the Moscone Center as well as the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art. We took in the International auto show at the Moscone Center. I would definitely be a repeat guest, as I am already a Starwood Preferred Guest.

review.title: First Experience with a Westin
review.reviewText: Very good impression even upon walking in...modern, marble and contemporary feel in this hotel. Staff very friendly, and the room was fantastic. They had a full gym-size treadmill and a large plasma TV to enjoy...and the bed was "heaven". It was the best sleep I've ever had at a hotel chain. BY ALL MEANS...GO and enjoy!!!

review.title: Very Satisfied.
review.reviewText: We found the hotel to have a perfect central location to absolutely everything we wanted to do. The staff was also friendly and accomodating. The room was a bit small, but we chose the single king instead of the two doubles, which we heard was larger. Very clean and comfortable. Will definitely stay here again. Great value

review.title: the king size bed is awesome
review.reviewText: love the room and hotel, and there was even a treadmill in my room!

review.title: very satisfied
review.reviewText: felt at home

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Very nice suites. Hotel restaurant was very upscale.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great views, great service, great location. Definitely i will go back to this hotel.

review.title: Good location but noisy room
review.reviewText: While this hotel is centrally located near Chinatown and Union Square, the first night we stayed we were put in an adjoinging room. We were woken up at 5 in the morning by our noisy neighbor's lenghty phone calls, which we could hear as if she was in the room with us. We requested a different room the second night and we stayed in a corner room, which was quieter. We were disappointed that it took the hotel staff all day (until 6pm) to move our stuff to the second room.

review.title: Excellent choice for convention center hotel
review.reviewText: Well appointed rooms, very clean and orderly. The room was on a bend in the hotel and made for an unusual layout.

review.title: Very good hotel Central Location
review.reviewText: Everything was top rate

review.title: Nice hotel, but like all in SFO... outrageous parking rates!
review.reviewText: Recent renovation is a nice improvement over the old and tired Argent Hotel.

review.title: nice enough
review.reviewText: normally love westins. this one was "ok-". perhaps just luck of the draw - but room seemed unually tight. view was horrible (directly looking at an empty building under construction); missing the usual room "accessories" such as lotion, shower cap, mouthwash, cotten swaps.... (may seem petty - but you're paying top dollar here) plus 2 light bulbs were out.

review.title: Westin SF - no way!
review.reviewText: I was surprised to find someone had checked into my room when returning from dinner. I was shocked at the fact no one noticed my belongings sprawled all over the room. Very disappointed how it was handled. After 20 minutes at the counter sent to a room unfortunately the manager wrote the wrong number down and we couldn't get in. The tub backed up in the morning and to top it off the manager told me that there were 4 others that were sent to rooms that already had guests booked in. I'd say, not a good safe choice.

review.title: Very Good
review.reviewText: I will be back!! Very nice and relaxed hotel.

review.title: great gym no pool though
review.reviewText: Clean, curteous service great location to Menino

review.title: would stay there again for sure
review.reviewText: the room was a good size, bed was very comfortable. hotel walking distance to good food and shopping.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This was a very nice and clean hotel. We stayed on the 35th floor and had a very nice view of Yerba Buena Gardens and some of the Bay. The staff were friendly when I needed assistance with directions and local transportation. We could walk to everything in only a few minutes. Union Square is only two blocks away as is the trolley turnaround. My only beef was that the restaruant there is not all that great. We arrived at 5:30pm to eat dinner and got seated way back in a corner when the room only had a handful of patrons in it. I thought guests of the hotel were supposed to get prime seating. I guess NOT! Our room was comfortable, but I wish that it would've had a bath/shower combination. It only had a shower and my husband loves to soak in the tub in the morning. He wasn't happy with that. For the most part the hotel was accomodating to our needs. I found many other places to eat at that were more reasonablly priced and not so stuffy. We would stay there again.

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very convenient. The bus stops were near by and shopping was just a few blocks away. We were very impressed with the hotel and definitly will come back the next time we visit San Francisco.

review.title: OK for the price
review.reviewText: Hotel was very crowded, and elevators were slow. Walls were very thin and the hotel was overall very noisy. Beds were nice as were sheets and towels. The view was good and location was very convenient to North Beach. There is aparking lot across the strees for $26, much better than the 36 the hotel wants for Valet.

review.title: Typical 4 Star Chain Hotel
review.reviewText: In a great location. Easy to walk to almost anywhere from here and better than busy Union Square or super tacky Fisherman's Wharf. The bathrooms are a bit on the small side but the showers are good and the bed is very comfortable. Big flat screen TV is nice aswell. Being a big hotel there is not much in the way of personal service. We changed rooms three times as they kept giving us the wrong room (2 queens instead of King). No-one at the front desk seemed to bothered and were happy for me to trapse up and down the hotel trying to find a room. The cleaning of the room was never more than the minimum and at breakfast the floors and tables were not clean. I saw several couples change tables as theirs were filthy. However, these were not major drawbacks just symptomatic of a big chain hotel which employs the least amount of staff it can get away with. I would definitely recommend staying here as the prices are good value.

review.title: Time for a reality check on room titles...
review.reviewText: The "Grand Delux Room" booked at the Westin joins a long list of hotels that continue to badge their rooms way above what is delivered. The room was so small and featuring only one chair we went down stairs to check that we hadn't received the wrong room. We hadn't. We asked for another chair and made do. The room was clean, quiet and apart from the cheap shower curtain sticking to you when showering the experience was bearable. For two people sharing a room - I would recommend checking out the suites - as it doesn't quite make the grade when there is more than one of you...

review.title: The place is ok
review.reviewText: Not really impressed with the service!

review.title: So-So
review.reviewText: The views were great but the rooms looked a bit old.

review.title: relaxing stay
review.reviewText: I've pretty much lodged in every class of hotel & Westin Market was a solid 4 star stay. It was evidently not always a Westin, but you still get the Westin feel from the door to the heavenly beds. Fitness center was good, neither a pool nor a sauna though. The property was worth the rate I paid and the location is walking distance to everything in SanFran, especially the cultural arts district. I rented a car only for a day trip, other than that you can walk it to the baseball stadium, theatre & shopping@ Union Square. While I'd probably get a trolley up to Knob Hill next time, I did walk it. Staff was excellent from bellman to maid & bartender. And the outdoor restaurant/lounge is ultimately relaxing.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: everything was great, the hotel is beautyfull, except that my room was a little small (corner room #826) everything else perfect.

review.title: Good hotel just don't bring a car
review.reviewText: Hotel was very good. Only concern was the price of parking. $42 a day was too much too charge for parking.

review.title: Will definitely come back
review.reviewText: I read a number of poor reviews before booking with complaints about bad service and the condition of the hotel during the recent renovation. During our stay, I was pleasantly surprised to find the staff/service was very professional and the remodeled hotel was excellent. It was everything I expected from a 4 star hotel.

review.title: Bad hotel
review.reviewText: No breakfast room. Hotel directory was missing. reception desk to dark. No bellboys.

review.title: westin
review.reviewText: nice & well located.. concierge very good

review.title: 4 star?
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a nice location and most of the staff were helpful. However, the line for the concierge was so long that we were never helped. Our bathroom toilet was broke when we arrived. The room service menu had very few options. And call me crazy but I think that 4 and 5 star hotels should have robes.

review.title: Exceeded all expectations
review.reviewText: Stayed here recently with my wife and daughter for 5 days. Room was nice and the staff was absolutely amazing - truly great service, they went out of their way to help us with our baby. In addition, location was great . . . close to the Moscone center and Union Square. Will stay here again the next time I am in SF.

review.title: Great view
review.reviewText: this is a very nice hotel in a great location - view from the corner room on the 28th floor was amazing - proximity to union square perfect - elevators were super fast - staff was friendly - only major complaint is that there was always a line of people for the concierge so that service wasn't really useable - bed was comfortable as at most westins - oh and the tv is awesome - flatscreen and large!

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: It was fabulous - definitely as "heavenly" as they claim

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: It was fabulous - definitely as "heavenly" as they claim

review.title: Fantastic hotel!!
review.reviewText: I stayed in the Westin for 7 nights and had a fabulous time. From the minute I walked in to the moment I left the staff were always making sure that my stay was enjoyable. The room was spacious, clean and full of good goodies such as starbucks coffee! It is located in the heart of San fran, easy travel distance to China town, Union square and fishermans Wharf. I enjoyed my stay soo much that I am plannig on going back again next year and staying in the Westin!!

review.title: Great Hotel, will go back anytime
review.reviewText: Clean and spacious,everything you need in one place. lounge,restarant,patio outside. really enjoyed Sunny, the desk clerk who pointed out the attractions of the city. thing I didn't like was you need to supply free Internet would make this hotel just about perfect.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Parking Charges are a rip-off at $47 per night, incl tax. Hotel Lobby is sparse, dark and uninviting. Concierge was not knowledgable about local restaurants. Our room did not have a telephone book. At check-in, we were not introduced to the hotel, eg amenities were not described.

review.title: Comfortable stay. Would stay again.
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel. Room was very clean. Hotel is right on the edge of Downtown San Fran, and everything is within walking distance. The only bad thing I would have to say is that this is the first hotel I've ever stayed at that stuck to their 3:00pm check-in time. There were a few guests (including us) that were still waiting for their room at 2:30pm. Perhaps Westin should clean the rooms of guests that have checked out by 10:00am first, then clean the rooms of guests that are not checking out last...so that awaiting guests can check in to open rooms before 3:00pm. But, I'm sure they have a reason why they are the only hotel that has never been ready for me to check in by 1:00pm. So, we just dropped our bags off with the bell hop and walked to the nearest lunch place.

review.title: 'We definitely will be back
review.reviewText: The hotel was very lovely. Great view from the 24th floor, friendly bar staff and fantastic location for shopping whether at Union Square or San Francisco Centre. I was very impressed.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: No complaints. We arrived early (9:00 am) and we we were actually able to check into our room. Walking distance to union square, BART and cable line.Staff was very friendly and helpful. Bed was super comfy. Fitness facility was clean and although not overly large, had all the right equipment.I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to other travelers. I love San Francisco!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location - near all major attractions (Union Square, shopping, Chinatown) and near transportation (cable, MUNI, etc...). Some of their hotel staff were friendlier/helpful than others. But overall experience was good.

review.title: Excellent Experience
review.reviewText: This hotel was formerly The Argent. I stayed there for two nights over the Labor Day Weekend and I thought that the place was excellent. The staff was very pleasant and the room service was very prompt. The food wasn't bad at all, either. The king sized bed was one of the more comfortable beds I have ever slept in. Nice large flat-screen TV was another plus. When I return to San Francisco, I'll probably stay there again.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: This hotel was in an excellent location close to Muni and BART transportation, shopping, Chinatown, museums; just everything. All of the workers were wonderful to us. My husband found the room a little small, but it was fine for me. The bed was "heavenly" just like their adds say. I've slept better than I have in years. We enjoyed our stay at the Westin on Market Street and would stay there again.

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: Great location for business travel in SF near Moscone Center and othe conference hotels. Room was very quiet and comfortable. Exercise facility was very good.

review.title: Well priced for the hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was newly redesigned, clean and contemporary. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable and the service was good. And the hotel location was ideal in the downtown San Francisco area. I would stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Good Hotel to Stay in
review.reviewText: They have excellent service and good clean rooms. I really liked their beds, they are so comfortable. This hotel is very close to many restaurants and most of the attactions.

review.title: Lousy Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby looks attractive, but the service is shabby. I will not stay at this hotel in the future and will not recommend it to a friend. The first day I arrived, they were testing a fire alarm system and had the service people knocking on people's doors.

review.title: Our San Fran Trip
review.reviewText: Top Class all the way. Needed a late checkout, no problem in getting one.

review.title: Fabulous service. Nicely updated rooms.
review.reviewText: The service was truly excellent. Room was very nicely appointed, large screen LCD, keyboard, new bedding, starbucks coffeemaker, in-room safe and large floor to ceiling windows. Found it to be ideally located. 5 minute walk to Union square, 10 minute walk to financial district. Definetely nice value for SF.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, not a lot of choices for restaurants in the area however.

review.title: Wonderful place to stay with affordable pricing
review.reviewText: This was a nice, well kept hotel, with comfortable rooms. The staff were well mannered and helpful at all times. I would stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The room was a little smaller than I expected but it was close to everything I wanted to see.

review.title: Would stay here again without hesitation!
review.reviewText: This was my second trip to San Francisco and the first time to stay at this hotel. I traveled with my 13 month old and they made the stay very comfortable for him too! The hotel provided a sturdy and clean portable crib with a down comforter and towel. Also, I requested that the mini bar be emptied so that I could store baby food...instead they sent me a precooled mini fridge at no additional cost. The room had a beautiful view, nicely decorated and VERY clean. The location was perfect. Close to all public transportation and in the heart of downtown. Enjoy your stay and pick this hotel...you won't regret it!

review.title: Would definitely stay there again
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel- the "Heavenly Bed" and "Heavenly Bath" were very nice! Slept better than at home! Caution: Was given the option if wanted smoking vs. nonsmoking room - found out at check-in that the entire hotel is smoke free! Could only smoke outside on the patio, which has nice furniture and patio heaters for cold nights. And, the parking is $47.95 per day, which seems high since you are paying a decent amount as a guest of the hotel. Did have to call a few times because the TV wouldn't power on (they just purchased new flat screen TV's and were having difficulty with some of them), but they were very prompt in coming up to the room and solving the problem. Good location - not too "touristy", but very easy access to the cable cars and bus system. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great value relative to other downtown hotels
review.reviewText: + Good location + Sophisticated looking lobby + Well-appointed rooms + Friendly staff + Priced well below other Starwood properties in the area

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: An excellent location near all central San Francisco facilities. We were up-graded without request to a superb room. Thoroughly enjoyed the stay.

review.title: othr than its location, its not worth it
review.reviewText: Had the worst stay at this hotel. the room was not at all like it was pictured or described. i did not get what i paid for. when i arrived in the room there was food from a previous stay in the refrigerator and the supplies were not replaced. I will not stay here again.

review.title: Very Pleased
review.reviewText: Had a splendid time at this hotel. Wonderful location that is extremely easy to navigate from and to.

review.title: Would definitely go back.
review.reviewText: Hotel room was clean with the exception of a small stain on the bed skirt which kind of looked like blood. Wasn't happy about that but didn't make a big thing of it. Clearly that was overlooked by the cleaning people.

review.title: great accommodations
review.reviewText: was very nice for the money. from valet to concierge the staff was top-notch. if tempted to stay in downtown SF again i would stay at this hotel.

review.title: great hotel!
review.reviewText: very nice staff! super comfortable room, very elegant. Resturant a bit over priced. Great location!!! Could walk to everything, or was a 5-10 cab ride away.

review.title: Wonderful Stay
review.reviewText: Great location. Attractive lobby and lounge. Very helpful service. Room with a great view.

review.title: Too Noisy
review.reviewText: Doors and rooms were inadequately insulated. Noise from the hall and neighboring rooms was discomforting.

review.title: Great Price
review.reviewText: The only drawback to this hotel is that it is right on the border of the "good" and "bad" parts of San Fran. There were no saftey issues, however if you travel away from downtown and more inland, you will find some shady areas. Overall, great hotel, will stay there again.

review.title: Didn't want to leave!
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and very comfortable. It was in a great place to walk everywhere. It was a perfect place to stay in San Francisco! The only thing I wish they had was a pool!

review.title: Great room but satisfactory service
review.reviewText: The room was extremely comfortable as the bed sheets and pillows were of the utmost quality. I felt right at home in the room. As for the service, the room was promptly cleaned everyday. The concierge service was satisfactory at times however because not all questions related to transportation were addressed adequately.

review.title: Fantastic hotel!
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at the Westin downtown San Francisco and highly recommend this hotel. As well as the exceptional service and well maintained rooms the hotel is an excellent location to all shopping and travel routes.

review.title: Great stay at Westin
review.reviewText: We wre in tiwn for a convention at the Moscone Center. Location was perfect. We had a queen room on the 34th floor with a million dollar view - very nice. Doormen extremely helpful. One of us loved the breakfast buffet, the other thought it was at best 'poor'. Walk to Union Sq. restaurants, cable car and metro lines. Yerba Buena gardens out the back door. In all, a real winner.

review.title: The Westin Market Review
review.reviewText: The Westin Market was quite beautiful. The location is really conveniant. I had a view of the Sony Metreon, the Yerba Buena Museum, and a brief walk to many locations. Extremely close to the BART station and trolley stations. It is located south of Market, wich can be less than desireable at times, but the location is up and coming. The hotel was recently remolded and extremly clean and beautiful.

review.title: Great location, comfortable stay
review.reviewText: The room was very comfortable, clean and maintained. Staff was helpful and friendly.

review.title: Love the beds!!!
review.reviewText: Even though we were on the 18th floor we still heard some street noise (a lot of sirens), but that's to be expected since it was downtown. We were able to walk to AT&T Park, Union Square, huge shopping mall around corner, museums. Public transportation (cable cars, muni, buses, trolley)was just around the corner and very reasonable. The beds and linens were incredibly comfortable and the tv's were flat screens.

review.title: good hotel but concierge service was very poor
review.reviewText: Excellent location, clean hotel and solid 4 starts on 5 star scale. Other then extremely poor concierge service - no idea how to get to museums; will not reserve car service; generally busy and rather un-interested in helping - good place to stay. As a side note rest of the staff was very responsive and we ended up asking other employees of the hotel for the direction which worked just fine...

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice, clean and quiet. Great location close to Market street with access to BART, and rail cars, shopping, resturants.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Westin Market Street. The Heavenly Bed lived up to its name...request a room away from elevators and you will be assured a blissful sleep. Hotel staff was friendly and accommodating...all requests fulfilled promptly. Although the hotel itself was wonderful, it is the location that can't be beat. The Westin is located downtown, just steps from lots of great shopping and all modes of transportation. We were able to easily navigate all of San Francisco with ease.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our 9 nights at the Westin Market Street. The hotel is in an excellent location (close to many sites, shopping and transit). The rooms were well-appointed (flat screen LCD, great bed, coffee machine, small but very nice bathroom). We found the concierge, bell and door staff to be friendly and very helpful. We would recommend this hotel... just avoid the rooms with treadmills!

review.title: Great Hotel, small rooms, Poor restaurant and bar
review.reviewText: The hotel was very smart and the hotel staff we're extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms where quite small, but we did have a great city view out to Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge in the distance. My only real problem with the hotel was the attached restaurant and bar had very poor service. We had long waits for dinner and breakfast even though there were lots of tables free, just not cleared. The staff in the restaurant and bar areas weren't particularly friendly or helpful either. A big contrast to the rest of the hotel. Guest's we're getting turned down for breakfast 20 minutes before the restaurant closed as it was close to closing. There were extremely long waits for service at the attached bar, a lot of people left before getting served. I wouldn't normally complain about something like that, but this is a 4 star hotel. A hotel with that rating should have better and more staff in all departments, not just the hotel. I would stay there again though, just not use the restaurant or bar.

review.title: Very courteous staff!!!--Great Location
review.reviewText: Very Nice--well maintained--the STARBUCKS coffee every AM was awesome!!!!

review.title: Great hotel experience
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was clean and comfortable. Overall, a great place to stay.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Overpriced Parking - $50 per night did not add much joy but otherwise the hotel is good and price is acceptable for this level of room. Liked gym and restaurant. I would advice to stay in this hotel.

review.title: Good location for Moscone attendees
review.reviewText: To be expected from a Westin, service, cleanliness all were up to par for any business traveler. A good location to any Moscone event as it's about a 3 block walk. Bart is just up the street, and there is a great dive bar across the street for cheap eats and drink specials called "Dave's."

review.title: Modern decor made an impression
review.reviewText: I stayed there with my wife and three children. I think the normal guest are business people because the hotel is very close to the Moscone Convention Center. Parking was average for SF (Approx $47 per day). The staff were warm and friendly and the bell hop was especially helpful when we arrived providing us with free maps and tips on where to go with the kids. We were impressed by the floor-to ceiling window view (we stayed on 24th floor) and could see Alcatraz and the Bay bridge. The beds were a bit soft for my taste but my wife liked them. The walls were solid and very quiet. The only sounds we heard at night were firetruck sirens passing on the street below and even then it was not too loud. The bar/lounge was interesting with the ultra modern seating arrangement of low pillows and a round room. The drinks and food in the lounge were expensive. We had to leave the hotel to find children friendly food but there is a Starbucks, McDonalds and Dennys all within walking distance. Attractions within one block are SFMOMA, the Yerba Buena Gardens, and lots of name brand shopping. Chinatown is only about 3 blocks to walk to.

review.title: not impressed for the price, good standard hotel
review.reviewText: It was a pretty nice hotel but as someone who travels quite alot ... it doesnt leave a lasting impression on me. good hotel, good bed, they could at least offer little extra things for the bathroom, bigger rooms for a premium king and faster service for the valet as it was 42$ !!!! pretty good overall but not exceptional.

review.title: Will Be Back
review.reviewText: I will stay at this property on my next visit to San Francisco. It is centrally located to Union Square as well as great shopping and restaurants. The trolley is close to get to the Wharf areas and no wait unlike the cable cars. An outstanding hotel.

review.title: Great location, decent room
review.reviewText: This is a newer hotel just steps from Market street in the South of Market area. It is in walking distance of the SFMOMA, the Metreon entertainment complex, and plenty of good dining. Hotel was clean and well designed, with upscale furnishings in room. Rooms are not sound-proofed. The front desk was understaffed. Upon check-in, there was only one person working the desk and a long queue. When I left my key in the room the next night and went downstairs to get a replacement key, again one person. Each night upon my return, one person, despite there being five or six stations available. Individual rooms and the housekeeping service were a slight disappointment as well. There was a piece of toilet paper in the toilet, paint spots on the bathroom floor, and room was not restocked with toiletries or room service trays removed. Despite that, the hotel was fine and a decent price. If they can sort out their front desk log jam and housekeeping issues, I will definitely return.

review.title: could have been better
review.reviewText: room was next to service elevator so lots of noise came thru the walls at 8am. housekeeping do not understand what "do not disturb" means and will still try to get in if you dont respond. all other staff were very kind and helpful. hotel itself is very nice and up to date. automated minibar charged for water i didnt touch but was resolved at checkout.

review.title: Great all around!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great and very impressive. The location was within a couple of blocks of both the BART station and the cable cars. We got in around 10:00 a.m. and didn't expect to be able to check in until 3:00, but we were pleasantly suprised to find that our room was ready for us and we could go right up. We spoke to the concierge twice on our trip, and both times got quick and easy directions on the bus routes we would need and an idea of places to eat.

review.title: Great Deal!
review.reviewText: The hotel just finished a major remodel and was beautiful. Great lounge and bar. Most comfotable bed I have slept on in a while. (You can order a set including bedding and all for your home... I was tempted!) Doormen, bellhops, room service, concierge, and check-in staff were all VERY friendly and helpful. Was able to check-in at 9:30 a.m. w/ no extra charge or hassle. Located across from Yerba Buena Gardens, on Market street in the middle of shopping district. Just a few blocks to every direct tram/bus/trolley/BART we needed to all the tourist sites. Great location for a shopper/ art tourist.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location to Union Square, shopping, etc. Nice lounge for meeting family/friends or just read a book. Efficient staff and services. Will definetely stay again.

review.title: Great view of the Yerba Buena gardens and S.F. Bay.
review.reviewText: Everything was lovely.

review.title: Westin San Francisco Market Street
review.reviewText: We stayed in this hotel in July of 2007 and really enjoyed it. We were in a lower floor (the 7th), but had a corner room which gave us a little more of a "suite" feel as it was larger than the other rooms on the floor (from looking at the floor plan on the back of the room door). The hotel was perfectly situated in the heart of San Francisco and everything was so easily within walking distance. We walked to the Ferry Building (about 15 min.) to the Cable Car lines (about 5 min) and to Union Square (about 5 min) and we walked to Fisherman's Wharf (about 30 min). In terms of service, we really had little to do with the hotel staff. We stayed for 5 nights and only interacted with the doormen. We called down to the front desk to ask for a wake-up call, but never received the call the next morning. Good thing we had set the in-room alarm clock as a back up.
