It seems as though the hotel has finished with their 30 million dollar renovations as we encountered no construction while there. The Reebok Gym was well equipped with top of the line elliptical machines, treadmills, stationary bikes and weight systems. An enjoyable stay!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel... nice room, amazing view, just what we were looking for.

review.title: Nicely rennovated
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were courteous and helpful, the room was spotless, a bit on the small side for the bathroom but not bad. Lovely night view with to the floor windows. Flat widescreen TV an added bonus. Good location.

review.title: Westin fun San Francisco Market Street
review.reviewText: This hotel has qualty rooms, flat panel large TV's, and of course the heavenly beds is in walking distance to Chinatown, a hike to little italy, and little further to fishermans wharf and the golden gate bridge. I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: great!
review.reviewText: Great hotel, perfect location! All you need for a nice weekend in San Francisco:-)

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: is close to union square and cable cars. Not much to do in the hotel but lots around.

review.title: Excellent Location / Horrible Guest Services
review.reviewText: This hotel was recently renovated and it shows throughout the room. We stayed on the 25th Floor with Bay and City Views and it was great! The new Westfield Shopping Center was only one block away along the rest of the shops and boutiques. The only problem we had with the hotel was their guest services. We could not get a hold of concierge throughout most of the day and their guest services was awful!

review.title: Perfect location. Close to everything downtown.
review.reviewText: Shopping, galleries, dining, mass-transit (i.e., bus, trolley, underground), all within blocks of this hotel. It's undergoing renovations, but you'd never know it. They do an excellent job of keeping you from seeing or hearing the construction. Our room and view were great. Very friendly and helpful staff.

review.title: Comfortable Hotel
review.reviewText: The room was very clean and comfortable. The location was nice - close to everything in the city. My only complaint was the parking fees - it is $42 per night.

review.title: Outstanding
review.reviewText: THE friendliest people in the world - the doorman & the bellmen. The room was fantastic. The view was tremendous. I have nothing bad to say about this place at all. The cost was reasonable for a 4*, especially when you're treated like a 5* yourself. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Great hotel, will stay there again. Perfect location.
review.reviewText: Great flat screen TV. Was an unexpected surprise!

review.title: best in San Francisco
review.reviewText: overall excellent from A to Z

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: The Westin On Market Steeet is conveniently located yet not noisy. The hotel has just been renovated so it has a nice clean feel. Excellent service! Will stay here again.

review.title: Perfect location. Close to everything downtown.
review.reviewText: Shopping, galleries, dining, mass-transit (i.e., bus, trolley, underground), all within blocks of this hotel. It's undergoing renovations, but you'd never know it. They do an excellent job of keeping you from seeing or hearing the construction. Our room and view were great. Very friendly and helpful staff.

review.title: Smoke Free Rooms.....not
review.reviewText: I asked for a non-smoking room and was given a room that used to be smoking but is now non-smoking. I sneezed all night and the towels smelled of smoke.

review.title: Perfect location. Close to everything downtown.
review.reviewText: Shopping, galleries, dining, mass-transit (including bus, trolley, subway), are all within blocks of the hotel. The hotel is undergoing renovation, but you'd never know it. Four-star hotel disguised as a five-star. Service was excellent and the staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: Very satifsfied
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable,convenient and excellent price! Hight recommended!

review.title: Adequate for a 4 Star
review.reviewText: The location was ideal for visits to Union Square and Fishermans Wharf and easy access to and from the airport. The hotel is in the process of a change to Westin hotel and many of the services were not available such as the restaurant and gym. The room was clean, but needed some painting as the walls were dirty. All in all a nice hotel to stay at with many restaurants nearby and entertainment in walking distance.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: I had a great stay. Doing some maintenance and repairs to the lobby area, but still had a very enjoyable stay!

review.title: Helpful Staff, Helpless Room
review.reviewText: Cons:The hotel room looks larger online. I requested a Deluxe room, but I'm almost certain I stayed in a standard room. The room was clean except for lipstick stain on the side of pillow and the coffee maker was dirty inside. The mattress and pillows were uncomfortable. I woke up with neck cramps. Pro: The Staff were friendly and helpful, the hotel is located in the center of downtown, public transportation everywhere, within walking distance to shopping centers, museums, cafes, and restaurants.

review.title: NOT IMPRESSED AND WASTE OF MONEY
review.reviewText: I stayed for 3 days and 2 nights...and soon as i arrived...the greeting was in a rude manner... had problems checking in...and when i arrived at my suite...i didnt have a balcony as advertised...plus i have a 7 month old baby and there was no BABY CRIB as i had requested...and when they finially brought the crib...it was a play pin with towels as a mat...come on now....the location is very good for shopping...its near GUCCI, LOUIS VUITTON, DIOR, and BURBERRY...plus near Macys...but parking is to expensive a night and it can take up to 20 min. just for them to pull your car...I Had better service from 3 star hotels in the past...

review.title: Loved the location
review.reviewText: We were so glad we picked this hotel. We are very picky about hotel cleanliness, and this hotel met our standards. Blocks from Union Square and lots of shopping. Also close to Bart and Muni stations. Made our commute to Oakland airport easy even with luggage. Also made commute to Candlestick Stadium easy since it was just a few blocks from the Muni express to Candlestick. It was very reasonably priced for its location and quality. Afraid rates may go up though because apparently it is merging with another hotel chain. We were able to check-out and leave our bags to do sight-seeing since our flight was not until late evening. That was a big bonus. Would definitely stay at the Argent again. A minus though was that the view left something to be desired - construction site and minimal city view.

review.title: I loved it.
review.reviewText: The hotel was in the perfect spot for shopping. Everything was within walking distance or we jumped on the cable cars. I plan on staying at the same place the next time I'm out there.

review.title: A Very Delightful Hotel!
review.reviewText: We'd definitely stay at the Argent again. An non-pretentious hotel in a great location. Our 23rd floor room was very comfortable with the floor to ceiling window and wonderful view. There were two comfy chairs with an ottoman to either read or to view television.

review.title: Goot taste, quiet, clean, what more to ask for!?
review.reviewText: The location is great, close to everything. The staff is friendly and helpful. The room had a spectacular view to the downtown area. I was so please with my stay there that maybe I should be selfish and keep this information to myself!! No, seriously, the hotel is very nice, and I highly recommend it. The beds are clean and comfortable, no noise from adjacent rooms, the decoration is in good taste, with real furniture, not hotel furniture.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Very close to Convention Center, wonderful views, and nice rooms.

review.title: Good location - Lacks much in customer service
review.reviewText: I do not consider myself a demanding person, but the staff at this hotel is very lacking in making you feel welcome. You walk in and it looks inviting and makes you feel like you want to be there, but when you ask for something and it take 20 minutes or the bell boy will not carry your bags, open the door or just give you the courtsy of a smile well it does not make you want to go back. Overall they have the correct concept, but need to review their employee as it seemed that over 75% just looked unhappy and it showed..

review.title: Will always stay at the Argent while in SF
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is unbeatable. It is near everything and public transportation is right outside the hotel. We were very, very pleased with the hotel. The lobby was beautiful and well taken care of. We were always greeted by the door men coming in and out of the hotel. It was wonderful. Our view was beautiful and the full windows made seeing the city a treat. The room was not to small as stated in earlier reviews. The decor was nice, and having a desk and chair came in handy. The beds were not to comfortable, they were kind of hard. There was no coffee maker in the room, but coffee mugs. I need coffee in the morning. High speed internet is kinda pricey, and the items in the fridge are very expensive. Local calls are too much money also. The desk staff was very pleasant and even held our bags for several hours after we checked out so we could explore the town more. Overall this place is the best place I've satyed in SF for the money and I will always stay at the Argent on future trips to the SF.

review.title: Business/Convention Spot
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel. The location can not be beat if you are going to the Moscone Convention Center. Rooms are small but this is the city. The breakfast was good but was $60./ for two. Parking is fine but $50./ a day. Hey, it is San Francisco.

review.title: Not worth the price or the 4-star rating
review.reviewText: Don't get me wrong, this isn't a BAD hotel. But the 4-star image the lobby conveys fades rapidly when you get to your room. There, mediocrity reigns. Remember the first "Shower Massage" shower heads from the early 80's? That's what you'll find in the shower, and it's emblematic of the rest of the room (the bedding is quite nice, however). This is a solid 3-star hotel that should price itself accordingly. Side note - expect to pay $42 per night for overnight parking (even as a hotel guest) and $15 for 24 hours of internet access. You'll find better value at any of several excellent hotels in the same area.

review.title: Lovely Hotel /. Great Service
review.reviewText: This was a lovely hotel with excellent service, especially the concierge desk. The cleanliness of the room and guest areas could have been better. I was there for 4 nights and thouroughly enjoyed my stay

review.title: Good hotel at San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel was a bargain for its category through Expedia. Rooms are spacious, clean, with good size bathroom and extremely comfortable beds. Despite it was busy, it was not noisy. Decor is beautiful and quite soothing. Location is great, near Moscone Center (if you happen to go on a bussines trip) and a couple of blocks from all shops and restaurants. It was not my first time at San Francisco and definitely was one of the best hotels I've stayed in.

review.title: Some Problems
review.reviewText: Bathroom faucetts leaked. Bed was hard as a rock and pillows were extremely lumpy. Tried to have breakfast in Jesters but wait was too long and they were short staff

review.title: UNremarkable
review.reviewText: Great location...just average experience. Rooms are nothing to write home about. Parking was 42 dollars per day. Location is great...close to shopping. There are plenty of other hotels in the area that have better rooms, better service, and have more to offer.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Service, cleanliness and concierge assistance were awful!!!

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: The Argent is located perfectly for the theatre, shopping and great restaurants. The full length windows add to the spectacular view, especially if you can get a room on the higher floors. Our room was very comfortable, and the staff very attentive. Very highly recommended.

review.title: Less than friendly...
review.reviewText: While the room itself was fine, and the location and access to public transportation wonderful, the hospitality was lacking. The front desk was brusque, and help had to be requested rather than being offered.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Helpful, friendly staff throughout. The Argent has a great location for doing business in downtown SF. The in-hotel restaurant is excellent, just a bit pricey. $42 to park your car overnight is an eye-opener too.

review.title: Would definitely stay there again
review.reviewText: Great location and very professional and helpful staff (especially concierge service). Had a deluxe room, which was reasonably spacious for a major urban hotel. View was excellent.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: this was a nice hotel.The rooms are a bit small,but the view makes up for it.Everything is in walking distance if you don't mind walking.If you're not up for walking, then I suggest you purchase a muni pass which allows you access to all municipal transportation.The cabs will run you about 20 bucks to go just about anywhere.Go to Sears for b-fast on post St.,the Wharf for lunch,Northbeach for nightlife.Have a great trip!

review.title: convinient location with great view!
review.reviewText: Great view from room! Great service.

review.title: Just the Spot
review.reviewText: Not in the hustle and bustle, but close enough to get around. We had an enjoyable and relaxing weekend. Great view of the city and very cozy room. Bartender was GREAT!!

review.title: Downtown Treasure
review.reviewText: Located at 50 Third St. just off Market. You can easily walk to shopping, Chinatown, Union Square and if you really like to walk the Ferry Building. Public transportation within a short walk. Dining is on the expensive side especially breakfast so find an alternative unless a $20 per person bill for eggs and coffee is acceptable. Staff very professional and courteous. If you stay during a slow time - (long holiday weekend), you may end up with a very nice room upgrade - we were on the 35th floor with a fantastic view. Great alternative to touristy wharf area.

review.title: Excellent View!
review.reviewText: Convienently located off the BART in downtown with an excellent view of San Francisco in northwest facing rooms. The windows in the superior rooms extend from floor to ceiling and bed and bedding were topnotch. I've stayed in many hotels in SF before and so far this is my favorite!

review.title: Very decent hotel, great location
review.reviewText: I thought this hotel was just fine, the room was pretty large, kind of angular, with a sitting area with two large upolstered chairs. There was an ottoman and large end table, it also had a large desk and TV Armour. The television was a dissapointment though, kind of small and it would not angle properly to view from the bed. They need to upgrade to a plasma like all other cool hotels have now a days. The view fromt eh room was of Moscone center and a Yerba Buena gardens, it was actually pretty nice. The bed was king size and firm. The sheets were basic white and a little rough. overall decor was Beitermeyer type, with creams and subtle yellows and off whites with a little black, I thought it was pretty soothing. Carpeting was nice and drapery was good quality. The backroom was a little on the small side, with your basic tub/shower combo. Not much to rave about in that department.

review.title: Will Go again Soon
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay. We experienced the bar, resturant and room service. We were not too impressed with the resturant. It was overpriced and the food was not that great. Service and atmosphere were amazing though!

review.title: Comfortable but not clean
review.reviewText: The service at the hotel is great but the cleanliness of the rooms is not good. Hair on the ceiling in the shower, hair on the floor, vent looks as if it hasn't been cleaned in years, etc.

review.title: Will go back, great location
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the Argent this past Memorial Weekend. The location of the hotel was excellent, within walking distance to everything...Union Square, SFMOMA, Yerba Buena Gardens, Giants Stadium & Chinatown. The hotel staff were very nice and extremely helpful. We relied on them for everything including directions to getting around town, car rental, best places to eat etc. The only one negative is that the hotel does not have a pool or jacuzzi only a sauna & gym, other than this I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning to visit SF.

review.title: San Francisco Stay
review.reviewText: We arrived at 10:30am and we didn't expect to check in, but we could check in and leave our baggage. The room is clean and the location is very good for sightseeing.

review.title: Always a great experience
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the Argent 5 times and each visit has been excellent. The room rates available through Expedia are really a bargain. The hotel is very centrally located right near Union Square. It's stylish and contemporary. The rooms are not huge, but well furnished and very comfortable. The views from the upper floors are spectacular. The staff is friendly and helpful. Check the minibar prices before you consumer anything, though! Ouch. If you're renting a car, be prepared for the big-city garage fee which is $45 per night at the hotel.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Great hotel, location, and hassle free service.

review.title: Great location, great service, great price
review.reviewText: I was surprised at the level of hotel for the price I paid through Expedia. The hotel lobby is very nice and reminds me of other bigger chain hotels. The rooms are spacious and they gave us an upgrade to a room on a higher floor when we checked in. We had a great view of the city and were pleasantly surprised. Door and concierge staff were gracious and attentive. The location was also very easy to get to via the BART from SFO and is convenient to walk to downtown, North Beach, and Muni stops.

review.title: Great location and price
review.reviewText: My wife and I felt this hotel was top-notch! Easy access to all forms of transportation and the Moscone Center made our trip a memorable one. The view was great and the room more than comfortable.

review.title: ** Great **
review.reviewText: great hotel, close to everything, very helpfull staff. i would recommend it to everyone...

review.title: Great location, courteous staff, but alot of mold in bathroom.
review.reviewText: Quiet room, but uncleanly, would not stay again.

review.title: Best SF experience
review.reviewText: I've traveled to a lot of places, but I must say that this was one of my top best hotel experiences. Convienent location, great rate, attentive staff make this a 10+. If only NYC could take lessons from how this hotel treats it's guests.

review.title: Small Rooms
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was polite, but not what I would call "friendly." The room was clean, but quite smaller than you would expect for the price you pay. Can't say that paying the additional money for the view was all that worth it either. Food ordered from room service was cold and bland. If your looking for something special, I would look past the Argent.

review.title: Quality doesn't justify the price
review.reviewText: Room had stained carpet, stained duvet cover, mold in bathroom. Floor to ceiling window looked at an air conditioning unit on the roof of the floor below. When inquired with front desk about room change was told "that's the room you paid for". Will not be back, there are too many hotels in the area providing far better value.

review.title: A great night in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Our stay in the Argent Hotel in San Francisco was a relaxing, enjoyable experience. The hotel was immaculate and the concierge desk was helpful on several occasions in assisting us in making the right decision on where to go or what activity to do next in the short time available to us in the City by the Bay.

review.title: A very nice hotel and good value
review.reviewText: Lots of room, very nicely appointed and a good location near SFMOMA, BART, Union Square, etc.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Above average room (on the 20th floor) in an outstanding location. Very helpful front desk and concierge service. No experience with hotel restaurant, but this hotel is five minutes from 50 outstanding restaurants. I am a frequent visitor to SF this was my favorite of the non-boutique large downtown properties I've stayed at.

review.title: Great place to center a business trip
review.reviewText: The hotel was very comfortable, we came into San Fran early and were able to check in right away, which was nice, we didn't have to leave our luggage with the porter.

review.title: Smoking room
review.reviewText: This should not be classified as a 4 star hotel. Staff was customer service oriented, but cleanliness of room was not of 4 star quality.

review.title: Solid stay in the city.
review.reviewText: Great location, close to all of the majors. Walking distance to SBC park and close to BART and the trolley to tourist locals. Hotel staff was very accomodating, no complaints. I would have liked for the room to be alittle bigger, but I wasn't in San Francisco to sit in my room.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: I was disappointed with the room I stayed in. The carpets were stained and the duvet cover was also stained. I went to the restaurant in the hotel for brunch Sunday morning. I arrived shortly after 11:00 and was told that they stopped serving breakfast at 11:00. The waiter was very rude when I requested a breakfast menu. His rudeness continued when I proceeded to order lunch. I will not return to the restaurant ever again.

review.title: Good location and price
review.reviewText: Very nice experience staying at the Argent. Clean, nice staff, price is right. Neighborhood is a little iffy at night, but the proximity to Union Square, Maiden Lane, Orpheum Theater and retail galore makes up for it. Jesters, the restaurant, is excellent, too.

review.title: Great Hotel, in the middle of everything!!
review.reviewText: in the middle of all atractions. In between two BART exits, not far from the trolly ride and about a couple blocks from china town and union square. Great place to stay.

review.title: Not what it use to be
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Argent once before and I had a wonderful experience.  It seems as though things have gone a bit downhill since my last visit.  While the hotel is comfortable I'd consider other options if you are looking for something special.

review.title: Great Room
review.reviewText: Very nice room, but get the higher floors.  Great location and near public transportation.  We are already planning another trip.

review.title: San Franciso's Argent Hotel
review.reviewText:
I have been a guest of this hotel many times and was just there in early January 2005. I enjoy its proximity to both the SF Museum of Modern Art (SF MOMA) as well as the Moscone Center. Union Square is close by and transportation is a breeze from the hotel.

The rooms have been nice and appear well maintained, however I have noticed on my last two visits that the shower/bath tile grout has mildew on it. This bothers me as a top-rated hotel should have spotless bathrooms. The furnishings were comfortable and the high-speed internet service is handy.

The service by the is great. The doormen were really helpful and the people who work the bell service desk were extremely curteous and quick. They made my stay very pleasant with their attentive, cheerful attitudes and good advice

I cannot comment on the Jester's Restaurant as I did not dine there on my last trip. There are so many wonderful restaurants in the area that I skipped it this time. I have had nice meals there, but that was back in June 2004.

review.title: nice place, near union square, very close to every where i wanted to go.
review.reviewText: i would go again just to go.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Enjoyed a wonderful couple of days in the Argent.  The location is great, close to The Modern Art Gallery. Union Square, shops and theatres are within easy walking distance. The rooms are very comfortable.  Would have liked a second armchair in the room.  Loved the contemporary decor of the public areas.  Would definitely return.
